111.title: A growth spell

choices: Zelda's growth stops when she fills the room
Zelda grows large enough to destroy the chapel
Zelda grows so large she could destory the castle with a single foot
1112.content:
Zelda opened her spell book to find an interesting spell she had somehow never seen before, the spell of... Well, she wasn't sure what spell it was, as the words became blurry in the title. Feeling adventurous, the princess decided to cast the spell anyway, unsure of its effects. After the spell was cast, a brief show of sparkling lights emitted from the princess' hands, but after that, nothing happened.

"Hmm... How disappointing." Zelda thought.

After casting her less than spectacular new spell, Zelda practiced her magic some more, and then went about her day as usual. She next had a break from all her royal duties in the afternoon, when she decided to eat some lunch with Impa in the chapel inside the castle. Zelda talked with Impa about various things, reminiscing about the hero of time, Link, and how he had helped save the kingdom. She even told her about the mysterious new spell she had tried.

"Princess, you shouldn't use magic if you don't know what it will do." Impa told the princess.

"Yes, I know, Impa." Zelda laughed. "But it's strange, I've had that book for a long time, but I'd never seen that spell until today."

"It is quite odd." Impa replied, weary of bad magic, but intrigued nonetheless. "And you say it did nothing at all?"

"Yes! That's the biggest mystery of it all!" Zelda said.

The two discussed the spell and magic in general some more, when Zelda felt her dress starting to get a little tight. Zelda stood up and adjusted her clothes, saying that she might need a new wardrobe soon. But when Zelda kept readjusting her clothes, Impa took notice, she stood up as well and was about to ask the princess if something was the matter, when she saw that Zelda was somehow taller than she was, almost a whole 2 feet taller in fact!

"Princess!" Impa shouted in surprise. "You're so tall! But how..? And are my eyes deceiving me, are or you getting even bigger?"

"W-What are you saying!?" Zelda cried as she grew. "I'm getting... Bigger?"

Zelda saw that it was true when she tried to leave the room to figure out what was wrong with her, but she found that she couldn't even fit through the door anymore! The princess could not ignore her ever increasing height anymore, it had only been a few seconds and she was nearly half the size of the room already, and still growing!

Zelda's clothes were long gone, having reached their stretching point a moment ago, leaving the growing princess completely nude. She was embarrassed at this, and tried to cover herself with what little scraps of clothing she could find, but she quickly outgrew even that and resorted to covering herself with her hands.

Zelda looked down and blushed when she saw Impa, who had just seen the embarrassing scene. But Impa wasn't too interested in that, she was just standing in awe at the princess' huge height, she was so surprised by what she was seeing that even she was unsure of what to do now. Impa was beginning to look like a tiny little doll to the growing princess. Higher and higher Zelda grew until she reached the very high up ceiling, conking her head on it.

"Oww!" Zelda yelped as she rubbed her head. "T-This is terrible, if this keeps up I'll destroy the whole castle!"

"Princess, I'll go get help! Uh,Try not to get any bigger in the meantime!" Impa shouted up to the room-size princess, and ran through the door of the chapel to find somebody.

"Impa, please hurry!" Zelda cried, still growing larger.

With her protector gone, Zelda then crouched down and got into a kneeling position on the floor. In this position, she could still fit into the room, but for how much longer, she wondered. Zelda was still growing, soon she'd fill the whole chapel! She just wanted it to end...
1112.title: A reluctantly giant Princess

choices: She purposefully shrinks herself
She accidentally shrinks herself
Someone shrinks her
112.content: How does Zelda begin to shrink? Does she accidentally shrink herself or does she do it on purpose? Or does someone else shrink her?
112.title: How does it happen?

choices: The kids want to play with her like a doll
Another person enters the room
Her reversal spell simply doesn't work
1121.content:
Ganondorf was gone and with him so was the threat to Hyrule's well-being. The Kingdom of Hyrule was finally beginning to enjoy peace once more.

Princess Zelda had spent a long time leading the re-construction of Castle Town, it was wasn't an easy process, but she soon found that many of its former citizens were happy and eager to return to their old hometown and help rebuild. So, along with their help and that of the Seven Sages, Castle Town had been rebuilt, almost back to its former glory, in only a few short years.

Zelda enjoyed the comfort and peaceful atmosphere that had returned to her kingdom. But she still worried about future threats, so in an effort to prepare, the princess had started a new campaign aimed at the next generation of Hylians. A royal class was opened to kids of all ages, teaching a variety of subjects, from general scholarly studies, to that of fighting and even magic.

It turned out to be a successful program, and Zelda was happy to be enlightening so many young minds. She had always loved children, and she was well-versed in the ways of magic, so it only made sense for her to come in and teach some classes herself, and the children seemed to love her so much, always being overjoyed when she'd make her appearance in their royal classroom, clad in such regal dresses.

One such day, Zelda had nearly finished a lesson with her young students on the subject of magic, and was about to leave the class to finish up her more royal duties. But Zelda had made it a habit to end her lessons on something unique, advanced spells from the royal spellbooks, and today she had something special in mind to show everyone before she left.

"Alright, children, watch me now." The blonde princess told her students, who stared at her wide-eyed at what trick she'd pull of today. "This is a 'little' spell I like to use around the castle to make moving things a bit easier!"

She had brought out a pot and placed it on a desk when she first arrived. None of the kids knew what their princess had brought it to class for, until now. Zelda cast a quiet spell and pointed her index finger at the pot, magic sparkles flew from the tip of her finger into the pot, making it shine dimly. The kids were besides themselves with anticipation by this point, all of them wondering what this new spell was going to do to the pot. They got their answer in just a moment, when the pot suddenly started to shrink!

"Wow..." The children 'ooed' and 'aahed' together. Zelda smiled, pleased that her little magic trick had amused the youngsters. The kids ran over to the pot and looked at it. It was only a fraction of its former size, small enough that even a little kid could pick it up in one hand. One of them indeed picked it up but, well-mannered as they were, they took turns passing the pot around, though some still grabbed at it.

"Can you shrink people?" One of the kids asked when the pot was in her hand. This off-hand comment, born out of innocent curiosity, got the other boys' and girls' minds wandering. They'd already thought seeing a pot shrink was cool, but they young minds raced as they imagined other things they'd like to see dwindle away, and all started to talk about potential shrinking subjects.

"Oh! Can you shrink yourself!?" One especially creative boy asked, rather loudly. This louder suggestion got the attention of the group, and soon they were all cheering and asking the princess to shrink herself for them.

"W-Well..." Zelda suddenly sounded not so confident. It was true that she'd practiced the shrinking spell before, and the corresponding growth spell along with it. However, she had only ever tested them on inanimate objects, like the pot, she'd never tried it on a person before, much less herself!

"C'mon! Pleeease!" The group begged her. Some of them had started laughing by now, probably imagining the image of their beloved princess shrunk down to the size of a doll.

"Well, alright. I'll try." Zelda told the kids, and they immediately cheered happily and waited eagerly for Zelda to shrink herself.

They're so innocent, they probably believe I can do anything I want to with magic. I hope I don't let them down! Zelda thought. The spells to change size were indeed advanced, but with her skill level and experience in using them on things other than herself, Zelda thought she'd just be able to pull off such a trick for the kids. She'd just target the magic to herself, shrink herself, let the kids enjoy the show, and then grow herself back to normal in no time, she thought.

"Here it goes!" Zelda tried to sound enthusiastic about giving the kids the show they wanted, but she still had some doubts in her mind.

Zelda walked in front of the classroom and cast the spell once more, she used her magic in the same way as she had on the pot, but this time focused on diminishing herself. All eyes were on the beautiful princess as she slowly started to dwindle down in size, dress, crown and all. There wasn't a single jaw in the room that had managed to stay up as Zelda's size went down. But the children, keeping their patience about them, stayed still and watched in awe as their beloved teacher/princess got smaller and smaller right in front of their eyes.

How surreal... Zelda had to admit being watched was making her nervous, and getting tinier by the second made her feel even more so. But she knew she was still in control of the room, she was after all not only the teacher of these young minds, but also their ruler, she didn't demand respect but she knew she'd gotten it from all the time she'd spent with the children. So she tried not to worry about making herself doll-sized while in a room filled with toy-loving children.

Zelda's shrinking stopped, leaving the princess of Hyrule standing at only a mere 5 inches tall. To the kids in the room, she now looked like a doll version of herself. But to Zelda herself, the kids now looked like giants! Big-eyed, round, giants! Zelda was amazed at the reversal of their respective heights, she wondered if this was how big she looked to the young children.

"... And that's how it's done!" Zelda said confidently, hands on hips as she looked up at the children that now towered over her mini form. But then she gasped and covered her mouth when she heard her new, smaller voice. "Eep!" She squeaked out, face reddening. She now sounded like she'd ingested a large amount of helium!

"Ha ha ha! Look at Princess Zelda!" One of the more rambunctious kid's laughed, many joined him in laughing at Zelda's voice and small size. They didn't mean to poke fun at the princess, the whole situation was just so bizarre that they'd settled for laughing at it over staring awkwardly. Still though, to the reduced princess, it was enough to make her regret her decision to shrink herself.

"Alright, children!" Zelda started, still sounding like a chipmunk. She stopped herself and tried to deepen her voice when speaking again, "That's enough fun for today!"

Unfortunately for Zelda, her attempt at sounding more serious only made her sound more hilarious to the kids. They all burst out laughing at her now. Zelda's face turned even brighter red and she stomped her foot down in an uncharacteristic show of anger. She wanted to scold her students for their behavior, but by now it was too late. They'd all almost gone from seeing her as their teacher, to now seeing her as little more than a princess doll!

Zelda knew the situation was rapidly spiraling out of her control, and she knew that she'd have little to no hope of getting the kids back under her at her current size, so Zelda tried to cast the growth spell on herself, when...
1121.title: She purposefully shrinks herself

choices: Zelda casts the spell herself
Zelda has Carrie cast the spell on her
Zelda asks Carrie to bring in someone else to help
11213.content:
Zelda shook her head, disappointed with her students for their unruly behavior. Inwardly though, she knew she had nobody but herself to blame for getting into this mess. She'd traded in her height and control for a chance at pleasing the children, but now as the kids continued to amuse themselves with her puny size, she realized that doing so was a mistake.

They'd best be prepared for scolding once I'm big again! Zelda thought as she prepared to grow herself back to normal.

The tiny princess focused on the spell of growth, like she had many times before in practice for today. However, this time, Zelda felt odd. The spell was prepared, but nothing happened!

"Wh-What is this!?" Zelda squeaked in horror.

Before Zelda could even begin to think of what the problem could be, a giant hand suddenly swooped down and grabbed her. The mini princess screamed as she was carried up into the air, taking her for a wild ride for a few seconds before she was stopped abruptly right in front of one of the kid's faces, her captor, a young girl.

"Stop it!" The girl cried, raising her free hand up palm-forward to deter the rest of the children from messing with the princess.

Princess Zelda looked up and saw that her captor was a little girl with short brown hair, and wearing a pink dress. Zelda smiled as she recognized the girl as Carrie, a prodigal student of hers. Carrie always treated Zelda so sweetly and kindly, and always listened intently to her lessons. It wasn't a stretch to say that Carrie was among Zelda's favorite students, and was by far the most adept in the ways of magic.

"Thank you, dear!" Zelda squeaked from the girl's hand, gasping through her words as, although Carrie was trying to help, the little girl was holding the shrunken princess a little too tightly by accident.

"Your welcome, miss Zelda." Carrie smiled down at the puny princess.

"W-Would you mind to let me down on my desk, please?" Zelda asked. As much as she appreciated Carrie's help, the innocent girl had her in all but a choke hold right now, and even had her arms and legs tightly squeezed.

Carrie nodded and went over to the desk, which was neatly arranged with books, pencils, rulers, and all sorts of teacher's tools on it. Carrie then somewhat carelessly dropped Zelda onto the desktop, like one might toss an unwanted toy. Zelda groaned from the rolling toss, but didn't want to say anything about it, yet.

"Alright, kids. Stay there and let me work out the reversal spell." Zelda said, collecting herself and brushing off her dress. The class did as they were told, having calmed down thanks in part to Carrie's actions. They watched quietly as their doll-like princess moved around the desk, inspecting the various objects on it that were now almost all bigger than her whole miniature body. In particular, Zelda was interested in the ruler she had on it.

"Carrie, would you mind holding that up for me? I'd like to see how small I am now." Zelda told her trusted student.

"Okay..." Carrie said. She grabbed the ruler and held it up straight. Zelda stood next to it and looked to her side to see that her head was aligned with the 5-inch mark. "Five inches, ma'am." Carrie informed Zelda, and everyone.

The class burst out laughing once more upon hearing how small Princess Zelda had made herself. Most of them knew how big their favorite toys were, and they now knew that Zelda was even smaller than most of those! Zelda blushed in embarrassment, she knew she was tiny, but now she felt even smaller than before. Carrie looked between the embarrassed Princess and the other kids, and started to get upset that they were making Zelda all red faced.

"Hey! Stop it!" Carrie yelled at the other kids.

"No, it's alright, Carrie." Zelda told her giant protector. Carrie looked down at Zelda, almost teary-eyed from how bad she felt for the shrunken princess. "Thank you for helping me!" Zelda said. Carrie smiled.

Zelda then walked across the desk to some books that she'd brought in earlier. The shrunken blonde knew she'd be performing the size-changing spells today for the kids, and she'd practiced intently in the week before, but she still brought in the books detailing just how to perform the magic just in case. If the spell wasn't working for her now, then she'd need to do a little research to figure out just why that was. In a worst case scenario, Zelda also knew that she might be requiring Carrie to help her by having the little girl perform the growth spell on her, just in case she wasn't able to get it to work.

"Can you open this book, please, sweetie?" Zelda asked warmly. Carrie smiled and nodded, and did as she was asked to.

Zelda wasted no time in having Carrie flip through the pages for her to find the size-changing spells again. Once she did, Zelda hopped on the book and read through it thoroughly, twice even, to make sure she got everything just right for her return to normal-sized heights.

"Okay..." Zelda gulped, thinking about how to best proceed with the magic. "Here goes..."
11213.title: Her reversal spell simply doesn't work

choices: She notices her clothes are not shrinking with her
Ganondorf's minions find her
She soon found herself eye-to-eye with a deadly ant
1122.content:
Seven years. That's how many long years had passed since Ganondorf's evil reign began. The once peaceful country of Hyrule had quickly fallen into shambles without a hero, or a princess to guide it.

Unbeknownst to most, however, the long-thought dead princess Zelda had survived. Thanks to her trusty caretaker, Impa, Zelda had learned the ways of the Sheikah and was able to use magic to disguise herself amongst them. Using her learned ninja-like skills and training, Zelda had donned the persona of "Sheik" and gone into hiding some time after the near collapse of her kingdom.

Using this disguise, princess Zelda was able to keep herself safe until the time would come that the hero of time would awake from his years-long rest and rescue the kingdom from Ganondorf and his evil forces. Those seven years had been grueling, but the time was soon coming for the hero named Link to return...

Sheik, or rather, Zelda, was in a rush, she'd been on a mission to make sure the paths the hero would need to take were still accessible to him. In the previous months, she was doing everything she could to make sure that Link's journey would be a smooth, if not still dangerous, one to take. With everything now seemingly in order, Zelda hurried to the Temple of Time, for it was there that Link was destined to return from, and it was there that she was needed to wait for him to guide him.

With impressive agility, Zelda was able to traverse the wasteland of Hyrule Field quite easily while in her Sheik persona. It pained her to see all the remnants of destruction that Ganondorf had left in his wake over the past seven years, but she knew his time was almost over. She keep her wits about her and, silently as she could, dashed across the formerly prosperous field.

However, in her haste, Zelda had not yet noticed that she was being tailed by Ganondorf's minions, who had been watching her since she started scouting out the temples. With skills that nearly matched Zelda's own, they followed her, waiting for the most opportune moment to strike.

Zelda was blissfully unaware of her pursuers presence as she neared the ruins of Hyrule Castle Town. She allowed herself to slow down and breathe a sigh of relief, thinking in her mind that her long awaited savior would soon be here. She wondered how long she might have to wait for him in the Temple of Time. She chuckled softly to herself at the thought of waiting, the closest thing she'd had to a laugh in many years, and decided in her mind that she'd be fine waiting a little bit longer if it meant that her Kingdom could be saved.

Zelda prepared herself to scale the walls of the town, knowing it was better to avoid the zombie-like Re-deads that now inhabited the whole place if she could. But just as neared the bridge to the town, she was suddenly grabbed from behind. She gasped as she was thrown to the ground. With her quick reflexes, Zelda was able to easily get up and recover from the surprise attack. She prepared to strike back with some kunai, but stopped herself for a moment when she saw just who had been following her.

Standing before the former princess was a near small army-sized group of monsters. Zelda glared at the gang of beasts, cursing herself inwardly for being so careless to let such a large group track her to the town. Nearly 50 sneaky beasts had tailed her. Zelda was confident to be able to take a few of them down, but her training hadn't really prepared her to fight off so many attackers at once. This seemed to be her final challenge before the return of Link.

With the cry of what appeared to be their leader, the monsters rallied together for a coordinated, yet somewhat clumsy, assault on the princess. The princess immediately jumped into action, using every available technique and weapon in her arsenal to fight of the horde. Zelda was feeling confident as she pummeled foe after foe, but somehow it appeared that for every enemy she bested, three more took their place.

The odds were stacked against her, and the horde was succeeding in wearing her down. Zelda knew she would lose if this kept up, so instead of staying to lose the fight, she decided to cut her losses and try a more risking maneuver by running away across the bridge to Castle Town ruins. Her plan was to lose the horde by running into the Re-Dead infested town, but a quick glance behind her told her that the mod was more fearless than she expected, and they followed her right into the town.

Her first plan not working, Zelda went about trying to lose them in the maze-like ruins of the town instead. If nothing else, she knew she was faster than the monsters, so losing them wouldn't be too hard. In and out of the twists and turns of the ruined town Zelda ran, using her intimate knowledge of the layout of the town to her advantage to lose her pursuers. It took some minutes, but Zelda soon succeeded in throwing them off.

Zelda felt relieved that she lost her foes, but then another problem arose. She'd inadvertently backed herself into a corner near the entrance of the town, it made for a good hiding spot, but if she wanted to make a break for the Temple of Time, she'd surely be spotted, and letting them catch onto her plans at the temple was something she could not do. But at the same time, she couldn't just wait for them to leave. Ganondorf's minions were nothing if not determined, they'd not stop looking for her, ever. Zelda wasn't sure she'd be able to really take on so many enemies at once again. She needed a different plan, anything that could help her now.

Zelda consulted the words Impa had passed onto her so many years ago, she needed to concentrate on them now more then ever. As she continued to stay hidden, Zelda tried recall a move or technique or spell or anything that Impa might've ever told her about during her training so long ago.

Then it came to her, the one spell that Impa had told her to never use unless she was in a desperate situation, and even then only as a last resort. Impa had never told her exactly what the spell would do, explaining to Zelda that she had to be vague in describing it as it only worked in certain ways sometimes, which is why Impa had told her to never use it. But Impa also, after much prodding and questioning from a younger Zelda, taught her the spell. Impa also went on and told her that she herself had once used it to conquer 50 men. Zelda always thought it was impressive, but Impa's harsh warnings had kept her from casting it, until now.

"Please, goddesses, let this work!" Zelda thought as she cast the spell.

Immediately, Zelda felt a powerful tingling sensation throughout her entire body, and she briefly wondered if it were some kind of strength-boosting spell. However, her hopes were soon dashed as, instead of growing strength, her body quickly shrank down. Zelda let out a yelp of shock as she watched the world around her stretch and grow to gigantic proportions. She crawled about frantically in her hidey hole, clawing at the air in the hopes of grabbing onto an invisible force that might stop her shrinking, but it was no use, the spell was cast and set in motion.

"This can't be right!" Zelda cried aloud as she dwindled further into smallness. Her height quickly melted away, leaving the worried princess smaller and weaker then ever! Just as Zelda thought things couldn't get worse...

112332.content: OK, who's the lucky lady to get shrunk by the princess?
112332.title: Zelda shrinks a female character

choices: Zelda begins training Ruto immediately
Zelda wants to play with Ruto for now
Zelda gives Ruto some time to adjust and leaves her alone
1123322.content:
Princess Ruto sighed. She'd been summoned to Hyrule Castle by none other than the princess of Hyrule herself, Zelda. Being good friends with the princess, especially after her alter-ego Sheik had helped her people, and with the two of them both being sages, Ruto happily agreed to meet with Zelda.

However, after making the long trek to Castle Town, and getting some weird looks from the townsfolk, Ruto had been told to wait for Zelda in the throne room by the guards. Ruto understood the life of a princess was not one that allowed one to have much time to herself, so she agreed and took a seat at the steps to the throne.

That had been nearly an hour ago, and Zelda was still nowhere to be seen, leaving Ruto to wait alone in the big empty throne room, only a mysterious big box, covered by a cloth was in there with her. Ruto wasn't one to get upset or irate with such matters, she had waited seven years for her beloved Link to come save her and the whole Zora tribe after all. But Zelda's invitation and then lack of promptness was giving Ruto half a mind to just call it a day and ask to come back at a later time.

Ruto shook her head in disappointment, she'd even been looking forward to catching up with the Hyrulian princess, but it seemed like that wasn't going to happen today. She stood up and made her way to the exit, she was going to make some excuse up that she had to leave, and then say she'd be happy to return at a later, more appropriate time.

I hope Zelda won't be mad at me... Ruto thought as she neared the doors.

Just as Ruto was about to open the doors, they opened up, and Princess Zelda entered the room. Ruto had to stop in her tracks, surprised by the Hylian princess's sudden appearance. Ruto gasped and quickly collected herself, kneeling before the blonde woman.

"P-Princess Zelda!" Ruto stammered, bowing her head.

Zelda smiled at her and raised her right hand, to signal to the Zora princess to stand.

"Please, Princess Ruto. There's no need for formalities around me." Zelda assured her softly.

"Oh, right. Forgive me your highness." Ruto blurted out and quickly stood back up. Zelda laughed at Ruto's nervousness. Ruto felt a little awkward now, and she blushed slightly.

"My, what's gotten into you, Ruto? We're all friends here!" Zelda insisted, her voice soothing and calming to Ruto's nerves. The Zora princess loosened up a little and allowed herself to relax, feeling more than a little foolish for her display.

"Sorry. It's just a little nerve-wracking to have to wait for so long. Us Zoras are used to a more fast pace style." Ruto told her.

"Oh, forgive me for being late. I didn't mean to make you wait." Zelda apologized, cocking her head to the side and looking downward, as if sad herself now.

"Oh no! I'm not trying to scold you or anything! I just mean, uh, you know..." Ruto lost her train of thought and again could only stammer a response. Zelda could only once again laugh at Ruto's cute nervousness, she found it funny that it was so unbecoming of her Zora princess friend. She knew she had to bring some order back to their conversation, and so simply said,

"It's good to see you again, Ruto." Zelda smiled at her friend. Ruto giggled a little, and sighed.

"Yes, it's good to see you as well, Zelda." Ruto smiled back.

With that, Zelda clasped her hands together happily and walked down the hall to the throne. Ruto followed her.

"How about we get straight to the point, then?" Zelda asked, looking back at her fishy friend. Ruto nodded, much to Zelda's amusement.

"Good!" Zelda said. She walked over to the nearby sheet-covered stand and grabbed onto the top of it. "Brace yourself for this, Ruto."

Ruto gulped. She'd been wondering what was underneath the sheet since she walked into the throne room, and now Zelda was about to reveal it to her with a warning to 'brace herself', Ruto could only imagine what the Hylian princess had in store for her.

Zelda pulled off the sheet, revealing what appeared to be an aquarium underneath, it was a decently-sized one at that! Inside fit corals and seaweed, and even miniature figures of a castle and a sunken ship.

"Oh, how cute!" Ruto exclaimed. As a Zora, she loved all things aquatic, and even though she wasn't too keen on keeping fish as pets herself, even she had to admit that the craft was well done on this aquarium.

"I'm glad you like it." Zelda said, smiling at the Zora princess's positive reaction.

"I do! But you know I don't like to keep fish as pets, right? So why call me over here just for this?" Ruto asked, to which Zelda chuckled lightly.

"Don't be silly, I wouldn't keep regular fish in it! No, YOU'RE going to be my pet!" Zelda stated happily.

Ruto's eyes went wide as she processed Zelda's words. It didn't make any sense to her.

"What?" Was all Ruto could ask.

Zelda didn't say anything back. Instead, the blonde princess simply murmured something under her breath. Ruto knew Zelda well enough to know when the princess was casting a spell, and it seemed now was one of those times. Ruto started to worry as magic energies flowed up from Zelda's body and gathered in the air, then in the next second, the collected magic 'flew' into Ruto's body, knocking the wind out of her.

"What are you doing!?" Ruto cried. The Zora princess could only wonder what in the world Zelda was thinking by casting some strange spell on her in the middle of their meeting. She got her answer shortly when she noticed that Zelda was suddenly looking a little taller. Ruto started to sweat and looked around the room, she noticed that it wasn't just Zelda that was getting bigger, the aquarium and everything else in the room was seemingly growing all around her!

"Wh-Why!?" Ruto cried out, she realized now that her supposed 'friend' princess Zelda was now shrinking her! Ruto was too scared to move, and as she looked up at the increasing large Zelda, she remembered what the blonde princess had said to her earlier. If Zelda indeed meant that she'd be taking Ruto as her pet, then it all made perfect, horrifying sense. Zelda was shrinking her to make her into own little pet fish!

Zelda saw the look of terrified realization in Ruto's eyes and smiled darkly. "I assume you've figured it out, my little 'fish'." She admitted, much to Ruto's horror. "I didn't call you all the way over here just to 'show' you my new aquarium, I called you here so you could live in it!"

Ruto was shocked by this sudden betrayal. She'd never have expected Zelda to turn to Zora slavery, much less in the way that she was doing it now by shrinking her! The terrified tiny could do nothing but curl into a ball and weep on the floor as her shrinking slowed to a stop, leaving the former Zora princess a mere 3 inches tall and in the shadow of a her giantess captor.

Zelda was pleased with her new toy and cheerfully plucked her up from the floor. Everything seemed like an ordinary yet peaceful day within hyrule. The sun high above the fields casted it's great rays of light down upon the grassy terrain, as the clouds high above casually glided by. With Ganondorf's plan in conquering hyrule ultimately thwarted, mainly thanks to the heroic efforts of Link, tranquility flourished all throughout the kingdom. Despite the incredibly low presence of evil afoot throughout hyrule, princess Zelda was trapt within a current predicament that she so desperately tried to escape. The predicament? Boredom.

With everything now at peace all throughout the kingdom, there really didn't seem to be any pressing matters that required her attention, ultimately leaving her with plenty of moments to spare. Yet this overabundance of free time caused her to grow restless. Surely there must've been something that could satisfy her stale lifestyle. As she was within her royal chambers, a sudden idea emerged within her head, an idea that could easily help with this boredom issue. If nothing in the real world could quench her restlessness, then maybe something in terms of magic would do the trick. Immediately, she began flipping through the pages of an old incantation book passed down through the royal family for any sort of spell that sounded interesting.

"hmmm...now let's see." the royal princess muttered to herself while scanning through the old text. After looking through nearly thirty pages of spells, one quickly garnered her upmost attention.

"dragon alteration?" she reads out the title with a raised eyebrow. The most she knew about dragons in hyrule were through children stories impa would tell her right before she went to sleep. Why on earth would there be a spell based on them in a spell book? Let alone one that originated from the royal family? After pondering for a few seconds, curiosity soon began to get the best of her mind.

"Well...minus will give it a try." she tells herself while preparing to recite the incantation.

It was a lovely evening outside and princess Zelda, the ruler of Hyrule, couldn't stay cooped up inside the whole night. So it was that she was out on the balcony to her room, reminiscing about her time with Link, the hero of time. She recalled that while they hadn't spent much time together, the time they did have was precious to her. Zelda sighed. She wished she could spend a little more time with him, but also knew that that was impossible since she had sent him back to the past.

Later, Zelda got ready to hit the hay and went to sleep shortly after, turning in to bed wearing her usual nightgown. Once she lay down and fell asleep, something changed in the land of Hyrule that night. But the next day things were different.

Zelda had slept soundly and peacefully through the night. She awoke to the sound of Cuccos crowing. She brushed her long, blonde hair out of her eyes and sat up on her bed to get ready for the day. But when she threw her covers off, Zelda was met with a surprise.

The princess gasped. She was shocked to find herself wearing a maid's uniform! At least, that's what she assumed it was. With it's black and white pattern and frilly design, the uniform didn't much resemble the ones her own maids usually wore. But somehow Zelda knew that it was meant to be worn by a maid.

Is this someone's idea of a joke?! The princess wondered as she ran her hands across her new outfit. It's in poor taste... How did they even get this on.. me..? Zelda felt her face turn red. Did they see me... naked!?

"Ugh!" Zelda groaned at the thought. Now she felt violated.

The princess got up off her bed and paced around her room, trying to think of how this could happen. As she thought, she managed to catch a glimpse of herself in the mirror. She thought she looked ridiculous in her new outfit. Although it hugged her figure rather nicely, it was somehow also far too short!
She thought that if she were to bend over even slightly, she'd be flashing her panties to anyone behind her. And every step she took made the frilly "skirt" of the uniform bounce up high, showing off her legs with every movement. The top of her uniform pushed her breasts up, giving her an ample cleavage, and the low cut design showed it off.
One thing she hadn't noticed before was a cute little maid's cap adorning her head, seemingly put there to replace her princess's crown. But Zelda didn't think it was cute, she thought it was absurd, but somehow she couldn't bring herself to remove it.

She continued to stare at herself in her highly sexualized maid's uniform, thinking it was ridiculous. Zelda tried to remain focused though, and figure out how this happened. She wondered how she could wake up in this outfit without knowing how it got on her, or where it came from. All she remembered from the night before was the time she spent on the balcony.
Could someone have really snuck into her room, removed her usual nightgown, put her in this base uniform, and then sneak off? Zelda shook her head, it wasn't likely, what with her guards stationed just outside her room at all times.

"Yes. One of them must've seen something. Unless they really are playing some sort of prank on me!" Zelda told herself. "If that's the case, then I'd better have a talk with Impa about getting new ones! But first..." Zelda looked down at her outfit with disgust. "... I'd better change." She said.

Zelda went into her wardrobe, only to find all her clothing had changed!

"What is the meaning of this!?" She shouted to nobody in particular. She caught herself quickly though, and tried to keep a level head, but with all these strange things happening around her it wasn't easy.

Next...

She wasn't about to give up though, she knew now that more drastic measures should be taken if she wanted to be rid of this thing. So I can't take it off, and I can't cut it... Zelda thought. She was now quite frustrated with this blasted maid's uniform.

115332221111.content:
Zelda stayed cautious about being seen in her new maid's uniform. So she went over to her bedroom door and opened it just a crack, just enough that she could poke her head out. She saw a guard standing by, she called to him, forgetting for a moment about the maid's cap on her head.

"Huh? What are you doing in there?" The guard asked, sounding like he was interrogating her. He also looked confused, like he didn't understand why Zelda would be in her own room.

"What do you mean?" Zelda asked in response, taken back a bit by this guards callous question. "Please, just get Impa!"

"Why? What's wrong?" The guard asked, he made a move for the door. Zelda was worried he'd see her in her pitiful costume, so she cried out to try and stop him.

"Wait! I-It's something for her eyes only!" She shouted quickly.

The guard stopped in his tracks. He seemed hesitant, but he nodded. "I'll call for her." He told Zelda, and then went off to find Impa.

Zelda closed the door and sighed. That didn't go exactly to plan, but Zelda had gotten Impa on her way up. Zelda slumped down beside the door and waited for Impa, she would explain everything the Shiekah woman.

A few minutes later, her bedroom door opened and Impa walked in. Zelda stood up to meet her servant.

"Impa, thank the goddesses!" Zelda cried. She went to hug her friend, but Impa held out her arm, blocking Zelda. "Wh-What..?" Zelda asked, bewildered that Impa would do such a thing.

"What do you think you're doing!?" Impa shouted.

"What are you saying? Impa! It's me! Zelda!" Zelda cried. Impa just stood there, her arms folded, a clear sign that she was upset with Zelda.

"Yes, I know it's you, Zelda." Impa said impatiently. "Don't tell me you called me here just to give me a hug!"

"Why are you being like this?" Zelda asked. She looked at Impa with pleading eyes. "Can't you see I need your help?"

"No. What you need, is to leave the princess's room right this instant!" Impa barked.

"Impa, please!" Zelda cried. She motioned to her current state of dress. "I woke up like this!"

Impa didn't seem surprised by this though.

"Wearing your uniform? Did you forget to change last night? No matter. I can't imagine what you were thinking coming in here with orders to!" Impa's eyes narrowed. "You weren't thinking of stealing from the princess, were you!?"

"What! Impa, I am the princess!" Zelda insisted.

Impa responded to Zelda's cries by slapping her face.

"Ow!" Zelda cried. She fell to the floor, and started to weep. She couldn't believe how Impa was acting, she'd rarely seen her so upset, and she'd never seen her act so cruel.

"How dare you claim such a thing! Even in jest!" Impa shouted. "I don't train my maids and servants to act this way! You need to get your act together!"

Zelda was baffled. This whole ordeal was unbelievable. First she wakes up in a maid's uniform that she can't take off, then Impa comes and tells her that she isn't the princess anymore. Zelda's mind was rapt with emotions, she couldn't understand what was going on anymore. But something in her mind told her to keep quiet about being the princess, for now at least.

"Well?!" Impa shouted, impatiently tapping her foot. She seemed to be waiting for Zelda's response, and excuse for her "inexcusable" actions.

Zelda...

1153322211112.content:
With no other options available to the former royalty, Zelda decided to play along, for now at least. She knew she'd probably be considered insane if she kept rambling on about being the princess, Impa might even fire her, or worse! So Zelda had to keep quiet to avoid arousing more suspicion. Most of all though, she just didn't want to get slapped again.

"I'm sorry." Zelda said softly. "Please forgive me, I meant no disrespect. I don't know what's come over me myself."

"That's okay, child." Impa said, her voice and gaze softening. Impa offered Zelda her hand, the former princess took it and Impa helped her up. "I don't like being hard on my subordinates, but you have to promise me you'll be on your best behavior from now on, understand?"

"Yes. Thank you." Zelda nodded. She wiped her tears. She still tried to piece everything together in her mind, but right now she'd just play the subservient role she seemed to be meant to.

"Good." Impa said. She went and opened the bedroom door, and ushered Zelda through. "Come with me. Let's get you back to your duties."

Zelda did as she was told and followed Impa.

As Impa lead Zelda through the halls of the castle, the former princess started to understand this wasn't just some prank being played at her expense, something big must've changed overnight. Like all of Hyrule had suddenly accepted that she was not the princess anymore, and that she was now just a lowly maid. The changes in Impa's attitude towards her, and even the guards and castle staff she passed on the way seemed to confirm this. No one looked at her like she was the princess.

Though the real kicker had been her waking up in her current maid's uniform. There was no way someone could've broke into her room in the middle of the night and changed her into it. She'd have woken up during the change, not to mention her many guards standing watch for intruders. Zelda suspected there was magic involved in this world-wide reversal of fortune.

One thing she hadn't really considered until now was, if she's not the princess anymore, then who is? She had to know.

"Excuse me, Miss Impa?" Zelda asked meekly, not sure if it was her place to do so now.

"Just Impa is fine." Impa replied, sounding not too upset, much to Zelda's relief. "What is it?"

"Yes, well, Impa. Forgive me for asking..." Zelda hesitated. She realized how strange this question was about to sound, but she just had to know. "Um, who is the princess?" She asked awkwardly.

Impa stopped in her tracks. She faced Zelda and looked dumbfounded by the maid's question.

"What an asinine question!" Impa yelled. Zelda flinched, worried she might get hit again. But Impa continued, with some restraint. "The princess of Hyrule, whom you serve, I should probably remind you, is..."

If there was any upside to this situation, it was that Zelda now had a chance to be seen by someone. She wasn't sure if Navi was the ideal helper, but what other options did she have? She then shouted out to Link, "Link, listen! What we should do is..." She stopped mid-sentence when she saw the hero's expression, he was looking away from the tiny girls on the floor and his face was beet red. Which she might have expected, but was that blood running down his nose? "Link!" She shouted at him, even louder this time. "Get focused, you're supposed to be our hero!"

Link heard Midna's scolding this time, and almost immediately straightened up, he wiped the blood from his nose. And finally spoke, "Right. I got you Midna, we should get the girls something to wear!"

"Well, sure. After that we can talk about restoring my size!" Midna yelled.

"Well in that case, it's a good thing I helped that merchant! He gave some things that might just help!" Link says. "Hold on, I'll go get them." And with that Link left the house, leaving the shrunken women alone with each other.

There was an awkward air in the house for a while. Zelda was the first to speak up.

"I'm sorry, everyone." Zelda said quietly. "I don't know what went wrong with my spell."

"That was your spell, Princess?" Ashei asked.

"Um, well, yes." Zelda admitted.

"Hold on. Then that residual magic Midna spoke of, that was you?" Ashei asked. "You're the cause of all this?"

"Wait, you mean the Princess shrank all of us!?" Hena asked. "Is it true, Princess?"

Zelda was beginning to think she might be a in bit of trouble if she couldn't keep the other girls from jumping on her. She heard a little chuckle from under Ilia's clothes and rolled her eyes, that country girl would get a kick out of this. Zelda had to keep the others attention of her, that was best, she thought.

"Please listen to me!" Zelda said. "What we need to do now is focus on getting back to normal, now my magic is acting funny at the moment so we need-"

"To know just what you were thinking, shrinking us all." Ashei cut off the Princess. "Why would do such a thing? And did you shrink yourself as well?"

"Now I never said that I did!" Zelda shouted, trying to keep control of the conversation. But she could tell that the other tiny women were getting more upset and uncontrollable the longer this went on, Zelda would have to tell them the truth after all. But before she got a chance...

"So what is it then?" Ilia demanded.

"I think the reason that the Princess' magic isn't working is because of the mirror shard over there." Midna pointed to the table. "The mirror and the Princess' magic must have had some negative reaction to each other. Causing the portal between the light and twilight worlds to open, which is strange because the mirror shouldn't have worked at all, since it's all broken up. It's also how I ended up this small..."

"My magic caused all that?" Zelda asked.

"It's possible." Midna explained. "And if I'm right and this all was because of that magical reaction, then the only why to get your magic back is to find all the pieces of the mirror, again, and then I can get back..." Midna paused. "I mean, Zelda's magic will work again."

"So that's it, huh?" A big voice said.

The shrunken women all looked up and saw Link standing there, nude and all. He was holding the twilight mirror's shard.

"We need to get the mirror back together again." Link said. "Well, we've done it before! And besides, it's not like there's 100 pieces to find, I'm sure we can do it!"

The clothes they had were meant for dolls with bodies slightly smaller than the girls six inch forms, so they were ever so slightly tight on their bodies.

"Yes!" They said in unison.

Link grabbed them all up and gently deposited them inside his pocket. But Midna insisted on riding on his shoulder, like the old times she told him, and he allowed her to do so. Now that everyone was ready, the group left the house and started their journey!

Link entered Agitha's castle like normal. He immediately noticed a mirror shard hanging on a wall. Then he saw the bug princess herself, by the tree, with her bugs around her. Agitha was tending to her precious bug when she heard footsteps, she turned to face whoever it was. A big smile appeared on her face when she saw that it was Link.

"Oh, grasshopper, you're back!" Agitha said. "Did you find another little darling for me?"

"Sorry, Agitha. Not this time." Link explained. "I was actually hoping you might have something for me?"

"For you, grasshopper?" Agitha asked. "Why, of course! I'd love to help, after all, you did bring me all the guests for my ball!"

"Thanks. I was interested in this thing right here." Link said, pointing to the mirror piece that Agitha had framed up on her wall.

"Oh, this?" Agitha asked, taking the mirror shard down. "I found it the other day while looking for my little darlings. I don't what it is, but I thought it looked pretty. But if want it, you can have it."

"Thank you, Agitha." Link said.

Agitha was about to hand over the mirror shard, but then she spotted Midna on Link's shoulder. The tiny twili looked like a little insect to the bug princess.

"Oh my! Is that a new bug for me?" Agitha asked.

"Bug!? How rude!" Midna said.

"It talks!" Agitha exclaimed.

Midna sighed. "Look, kid. I'm not a bug, I'm a... I'm just small, is all!"

Link laughed at the Midna being mistaken some kind of bug. "Sorry, Agitha. I don't think this one'll fit in your collection!" Link joked.

"Oh, that's too bad..." Agitha said, disappointed. Then, she saw a little head poking out of Link's pocket. "Is that another 'not bug' in your pocket? Can I see it?" She asked.

Link sighed. The girls' cover was blown. "Uh, sure thing." He said, and gently scooped the four shrunken girls out of his pocket, and held them in his hand for Agitha to see. Agitha's eyes widdened when she saw that they really weren't bug after all, they were tiny little people. And it seemed like they were arguing about something.

"I told you to stay down!" Ilia shouted at Hena. "I told you she'd see you!"

"I'm sorry, I just wanted to see the bug girl is all!" Hena said.

"Amazing!" Agitha exclaimed. "They're like little wingless fairies!"

"Alright, Agitha, you've seen them." Link said. "Now can I please have the shard?"

Agitha looked up at the hero, then at the shard, then back up at Link. She then pocketed the shard.

"I want to play!" Agitha exclaimed.

"What! Agitha, we had a deal!" Link shouted.

"Let's have your 'not bugs' play with my real bugs!" Agitha said. "Please, grasshopper! Afterwards I'll give you the shiny thing you want, so please play with me!"

"What an unruly child!" Midna said under her breath, so only Link would hear. "I can't believe she would hold the mirror shard ransom like this! I say we just take it by force!"

Link sighed, this was getting out of hand. He just needed to get that piece of mirror from Agitha somehow, but he wouldn't try to take the mirror shard by force, like Midna suggested, he did need to get it though. Maybe he should just play along with Agitha for now. But he could tell by looking at them, that the shrunken women didn't want to play any games with this little girl.

Link decides to...
13231112221221212221121111122.title: They're not bugs, they're tiny women!

Link sighs and says.

"Alright We'll play your game,"

"Really! Thank you so much grasshopper!" Agitha says with a smile as she goes over to where some of bugs were.

"Always have to play nice," Midna pouts as Link puts the tiny twili with the rest of the tiny women.

"I'm sorry. But I don't think we have to worry," Link says with a smile.

"Link's right. Even though we are this small, I doubt we will lose to some bugs," Ashie says as she gets ready for any challenge Agitha would throw at them.

"Well, alright. If sure we can win, but it's still going to be scary seeing a giant bug up close," Ilia says as she tries not to think about how big the bugs are now.

"I have to agree. I don't even want to think how big those fish are now," Hena agrees.

"We have nothing to fear. We will win this challenge," Zelda says with a smile.

"I have to agree. This will be easy," Midna says as Agitha comes back with some bugs in her hands. The bugs in Agitha hands are Stag Beetle, Mantis, Pill Bug, Snail and Grasshopper. Agitha puts the bugs down in a garden. Agitha motions Link to put the tiny women in the garden as well.

"Here's the game. Out tiny races will towards the other side of the garden. You win when one entire team gets to the wall. Now who will win? My bugs? Or Link's wingless fairies? Begin!" Agitha says with as gives the signal to go.

No, and they lose, Agitha insists on another game
1323111222122121222112111112212.content:
Zelda and the rest of the shrunken ladies ran off as fast as they could. Their tight little costumes hindering the four girls who wore them's mobility ever so slightly. But not for one of them, Ilia seemed to have no problems running at breakneck speeds towards the goal.

"Gyaah!" She screamed. "They're even more disgusting than I imagined!"

The other shrunken ladies heard Ilia's cries and couldn't help but laugh. But, even at their slower pace, Zelda Hena Ashei and Midna were still far ahead of their insect competition. Looking back, Zelda could see the bugs were moving rather slowly and not really towards the goal at all. The grasshopper seemed to be hopping around aimlessly.

"This will be easy! *huff* We'll get that mirror shard no problem!" Zelda cheered.

"It's kind of a *huff* sad sight for them, though." Hena relented. "I wonder if they even know that *huff* they're in a race at all?"

"Don't worry about them, Hena." Midna told the fisherwoman. "Just focus on the goal in front of you!"

"Right!" Hena said, and picked up her pace.

The tiny girls continued to race to the finish, when suddenly, they all felt something strange happening to them! The girls had to stop in their tracks for a moment to catch themselves. Then it happened, the girls saw the world around them expand larger even their new costumes were getting bigger on them, and they knew what was happening, they were shrinking again!

"Oh no!" Hena cried. "We're getting smaller!"

"This is not good. If we get much smaller, Link might not be able to see us!" Ashei said.

Zelda turned to Midna and asked, "Why is this happening!?"

"I don't know..." Midna replied. "There shouldn't be any reason for us to have shrunk any further! Darn, and in the middle of the race, no less!"

"Oooh, I just want it to stop!" Hena cried.

Just a few seconds after Hena said that, the girls' shrinking slowed to a stop. Zelda estimated them all to be about an inch tall! Their clothes now once again too big for the girls, they all stepped out of them and stood in the nude.

Link watched from above as the girls shrank even smaller. He was relieved that they didn't shrink out of existence, but they were all so much smaller now. It would be that much more difficult for them to win the race.

Agitha meanwhile, was quite happy by this turn of events. Her childlike innocence meant she didn't think that the girls were really in any trouble, she just wanted her bugs to win. The girls were really in no condition to continue the race, but they knew the mirror shard was on the line right now.

Can they get themselves together to win the race in time?

"She's right! We can't let those bugs beat us!" Ilia yells as she starts to run as well. Zelda, Midna and Hena nod and soon the tiny women were running as fast as they could.

Link smiles as sees the tinier women still running the race, though he blushes a bit as he watches the girl's back sides.

"My darlings are not going to lose!" Agitha says with a smile as she claps. Suddenly the bugs stay in motion turn around start for the goal. Soon the bugs were moving at high speed to the finish line. The tinier women watch as the giant grasshopper soon jump over them.

"We have to go as fast as well can!" Hena says as she starts feel the sweat hard from all of the running.

The tiny women were able to stick together but two bugs pass them and make it to finish the line. The two bugs are Stag Beetle and Mantis.

"They only need one more to win!" Midna says as they were running along wtih the last bug, the snail.

"Okay. I can't lose to a snail!" Ilia yells and soon sprints with all of her might. Zelda and other women are impress with Ilia's running speed.

"That's the type of speed you get when you work as a rancher," Link thought with a smile as Ilia makes to the finish line.

"Good job, Ilia!" Ashie says with a smile as she is the second tiny women to reach the finish line..

"*Huff* Thanks *Huff*" Ilia says as she sits down on a leaf.

"Now it's their turn," Ashie say as she joins Ilia on the leaf.

"We're almost there!" Hena yells as the Zelda, Midna and herself were close to the finish line.

"So is the snail!" Zelda yells as the snail is using it's eyes to reach first. Midna wonders what they can do to win and then thinks up an idea.

"I have an idea! Hold on!"

Zelda and Hena wonder what Midna in mind as they see Midna's red hair turn into hand. Midna then grabs the two women and lifts them in the air.

"What are doing!?" Hena yells and blushes at Zelda and her bodies touching. Zelda blushes too until she sees what Midna is doing.

"Wining this race. Midan says as she holds the two forward. Luckily with Midna's long hair Zelda and Helen soon past the snail's eyes and get to the finish line.

"We won!" Ilia yells happily as she hopes up and down. Midna puts Zelda and Hena down on the ground.

"Oh my darlings lost by a inch," Agitha pouts as Link holds up his hand.

"This is a fair race and a win is a win," Link says with a smile. Agitha nods and smiles and gives Link the piece of the mirror.

"You're right. My darlings did the best they could. I'm proud of them," Agitha says as she looks at the bugs.

Link smiles and looks at the tiny women and figures he should...

"Alright take care grasshopper and wingless fairies," Agitha says with a smiles as she picks up her bugs and move them back to their spots.

Link bends over and looks at the tinier nude women and whispers to them.

"Are you alright? How did you shrink more?"

The tiered tiny nude women smile at Link talk softly at them. Zelda is the one to reply for the group.

"We have no idea. We were just running and suddenly we became much smaller," Link nods and looks outside Agitha's window notice that it's getting late.

"I think we'll stay in Castle Town tonight. It's getting late and you ladies must be tiered," Link explains to the shrunken women.

"Okay. That sounds like a plan," Hena says as she was ready for a bath and a good rest.

Link picks up the doll clothes and Midna's clothes and put them in his item pouch. Link then looks at the tiny women and lowers his hand down so they get on it.

"Thanks Link!" Ilia says as she gets on the giant's hand first. The rest of the women get on Link's palm and the young man blushes as he feels their bodies as they sat down lie down on their stomachs. Link then slowly moves his hand and slowly and gently puts the one inch women in his pocket. After making sure they are safe, Link decides to check what the mirror shard looks like and notice that the mirror shard is only one inch tall.

"Could the mirror be the reason they got smaller?" Link thought as he puts the new piece of mirror with the other one. Link then walks out of Agitha's castle and goes to the local inn.

__

"I can't believe we became smaller then we were," Hena sadly says as lies down from all of that running.

"So what do you think happen to make us smaller?" Ashei asks as she is wondering why they became smaller.

"I can't think of anything. Do you have any idea Midna?" Zelda asks the twili. Midna shakes her head.

"I'm sorry I don't know,"

"Say, could that mirror control our size?" Ilia asks out loud just talking to self.

"What do you mean?" Zelda asks, interested in Ilia's explanation with them shrinking more. The country women blush for a moment with Zelda and the rest of the women listening to her babbling to her self.

"Well... We only change size when we were near that mirror shard that Agitha had. So I was just thinking that maybe that the shards could affect our height," Ilia explains her thoughts to the other women. Zelda and Midna both look at each and then back to Ilia.

"I think you may be right Ilia. That's the only explanation at why we would shrink again," Zelda says while smiling at the country women.

"It's our only real explanation. But it's good for now," Midna says with a smiles proud for the country women able to think of an explanation.

"T-Thanks," Ilia says with her face red.

"I wonder if LInk found a room yet?" Ashei ask herself as she wants to take a bath.

"It shouldn't take that long," Hena says with a smile.

__

It didn't take long for Link to find the inn, he is able to go in and pay for a room and told the staff to not enter his room. The staff agrees as they want to give the hero of the land some private time in his own room. LInk enters his room notice that he had a bed, a book shelf, a table and a small dinning area. Link then notices that there is a door, the young man opens it and sees that it's the bathroom with a sink, toilet and a bath.

"I think it will be good time to get the ladies out," Link thought as he lowers his hand into this pocket and then softly says.

"We're at the hotel. We're in our room's bath room now, I figure you would like to take a bath first,"

Link then feels the tiny women's bodies on his hand they get on. Link slowly lifts them out of the pocket and puts his hand the sink. The tiny women are in awe as they look around the bathroom.

"It's really hard to imagine that I would be in awe for a bathroom," Hena says as she looks around the room.

"I have to agree," Ilia says with a nod.

Link is able to find a small enough bowl for the women to use for a bath. He breaks a piece of soap for each ladies and gives them a hand towel to dry them selves. Link is close enough to hear what Zelda had to say.

"Thank you very much Link. We'll be taking our bath now," Zelda says with a smiles as she gets in the bowl.

"Why don't you take a bath your self. You might as well use that tub," Midan says as she gets in the bowl with Zelda.

Link, Zelda, Ilia, and Hena were about to say somthing but also remember they made love yesterday. Midna and Ashei didn't really care if they took a bath close to each other.

The tiny women watch as Link strip out of his clothes and get into the tub.

"That's very nice show we're getting," Midna says with a smile as she watches.

"I wish we could take a bath with him..." Ilia says to herself.

"You just want to make love again. But then again I do too," Hena says with a blush on her face.

"You never know. We could grow at random as well," Ashei says to lighten up her friends spirit.

Zelda sighs as she looks at their big hero. It would be nice if they grew a little bit to join him in the tub.

1323111222122121222112111112212121.content:
As if on cue, the girls felt another strange feeling throughout their bodies. They were worried that they might shrink again, and then Link wouldn't be able to find them. But they soon realized that the world around them was getting smaller, not bigger, and they knew that they were growing at last! The all shot up in size very quickly.

"That mirror works in mysterious ways..." Midna said in surprise at their growth. "Even I don't fully understand it..."

"We're getting bigger!" Hena exclaimed. "Are we going to get back to normal!?"

The growing girls were all hopeful that was the case. Their growth lasted mere seconds more before suddenly stopping.

"Huh? Is that it?" Ilia asked. "We didn't get much bigger at all!"

"No, but, I think we're back to six inches tall." Zelda said.

"I think you're right, Princess." Ashei said.

"If I didn't know any better, I'd say this is a sign." Midna said.

"What do you mean?" Zelda asked.

"We've gotten our wish and grown, at least a little bit." Midna explains. "Now we can go spend some time with Link."

"At our sizes? We're still too small!" Hena said.

"Hmm, maybe you're right." Midna said. "It was just a suggestion. After all, don't you think we should tell Link the good news?"

"It would be like a pond to us. We could even swim," Ashei says and starts to think about swimming in the giant tub.

"Hey Link! We want to join you!"

Link was enjoying his bath until he heard a Ashei's small voice. He turns his head and sees the one inch women were now back to six inches tall.

Link chuckles at the tiny women swimming around in the giant tub with him.

Link and his shrunken girls enjoyed their time together in the bath. After they all had their fun, Link got out and scooped up the tiny girls and set them next to their costumes. Link told them to dry off while he went and did the same. The girls obliged and got dressed after they were dry, to the tiny girls relief the costumes they wore before now fit them again, and they all put on the same outfits. But then something happened.

"Hey, I want to wear the bikini this time!" Ilia shouted at Hena.

"Oh, really?" Hena asked.

"What's this?" Midna asked. "Trying to show off for Link?"

"N-No!" Ilia blushed. "I just want something that's easier to move around in is all..!"

"Well, I'm fine with it." Hena said and handed the country girl the little bikini, while she got the cowgirl outfit and put it on.

"Thanks, Hena!" Ilia said, and put on the bikini.

With that settled, the shrunken women talked for a bit longer while they waited for Link to return.

"Midna, can you sense where the next mirror shard is at?" Zelda asked.

"Hold on..." Midna replied and focused her energy on finding the piece of mirror. "Ah-ha! I think I've got it! It's faint, but it's energy is coming from a temple above lake hylia!"

"Wow, there's a temple above lake hylia?" Hena asked.

"I know that place." Ashei said. "Midna must be referring to the temple of the minish."

"The temple of the minish?" Zelda asked. "I thought the minish were just an old legend!"

"Yes, but I've seen it with my own eyes, although I've never gone inside." Ashei said.

"Why not?" Ilia asked.

"Because it is not made for normal people, but for minish. As such, it is very small. In fact, most people have no idea that it is there, due to its small size." Ashei explained. "Only now, in our shrunken state, would we be able to enter it."

"What luck." Midna said. "If the Princess here didn't shrink us to begin with, we'd never be able to get this next piece of the mirror."

"Hmm..." Was all Zelda could say.

Just then, the door to the room the shrunken women were in opened up and someone walked through. It was...

13231112221221212221121111122121211211.content:
The next morning, Link got up earlier than the girls and made preparations for their journey. Getting all the essential items, Potions, arrows, bombs and the like. When he returned to the tiny girls, he found them awake and chatting amongst themselves. They stopped when they saw Link come in, and ran up to his feet, like excited children.

"Ah, Link! You're back!" Zelda exclaimed.

"Where have you been?" Ilia asked.

"I was getting some things for the journey." Link explained.

"You should've told us!" Hena shouted. "Or at least, left a note!"

Link scratched the back his head. "Oh, sorry. I didn't mean to make you all worry." He said.

"It's fine." Midna said. "We've just all been waiting to go on the trip with you."

"Alright, give a minute to get everything ready." Link said, glad that they were all ready for the journey ahead. "Ashei, you know the way, right?"

"Yes." Ashei replied. "It shouldn't take us long to get there."

Link nodded and got his, and the girls' things together. Then he grabbed the shrunken girls and put them in his pocket, but Midna again insisted on riding his shoulder, Link let her. With everything ready to go, the group headed off for the minish temple at last!

Ashei gave Link directions. They made good time, and made it to the temple without any problems in about an hour or two. When they get there they find that...

the temple is quite in good shape. Could it be because of the Minish?

"What a lucky break!" Link says with a smile as he sees that he could enter the Minish Temple.

"Yes. Now we can let you do all the work," Minda says with a nod, the tiny twili glad she didn't have to do much work.

"Your the same as always," Link replies back as he remembers that Minda liked it when he most of the work.

"I wouldn't have it any other way," Minda retorts back to Link.

Link could hear Zelda, Hena and Illia giggle at the sight.

"We better go in," Link says as the young adventure tries to change the subject. "Say do you think there's going to be any Minish in this temple?"

"But aren't they just legends?" Hena yells as loud as she could do.

"Well.... There's a lot of Legends that came true lately," Ilia says as the country girl thought about all of the folk tales she heard when she was a kid.

"That is true. It will be quite the experience if we do meet them," Zelda says, the tiny princess seem interested in meeting the Minish.

"I doubt you would be able to see them Link... But those of us who are small, could meet them," Ashei thought as the tiny warrior seem to get interested at the thought of meeting the Minish.

Link is at the door of the Minish Temple, he notices he has to bend some what so he could enter. Link then pushes the doors open and they see......

choices: The girls have to fight a creature in there
The girls have to solve a puzzle in there
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Link ducked to get into the temple, there was a somewhat long hallway for him to walk through before he entered the first room, and could stand up straight. The minish temple's entrance was dusty and worn down. The room was a complete mess. This state of complete disarray led Link to believe that the minish were long gone by now.

"Looks like its been deserted for a long time." Link said.

"Yes. It's unfortunate." Zelda said.

"Yeah, I kinda wanted to see some minish..." Ilia said.

"Who knows? There could still be a few hiding around here somewhere!" Midna said.

"It's possible." Ashei adds.

Link explored the room, checking carefully for any traps or other devices hidden around. There weren't any traps though, or monsters for that matter. In fact, there didn't seem to be anything like that in this temple at all. Link thought it strange, as he passed from room to room without any real problems. Then, he came across a locked door that needed a key.

"It's locked!" Link said.

"Well go find the key!" Midna shouted.

"But we just explored every inch of the temple we could just now." Link stated. "There were no chests, or keys!"

"Hmm..." Midna muttered.

Midna had been on Link's shoulder the whole time, so she saw what he did, and he was right, they never did come across any treasure chests or really anything at all. It puzzled the tiny twili, and it was a mystery to Link and the other girls too.

"Wait a minute, over there!" Ilia suddenly shouted.

"What?" Link asked.

Link grabbed Ilia from his pocket and held her in his hand. Ilia pointed out what she was talking about, a small hole next to the door. Link went over to examine the small hole.

"That's odd, it looks like a little passageway." Link noted.

"Ah, I see!" Midna exclaimed. "This must be the way the minish move around the temple!"

"I think you're right, Midna." Link said. "And I bet the key's through there!"

Ilia hopped off of Link hand and peered inside the hole, finding that it was the perfect fit for her and the other shrunken girls.

"Alright, then." Ilia said, her mind made up. She turned back to Link. "Link! I think you should let us handle this one!" She shouted.

Link was a little hesitant to allow the tiny girls to go. He thought there might be some dangerous traps in there. But before he could even express his concerns, the tiny girls spoke up.

"She's right." Zelda said from Link's pocket. "We're the perfect size."

"Yes. And I think we can handle ourselves just fine." Ashei added.

Link took out the remaining tiny girls from his pocket and set them down next to little passageway. Midna hopped off of his shoulder and joined them.

"Okay, guys." Link said. "I'm leaving it up to you now. Be careful in there!"

The girls smiled and nodded. Link watched them all enter the little tunnel, they walked through it until he could no longer see them...

Midna had managed to land on her feet though, she helped Ilia up. "Sorry..!" She said. "I guess I should have seen that coming..."

"It's right here, Princess." Midna pointed out the key to the princess, it had fallen from the tiny twili's grip when she fell and was now just across the room.

The girls agreed and went over to the key. At their size they couldn't simply carry it in their hands, they had to work together to heft the "giant" key along. So they did, carrying it back through the little tunnel they came from.
Link was happy to see them as they came back through the small hole in the wall, and they had the key too!

"How was it?" Link asked. "Did you have any problems?"

The girls looked at each other for a moment, then laughed. Link was confused by their reaction.

Zelda broke her laughter and answered him by saying, "No. No problems at all!"

Link was still confused, maybe even more so now. But he went along with it. "Good." He said. "Let's get that door open..!"

Link took the key from the tiny girls and opened the locked door at last. He went back and grabbed the shrunken girls. With them in his pockets, and one on his shoulder, he entered the next room.
The first thing he noticed was another locked door.

"Darn, another locked door!" He thought. "I hope I can get open, without having to put the girls in more danger!"

1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Link watched as the three shrunken women climbed onto his hand. Zelda and Midna were now smaller, half their previous size. Ashei helped them onto Link's large hand. Link lifted them up to his pocket, but he took a good look at them before he put them in. He estimated their new size to be three inches tall. Then suddenly, Zelda and Midna felt strange again! And this time, Ashei was feeling it too!

"Link, I think it's happening again!" Zelda cried.

"Oh god, we're getting even smaller!" Midna shouted.

"I-It's happening to me too!" Ashei said.

Link could nothing but watch as the women shrunk again. It happened so fast, Zelda, Midna and Ashei were almost instantly shrunk down again. Before, Zelda and Midna could just barely fit into their doll clothes, but now, even the doll outfits were far too big for them! They had shrunk more than Ashei did, they were now only an inch tall yet again! Ashei on the other hand, shrunk to the size Zelda and Midna were just at, three inches tall.

"It's looks like it's stopped for now..." Zelda said quietly.

"Are you all okay?" Link asked.

"I'm alright." Ashei was the first to respond.

"We're fine, I think." Midna said. "We're just smaller."

"That's good!" Link said. "But I'm sorry, Midna, I don't think I can keep you on my shoulder like before."

"Aww, I thought you'd say something like that..." Midna pouted.

"It's okay, Link!" Zelda shouted. "It's probably best that we stay in your pocket anyway, at this size there are too many things that are dangerous to us!"

Link nodded and carefully put the smaller women into his pocket again. All he, and the girls, wanted to do now was find the mirror shard and get out of this dungeon...

1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Link spots yet another little hole in the wall. But this one was far smaller than any others he had seen so far, it was so small he barely noticed it at first, but the rest of this room's walls were flat and smooth, so it stood out to him. He still didn't think much of it, but decided to take a closer look anyways.
He went over to the hole and examined it. It was definitely much smaller than the others, he doubted even Zelda or Midna, the two smallest girls at the moment, could fit into it. They'd need to be about a fourth of their size to get in, at the least! He wanted to get the girls' opinions. So he took them out of his pocket, being extra careful with Zelda and Midna, and placed the shrunken girls on a small ledge right in front of the hole.

"What do you all think about this little hole here?" He asked.

"Hmm..." Zelda pondered. "It's even smaller than Midna and I."

"Yeah, I don't think that even we'll be able to fit inside it, Princess." Midna added.

"Do you think there's something special about this hole, Link?" Ilia asked. "Like there might be switch inside?"

"Yes, I think so." Link answered. "After all, there's nothing else in this room. And what better way for the minish to keep something hidden then by hiding the switch behind an extremely small hole?"

"Good point." Hena said.

"Yes, but it does raise another question.." Ashei started. "Don't you think it's strange that the mirror shard ended up here? In such a unique position?"

"Hmm, now that you mention it..." Link replied.

"It's almost like... Someone put it there." Ashei said.

"You're saying there might be some minish hiding around here after all?" Hena asked.

"I don't know. It just struck me as odd." Ashei answered.

"Well, anyway." Ilia said. "We still need to get in this hole to see if the switch is in there!"

"You're right." Link said.

Then suddenly, as if on cue, the mirror shard reacted to the girls causing some of them to shrink again...
