choices: Yes, Zelda stills wants to go inside the small tunnel
No, Zelda is still in shock
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Everyone continues to watch as Zelda shrinks to even smaller heights. The Princess is looking up at everyone else at the same time. From her point of view they all look to be growing, of course, she knows it's just her that's getting smaller. Link already was a giant to her, even moreso after she shrunk again twice before, and during her most recent shrinking, he seemed to be quadrupling in size! Even Midna, the closest to the ever shrinking Princess, and also closest to her size, was starting to look like a giant, Zelda only came up to her knees.

Then Zelda looked at the hole, she was at least relieved that she was able to enter it now, she'd have to go in and lower the mirror shard's protection from in there, she was the only one small enough to do so, after all. She was ready to do her best, and hopefully, open the way to the mirror shard. The tinier Princess started to walk in.

"Okay, I'm going in!" Zelda shouted, she wondered if Link could even hear her now.

Midna could hear her at least, she replied with, "Princess! You're still shrinking!"

"What!?" Zelda asked.

Somehow, Zelda hadn't immediately noticed that her shrinking hadn't ended yet. She just wanted to get in the hole and do what she had to, as a result, it didn't really occur to her that her shrinking hadn't stopped yet.
But as Zelda looked around again, she saw the world around continuing to grow, and knew that Midna was right. She was still shrinking! Zelda was panicked now, she looked at her twili companion. Midna's knees, which she was equal in size with before, were now far above her head, and still the Princess shrunk. Most shocking of all to the Princess, was Link. He had seemed to quadruple in size before, and with a sudden burst of shrinking, he had quadrupled in size again! His form was unbelievably massive to Zelda, his face covered her entire view.
Meanwhile, everyone watched as Zelda continued to shrink even smaller. They were all shocked by this, they'd never expected the Princess to get so small, they all wondered when it stop. Just as it seemed like it would never end, Zelda's shrinking suddenly stopped. Everyone sighed in relief.

"My goodness..." Hena said, she was six inches tall and Zelda looked like a speck, even at her size.

"How awful..." Ashei softly said.

"Zelda, are you okay!?" Midna asked, worried for the Princess' safety at her newest and smallest size.

Zelda stared up at Midna in awe. She knew the tiny twili was only an inch tall, but at her size, Midna appeared to be more like 50 feet tall! The size difference boggled her mind. Then, Midna crouched down and got closer to her.

"I'm sorry this happened." Midna whispered. "I can't imagine what it's like to be so small..."

"Midna." Link said, his voice was amplified to the tinier Princess, it was much louder, but not enough to hurt her elf-like ears. "Can you pick her up? I can't see her from here..."

Midna nodded at the giant. Zelda said nothing, she knew Link wouldn't be able to hear her anyway. And so she just let Midna pick her up. She was held in the twili's hand and presented to Link.

"Oh no..!" Link cried. Zelda was a speck to him and there wasn't anything he could do about it, he guessed her current height to be about 1/16th of inch tall. "This is terrible, I can barely see her! She just looks like a little speck on your hand, Midna... No, even smaller than that..!"

Hearing Link say that made Zelda truly feel how small she now was. But in the back of her mind, she knew she still had something that only she could do. That only question was, is she up for it?

Everyone is surprise but are proud that Zelda still had the courage to do what she must.

"Alright, Princess. I wish you luck," Midna says with a smile as she sits the tiniest member on the ground.

"I know you can do it, Zelda," Link whispers as he smiles.

"That's right!" Ilia cheers for the tinier princess.

"If you find anything dangerous make sure to come out," Ashei adds as the warrior would protect the princess to the ends of the earth.

"That's right! You can count on us backing you up," Hena says with gusto.

"You made some good friends, Princess. You also have me," Midna says to Zelda with a warm smile.

"Yes. Thank you everyone," Zelda replies to those who could hear.

Even though Link didn't hear the tiniest woman he could feel that Zelda is thanking everyone.

Zelda starts to move forward into the hole in the wall. Luckily for the very tiny woman the tunnel is very bright so she could see what is coming up. Zelda continues to walk until she sees a switch in front of her.

"I need to get on this switch. I hope I'm heavy enough to even push it down," Zelda thought as she steps on the switch, hopping she could press it down.

While they leave, the shard activates another size change for the girls
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
As Zelda got onto the switch, she found that it didn't budge at all! Horrified that she might be too small to make a dent in it, Zelda tried another option. This time she jumped on the switch, and much to her relief, the switch went down.

"Thank the goddesses!" Zelda thought, if that hadn't worked, then all of her and her friends efforts would have been for naught.

Zelda then made her way back through the small tunnel with ease. When she made it back to the other room, she was greeted by Midna, who was looking quite pleased. The twili bent down in front of her.

"Princess, it worked!" Midna exclaimed. "Whatever you did in there worked!"

Zelda rested a hand on her chest and let out a breath of relief. Then other girls also congratulated her on a job well done. Zelda smiled at their kind words, she was glad that she was still able to help the team, despite being the smallest of them all.
Link walked over, the mirror shard now in hand, and also gave the Princess a congrats.

"Good work, Zelda!" Link whispered to the near microscopic Princess. "We've got another piece of the mirror of twilight now. And it's thanks to you."

Zelda was happiest to hear Link's words of all. She knew that he couldn't even really see her at her size, but even so, hearing him say that, made her feel like he still thought of her as an integral part of the team, no matter how small she was.

"Thank you, Link!" Zelda shouted as loud as she could. She didn't care if Link could hear her or not, she just wanted to say it.

Link didn't hear her at all, of course, not even a little squeak. But Midna did, so she helped out the very tiny Princess, "Zelda says thank you, Link." She shouted.

Link smiled, "Of course!" He said. "But Midna, now that we've got the shard, shouldn't that have some effect on you guys' sizes?" He asked.

"Not necessarily." Midna answered. "The mirror probably was what caused us to shrink again, but the effects are random it seems. Sporadic. I don't think anyone can really say for sure when our sizes will change again, and if we'll be growing... Or shrinking." Midna hesitated to say that last part, she thought of how awful it was for Zelda at her current size, even if the tiny Princess didn't want to show it, and how much more terrible it would be for her if she shrank again.

"I see." Link said. "We'll just have to wait and see then..." Link took a moment to pause before continuing, as if he was waiting to see if anything really did happen. "Well anyway, it would probably be best to get out of this temple as soon as possible."

"I agree." Ashei chimed in.

"Yeah, I don't want to be in here any longer then I have to." Ilia said.

"Alright, then let's get going." Link said.

Link grabbed the girls and put them back into his pocket, all except for Midna and Zelda. Who were too small to put in with the other shrunken women at once. Link placed his hand next to the two smallest girls and waited for them to climb on.

"Come on, Princess." Midna said, holding out her hand. "I'll keep you safe."

Zelda nodded at the larger woman, and climbed onto her hand. Midna then climbed onto Link's hand herself, and both girls were very carefully placed back into Link's pocket along with the other shrunken women. With everyone together again, Link made his way out of the temple...

1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
"We're going to check the fishing hole." Midna explained. "I can sense it there."

"Oh wow! What luck!" Hena exclaimed happily. "I live there!"

"You live at a fishing hole?" Midna asked.

"Well, yeah." Hena replied. "Anyway, if the shard is there, I bet I can find it in no time!"

"Let's hope." Midna said.

"It'll be no problem at all! You'll see." Hena said excitedly. "But, I've been there for a long time, and I don't remember ever seeing anything quite like those other shards..."

These setbacks were proving to be quite a problem for the hero, he tried to counter them by going very slowly, and it seemed to be working.
Several more minutes passed as the shrunken girls watched in anticipation at Link's playthrough, he was sitting down next to them so they could all see, and then...

"Rollgoal!" Hena shouted as soon as the ball made it to the end.

"Good work, Link!" Ashei said.

"Congratulations!" Ilia exclaimed.

"Yes, nice work!" Zelda shouts, which goes unheard by Link, but Midna helps out the tiny Princess again.

"Me and Zelda agree." Midna says. "Good work!"

Although all the girls had congratulated the hero, what they all really wanted to see was Link lose and have to strip in front of them as a result. They were still happy for him, though. So their words of praise were genuine, even if they did want to see him lose.

"Thanks, everyone." Link said with a big grin.

After that, everything pretty much went back to normal. Hena put her clothes back on, much to Midna's despair. And Ashei got her shoes on too. It had gotten to be pretty late, so they all agreed that it was about time to go to sleep for the night. Link thanked Hena for offering her bed to him, but insisted that the tiny girls use it instead, which they did. Link fell asleep in a chair, and soon the girls were sleeping too.

Next..

1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Ashei heard sounds coming from beneath her, she looked down and saw that it was Zelda shouting, and Midna was with her! Both girls were now 1/16 of an inch tall, they appeared to the warrior as mere inches tall, even though she herself was only 3 inches tall. The warrior bent down to get a better look.

"Princess. Midna." Ashei said.

"Thank the goddesses you heard us!" Zelda cried.

"Yes, unfortunately It seems I've shrunken some more in the night.." Midna said.

Then, they all heard Link's much louder voice ask, "Ashei? Did you find them?"

Ashei picked up Zelda and Midna, and then held them up for Link to see. Link has to move in closer to even see the incredibly tiny speck sized women and even then, he has to squint just to make out any details on them.

"Midna... Zelda, too..." Link whispers.

Midna was awestruck by just how huge Link was to her. If Ashei was a giant to the tiny twili, then Link was a giga giant, about ten times bigger than the fisherwoman! She couldn't believe how small this size really was, but seeing Link gave her a good reminder of just how insignificant she now was. It was enough to break her formally calm demeanor, if only by a little bit. The tiny twili was now shaking a little from it all. She turned to Zelda and was surprised with how well the Princess had taken being reduced to this size, especially for so as long as she was so small, the Princess must be much braver than she thought.
Zelda was reluctantly getting used to her size though, so it didn't bother her as much. It did still amaze the Princess though, and she was caught staring up at Link's massive form just like Midna was.

"I don't... This is just, so much..!" Midna muttered, her expression now one of fear.

Zelda noticed her friend was scared, so she put her hand on the twili and smiled at her, "Don't worry. We'll get out of this, Link will save us, just like he always does." She said confidently.

"Yeah... You're right." Midna said, calming down.

"Look." Zelda said, pointing at Link's gigantic face far above. "Link's just as worried. So we need to keep calm for him, okay?"

Midna nodded silently. But her resolve showed itself, the tiny twili was back to her normal self.

"Tell him we're okay!" Zelda shouted, loud as she could at Ashei.

Ashei nodded at the tiny Princess and shouted to Link, "They say that they're okay!"

Link sighed in relief upon hearing those words. "That's good." He said. "Ashei, can you look after them for now?"

"Yes. I think that would be best." Ashei said.

When it was over, Midna sighed, she was glad that she could still sense the shards, even at her tiny, tiny size.

Hearing this, Ashei asked, "You do? Where is it?"

"Well, it's at.." Midna started...

1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Now that the group had their next location set, it was time for them to set off, for Hyrule Castle. As usual, Link got everything ready. But with Midna shrunken to Zelda's size, it was now up to Ashei to carry and take care of the smallest women of the group. It wasn't a huge change though, Link and the others were ready to go in only a few minutes.

As the journey back to castle town dragged on, the girls stayed put in Link's pocket, with the smallest two striking up a conversation amongst themselves.

"How does it feel? To be going back to the castle, I mean." Midna asked the equally tiny Princess curiously.

"Hmm... I'll admit, it does feel strange." Zelda replied. "I'm sure it'll be fine going inside the castle, but... After everything that's happened, and with me being at this size, I wonder how the chancellor and the others will react.."

"Yeah, that's good point." Midna said. "I'd bet that they might not be too happy with having their Princess so small, they might even blame Link for it."

Zelda nodded. "That's what I'm worried about. At my size, there's no way they'd be able to hear me explain the situation. Maybe it's better if I don't show myself at all..." Zelda sighed. The burden of her size weighed on her more heavily then before, now that she and her friends had to go to her castle, her size presented a new problem for the Princess.

"It might be better to just sneak in." Midna offered with a wry smile.

Zelda wasn't sure if the twili was being serious, she just lightly chuckled at the comment, and had to wonder if that really was the best option. How sad it would be for her, the Princess, to have to sneak into her own castle. Then another thought hit her, about the location of the shard.

"Anyway, how come you didn't sense this shard when we were in town before?" Zelda asked.

"Yeah, sorry about that." Midna said, rubbing the back of her head casually. "My powers don't work that way. I'm only able to tell where one is at a time, and never able to know which one will come up next."

"Ah, I see." Zelda said. "But it is strange still. I've never seen a mirror shard at the castle before."

The two's conversation was suddenly interrupted by Link who had stopped to say...

1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
"Oh, mister Link, sir!" One guard shouted. "Welcome!"

Link nodded at the guard and went inside the gate. but before he made it passed he was suddenly stopped by the guards.

"I'm sorry sir, but something terrible has happened." A guard explained. "The Princess has gone missing!"

Uh oh... Link thought. Now he thought it would've been a good idea to come up with a plan before coming to the castle. It was too late now though, as the guard began explaining what the royals knew about Zelda's so-called disappearance. He wondered what Zelda thought of the whole thing, she'd no doubt heard it, he thought.

"Oh no..." Zelda said softly. "They do think I've gone missing."

Zelda feared this would happen. She wished she could tell everyone that she was fine, she couldn't of course, and now she just hoped that they'd let Link inside.

"... And that's the situation." The guard said, having just explained what they thought was going on.

"Don't worry, I understand what's going on." Link said knowingly.

"Good. At least you've got the gist of it." The guard said. "Now, the chancellor wishes to speak to you. If you'd follow this path please." He motioned towards the castle entrance.

"Yes." Link said.

Link then finally walked into the castle courtyard. Once he was out of earshot of the guards, he spoke to the tiny girls in his pocket.

"We're in the courtyard now." Link whispered.

"Thank goodness!" Hena shouted back. "I was kind of worried there..!"

"It's nothing. But it's not safe to come out yet, wait until we're inside the castle itself." Link replied. "I think we should go and see this chancellor and explain what's really going on first, you trust him right Zelda?"

Zelda's response didn't come directly from the Princess herself, since her voice was so tiny she first had to tell it to Ashei, who then relayed the message to Link.

"The Princess says she trusts him..." Ashei said. "But, wait..."

"What is it?" Link asked.

It was in fact Minda who was now speaking up, telling the warrior woman that she's got a better lock on the location of the next mirror shard.

"Midna knows exactly where the next shard is!" Ashei shouted. "She's pin-pointed its location inside the castle!"

"That's good." Link said. "Now we can just go and get it. But, wait. Zelda, what do you think? What do you want to do?"

Ashei looked down at Zelda and waited for her response. Zelda weighed her options, explain things to the chancellor and ease their worries about her safety, or try and skip that and look for the mirror shard. The tiny Princess pondered both but in the end she decided...
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.title: Hearing of a missing Princess

"The Princess wants to see the chancellor. She wants everyone to know that she's safe,"

Link only nods and continues to walk down the path that guards told him to. While Link walks over to where the chancellor is the tiny girls in Link's pocket start to talk.

"So you think it's okay to trust this chancellor?" Ilia asks as the country girl wants to hear Zelda's answer once more.

"It will be fine!" Zelda shouts as loud as she could. "We can trust him!"

"If you trust him Princess, I'll trust him," Midna agrees to trust Zelda's judgment on want to meet with the chancellor.

"Okay. But do you have a plan?" Hena asks the tiny princess as the fisher woman wants to know what Zelda will do. Zelda is silent for a couple of minutes before answering Hena's quest.

"I do. You have nothing to worry about,"

"Okay," Hena replies to Zelda's answer and would trust the princess.

"I'll help you any way I can Princess," Ashei adds wanting to help Zelda any way.

"Thank you," Zelda says as the tiny princess is glad she had some friends with her to encourage her and to help her out.

choices: Hena, Ilia and Midna would stay hidden in Link's pocket
Hena, Ilia and Midna would split off from the group and find the shard
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Link enters the castle with the tiny girls in his pocket. The foyer was a big room with many chandeliers hanging from the ceiling. Link remembered how empty it was the first time he came here, back then it was part of his quest to rescue Zelda and save Hyrule, it was sort of like it was now, but this time he only had to help the shrunken Princess and the other shrunken girls and not save the whole country.
There were also many people in the room now as well, guards and servants alike, scurrying about doing their required duties. But there was also an air of worry in the room, all the guards and servants seemed to be anxious, no doubt they were worried about their beloved Princess Zelda.

Link broke away from the somewhat crowded room to find a more secluded space where he could speak to the tiny girls hiding in his pocket.

"We're in the castle now." Link told them.

"Oh really? Let me see!" Ilia exclaimed. She was excited to see the inside of a real castle, and so she peeked over Link's pocket a little bit to see what it was like.

"Be careful, don't let yourself be seen." Link said.

"Why not?" Ilia asked. "We're going to show Zelda to the chancellor guy right? So does it really matter?"

"Ilia please!" Zelda shouted. "Remember what I said? I have a plan, and it doesn't involve you being seen!"

Ilia understood, and ducked back into the pocket.

"What is your plan anyway?" Hena asked.

"Well, I think it'll be bad enough to show how small I've become..." Zelda explained. "And if all of you were revealed, I don't think it would be a good idea."

"Why not?" Midna asked.

Zelda sighed, she didn't want to hurt her friends feelings and was afraid that by answering that question she very well might. It was all part of her plan though.

"Because, if you were all seen, then we'd have to explain what was going in the house where we all shrank." Zelda explained.

"I get it, you're embarrassed to talk about it, huh?" Midna asked.

"No!" Zelda shouted. "That's not it at all! It's just that, I am a Princess after all.. So there are things that it just wouldn't be right for someone of my standing to do.. What went on in that house, well, that would be one of them..."

"I see." Ashei said. "Basically you want damage control?"

Zelda nodded at the larger woman. "I want to let everyone know that I'm with Link and that I'm fine. For the most part. But I also can't risk letting out our little secrets, you all understand, right?"

"Oh, sure." Midna said with a tinge of annoyance in her voice.

"Hmph. Well in that case, why not just make something up?" Ashei asked.

"Believe me, that's what I wanted to do." Zelda said. "And I think we can still pull it off. But only if all of you aren't seen."

"So less people makes for a more believable story?" Ilia asked. Also a little upset with the Princess' want to hide their affairs, but she could also understand why she needed to do it.

"That's what I'm hoping." Zelda said. "Anyway, I think it's best if only I and Ashei show ourselves to the chancellor. Ashei comes to the castle from time to time, so it would be the least suspicious."

"Very well." Ashei said. She was completely on board with the Princess' plan.

"Very well?" Link asked, trying to hear the conversation the girls were having was hard for him since he couldn't very well hear Zelda or Midna when they spoke. "Did you guys come up with something?"

"Yes." Ashei replied. She went to explain Zelda's plan to the hero.

"Okay. I understand." Link said. "That certainly sounds like the best way to go about doing this, for Zelda's sake. But then, what will the rest of you do?" Link asked, meaning Hena, Ilia and Midna.

"Don't worry Link." Ashei said. "We've got a plan for that too..."

"It will be alright Link. I'm good at sneaking around," Ilia says with a smirk. " I also am really good hiding. Remember at how good I was at hide and seek,"

Link chuckles at remembering his childhood days with Ilia.

"You don't have to worry about Midna either. I'll take care of her," Hena says as the fisher woman is now holding the tiny twili in her hands. Link then hears squeaks from Midan and Hena says. "Midna says the mirror is close by, so might as well get it fast,"

Link still feeling uncertain but knew he could trust Ilia, Hena and Midan with the task of getting the shard.

"Alright. When this door opens we'll go our separate ways," Ilia says with determination in her eyes.

"Let's meet back when everything is done," Link says to Ilia, Hena with Minda in the fisher woman hands. Midna made more noise and Hena replies the message to Link.

1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Midna had sensed the next mirror shards location, she had a lock on it's exact placement in the castle. Now Ilia, Hena and herself were going to find it by themselves.

The tiny girls had just split up from Link's group and were now in a large hallway, which seemed even more so at their reduced sizes. There were not a lot of guards in the hall, which made the going a little easier.

"Which way to the shard?" Hena asked the tiny twili sitting in her hand.

"It should be right, down this hall." Midna directed the larger girls, telling them exactly what room it was in.

Hena and Ilia ran down the hall in the direction Midna told them to. Ilia was still quite impressed with how the inside of the castle looked, everything was so shiny and well kept, and at her size, so huge!

"This is pretty cool, isn't it?" Ilia asked Hena as the two ran along the floor.

"What is?" Hena asked.

"This!" Ilia exclaimed, motioning to the grand room they were in. "Being inside this castle!"

"Huh? Oh sure." Hena said. "It's nice in here. But honestly, I just want to go home... At normal size, I mean."

"Yeah.. I guess." Ilia sighed. "But still, taking in the sights is pretty cool..! I mean, look at that!"

Ilia had pointed to a huge set of armor set up next to the wall. Hena saw it and had to admit, it was quite a sight to behold.
As the tiny girls, even Midna, stared up at the giant armor and other huge decor in the room, they failed to notice a guard had just entered the hall. Likewise, the guard had failed to notice the tiny girls scampering around on the floor. He walked towards them completely unaware that they were even there, as he passed them his huge foot knocked Ilia right over!

"Oof!" Ilia grunted as she was kicked by the unaware guard.

The poor farm girl was knocked back by, what was to her, several feet. She hadn't seen him coming at all. She had been hit right in her stomach and reeled over in pain, unable to get up.

"Ilia!" Hena and Midna shouted.

Hena wanted to go to Ilia's aid, but then she looked up at the giant guard above her. Hena hesitated and ended up frozen in her tracks, unsure of what to do. Midna couldn't think of anything either. The tiny twili was too surprised too, at both the giant guard and at how quickly their plan had started to crumble.

The guard seemed to have felt bumping into something and was scanning the ground to see what it was. Then the guard saw what he had bumped into and could hardly believe it. A tiny girl, she lay on the floor in pain. From what he could tell, she looked to be about a foot tall. And then he noticed that she was completely naked! The guard blushed under his helmet, but stayed the course, trying to figure out what this small girl was. He thought at first that someone that must be a fairy, that would explain he lack of clothing, but she wasn't a fairy, she had no wings that he could see. He wondered what she was and knelt down for a closer look...

Ilia was now starting to recover, the pain was minimal from the beginning and it was now subsiding quickly. When she got her bearings again, the first thing she saw was the giant guard looking down at her and...
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.title: Ilia's tour runs short

choices: Ilia leads the guard to the next mirror shard
Meanwhile, with Link and Zelda meeting the chancellor
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Ilia saw the gigantic guard looming over her, she backed up immediately, crawling back a few inches. The guard was covered head to toe in armor, which only served to make him more imposing to the tiny country girl. Ilia's first instinct was to scream and run away, but she stayed strong and looked him in the eye, well as much as she could, what with his helmet and all.
The guard just watched and stared at the tiny girl for a few more moments before finally speaking.

"What are you?" He asked.

Ilia thought about her response. It didn't seem like this guard wanted to hurt her or capture her, no, he just seemed to be genuinely curious about her. Ilia thought that this would be a good chance to come up with some kind of story to fool him, and hopefully lead him off the trail of her friends. Her friends, or friend at least, she could still see just standing behind the guard. Ilia had to come up with something now!

"I-I'm a... Fairy." Ilia answered at last, her voice betrayed her, as she sounded unsure of herself.

"A... Fairy?" The guard asked. "Are you sure? I mean, no offense, but where are your wings?"

"Uhm, well..." Ilia started, she had think of something fast! "I lost my wings. And, er, that's why I've come here!"

The guard stood up. "Is that so?" He asked. The question sounded rhetoric, but his voice sounded sincere. "How awful.."

"Yeah." Ilia said flatly, but then cried out, "I'm a fairy with no wings..!"

Ilia thought it was a good time to try some play acting, and pretended to cry into her hands.
The guard knelt back down quickly and put his hands up.

"Don't cry!" He said, trying to hush the "fairy". "Listen, I'll help you!"

Ilia stopped her fake tears and looked up at the guard. "You will?" She asked with big puppy dog eyes.

"Yes, of course!" The guard said. "As a member of the royal Hyrulian knights, it is my duty to help and protect any who need!" The guard then offered his hand to the tiny country girl.

"T-Thank you!" Ilia shouted. In her mind she was thinking, I can't believe how well this is turning out! Indeed, she had a guard who would keep her a secret and help her at her disposal now. Not only that, but when she looked back to where Hena was standing, she saw that the tiny fisherwoman was now gone, thanks in part to Ilia's masterful distracting of the guard. Hopefully her and Midna were hiding not too far away, so as for them to hear what Ilia had just pulled off. If they did, they could follow behind discretely, and if they didn't, they'd all still end up in the same place eventually anyway.

Next...

1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Luckily it didn't take long for Link to get to where the chancellor is. The chancellor is in his own room with books, a desk and a chair and globe, Link notice the chancellor seems a bit stress out. The chancellor is going through books and marking his globe at high speeds. Link decides to speak up so the chancellor would notice him.

"Chancellor.... You wanted to see me?"

The chancellor stops what he is doing and looks up to see Link right in front of him.

"Oh! Link, I'm glad you're here!" The chancellor exclaims as he gets up from his chair and goes over to Link. "The guards told you what happen correct?" Link nods his head. "Good we're going to need your help in finding here. I've been trying to find out where she went,"

"Well...." Link starts and and continues when the hero notice the older man is listening. "I've found her,"

"That's excellent! Where is she? Did you bring her with you?" The chancellor asks happy to know that the princess is found.

"It's better if I just showed you," Link says as he puts his hand into his pocket. At first the chancellor thought Link is going to pull out a crystal ball or even a note from the princess. But to the older man's surprise Link holds out the three inch form of Ashei! Link then places Ashei on the chancellor's desk.

"Ashei! What happen to you!?" The chancellor shouts as the tiny warrior covers Zelda so his loud yells will not hurt her ears.

"I'm not alone!" Ashei yells as the tiny warrior holds out her hands. The chancellor looks and sees a speck on the palm of Ashei's hand but on closer inspection he could see the speck is Zelda her self! Zelda blushes as she stares at the giant face of the chancellor and saw the older man is blushing even if the princess is almost a speck.

"Princess!? What happen to you? What is going on?" The chancellor making sure his voice quiet so not to hurt the princess's ears. The chancellor then heard the 1/16 inch princess make some noises but the chancellor couldn't understand what she was saying.

"The princess is saying while practicing magic a piece of the mirror twilight came in contact with her as she casting a spell. I was also near when the spell was cast and Zelda and I end up at these sizes," Ashei talks for the small woman. "Luckily Link showed up to help us,:

"Really..." The chancellor says as he looks back to Link and back to the tiny woman. Link, Ashei and Zelda wonder if their lie would be enough for the chancellor.

The chancellor......
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.title: Meeting with the chancellor

choices: The chancellor listens and comes to his senses
The chancellor doesn't wait and arrests Link
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
The chancellor had doubts about the Princess' story initially. Unbeknownst to Zelda, the chancellor was actually well versed in the ways of magic. As he had been studying it himself for decades in secret. The chancellor wasn't so old though, he was only about 40 years old, and in good shape, looking like a much younger man. But because of his extensive knowledge of magic arts, he knew that when Zelda told him her story something was up. Now he wanted to confirm his suspicions.

"Princess..." He began. "You say you were practicing your magic, yes?"

He waited for the Princess' response to come via Ashei. "She says yes." Ashei said.

"But wait, why weren't you accompanied by one of our trained wizards or witches?" The chancellor asked.

This time, the chancellor had to wait a little longer to get an reply, as Zelda was hesitant to answer. The tiny Princess suspected that the chancellor was onto something, and at her size, she couldn't really argue back effectively, so she answered honestly.

"The Princess says that she wanted to try it on her own." Ashei answered for the speck sized Zelda.

"I see." The chancellor said, the doubt in his voice was readily apparent.

"What is this?" Link suddenly interjected, thinking this might be taking a bad turn. "You sound like you're trying to interrogate Zelda. When you should be trying to help her!"

"Link!" The chancellor shouted, throwing his arms up and suddenly becoming very animated. He seemed like a much different person then before all of a sudden. "I'm sorry you feel that way. But what you and the Princess don't know... Is that I'm an expert on magic myself!"

"What!?" Zelda shouted in shock. She never knew, and this revelation came as quite a surprise. Then it hit her, if he really was a wizard himself then he must've seen through her made up story before.
The chancellor heard Zelda's surprised squeak come from Ashei's hand.

"You're surprised, aren't you Princess?" The chancellor asked. "I'm sorry I kept it a secret for so long. But now I know you're lying to me, Princess. You trying magic on your own is dangerous yes, but that's not all there is to this story, is there? And I think Link here had something to do with it!"

There was a moment of silence before Ashei was finally able to relay Zelda's message again..
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.title: Sudden doubts

choices: Ashei makes her escape
The chancellor captures her
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
The air in the room was very tense, as the chancellor seemed to have suddenly gone crazy. Link stood in front of the man. He looked calm and collected, but was really watched closely to see if the chancellor would try something. Down on to desk, Zelda was telling Ashei what to say, hopeful that her words would stop this increasingly tense scene. But just as Ashei was about to speak for the tiny Princess Zelda, the chancellor spoke up himself shouting, "Guards!"

Suddenly, a group of guards stormed into the room, surrounding the exits.

"Excellent." The chancellor said. "Guards, arrest that man!"

The guard all charged at Link, ready to subdue him. But Link didn't try to fight back, instead he let them knock him to the floor.

"Link!" Zelda cried.

"Ashei! Keep Zelda safe!" Link shouted as the guards apprehended him.

"Yes, I will!" Ashei shouted.

"Hmph, take him away!" The chancellor commanded.

The guards put Link in cuffs and took him to the cellar. Link made no attempt to fight back during this time, worried that doing so would make things worse. When Link and the guard were gone, it was just the chancellor and two shrunken women in the room. The chancellor looked down at Ashei, eying the tiny girl's palm, he was saddened to see Princess Zelda in such a state. Then he looked up, staring Ashei right in the eyes with a face of scorn.

"Now Ashei..." He began grimly. "I'm afraid we won't be needing your services any longer."

"W-What are you talking about?" Ashei asked. She didn't like the way the chancellor was looking at her, it made even her feel uneasy.

"After what happened to the Princess, I don't believe that we can honestly trust you ever again!" The chancellor replied. He then extended a finger out towards the shrunken warrior. "Hand the Princess over to me!" He demanded.

"Ashei, please don't listen to him!" Zelda shouted. "He's, he's not himself right now! T-There must be something wrong with him!"

"I understand, Princess." Ashei said. "I'll keep you safe."

The chancellor chuckled. "What are you two talking about?" He asked. "Quit wasting time!"

The chancellor then tried to grab Ashei, but the tiny warrior was too quick and she dodged his hand. Ashei then ran as fast as she could, while still keeping Zelda safely in her hand, to the edge of the desk. She was thinking on her feet now, so when she made it to edge of the desk and saw there wasn't really anywhere for her to go, she was stuck! She took a quick look behind her, the chancellor's looming form was making its way around the desk, no doubt to try snatching her up again. The tiny warrior took another look down, the drop to the floor was quite long at her size. But then, she saw the chancellor's chair and thought that she could make the jump to there and then quickly climb down the leg of it, then she could escape!

Ashei had to act fast, and next...
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.title: Evil chancellor

Switch over to Ilia and her group.
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Ashei then ran and jumps down to the chair. The chancellor is shock that the tiny warrior would jump down to the chair, allowing Ashei slid down one of the legs of the chair while Zelda hanged on Ashei's neck. Ashei is now on the ground and puts Zelda back on the palms of her hands.

"It's going to be shaky Princess, so bare with me," Ashei says as the tiny warrior runs as fast as she could towards the door. The chancellor regains his senses and now after them.

"This is bad! He'll catch up to you!" Zelda shouts as the tinier princess could feel the chancellor's movement. Zelda looks and sees a hole in the wall. "Ashei! There's a hole in the wall near us.

Ashei sees the hole Zelda is talking about is rushes towards it, the chancellor notices that the tiny warrior is now running for the wall and sees a hole in the wall. The chancellor dives hopping to get a hold of Ashei, but the tiny warrior runs through the hole. The chancellor stops short in front of the hole, the man a bit angry that he let the two get away but calms down.

"I'll get them later. Besides I still have Link," The chancellor thought as he walks back to his desk.

Hena shrinks out of sight just before he does
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Back at Ilia and her new "giant" friend. The search for the next piece of the mirror of twilight was well underway. Ilia had instructed the guard who found her about where to go next, and they ended up in one of the many storage rooms around the castle. This was where Midna had told Ilia that the next shard would be at. The room was filled with all sorts of boxes and crates, so the two were making slow progress.

"So..." The guard said as he and Ilia searched the room. "We're looking for some piece of mirror or something, right?"

"Yeah." Ilia replied. The tiny girl was making herself useful by looking inside and around the smaller containers. "I need it to gro- I mean, get my wings back!"

"My..." The guard softly said, feeling for the poor little "fairy". "How awful it must be to lose your wings.."

"It's.. It's horrible..!" Ilia cried. She knew the guard was talking about her "wings", but she was referring to her shrunken size.

Ilia then heard what sounded like a little sniffling coming from the guard. She couldn't see him through the huge boxes though. He's an emotional one. Ilia thought. I wonder how the others are doing?

Ilia walked around the side of a box, and then to her surprise, saw Hena there! Ilia ran up to her and hugged her closely.

"Hena!" Ilia exclaimed, happy to find her friend again.

"Ilia." Hena said. "Thank the goddesses we found you!" Ilia broke off the hug, and Hena then raised up her hand to show that Midna was there. "Midna here told me where to go, so I thought we'd run into you eventually. I'm just glad we did!"

"So am I." Ilia said. "How long have you been here? Did you find the mirror shard?"

Hena shook her head. "No, not yet." She answered. "Hey, so how's that guard treating you?"

"Oh, he's been very helpful!" Ilia said. "Oh! But I told him that I'm a fairy who lost her wings, and that the mirror shard will help me get them back. So he doesn't know what's really going on."

"That was pretty smart thinking, Ilia!" Midna shouted from Hena's hand.

"Yeah, thanks!" Ilia replied.

"Hey! I think I found something!" The guard suddenly exclaimed.

Ilia heard this and knew that he'd be looking for her soon, and she knew that she had to keep Hena and Midna hidden from him. She was about to tell them to run and hide behind one of the many boxes in the room, but the guard was quicker! His shadow loomed over the tiny girls in no time at all, he didn't seem to notice Hena or Midna yet, instead he simply asked, "Ms. Fairy, is this the mirror shard you're looking for?" Ilia turned around and saw that it was indeed a piece of the mirror of twilight he was holding in his hands.

Next...
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.title: The "fairy" and the guard find the shard

choices: Stick with Ilia's gorup
Switch over to Ashei and Zelda
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
"Yes. That's the mirror," Ilia says to the guard and turns her head to tell Hena to get away but notice that Hena is no longer there! The country girl at first thinks that Hena must have ran for it but soon heard voices from below. Ilia looks down and is surprise to see that Hena is now the same height as Minda!

"Looks like the mirror caused me to shrink more!" Hena shouts as Ilia bends down to pick them up.

"At lest your small enough so the guard can't see you," Minda notes as the fisher woman and twili get on Ilia's open palm. "Now we just need to get back to our meeting place,"

Ilia nods and looks back at the guard. "Thank you for helping me out. Could you hand the shard?"

The guard did what Ilia asked and gives the small woman the piece of the mirror. "It's no problem. I'm glad I was able to help," The guard is happy that he was able to help the "fairy".

Before the two of them can get out the room, anouther guard comes into the room. Ilia's guard friend turns around makes sure that he is hiding Ilia.

"You never are going to believe this, That hero Link was just sent to the dungeon. Me and the other guards were just going to check it out. You should come too," The second guard says to his friend and then goes out the room.

"Link is in the dungeon!" Ilia shouts as Hena and Midna are just as shock as the country girl.

"You know Link?" The guard asks as he turns around to face Ilia. Ilia with out hesitation says.

"Yes. He's helping me out right now. I would like to see him if you don't mind,"

"Okay. Besides there's no way it's Link down there. Must be a imposter," The guard says as he puts his hand out so Ilia can climb on. Ilia climbs on but makes sure that Hena and Midna were still in her hands. The guard puts Illia in one of pockets as he heads for the dungeon.

As they moved the small girls hope that Link, Zelda and Ashei are alright and that they could help them.
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.title: Fisher woman shrinks small and hearing the news.

choices: It was the chancellor, holding another mirror shard!?
It was Ashei and Zelda, crawling through a hole in the wall
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Ilia kept the tinier Midna and Hena concealed as she rode in the guard's pocket. The country girl could keep her little head poking out of the pocket discreetly enough as to not be seen by anyone else. As such she was able to see where the guard was going and how to get into the prison cells. When they made it down into the cells under the castle, she saw something else important too, one of the guards was letting a prisoner out for some reason. Ilia watched as that guard simply pulled a lever to unlock and open the door automatically, she took note of this.

As the guard walked along the hallway him and the shrunken ladies could hear a crowd of people talking further down. The guard, and Ilia, then saw a small group of other guards huddled around a cell, in it was none other than Link!

"It's true!" The guard exclaimed. "Link's been arrested!"

"No!" Ilia cried. "How could this happen?"

"Do you think something went wrong when they met with the chancellor?" Hena asked.

"Yeah, I bet you're right, Hena." Midna said. "I knew something like this would happen!"

"I don't doubt it." Ilia said. "But let's get some more information first." Ilia looked up at the guard carrying her. "Hey! Can you get a little closer?"

The guard looked down at the tiny girl in his pocket and nodded. He went over to Link's cell, he could see the young man inside, simply sitting on his bed.

"Hey, you believe this?" One of the other guards asked. "I thought Link was some big hero? Ha!"

"Yeah!" Another guard shouted. "I hear he did something to the Princess!"

"What!?" Yet another guard asked. "You think he's behind the Princess' disappearance?"

"Tch." Ilia's guard friend said. "That's enough!"

The other guards stopped their heckling and looked at him.

"Whatever..." One of them said. "I've got work to do."

"Yeah.." Another one added.

Then, one by one, all the guards left the prison and, hopefully, returned to their posts. Leaving just Link, Ilia's guard, Ilia and the other shrunken women in the prison. Link knew the others had left, but still didn't bother to look outside his cell.

"Here!" Ilia shouted from her protectors pocket, and she raised her tiny arms up as well. "Let me out!"

"Ah, yes. Of course!" The guard stammered.

The guard picked up Ilia from his pocket and set her down on the cold, hard floor of the prisons. He wondered what she was planning on doing. He saw his little "fairy" friend run across the floor and reach Link's cell, then much to his surprise, she was able to squeeze through the bars of the cell.
Ilia ran some more until she was right under Link's big, sulking form. When Link saw the tiny Ilia he immediately brightened up.

"Ilia!" He exclaimed. "How did you find me?"

"Him!" Ilia shouted, pointing to her guard friend, who was waiting patiently outside the cell. "He helped me get down here."

"Oh, really?" Link asked, then lowered his voice to ask, "Does he know about the mirror shards?"

"Yeah." Ilia said. She held up the latest shard for Link to see. "He helped me get this one! But... He thinks I'm a fairy and that the shards will help me get back my 'lost' wings."

"Ah, I see!" Link said, stifling a laugh. He faced the guard. "Thank you for helping my little 'fairy' friend here, sir!"

"Y-Yes, of course!" The guard said. He never thought he'd be thanked by the great hero Link, it made him a little nervous.

"Link!" Ilia shouted. Bringing the hero's attention back to her. Link could see Ilia holding up her hands, and there appeared to be something small on each. "Hena shrunk again after we found the mirror shard. And Midna's still the same height."

Link sighed. He wished that the shard's would do more growing than shrinking. But at least they were all together again, but then he remembered Ashei and Zelda, who he thought were still with the chancellor. But before he could say or do anything about the other shrunken girls' plights, someone came into the room...

Zelda had the same thought as the tiny princess could leave her kingdom and her people in the hands of that evil man. Zelda wanted to go after him but at her size she wouldn't be able to do anything.

choices: It causes a growing effect

1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
With everyone back together again, things were looking up for the group. But then, they all heard footsteps coming from down the hall. From the metallic clanging of their steps, it sounded like a group of guards were coming!

"More soldiers?" Link asked.

The guard could see it from outside Link's cell, there looked to be about four guards closing in on them. "Yep, looks like it..!" He said. Acting fast, the guard flipped the lever to open Link's cell. He wasn't sure what was really going on, now that there was another supposed "fairy" in the room, but he knew that Link wasn't a bad person he saved Hyrule before for goddesses' sake!

The cell door opened, and Link stepped outside. The guard was ready to fight alongside Link and had his weapon at the ready, but then Link spoke.

"Stay back." He said. The guard did as he was told.

The guards were charging at Link now, screaming and holding up their weapons. Just as they came into arms reach, Link pulled out his sword, which the guards so graciously allowed him to keep in prison. He used his signature spin attack to easily dispose of the guards. All at once the attacking guards were knocked into the walls of the small prison hallway and rendered unconscious.

"W-Wow!" The helpful guard exclaimed. "What power!"

Link turned around. "Thank you for your help. I'll take it from here." He said. The guard understood, after seeing Link's swordsmanship up close, he knew that he'd only get in the way from here on.

"I understand." The guard said. "I know you've probably got a lot of shards to still find, so I'll try and help you by keeping things under control here in the castle as much as a lowly guard like myself can. Good luck!"

And with that, the guard who had helped Ilia so much ran off. As he left, Ilia couldn't help but think that she heard him crying again. The tiny country girl just giggled and then looked up at Link, who was kneeling down before her.

"We don't have a lot of time." Link said. "We need to get out of here quickly and find the other shards."

Ilia nodded, but then heard Zelda speak.

"I hate leaving my people in the hands of the chancellor..." Zelda said. "But, there's nothing I can do at my size."

"Zelda..." Ilia said.

"What is it?" Link asked, unable to hear the tiny Princess' words.

"Wait a minute.." Midna interjected, thinking. "You said before that the chancellor's actions at the castle were strange, right?"

"Yes." Zelda replied, wondering where Midna was going with this.

"I see." Midna said. "Well, in that case, maybe the mirror shard had something to do with that? It's possible that he might have been corrupted by the power of the mirror! Link and I have seen it happen before."

"Really?" Zelda asked, hopeful that the chancellor may still be saved.

"Yes, Link and I have seen it happen before." Midna explained. "When we get all the pieces of the mirror of twilight back together, he should return to normal!"

"Oh, that's great news!" Zelda exclaimed. She was glad to hear that there was a possible explanation behind the chancellor's earlier actions.

"Hmm.." Ilia said, then smiled up at Link. "It's nothing, we should be leaving now!"

"Okay, let's go!" Link said. He picked up the shrunken girls and headed for the exit. But then the mirror shard activated..!

1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
"I see it... In... Link's house?!" Midna exclaimed, shocked to be sensing a shard there of all places. "Not only that, but I can't sense any other shards. Before I was able to get a faint read on them, but now, I can only sense this one."

"Does that mean, is this that last mirror shard!?" Hena asked.

"Yes. I certainly seems so." Midna replied.

"Link, did you hear that?" Ilia asked. "Oh, no, of course not... But, Midna's saying that the next shard is the last one! And it's at your house!"

"My house?" Link asked. "That's great! We can be there in no time!"

"It's strange, yes." Link replied. "But I'm not complaining. Not when we're so close to the end of this journey."

As soon as Link said that, him and the girls realized that this really was it, the end of their journey together.

"So this is it then, huh?" Ilia asked. "After this we'll all go back to normal."

"Yes." Ashei said. "It's kind of sad in a way."

"Don't worry, we'll still see each other!" Link assured the shrunken girls.

"No, Link..." Midna whispered under her breath so nobody could hear her. She knew she'd have to return to the twilight realm after everything was done, and she'd have to destroy the mirror again as well. "We won't..."

Next...
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.title: The last shard is at Link's house

1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Link then starts to walk back to home as the tiny girls in pocket thought about their journey with everyone.

"Soon we're return to normal.... I have to admit it has been hard but I now I have more friends now," Zelda thought as the princess looks around. "Even when we return to normal, I have to make sure we spend more time with each other after I fix things at the castle."

"I can't believe it's almost over. Even though this start when I wanted to know where Link went...... Even though I got shrunk, it was really fun. I got really close to Link and the other girls..." Ilia thought with a smile. "Also this is like my first journey since I don't really get out of the village often. I hope we can get back together again after this,"

"Well this has been quite something. I never imagine I would go on an adventure with Link and even do those type things with him and the other girls. especially with the princess, " Hena thought as the fisher woman blushes at what they did together. "We have to get together and do a fishing trip,"

"This has been an intresting trip. I never imagine that I would do those sort of things with the princess, Hena and even Link," Ashei thought to her self. "I have to take them up to the mountains some time. It would be nice trip for the princess, Ilia, Hena and Midna. Link and I would be their guides since we now the area,"

"It's going to be over soon.... I wouldn't imagine I would get to meet Link and the princess one more. I didn't expect that we would be part of an orgy," Midna smiles at everyone having their fun with each other. "I hope you understand that I must leave once more Link. I know you will not be alone since you have everyone with you...."

Link was thinking why the last shard is in this house. The hero wonders if the shard went to his house because of Midna herself. The group continues to walk until...
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.title: Heading to LInk's house to get the final shard

choices: Link wants to find it now
Link agrees to wait until tomorrow to look for it
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
The journey to Link's house was surprisingly fast, Link wasn't taking his time walking anymore, instead the hero ran as fast as he could to his house in Ordon Village. The tiny girls in his pocket held on as the ride became quite bumpy from all of Link's running, but not so much that it was too uncomfortable for them. Link ran and ran as the sun began setting above him, it was already well into the day when they had escaped the castle, so by the time the group reached Link's house it was sundown.

"Here we are." Link said as he stopped in front of his house to take a break from all the running he did and catch his breath.

Ilia and Ashei peeked out from Link's pocket to see, they were currently the only ones big enough to do so. There was Link's house, looking the same as ever.

"So this is your house?" Ashei asked. She'd never seen Link's house before and was surprised to see that it was basically a tree. "What interesting architecture!"

"Yep. Home sweet home." Link said. "Now hold on tight, cause I've got to climb up the ladder first."

Ilia and Ashei nodded then ducked back into the pocket and held on to the cloth. They felt the world around them shake once more as Link grabbed onto the ladder and climbed up. As they went up, Midna had another vision.

"The shard, I see it!" She exclaimed.

"Really? Where?" Hena asked.

"It's somewhere dark..." Midna answered. "Dark... Oh, Of course! It must be in the basement."

"Okay. Then that's where we'll look." Ilia said.

Then the girls felt the pocket stop shaking, Link must've reached the top. They then heard the sound of a door opening.

"We're in." Link said. "Hold on a second and I'll let you guys out."

Ashei and Ilia took that as their signal to get the tinier girls ready, the equally small Zelda, Midna and Hena were ready and let the larger girls pick them up. Meanwhile, Link found a suitable place to put the shrunken girls in the form of his table, reaching into his pocket and pulling out the two biggest girls, Ilia and Ashei, then placing them down on the surface.

"Sorry for the bumpy ride, girls." Link said. "I hope it wasn't too bad..!"

"Not at all." Ashei said. "We all fine, even Zelda, Midna and Ashei." The warrior held up the tinier girls to show Link that they were there.

"Oh, good!" Link said.

"That's not all." Ilia said. "Midna had another vision, she saw the next shard in your basement!"

"The basement, huh?" Link asked. "It could take a while to find the shard if it's down there. Since it's always so dark, and oh yeah, I put some stuff down there just recently, so it might take even longer!"

"Don't worry." Ashei said. "We can always wait until tomorrow to start looking for it, if you want?"

Next...
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.title: Last shard in a dark place

choices: Link and Ilia come back up with the mirror shard.
Link comes back up and needs Ashei to find Ilia. Ilia is now smaller!
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
"I think I'll just go it right now," Link replies as the hero is a bit worried about Ilia and Ashie getting as small as Zelda, Hena and Midna.

"Yeah. I have to agree. How about if I go with you?" Ilia asks the giant. "It might go faster then just you going down,"

"That sounds good. I'll stay here with the princess, Midna and Hena," Ashei adds and then tiny squeaks were heard, Ashei nods and then says. "These three say you two be careful down there,"

"Thanks," Link and Ilia both say as Link puts his hand out to Ilia. Ilia gets on Link's hand and Link puts Ilia back into his pocket. Before Link goes down to his basement, the hero went over to the front door and lock.

"Good Idea. Don't want anyone coming in and seeing them," Ilia shouts from Link's pocket, happy that Link thought about someone barging into his house. Link nods and goes to the ladder that leads to the basement.

The tiny girls watch as Link does down the ladder with Ilia in his pocket. After they see that Link is out of sight, Hena opens her mouth.

"I hope they're able to find it,"

The fisher woman is happy that their journey is almost over but feels a bit sad about everyone separating.

"Yes. Ashei and I need to go back to the castle and make sure everything is alright," Zelda adds and the larger woman nods in agreement.

"Yes..... We all have things that we must do," Midna says as the twili knew what she must do when they complete the mirror.

Zelda sees that Midna has a sad look on her and wonders if it's something to do with the mirror. Before Zelda could ask what's wrong with Midna....

1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Link came back up from the basement with something in his hand. He flashed it at the girls.

"Here it is!" He exclaimed. "The last piece of the mirror of twilight!"

"Excellent work Link, Ilia!" Ashei shouted, her and the tinier girls cheered.

"Thanks, Ashei!" Link said. "It was surprisingly easy to find, even in the dark. I guess it was shining..!"

Link put the piece down on the table, and also let Ilia down as well. The other girls were relieved to see that Ilia hadn't shrunk any further, but also wondered when the new mirror piece would activate.

"Alright, girls." Link started, and dug out the other mirror shards from his inventory. "It's time to put the thing back together again."

The shrunken girls watched as Link arranged the pieces and tried to put them back together again. But then...

is stop by the others before she enters the mirror.
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
The three 1/16 girls feel like another size changing is happening, luckily for them instead of getting smaller, the three are growing! Ashei is happy and sets the three growing girls on the table. Link is happy that Zelda, Midna and Hena are growing. The three stop growing when they reach the height of five inches.

"Well at least we're not that small any more," Hena says with relief in her voice. "You must be happy too, right princess?"

"Yes. I'm glad I"m a little bigger," Zelda says with a smile. "But Ashei is still a smaller size,"

"It's fine princess. I"m glad you're no longer that small," Ashei relies happily that the princess is no longer 1/16 of a inch tall.

"So since we have the mirror back to together, how do we grow back to normal?" Ilia asks as the country girl thought that all the girls including herself would grow back to normal.

"I wonder as well," Link says as he thought the same thing as Ilia.

Midna not saying anything just smiles as the twili looks at the mirror, Minda knew what she had to do.

"Zelda just need to use her magic again. You'll return to normal," Minda explains to the group. "Since you were about this size when Zelda shrunk you back then,"

"That's right! Zelda just use you're magic to return us to normal," Ilia says with a smile.

Zelda nods but feels like she is forgetting something. The other felt it as well, as the others were in thought Minda walks over to the mirror ready to go back to her world. The twili is happy that she was able to meet Link and Zelda once more along with the others, but she knew she had to go back.So Midna decides to leave before the others figure it out. Minda...
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.title: The two princesses and fisher woman grow to 5 in.

choices: She was normal size (END)
She was still tiny!
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Midna was feeling a lot of emotions right now, the of which were sadness and regret. She was sad to leave her friends again, and regretted that she may never come back. But she also felt happy too, to spend a little more time with Link and Zelda was worth it, she reasoned. Though now that the mirror was back together again, it was time to for her to go home.
Midna looked around at her friends one last time, they were all smiling happily now that the journey was over and they could return to their normal sizes and lives. She knew that they'd have plenty of time to see each other again after it was all done, but not her, no she'd have to return to the twilight realm to rule over and guide her people once more. But despite the sad feelings that thought brought her, she smiled at her friends brightly once last time. Then she went...

Link and the tiny girls were busy trying to figure out how to put the mirror shards back together again. They all worked together to do this last thing on their journey, everyone had a piece to put into the mirror, and everyone had soon found which pieces connected together to form the twilight artifact. After everyone had put their piece into place, they still had one more to go, Midna's.

"Midna, we only need one..." Zelda started, but noticed that Midna had seemed to disappear. "More..." She finished softly.

"Where's Midna?" Hena asked.

"Oh no! Did she shrink again?" Ilia asked, concerned that the tiny twili might've shrunk while they weren't looking.

The tiny girls started their search to find a tinier Midna on the table top. They looked for her everywhere, but couldn't find her. Finally they gave up.

"Where could she have gone?" Hena asked.

"Hmm..." Link said, looking at what would've been Midna's piece of the mirror. He looked over and saw Zelda was eying the shard as well. "You don't think..? Would she?"

"I-I think so, Link..." Zelda replied. "She must have..."

"What? Must've what!?" Ilia asked.

"Midna's gone back to the twilight realm." Link answered. "She must have.. She must've done it when we weren't looking and snuck back in through the mirror shard somehow."

"What?!" Hena cried, sad to hear of friend's possible decision to leave so suddenly.

"Are you sure?" Ashei asked.

"I don't know for sure." Zelda answered. "I had thought she wanted to return to normal size before going home, but maybe.. The reason she didn't go home, was to help all of us find the mirror shard so we could return to normal..."

"Oh, Midna.." Ilia whispered.

Meanwhile, in the twilight realm, Midna had just appeared through the transport. Her home looked the same as ever, she was glad to see it was doing well in her absence. She then saw a twili was nearby, another look revealed that it was one of her guards, and not only that she compared herself to the twili and found that...
1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.title: A quiet farewell

1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.content:
Midna smiles as she is back to normal, the twili then use her magic to get clothes back on her naked form. Midna then looks back the mirror and smiles.

"I had a lot of fun. So thanks everyone," Minda thought and then goes back to work.

______

Link and everyone are sad that Midna had left but Zelda knew she had to cast her spell once more and return everyone back to normal. Luckily Minda left the last piece of the mirror near the mirror and the princess finishes the mirror.

Zelda cast her spell and magic filled the room as all of the girls shrunken by her previous magic glowed in a bright light, a sure sign of a powerful magic spell. Their bodies shimmered and shined and then finally, they started to grow!

"It's working!" Ilia exclaimed as she saw the room around her start to get smaller.

"Oh yes, thank goodness!" Hena cried.

Bigger and bigger the shrunken girls grew until finally, they were all restored back to their normal heights. Then the magical light faded and Zelda could stop her chanting. The princess opened her eyes and saw the everyone had indeed grown back to normal, including herself!

"You did it, princess!" Ashei exclaimed, proud of Zelda.

"Oh, thank you! Things can finally get back to normal around here..!" Hena said.

"Yeah, thanks Zelda!" Ilia said. She knew Zelda was the reason the whole mess started but, now she didn't care, she had had fun on the journey and made some good friends along the way.

"Your welcome, everyone." Zelda said in a formal tone of voice, but really, she couldn't have been happier.

"There is one thing you're forgetting. But I don't mind this," Link says with a smile as he looks at the normal naked size girls.

The girls look down and see they were once again naked but didn't really care about that right now.

"Well if it's you, I don't mind," Ilia says with a smile as the country girl goes over to Link and gives him a quick kiss on the lips. "You also help us out as well,"

"Yeah. We need to get back together some time," Hena adds with a smile and gets close to Link as well.

"Yes, don't we princess," Ashei says as well as Zelda nods her head and says.

"We need to get together once we get everything sorted out at the castle. Link do you mind if we use your extra clothes?"

"It's okay. At least you have a reason to come back," Link replies with a smile on his face.

The girls are happy and soon were trying out of some Link's farm clothes. Link is happy the girls are enjoying themselves as he looks at the mirror, the hero is surprise that the mirror is still in tack after the girls return to normal.

"So do you think we can use this to talk to Minda?" Ilia asks as the country girl is now wearing Link's farm clothes.

"I have no idea. Last time Midna shattered the mirror," Link replies as he picks up the mirror.

"Maybe we can meet each other again," Hena says as the fisher woman buts on one of Link's clothes.

"Yes. I have a feeling we'll be again one day," Ashei adds on as the warrior puts on one of Link's tunics.

"That's right. If Minda was able to go through a shard, we should be able to use to contact her," Zelda says with a smile. "But first I need to fix things at the castle,"

"Sounds good," Link says with a smile as he looks at girls. The group soon left Link's house, but before they left the hid the mirror in Link's basement hoping to use the mirror to get in contact with Minda once more.
