1323111222122121222112111112212121121121.title: Who does it effect?

choices: Zelda tries to fight back.
She remains powerless up to Agitha's Castle.
Agitha is interupted by Link on the way
13232.content:
Zelda remained silent but also astonished by who had just opened the door. Agitha, that 10 year old girl who pretended to be of royal blood among Castle Town's...bugs.

Zelda had always despised the fact that such a short child could mimic aristocracy like that of the Hyrule Princess, but now...she was the one to act with discretion! The girl's knees seemed to be as tall as a Goron was to Zelda if she was at her normal height! The latter kept shrinking, but was not tiny enough to avoid the intruder's hand, grabbing as easily as if she were a doll.

"P-put me down you hear me?!" Zelda said in her now squeaky voice.

"Well, it looks like the scroll containing the spells my servants have left in your castle has paid off! Enjoying that shrinking spell, I hope? With it, I got one new guest to add to my castle for the ball! "

Zelda was confused. What could that child be talking about? How did she manage to have servants? And how did they succeed in hiding the spells she had just learned?
Seeing how lost her prisoner was, Agitha explained her the situation.

"A weird turn of events, huh? After all, my insects are the most loyal and competent soldiers."

Zelda finally understood what Agitha had planned all along.

"So if I found those spells only because..."

"..my bugs sneaked the scroll in your private quarters. I knew you met your Grasshopper friend in this place quite often. My servants are my eyes and hands."

And so, Agitha directed towards Castle Town, with Zelda now as tall as a thumb.
13232.title: Agitha. The Bug Princess

choices: ..Screamed as a now giant beetle charged at her.
..noticed some of her magic was back.
..cried as Agitha picked her up
132322.content:
Zelda bumped her fists against the girl's grasp.

"Wow, that tickles!" the latter said. "I'm sure my other bugs are going to enjoy your massaging skills as well!"

Zelda ceased trying to break free: even if she had stopped shrinking, Agitha was now way too huge, and therefore too strong to let her escape. As they got out of the house in the middle of the forest, Agitha got into the carriage she had used to come. She waved the coachman to head back to Castle Town.

"How is it possible for a kid like her to have so much authority?! " Zelda thought. Something about her kidnapper was definitely too strange. Not only did she plan all along to shrink her, but she also succeeded in kidnapping the princess of the entire Hyrule Kingdom!

Agitha smiled at her shrunken prisoner, before saying: "You're so cute! I'm so glad to have you as my new guest!"

Before Zelda could even reply, she released a squeaky scream as her gigantic abductor dropped her in a glass bottle.
"Here you go, I would certainly not let such a gracious treasure for my castle like you get harmed during our travel!" The ten year old lass explained.
Through the walls of her crystal cell, Zelda noticed they were already approaching Castle Town. She had to find a way out, and quick! Zelda tried to cast the many spells she knew, but felt very weak when doing so. She then observed some sort of magical glow emanated from the bottle.

Agitha, commenting the princess's reaction, whispered:
"Do you really think I wouldn't have taken some measures to prevent you from escaping? I added in that bottle a poison which neutralizes any magic coming from the spells I sneaked to you. The effects can only be reversed with this antidote."

Agitha showed her a small (but huge to Zelda!) vial filled with an emerald liquid.

"But don't mind about that. Instead, I advise you to give my guests a good impression, so that they could see in you a nice partner, and not their next meal."

Zelda gasped out of fear. How the heck did the situation turn so sour? The carriage stopped, and Agitha got in her so-called castle, the bottle Zelda was in, in her hand. As they got inside, Agitha dropped the shrunken Zelda out of her prison, causing her to collapse in the middle of the grass. The latter...
132322.title: She remains powerless up to Agitha's Castle.

choices: Agitha's antidote lying on a table nearby !
Link opening the door !
Agitha smiling down at her
1323221.content:
As soon as she hit the grassy and muddy ground in her abductor's bizarre castle, Zelda expressed her terror in her high-pitched voice, when a golden but massive insect, as tall as a dog to her, snapped its mandibles at the tiny woman. Zelda ran as fast as she could, but fell as her dress caused her to lose balance. In spite of apparently being at the beetle's mercy, she managed to get out of its attack's way, although her clothes got torn by the bug's horn.

"Uh-oh..." Zelda said when she noticed her dress was no longer completely covering her chest. She raised her hand to hide her now partially revealed breasts, but did not linger: the beetle had stuck its horn in the dirt after its charge. Zelda swallowed, and climbed on its back. She was trained in horseriding, so using a bug as a vehicle could not be that different, she thought. The beetle unfortunately would not do so without a fight. Zelda held still while the bug did its best to shake its meal of its back: it deployed its wings, forcing Zelda to grab one of its legs while they were both in the air. The princess dropped as soon as possible, landing in a darker area, hoping to escape a gruesome fate. Taking some rest and also the advantage of not being in Agitha's sight or any other foe, Zelda tied a knot to repair her clothes as best as she could: her nudity was no longer compromised but she did not look as covered either. The Hyrule Princess looked back, and noticed she had been lying against a snail! Grossed out, she instinctively stepped out of her hide, but the first thing she could see was...
1323221.title: ..Screamed as a now giant beetle charged at her.

choices: she jumped out as well, diving into the potion leaking from the bottle.
she noticed some of her magic was back
she was noticed by Agitha
13232211.content:
Zelda, once away from any gigantic pest, looked up to stare at the vial. The problem was, it was on a table, which on Zelda’s scale, implied that the shrunken princess had to climb her way through a height of dozens of meters!
Zelda heard the ground shaking. It did not take long for her to turn back and see her gigantic abductor walking nearby, each of her steps causing a powerful shockwave. Although terrified and unwilling to end again in the girl’s grip to be treated like a toy, Zelda gathered her courage and prayed the three goddesses of Hyrule to not get spotted by Agitha as the princess jumped on one of her shoes.

“Oh!” Zelda screamed as she felt like dealing with an earthquake as Agitha kept walking, speaking around.

“Now, where has my new doll gone to? I'm sure she'll enjoy having some new guests...and perhaps even a partner..!” Agitha innocently said, as if not aware of how inhumane such a treatment would be. Zelda on the other hand -which she luckily was not- tried to grab the girl’s dress and discreetly climb it to get to the antidote bottle as Agitha would walk by. Hiding inside one of Agitha’s pockets, Zelda granted herself a few minutes of rest.

“Alright...Where’s that antidote now..?” the minuscule princess wondered. And as she looked for her only hope to escape, she spotted it just in time to leave the undesired vehicle that Agitha was. Zelda grabbed on to the ledge of the piece of furniture the potion was lying on, like waiting for her. The diminutive woman walked slowly towards her objective, to not alert the gigantic child of her presence. Once near the bottle, Zelda put her hand on its surface, thinking how to administer the cure to herself.
“That cryptic child has been rather...unclear on how that medicine was to be used. What should I do now ? Bathe in it ? Drink it up to the very last drop..? How does that make sense ? The potion is bigger than I am !”

As she kept thinking about all those details, the tiny Hylian princess never watched for the gigantic shadow the hand of Agitha was casting over her. Fortunately, and probably thanks to her very small size, Zelda sighed out of relief when she saw that Agitha had not noticed her either, and was only interested into grabbing the antidote.

“Oh no!” Zelda squeaked in despair.

This brutal emotion caused her to swiftly reach the bottleneck, while still escaping the sight of Agitha as the latter was carrying the bottle.

“It’d be such a waste for my special guest to get any misguided intentions...such as leaving my humble castle before the start of the ball!”

“A ball...” Zelda thought. “What ball ? This girl is really creeping me out. I gotta get out of here, at the size of a bug or not !”

While Agitha was pouring the content of the bottle through the window, Zelda took a desperate decision:
13232211.title: Agitha's antidote lying on a table nearby !

choices: It worked! Zelda gets her magic back!
It didn't work! Zelda is left tiny and powerless!
It backfires! Zelda shrinks even smaller!
132322111.content:
Zelda was shocked to see that the potion, supposedly the only thing that could help her sorry state, was poured carelessly out the window. Agitha cheerily hummed to herself, all while condemning Princess Zelda to the life of a insect. Zelda's heart sank as she considered the implications, and she made a quick decision to take desperate actions.

"No!" Zelda cried as she jumped out of the window after the potion.

"What!?" Agitha exclaimed, shocked to see the newest member of her "kingdom" was right under her nose the whole time. Agitha tried to grab the shrunken woman, but only just missed and ended up swiping at the air. The young girl screamed in frustration as Zelda had made her escape.

As the tiny Zelda flew through the air, she made a good enough leap to get herself doused in the falling potion. Zelda grinned as she felt the antidote make contact with her body, and immediately tried casting a spell to restore herself. But her confident smirk soon changed to a worried frown as she realized that her magic was still not back yet!

The shrunken, powerless Zelda screamed as she now realized she was falling down what was a great height to her without any magic to protect herself. She just barely had time to curl into a ball to at least somewhat shield herself from the fall before hitting the ground outside hard.

"Ugh..." Zelda groaned. The fall wasn't too high for a normal-sized person, but at her scale, it was equivalent to a three-story drop! She just thanked the goddesses that she somehow wasn't seriously injured.

Zelda wiped the potion and dust off of herself and got up. She had some bruises and everything ached, but she felt fine other than that. Zelda looked around the alleyway she'd fallen into and saw a big 'lake' of the discarded antidote. Zelda tried to hurry over to it, but with her damaged legs, she wasn't going to be running anywhere anytime soon. So Zelda instead took her time and limped over to the big mess of potion.

Hmm... Touching it didn't work, perhaps I need to drink it? Zelda wondered. She stared down at the brightly colored spill, it had only been out there for a few seconds, but it was already combining with other gunk on the street, giving it a discolored, disgusting look. It might not have looked good, but Zelda knew it was likely her only hope.

It's nasty. But I've got to do something before Agitha comes out here! Zelda gulped before getting down on her knees and lapping up as much of the antidote as she could. As she anticipated, it tasted awful. However...
132322111.title: Potion commotion

choices: Tried to fight off Agitha anyways
Used what little magic she had to try and escape
Suddenly felt the rest of her magic returning to her!
1323221111.content:
Zelda only had to wait a few seconds after downing the antidote to feel it's effects course through her whole body. She immediately felt invigorated as she could tell her magic power was returning to her slowly.

"Thank the goddesses!" Zelda exclaimed happily. She quickly tried casting a low level fireball spell, and much to her relief, a small fireball magically manifested before her. She released the spell, which sent the fireball flying forward at great speed. It hit a nearby wall and burst into embers harmlessly.

Hmm... Seems like my magic was been reduced along with my size... Zelda contemplated this turn of events. Even though she had her magic back, her more powerful spells would still be rather useless in her current shrunken state. She knew she needed to restore herself, and quickly!

Unfortunately for Zelda, her magic powers had not yet been returned to full power just yet. She needed a few more minutes before she'd be able to cast a reversal spell. The shrunken princess worried that Agitha might come and find her soon, so she tried to find a suitable hiding spot.

But, before Zelda could even think about it any further, a young girlish voice cried out.

"Ah-ha! There are you my lovely little insect!" Agitha shouted. Zelda looked and watched as she saw the self-proclaimed "Bug Princess" was merrily skipping her way down the dark alley, right towards her!

Not good! My magic isn't all back yet! Zelda thought with fear. All she had right now was low-level spells like her fireball spell, and she'd already seen how weak that particular spell had become.

Zelda knew that she'd not be able to fight fairly in her current state, and Agitha was almost on top of her already. So, thinking quickly, Zelda...
1323221111.title: Zelda gets her magic back!

choices: "Well, maybe surgery has the answer."
"I'll take some notes as I'll study you in detail."
"A doll of some sorts?"
13232211112.content:
Zelda’s mind was sinking into a whirlpool of panic as her abductor’s gigantic hand was slowly reaching for her, its shade expanding and hinting about the shrunken woman's unavoidable fate like a terrifying omen.
As she was about to faint out of fear, Zelda cast one of the spells she mastered the best: Farore’s Wind.
“Ha-ha,” Agitha whispered with satisfaction as her hand closed on the tiny princess’s silhouette. “I got you now!”

But a split second before she could touch Zelda, the latter released a pulse of green sparks, blinding her foe.
“Aow…Where are you, my ladybug?” Agitha complained, rubbing her eyes.

But Zelda did not really know where she had gone either. All what what she knew was that where she was was hot. Her own eyesight was blurred by mist, and caused to awkwardly trip into the source of all this confusion. The warm and pleasant smell of the water she had fallen in did not fool her: this could only be hot spring water from Death Mountain: a praised product for its medical properties. Zelda would have enjoyed this bath if she was not at risk of drowning!
“Come on,” the rough voice of the Goron merchant said. “Spring water from our famous mountain! 20 rupees a bottle only!”
“I'll get one.” an unknown person said.
While Zelda was still struggling to not sink in the bottom of the tank, the large spoon the Goron served his customers with scooped the unfortunate woman out of the ocean she was trapped in. Instead, she was poured into a smaller vial, which was not any better in terms of safety, she luckily managed to grab the bottle cap to stay above the water.
“I dare this fiendish child to find me now!” Zelda said. “Assuming I can hold my position long enough.”

The travel did indeed not prove easy. Zelda not only had to deal with quakes striking the bottle she was in as her unaware owner was walking, but also to not slip and fall back into the water. A few minutes later, she was put free from her cell as someone poured the content of the bottle into a bowl. Zelda quickly swam her way out of it, and squeezed her dress dry.
“Well…I can't deny that bathing into that water felt great! I wonder if I can use the reversal spell!”
As soon as she tried, she indeed grew back as tall as a toothpick.

"I guess I should count my blessings…” Zelda said with disappointment.
She then proceeded to investigate the house she had brought in, hoping no one would spot her. Her plans did not turn out to work as the man got closer, and abruptly took the bowl of spring water and checked it out from very close.

“Seems like I'm lucky for this man to have such a poor eyesight!” Zelda told herself.

“If only I could find out what's so extraordinary about that rip off of a medicine...I could turn filthy rich!” he said slamming the container back at the table, unknowingly splashing the shrunken princess with water.

“Ugh, it's cold!” Zelda squeaked.
The sudden drop in temperature struck her nose, causing her to sneeze. The sound was enough to get the giant’s attention. Now able to take a closer look at him, Zelda recognized the doctor from Castle Town. Unfortunately for her, he noticed her to and said:

“What do we have here? I was sure I had cleared my clinic of any pest!”
Although unhappy to be compared of such a way, Zelda tried to dash out of his sight, only to end trapped under a glass the physician dropped on the table. Now that the intruder was successfully captured, the creepy old man rubbed his chin, grabbed his magnifying glass and observed his prisoner, asking her:

“What are you? Some new fairy species? Or perhaps just an hallucination induced by my own medicine?”
As Zelda was unable to reply and to focus to cast any spell and escape the glass layer, the doctor shrugged and said…
13232211112.title: Used what little magic she had to try and escape

choices: "I am Princess Zelda. I need your help."
"That's none of your business, old man!"
"I'm actually a great fairy..!"
132322111121.content:
Zelda was hyperventilating as she heard the old man tell her his plans out, not to mention that her inability to calm down completely disabled her magical abilities, since the Triforce of Wisdom she was carrying could only function when one's mind was in peace.
Doctor Borville quickly grabbed her after lifting the glass. Despaired at the idea of getting mutilated into a bloody mess, the shrunken princess only managed to yell irrational threats she could never carry out and begging for mercy right after that. It was obvious her voice was not different from a faint squeak of some rodent, and yet, he looked at her -or at least as accurately as his failing eyes could- as if he had heard her!

“What did you say?” the physician asked.

“At least your ears compensate for your eyeballs, you filthy beggar!” Zelda instinctively thought.

The princess was glad to have her own physicians, enabling her to not deal with this joke of a doctor, whose repeated failures, obvious greed and racist opinions on the Zoras and Gorons alike were no secret to anyone in Castle Town. But for now, she had no choice but playing the modesty card.

“Please doctor, listen to what I have to say!” Zelda yelled. “I have a lot of Rupees, more than you can count!”
The doctor looked at her with a brand new curiosity.

“How would a puny fairy like you be worth anything?” he asked in his usual scornful tone.
Zelda gave her chance to an even riskier situation and replied :

“Come now, when was the last time you've seen a wingless fairy? I might be much more than that.” she hinted.

“Much more you say? Why would such a great creature like you be so tiny then?”

Aware she might have talked too much, Zelda sighed and said…
132322111121.title: "Well, maybe surgery has the answer."

choices: ...unavoidably fell into the water.
...was intercepted by something in her fall.
...cast a spell
1323221111211.content:
Zelda closed her eyes for a brief second, looked down to gather her courage and as she raised her head, said :

“I am princess Zelda. I ended up this small because of a spell a child-witch cast on me. I'm begging you, get me to Lanayru Spring! Only the Light Spirit living there can lift the curse!”

The doctor looked down as well, thinking.

“So...From what you are telling me...you are the wealthiest person in all Hyrule, aren't you?”

“Could you please stop thinking about money for a split second?” Zelda mentally scolded him.
She however held back her frustration and replied :
“Obviously yes, I could give much more Rupees than what you are able to count, as I've just said.”

“Hmm...It's a deal then. And you should count your blessings. It's not everyday that my generosity outweighs the cry of pain from those old bones.”

“And it's not everyday that I would accept to be handled like a toy by some creepy old man like you!” Zelda thought.

That said, Doctor Borville did not linger and quickly left Castle Town, as if his future reward had caused him to grow wings. Zelda, concealed under the physician’s thick cloak, looked left and right, marveling with terror but also with amazement at the giants composing the crowd. She sighed, thinking that with a little of rest, she would have been able to cast a spell strong enough to restore herself to normal, but all the recent events had left her exhausted, and using Farore’s Wind or any other magical techniques was out of the question. With a new hope finally in reach to grow back, she allowed herself to take a nap.

A few minutes, or a few seconds later for the shrunken princess, an abrupt move from the doctor woke her up.
“Shhh, shhh, out of my way!” the latter shouted at something in the sky.

Zelda woke up in a yawn, stretching her arms, before asking:
“What's the matter, doctor?”

“Stupid birds!” he grunted at the dark forms upwards. “Always trying to bite out belongings of travelers of this bridge!”

Zelda looked down, and could indeed spot Lake Hylia. In fact, they were so high on the bridge that the lake looked minuscule, even to Zelda! Distracted, she was not able to dodge the new assault from the flying pests, and neither did Borville. As the raven scratched a hole through the pocket Zelda was hiding in, the latter, powerless, fell right into the lake.
The physician was terrified as well, but for a different reason.

“No! My reward, my swimming pool filled with Rupees...Why?!” the greedy biologist lamented.

Zelda, on the other hand, cried as hard as she could during her long fall, although her reduced size prevented her from gaining velocity as she was sinking deeper into the void separating the lake from the bridge. Despaired and stricken with panic, she…
1323221111211.title: Painful revelation

choices: ...poked the newcomer with its beak out of curiosity.
...flew away.
...picked up Zelda and took her away
13232211112112.content:
While her lungs were burning from the lack of air and her heart beating at an incredible rate, Zelda kept falling towards the lake.

“So is it really how the Hylian dynasty is going to end? After all, it's perhaps better that way, who would accept to have a minuscule princess as a queen anyway…”

It is only when Zelda's feelings were at their lowest possible level that she felt something brutally grabbing her. She instinctively looked at what just caught her. She indeed preferred to keep falling to her demise: a Kargarok, one of Hyrule’s largest bird species, had caught her and certainly was about to swallow her whole. Zelda therefore closed her eyes and waited for all of this to end.

“So, what are you waiting for? Eat me already!”

To her dismay, nothing happened, or at least not what she expected. The gigantic bird carefully landed on the ground, dropping her on a small island before leaving the princess to her fate.

“Thank you for the trip I guess…” Zelda whispered as she was slowly getting up.

But her time for resting turned short, as a wide shadow cast itself upon her. Thankfully for the shrunken woman, the bird coming for her was this time much smaller, although still of a significant size for Zelda, but she no longer cared at this point. The newcomer however surprised her by the simple fact that it could talk!

“A human! A human!” the strange animal said.

Zelda slapped her forehead in a facepalm, seriously annoyed at this point.

“Alright, I'm definitely crazy now. I just heard a bird talking to me…”

“Plumm’s the name!” the creature said, upset at the princess’s reaction.
“And Plumm is wondering why my friend brought a female human here. Female humans are rare, very rare indeed in Lake Hylia! But I wonder also why are you so small…Is it a characteristic to all human females? That would explain why Plumm couldn't find any!”

Zelda shook her head and took a deep breath. After all, this bird was perhaps not that dangerous, if one put its curiosity aside…The princess took advantage of her newfound peace to stare at the animal and say:
“Well, if you really wish to know, we women are not supposed to be this tiny. In fact…”

Zelda then used her magic to get a few inches taller. She was now as big as a bottle. But this was far from enough.

“See? This is even not my real height! Now will you leave the tiny “female human” that I am alone?”

Hearing this, Plumm…
13232211112112.title: ...was intercepted by something in her fall.

choices: Zelda makes a break for the drain
Zelda tries to sneak past Agitha
Agitha grabs Zelda before she can make her move
1323221112.content:
Zelda waited, and waited, for any sort of feeling or otherwise that would signify her magic returning to her body, but after several minutes and many gulps, the Hylian Princess realized that the so-called "Antidote" was a fraud!

"Curse that Agitha! Tricking me into thinking she'd really have such a simple solution to my problems..." Zelda cursed under her breath. She wondered if all of this was part of Agitha's plan, making her reveal herself, then jumping out the window fruitlessly, and finally having her humiliate herself by drinking a disgustingly goopy potion that did nothing at all!

Zelda's lament was cut short by the sounds of loud footsteps approaching her. The tiny brunette quickly ran into hiding behind a nearby barrel, and peered out from behind it to see who was coming.

"Oh, Princess!" Agitha's loud, sing-song voice sang as she entered the alley.

Just who I didn't need to see... Zelda thought.

Zelda checked her surroundings closely. Right now, the princess found herself trapped into the corner of a dirty, mostly empty back alley. She didn't see much means of escaping unseen. All there was in the alley was some barrels stacked beside the one she was hiding behind, and a drain that had some of the "Antidote" running down it currently. Zelda thought she was probably small enough to fit through the bars, but she knew that it only lead to the Castle Town sewers, and she didn't know if she really wanted to go there at her size just to escape from Agitha. Aside from that, the only exit out of the alley was being covered by Agitha, and Zelda wasn't sure if she'd be able to sneak or run past the giant girl without being spotted, even at her tiny size.

"Oh, Zelda, won't you come out? I know you're back here!" Agitha's upsetting unfitting cheerful tone, grated Zelda's nerves.

The annoying bug princess was sure to find Zelda if she didn't act fast, this much Zelda was sure of. Agitha was sure to find her soon if she didn't try something though. Zelda exhaled deeply and braced herself for her next move...
1323221112.title: It's a trap!

choices: Remain hidden
Get Agitha's attention
Try to shrink Agitha to her size
1323221113.content:
Zelda didn't have to wait long for the effects of the supposed "Antidote" to kick in. However, when they did, Zelda didn't feel any magic returning to her body at all, instead the Hylian Princess found herself suddenly shooting downwards in size! The tiny princess screamed in frustration as she plummeted down to even smaller heights.

Curse that Agitha! How dare she trick me with a shrinking potion! Zelda thought with anger as she shrank again.

As Zelda shrank, her reducing body got closer and closer to the rest of the spilled shrinking potion. Fearing she might become even smaller just from being around the accursed potion, Zelda hurriedly backed away from it to higher ground.

She was safe now, but far from happy. As the smaller Zelda got, the more upset she became. She couldn't believe she'd let herself get tricked into downing a shrinking potion by an insane little child! To think her current state had become so pathetic so quickly, she was the princess of the kingdom for crying out loud! Meant to rule fairly and justly, not scramble around in the dirt like some mere bug!

Soon though, Zelda's shrinking came to a stop, leaving the once high and mighty princess much, much tinier. Zelda estimated that she couldn't be much bigger than a speck of dust by now! The small alleyway she'd fallen into looked to be about the size of the whole Castle Town to her, and the little spill of potion in front of her now appeared to take on the same size and shape as Lake Hylia to the hyper reduced princess.

Zelda was speechless by her new height, or lack thereof. She felt so tiny and insignificant, not to mention completely helpless without her magic powers. Her anger had been replaced by her new fear. Fear of the sheer size of things around her, a barrel the size of her castle, and Agitha's "kingdom" now looking more like Death Mountain by her scale. Zelda whimpered in fear and was nearly brought to tears by her seemingly helpless situation.

"Ahaha!" A girlish laugh echoed through the air.

Zelda looked up and gasped at what she saw. It was Agitha, only now magnified to the size of a mega giantess, the petite little girl was now more like a goddess in comparison to the incredibly shrunken princess of Hyrule. Zelda wanted to scream at the sight of massive girl, but she couldn't even do that, instead letting out a pathetic squeak. If she thought Agitha was trouble before, Zelda could only imagine what she'd be like to her now!

"I saw you fall into the potion, princess!" Agitha declared loudly. "I bet you didn't think it was working at first, huh? No, it works by touch, it just takes a little while."

Blast that little brat! Zelda thought in frustration. But then she noticed something, Agitha was stopped just outside the entrance of the alleyway, and seemed to be scanning it. Zelda gasped as she realized that Agitha must have been looking for her, not able to see her with her naked eye because of how small she had now become!

Am I really that insignificant? Zelda wondered, feeling hopeless.

"Hmm! I wonder how small you got?" Agitha said, carefully taking some steps into the alley while looking for her little prey. "You didn't drink it, did you? Even I don't know what would happen if you did that! Why, you might have just disappeared altogether!"

So she knows I'm near microscopic... Zelda thought. She pondered her options. P-Perhaps it might not be so bad to be found by her right now. I've little chance of surviving on my own at this size...

"You'd better just come out now!" Agitha called. The "Bug Princess" was soon almost on top of Zelda. The big little girl was looking down, right at Zelda, but even so she still didn't seem to see the micro-sized princess! Zelda gulped, feeling smaller than ever. She made her choice...
1323221113.title: Actually, it's a shrinking potion

choices: Zelda makes it to the top
The potion seeps onto Agitha's shoe while she climbs
Zelda accidentally slips while climbing
13232211133.content:
Right in front of the ultra tiny Hyrule princess was the giant form of her former captor, to her left, the brightly colored lake of shrinking potion. Glancing back and forth between the two, an idea started to form in Zelda's head. As Agitha was standing still, looking down for her treasured little "ladybug", she had ended up right next to the puddle of shrinking potion.

She's not that far from it... Maybe I can splash some of her own medicine on her! Zelda thought, hoping to bring her huge pursuer down to her size.

The super shrunken princess collected herself and put her daring plan into motion. She first ran over to lake-sized puddle of shrinking potion, taking great care to not trip and fall into it, lest she want to end up ruling the microverse. Zelda tugged at her dress and braced herself for the next step of her plan. She knew that the shrinking potion worked on and through clothes, so all she would have to do is use the only thing she had on her, namely her dress, to soak up the shrinking potion, and then hope that she can get it to Agitha and reduce the big brat down to a more manageable size.

Here goes nothing! Zelda thought.

Zelda acted quickly and hastily removed her dress, leaving the speck-sized woman nude for the world to see, of course she was so small nobody would actually be able to see her, that helped make Zelda's decision somewhat less embarrassing. With her dress in her hands, Zelda tied it up nicely like a whip. Then, Zelda got closer to the shrinking potion and "whipped" her dress into the spill, causing quite a splash at her scale, thankfully none of the potion splashed onto her, but it did soak into her dress quite nicely.

Zelda pulled her dress out of the potion mess and, keeping her hands on the still dry part of it, ran as fast as she could over to Agitha. But already Zelda could feel her dress starting to shrink in her hands. She groaned, knowing that even if her plan worked, she'd not be able to wear the shrinking garment ever again. But Zelda pushed on and made it to Agitha's shoe.

Upon reaching the bug princess's shoe, the Hyrulian Princess gasped at the towering footwear's size. In her haste to complete her plan, Zelda failed to take into consideration the Agitha had been wearing high platform shoes.

Oh no! Even I throw my potion soaked dress at her feet now, it would never touch her skin! Zelda thought in dismay.

It seemed that Zelda's chances of success were diminishing by the second, along with her dress. With no other choice, Zelda bravely jumped onto Agitha's high shoe and started to climb it. But at her pitiful size, the shoe alone seemed to be the size of a large house! For Zelda, getting up to the top wasn't going to be easy, not to mention that she had to carry her dress along with her while maintaining her grip, and of course her dress, soaked with her only weapon against Agitha, was rapidly shrinking away in her hands. Zelda feared that even if she did make it to the top, it might be too late to shrink Agitha.

She remembers how she got this way. Zelda was supposed to be beheaded by Ganondorf, but suddenly a spell was put on her so that she can live and try to get her body back. Zelda looked puzzled. She wonder about a way she can reclaim her body with only her head.

She has no neck so she can't look around. The princess's bodiless head just sat there thinking until...

She sat there feeling the breeze and peaceful atmosphere. The bodiless head smiled and closed her eyes. Then suddenly something was coming, it was...

1353111122121.content:
The relaxing scene was broken up as Zelda heard what sounded like footsteps, and they were heading in her direction! Everything had seemed so calm and peaceful out here, it was enough to make Zelda drop her guard for a moment. She nearly forgot her vulnerability as just a head.

Princess Zelda took action quickly to avoid being found. She first tried rolling around like she had before, but unfortunately for her, this time all she managed to do was knock her head flat on its side.

"Ngh!" The hyrulian princess struggled on the ground to get up or move, but to no avail. Now utterly helpless, Zelda could only hope that she'd not be found.

Luck was not on the princess's side today though, as a boot stepped in front of her field of vision. Zelda gulped. She looked up and saw that it was...
1353111122121.title: I'm just a head! Stay away!

choices: Link and Zelda travel until nightfall
Link and Zelda encounter some monsters.
13531111221211.content:
Much to Zelda's relief, it was Link staring down at her. The hero of Hyrule seemed just as relieved as he smiled down at her.

"Thank the goddesses you're all right, princess." He said.

"Oh, Link!" Zelda cried happily. She smiled at the sight of her hero, and struggled some more on the ground as if to show him how happy she was to see him. Link seemed to get the message. The green-clad young man knelt down to almost look Zelda eye-to-eye. "I'm so glad you're here!" Zelda told him.

"Yeah. I heard about the situation in Hyrule. I can't believe this was the best plan they could come up with to prevent your, er, execution.." Link said, staring in disbelief at the disembodied head of princess Zelda laying on the ground before him.

"Me neither!" Zelda admitted. "To tell the truth, I don't remember much from the day of my beheading. So it seems tha- Ow! Hey!"

Zelda's words were interrupted by a finger poking her face, Link's finger to be specific. The Hylian man had poked the princess's disembodied head out of curiosity.

"Heheh, sorry, princess!" Link apologized, and quickly pulled back his prodding finger, but couldn't help but laugh. The whole situation was just so bizarre to the young man.

"Link, please! This is a very uncomfortable form to be in!" Zelda pleaded, shaking her head back and forth to deter Link from any further poking.

"Sorry. Is this better?" Link asked as he grabbed Zelda's head from below in his hands and held her to face him.

"Much better." Zelda said with a smile. Link smiled back. He pulled Zelda's head in for a kiss, and Zelda obliged. After the smooch Zelda felt much more relaxed. "Just carry me under your arm and we can go."

Link did as his princess asked. It wasn't the best way to carry her head, but it would work for now. He had to admit that it felt very strange to be carrying someone's head around like this, especially from when he grabbed below her head; he had expected to feel her squishy insides, but instead of that there was just smooth skin there. But Zelda seemed comfortable enough, and the magic that allowed her to survive like this had saved her life after all.

For her part, Zelda was enjoying the ride. Being so helpless that she needed to be carried around like this would normally be a humiliating experience for the proud princess, but with Link she didn't feel that way at all. She just hoped that she'd get her body back soon.

13533211.content:
In an elegant throne room, a reflection of the wealth and virtue of Hyrule, Queen Zelda sighed deeply and, in absolute boredom, watched a speck of dust lazily float across a sunbeam. After the defeat of Ganondorf, the Mirror of Twilight was broken, the Bulblins made peace with Hyrule, and Zelda was crowned as queen. The trouble is, after the castle was rebuilt (courtesy of the hardworking peoples of all Hyrule races) there was little for the queen to do.

Link had gone off on some new quest, something about an evil wizard placing curses on people at seemingly random. Zelda wanted to go along, but Link insisted that the danger would be too great. They had a very long argument about it, but in the end, Link stormed off, leaving Zelda alone and longing for adventure....

The sound of an opening door roused Zelda's attention, though the door to the elegant throne room remained as shut as ever.

"Achem"

Zelda's attention was drawn to a dark corner of the throne room where a figure in a filthy, worn-out black cloak was standing. The odd gait and glowing eyes revealed him to be a Bulblin, who was now shambling over to the Queen of Hyrule!

"Queen Zelda of Hyrule...age eighteen...bearer of the Triforce of Wisdom..." the Bulblin was mumbling, though Zelda knew not whether it was to her or himself. Regardless, she drew her rapier, for this man broke into her throne room, and so clearly means harm.

"It draws a blade to Rajir!?" The bulblin snarled, "It must pay!
I lay this curse from blackest heart!
You and my foe shall never part!"

With that, Rajir the Bulblin Sorcerer vanished into a pillar of smoke, leaving only his evil laughter to echo throughout the room.

"Foe?" Zelda thought to herself "What did he- Oh no...Link! He must be in trouble! I must find him!"

But Link did not tell her where to find him!
13533211.title: Together forever whether they want to be or not

14.title: Skyward Sword Zelda

choices: ...3 inches tall.
...Less than an inch tall.
...slowly shrinking.
142.content:
Zelda was enjoying her return to Skyloft after getting saved by Link from Demise, an evil entity which, a very long time ago, tried to overthrow her when she was the Almighty Goddess Hylia. Even if peace had returned, she was now aware that the world was way more complex and fascinating than what others have ever told her. Indeed, it was time to discover how everything began, as her friend, guardian and mentor Impa had taught her. Therefore, she decided to keep studying mythology or in some sort of way, her anterior life. To do so, the young woman headed to her father's library, where all kinds of things related to what she was interested in could be found. Once there, Zelda gazed at the stacks of books, not knowing where to start with. Her eyes scanned the entire room until stopping on a small bookcase she had never noticed before. She approached it and grabbed a book, as filthy as the shelf it had stayed on. "Father should really think to clean this room, but as usual it is no use to remind him that once more...The cover is so dirty that it is impossible to read what it is written on it." She blew it, sneezed before taking a look at the title. "The many powers of the Goddess" she read.
"It does not sound that original but whatever. I think it can still be useful..." Zelda got back to her bedroom, so that she could read in peace. On her way, she bumped into Link. "Oh sorry Link, I did not mean to..." "It's alright, don't worry." he replied in a smile. "Just remember that if you need anything, don't hesitate to see me, okay ?" "Y..yes, thanks !" she said awkwardly. She then walk into her room and closed the door. While sitting in the chair in front of her desk, she dropped the book on the table and and began to read it, until stopping on what seemed to be some sort of spell, written in ancient Hylian. "Strange...Impa once told what this meant, but I can't remember, it however seems to deal with magic. Let's try it, what could go wrong after all ?" She pronounced the incantation as best as she could, when she suddenly felt very weak and fainted. She then was...
142.title: She shrinks

choices: ...Link !

Someone else.
1421.content: Zelda rubbed her forehead as she woke up, stretching . The first thing she noticed was the huge sheets of paper she was lying on. She reacted when she took a closer look to the line she had just read before falling asleep. The history lessons Impa had taught her kicked in and she managed to translate the spell. "The Oath of the Small"..." she read out loud. Was'nt that the magic Hylia used to shrink back to human form ? But then, what effect just had that magic on her, as she was a mortal already, not to mention her size which was quite short. Everything then made sense to her : by using this spell a second time, her size was that of a bug ! What was she gonna do now, as she had no idea how to reverse the effects ? A quick look to the clock above her desk (which seemed to be miles away from the tiny woman) indicated that the shrinking process had only taken a few minutes. As she was leaving the book she was on to get help (preferably from Link), the door opened, letting Zelda notice that someone just got in. It was...
1421.title: ...3 inches tall.

choices: Link agrees to help her
Link likes her like this better
Link wonders what other spells are in the book
14211.content:
Zelda was relieved when she saw that it was her closest friend, Link, who had just entered her room. She was just about to get help, but now she thanked her luck that help was seemingly coming to her. She quickly dropped from the Goddess book onto her desk and watched as a giant clad in mostly green garb entered her room.

"Zelda? Are you in here...?" Link asked obliviously as he came into the room.

"Yes! Yes! I'm down here!" Zelda shouted.

Link looked around, suddenly jerking his head around. He'd heard something squeaking in the room, and thinking it might be rats or some other small animal, he looked around to find it. He knew Zelda hated the things, so she'd probably reward him for removing it for her. But, when he layed his eyes on Zelda's desk, he noticed what appeared to be a tiny young woman standing there. He rubbed his eyes in disbelief, the minute girl looked and dressed like Zelda, he couldn't help but think it was her.

"It can't be... Zelda!?" Link exclaimed in shock that the tiny thing could possibly be the goddess reborn.

"Yes! It's me, Link!" Zelda shouted. She was happy to be recognized at last by the giant.

Link barely registered Zelda's response, as her voice was almost too quiet to be heard. He just stared at the miniuature Zelda for a moment before it finally clicked that she was speaking to him. So he sat down on the chair by the desk Zelda was on and carefully got closer to the small girl, and was shocked to see that it really was Zelda, her clothes and style and all, just in a smaller package.

Zelda blushed as Link looked down at her, keeping her head down shyly. It wasn't that she was afraid of Link's size or anything, the size difference simply astounded the shrunken woman, and seeing Link as a comparative giant because of her own mistake was enough to make her blush in embarrassment.

"But, how..?" Link asked at last, softly as to not harm the shrunken girl. Even though he knew Zelda was normally quite capable of taking care of herself, her current size made her look vulnerable, so he didn't want to risk taking any chances.

"Oh!" Zelda squeaked. She looked up at Link, and watched him follow her with his eyes before running off to the book she had found earlier. She then shouted up to him.

"It was this book! I was reading about the Goddess Hylia and found some kind of spell in it and, uh..." Zelda laughed awkwardly as she recalled her foolish behavior from before before continuing on, "I kind of cast it and passed out, and, well, ended up like this!"

"I see.." Link said, folding his arms. A look of relief on his face. "So it can be reversed then?"

"Uhm, I'm not sure. I need your help to find a reversal spell!" Zelda yelled.

"Hmm..." Link seemed to ponder some options in his head, making the shrunken Zelda start to get a little nervous...
14211.title: Link to the rescue?

choices: "Let's try one of these!"
"Nothing! Let's just take a break for the night!"
142111.content:
Link smiled. "Okay." He nodded. "Let's see what's in this thing."

"Oh, thank you, Link! I'm so glad I could trust you with this!" Zelda gushed happily.

"Don't mention it!" Link said. He went to look through the many pages of the book for a helpful spell. Zelda stood by the book and watched him, hopeful that there would be something that could restore her size written in there.

Time passed, a minute or two at first, but then several went by as Link flipped through the big book of spells and history. Zelda guiding him all the while, answering questions about the contents of the pages and other things. Together they worked to find any sort of spell that might help the shrunken girl restore herself to her former height. But they both were getting tired, as it was quite late. Zelda's memory of the ancient text was starting to get blurred, and Link was sure they'd been over some of the pages multiple times already.

"I'm sorry, Link." Zelda apologized as time wore on. Even though she was the one stuck small, she couldn't help but feel bad for dragging Link into her mess. "I can't get a good translation on some of these pages anymore. I wish there were some sort of index we could use."

"Me too.: Link agreed, turning away from the book to yawn. "But, wait, you don't need to apologize. It's not like you meant to make yourself this small, right?"

Zelda blushed. "Y-Yeah..."

Link and Zelda looked through some more of the book. Zelda now took minutes to translate a single page and, even though she didn't tell Link, she wasn't completely sure of her translation skills. She knew enough of the language to translate, but as tired as she was now, she couldn't be sure. As much as she didn't like being tiny like this, she also just wished she could get some well needed shut-eye. But she, and Link, pressed on. Both remaining ever hopeful that the spell to restore Zelda would be found soon.

Link yawned again as time wore on. "But, doesn't it make sense that Hylia would have wanted to be able to restore herself at some point?" Link asked, almost absentmindedly as he flipped through the pages. "So there should be something in here that can help you out."

"I think so too. But there's a lot to cover with a book this big." Zelda pointed out.

"Oh yeah, it must be pretty big to you, huh?" Link asked her, chuckling.

"Hey! Don't make fun of me because I'm small like this!" Zelda shouted, putting her hands on her hips and pouting. "When I get big again, I might just remember this!"

"Okay, alright!" Link laughed at the tiny Zelda's attempts to look tough, at her inches tall stature, she only looked cute. He went back to the book. "So, what do you want to do, then? Any of these spells sound good?"

"Oh, Link, we don't even know if these are spells..." Zelda was about to continue until she read the contents of the pages Link had turned to. "Oh! This is another list of spells."

"Well then, what do they say?" Link asked.

"I'm not sure... Give me a minute to translate them..." Zelda said, climbing on top of the book. She then crawled around the pages, slowly reading and translating it word by word. Link watched her as she did, enjoying her cute little form crawling around on the book.

A few minutes went by as Zelda studied the words carefully. She then stood up, shook her head of her uncertainty, and told Link...
142111.title: Helpful Link, but not enough?

choices: She obeys.
The tickling war continues.
1421112.content:
"Listen Link. We're both exhausted and what happened to my size is my fault, and my fault only. How about going to sleep ? Nothing bad is going to happen if I stay in your room for the night, right ? Plus, it's been a while since we had'nt the opportunity to stay with each other."

As she curled her tiny self against Link's chest, the latter knew what she was referencing. All that Demise stuff had lasted for too long. Link gladly accepted her offer and petted her in response. He got to bed, and Zelda laughed in her squeaky voice. "No one will even know were violating the "no girl in boys's rooms and vice versa' rule ! "

Link replied by another cuddle, and Zelda swiftly climbed up to the head of the giant, grabbing his hair to get on the top.
"Ouch."Link reacted, and grabbing the pranker. "Your little adventure with Impa apparently killed your usual shyness..!"

The tiny woman shrugged, smiling in Link's clutch. She pulled her blonde hair back, and long-jumped into Link's shirt, landing on his belly. He suddenly feels funny and burst into laughter. Zelda was tickling him with energy. Link laughed, to the point of falling off the bed. Link tries to get up, but could not. He was way too sensitive.
"O-Okay, Zelda ! You won ! Let's just have some sleep now !"
1421112.title: "Nothing! Let's just take a break for t...
