142112.content:
Link smiled at her. A little too much in Zelda's opinion.
"Link...What's wrong? Is there something you'd like to tell me..? Y-you're scaring me a little..." she said in her high-pitched voice, cowering in a fetal position.
Link was dazzled by all that cuteness.
"My teeny tiny Zelda...I love you so much..!"
He grabs her.

Zelda did not know how to react, she was secretly attracted to Link for such a long time, but she never found the courage to tell him the truth, how she would have liked to be more than his friend. And here she was, not bigger than a thumb, in the hand of her crush, who was telling her what she had thought about him for an eternity? Zelda did not know if she was either happy or terrified.
Sure, she was shrunk, but she was literally in good hands. After all Link would never hurt her in anyway, and her new size was the opportunity for them both to have some privacy after all the chaos Girahim and Demise had caused.

While Zelda was in a pensive mood, Link said: "So...do I deserve a kiss or a slap..?"
He slowly advanced his gigantic lips towards Zelda. The latter chose to...
142112.title: Link likes her like this better

choices: Zelda agrees to stay small
Zelda still wants to return to her normal height
Zelda wants Link to join in being small
1421121.content:
Zelda sighed, and let Link come closer to her. She closed her eyes and, standing on the tips of her toes, kissed her giant hero on his bottom lip. It only lasted a moment, but it was enough to confirm their mutual feelings for each other.

Link looked down at her and smiled, his face turning a little redder after the kiss. "So that's a yes, then?" He asked.

"Oh, Link, of course it's a yes! You have no idea how happy you made me when you told me you loved me!" Zelda beamed up at the young man. "I can't believe it's taken you so long to finally say it! If I had known that being, well, like this would've made you admit it, I'd have shrunk myself sooner!" Zelda giggled.

"You're adorable when you're like this, you know?" Link said, happy to hear Zelda's reaction. "So then, you mean it? You don't mind being this small for me?"

"Well..." Zelda mused, a finger on her chin as she thought about what to say. It was obvious to her that she loved her childhood friend, but she wasn't sure if she really wanted to be this tiny forever. But when she looked up at Link, his expression was all she needed to tell that he did enjoy having her small, and she had to admit, it wasn't all bad to be literally in the palm of his hand...
1421121.title: Sealed with a kiss

choices: Zelda wants to have the growth spell handy just in case
Zelda decides not to press the issue and just enjoy being small
Zelda is curious about the other magic in the book
14211211.content:
"... Fine, Link. You win." Zelda sighed, knowing she couldn't say no to her giant lover. She thought she could enjoy get used to being small, and she liked to make Link happy.

I can't imagine how I'm going to explain this everyone... Especially my father! Zelda thought.

"I'm glad you agree. Little lady." Link couldn't help but throw in a tease at Zelda's new size.

"Hey! I didn't want to stay small just so you could tease me!" Zelda squeaked, stamping her little foot in mock anger, but the smile on her face told otherwise.

"Oh, really?" Link asked, getting a devious look on his face. "So you don't like it when I do... This?!"

Link quickly grabbed up the shrunken Zelda in his hand and brought her to his face, giving his little lover another kiss.

"Wh-Whoa!" Zelda laughed, enjoying the feeling of being in Link's hand. She accepted the kiss and smiled up at Link. "Okay, I admit. I do like that. But no teasing!"

Link laughed as Zelda pointed her finger at him sternly. "Or what?" He asked, playfully bringing his own finger up and poking the tiny girl in her chest. Though he was gentle, he used enough force to knock her on her butt.

"Or.. Or... I'll use a spell to turn you into a frog!" Zelda threatened Link as she got up.

"Zelda, you can't even grow yourself back to normal! How am I supposed to be afraid of such an empty threat?" Link said.

"Hmph!" Zelda pouted cutely. But then she looked at Link and told him, "You're right, I can't grow myself back..."

"That's right." Link said, wondering where Zelda was going with this. The tiny girl sat down his palm and seemed to think...
14211211.title: Zelda agrees to stay small

choices: "Alright, let's give it a try !"
"I got a better idea."
"Let's worry about it later!"
142112111.content:
"That's right indeed." she repeated. "And that's where the problem is! I might agree to stay at this size for you, but my absence is going to be very suspicious, especially after coming back to Skyloft! We have to find a way to fix this when necessary. Then I could even teach you the spell to shrink me whenever you want! I want to be at your side until the very end of my life, but...we need a back up plan, like that reversing spell!"

Link kept looking at her, as she was walking around in his hand. He then replied: "If you promise to stay by my side and on top of that grant me the ability to manipulate your own size, then it could be fun! Let's do this!"

He put Zelda back on the desk, picked up the book, and checked each of its chapters, which were luckily written in modern Hylian.

"Zelda, we've been checking the pages mentioning Hylia's short return among mortals, but what if the chapters at the very end of the book were about what we needed, such as this one..? "

Zelda looked at where her gigantic protector was pointing.

"The Final Rise of the Goddess"? I don't know, Link. Even though there is indeed a spell in that page, that title is scaring me a little. "

"Listen to me, my tiny ladybug. It might be our only chance to turn you back to normal. Plus, you've been through a lot more, when we were down there, huh?"

Link tickled her with the tip of his finger.

Zelda laughed, and said...
142112111.title: Zelda wants to have the growth spell handy just...

choices: The spell works as planned
The spell works a little too well
The spell backfires and Zelda shrinks again!
1421121111.content:
"Alright, let's give it a try!" Zelda said enthusiastically.

"Great! So, all you have to do is cast it, right?" Link asked his little lover.

"Yes. Let me see..." Zelda said as she read the pages in order to memorize the spell. A few minutes later, she had it. So she turned back to Link and said, "Okay, got it!"

Zelda wasted no time in casting the spell. Link watched as his tiny girlfriend recited the words from the page, mesmerized by her ability and her squeaky little voice as she chanted. Zelda finished casting the spell soon, and waited for the results. Nothing happened at first, but then she started to feel strange.

"Ugh..." Zelda groaned, grabbing her head as if in pain.

"Zelda! Are you alright?" Link asked, getting worried for the shrunken woman.

"S-Something's happening..." Zelda replied.

Zelda could feel the magic energies surging through her whole 3 inch body, but it felt different from when she shrank, not painful, but stressful. Zelda could do nothing but wait for it to pass, she hoped that the spell worked and she would be growing back to normal soon.
1421121111.title: "Alright, let's give it a try !"

choices: Cast the shrinking spell on Zelda
Wish her a good night
Ask her out
14211211111.content:
In an instant, Zelda felt herself changing, and could see her surroundings grow smaller around her. She smiled, knowing the spell was a success.

"Here I come, Link." Zelda said, looking up at her still giant, but steadily appearing to get smaller, lover. "I hope you don't change your mind when I'm big again." Zelda giggled.

"Never." Link said, smiling down at his growing girlfriend.

The process of growth was slow. But soon, Zelda had grown to Link's knees, then to his waist. Zelda grinned as she imagined the possibilities of shrinking to different sizes, and wondered if there were such a spell to allow such a thing in the book. Then suddenly, Zelda felt big hands grab her arms and lift her into the air. She gasped as she saw that Link had picked her up.

"You're beautiful at any size." Link said as he held Zelda like a child. It was a little awkward, but she was the perfect size for it, at the moment.

Zelda blushed and smiled at Link's words. Link took Zelda into his arms and snuggled her, before giving her a kiss. Zelda turned a deeper red from Link's actions, but returned his affections and let herself swoon in his arms.

The growth spell was still working its magic though, and soon Zelda had grown to be close to her normal size. Link let his girlfriend down, though he was strong enough to keep carrying her, he wanted to see her standing normal again. And normal she was, as Zelda stood tall before Link, growing the last few inches in front of him before she was her full size once again.

"Thank you, Link. It's good to be big again." Zelda said happily. Though she had agreed to remain shrunken for Link, being able to switch between her big and normal(tiny) sizes would be something she'd have to get used to, and she didn't mind being at either as long as she was with Link.

"You're very welcome." Link said, and folded his arms. "And now, I think you owe me something."

"I don't know what you mean..?" Zelda tried to play dumb.

"You know what I'm talking about..." Link motioned to the spellbook.

Zelda did indeed know what he was talking about, the spell she promised to teach Link so he could use it to shrink her whenever he liked. She chuckled at Link's eagerness, but smiled at him and turned back to the spellbook, sitting down at her table. "You're not wasting anytime, are you?" She asked playfully.

"Zelda, what you offered me before is too incredible to pass up! I know you just got back to normal, but I'd like to at least know the spell, alright?" Link admitted. He knew he was being selfish, but he couldn't help it, Zelda was just too cute when shrunken!

"Okay, Link. I'll teach it to you right now." Zelda said, flipping through the pages of the spellbook. She stopped on one and pointed to the page, curious, Link got closer and looked at the incantation in the book.

"There it is. 'The Goddess's Reduction Spell'. It seems like Hylia used to use this spell to shrink her enemies to miniscule sizes. But, I'm not your enemy, am I, Link?" Zelda asked playfully and looked at boyfriend only to see that he was completely intrigued by the spell's powers, and wasn't paying much attention to her little comment.

"So how do I use it?" Link asked. Zelda rolled her eyes, but explained it to Link anyway.

"This one is a little different from the other spell I used to shrink myself." Zelda explained, and now noticed that she had Link's full attention. She smiled and continued, "This spell can only shrink others, and not only that, when you use it, you can determine the target's height just by imaging it in your head while you cast the spell!"

"I see. So how do I cast it?" Link asked. Zelda sighed from Link's one-track mind, but went on to explain the proper way to cast the spell on her to him.

"... And that should be how it's done." Zelda finished her explanation to Link. She smiled and got up from the chair. She saw Link was still staring at the spellbook intently. She was sure he wanted to play, but she felt a little tired from her unexpected shrinking earlier. So she stretched out and yawned loudly, hoping Link would get the message. "Okay, now that that's done with, I think it's time for bed..."

Link stood up and looked over at her. Zelda waited for him to say or do something, feeling a little uneasy with the power she'd just granted him over her. Then, Link opened his mouth to...
14211211111.title: Final rise of the Goddess

choices: she was as tall as a doll.
she was too small to safely jump out of her bed.
she wasn't in room her room anymore
142112111112.content:
..simply encourage her into having some sleep.
"Have a good night, promise me to be careful when playing the bookworm huh?" he said before kissing her on the cheek, leaving Zelda's bedroom.

"Th-thanks..." she replied in a last yawn.

As Link heard the door closing behind him, he too decided to get some sleep, although the way of using the spell he had just learned was carved so deeply into his mind he struggled to doze off once in his bed as well. It might had always been easy for him to quickly fall asleep, but his dreams would always leak with energy. In other words, he happened to weakly whisper random words and sentences very often, not to mention his erratic moves in his bed, as any other sleep walker would do. His thoughts about acquiring the girlfriend he always wanted and rescuing her from her shrinking accident overwhelmed his mind, to the point of affecting his very dreams. Link started to unconsciously casting the spell, whispering it and pointing at random items in the room, shrinking them. Suddenly, his fingertip aimed at a very specific direction, casting the magic as well, although nothing apparently happened, or at least as far as the male dormitory could see...

***

Zelda peacefully lied in her sheets, especially after such an exhausting day. As she curled herself in them as she always loved to do, she could not notice her cotton nest was getting thicker and thicker, as the sleeping beauty was sinking into it, unaware of the smooth whirlpool slowly trapping her.

***

Link stretched as he prepared to get out of bed, enjoying a long night of sleep he had been deprived for months. It was generally to Zelda's loftwing to wake him up, spitting a letter from his girlfriend at his face as an awakening ritual. This time Link stepped out of sleep on his own, until noticing something was wrong. A sharp, wooden item stabbed Link's toe as it hit the ground. The latter took a closer look to what had messed his very first step of the day.

"Huh? What's this? Am I still dreaming or something?"

The item lying in his hand was nothing more than the chair of his desk, but it was as big as a toothpick! The young man noticed how some other pieces of furniture had also suffered the same fate: the bookshelf was almost impossible to spot because of its new size, and so was a wooden bird statue Link had carved. The latter rubbed his forehead to help him find a rational explanation to this phenomenon. In a facepalm, he deduced what had happened overnight.

"Don't tell me that I performed magic in my sleep just because I was obsessed with what happened to Zelda..?"

He quickly used the reversal spell Zelda taught him to fix the accident before minding his business as if nothing happened.

***

Zelda woke up early as she was used to do. Normally used to observe the sunrise as the early bird she always had been, the young woman only had nothing to see but darkness, like during a cloudy, pitch black night. What disturbed her even more was that she could hear Loftwings cry, as they would always do at dawn. She rose, noticing her head bumping against a soft, wide surface. She could have recognized that her bedsheets given how glad she was to get to sleep after a busy day like yesterday. So why was she trapped in such a dark and giant mass? Zelda mentally cursed as she understood what had probably happened: Link had shrunk her in her sleep.

"You might be my boyfriend Link, but I'm not your toy!" she made her way through the smooth ocean, and once out of it, no doubt was possible:
142112111112.title: Wish her a good night

choices: Crawled outside
Stopped when somebody entered the room
Decided to try and climb her desk herself
1421121111121.content:
Zelda was fully prepared to give Link a scolding, but as she freed herself from her oversized bedsheets, she noticed two things. One, Link was nowhere to be seen, and two, she was once again as small as a doll. Immediately, Zelda tried casting the spell she used to restore herself the night before. Even though she had agreed to stay small, she didn't feel right being shrunken in her sleep, and without Link anywhere to be seen. But then after the spell was cast, to her surprise, nothing happened. She tried again, and again, but each time the result was the same.

Why isn't it working? An increasingly worried Zelda wondered. It couldn't be that.. 'Final Rise of the Goddess' was a literal title, could it? Zelda guessed as to why the spell wasn't growing her back to normal. She hoped that the "Final Rise of the Goddess" wasn't a one use spell, as its name could imply. She wasn't sure, but worrying about while stuck on her bed at mere inches in height wasn't getting her anywhere.

"Ugh, Link..!" Zelda groaned, now set on finding him and making him help her get to the bottom of this size-changing spell business.

The shrunken girl was frustrated by such a bad awakening, and also shocked at how it happened to her in the first. Mostly because she had expected the shrinking spell to only work if you were close to the target, and also because, while she had shrunk again, she wasn't actually as small as she had been last time. Zelda estimated herself to be at least twice as big as she was the night before, putting her at about 6 inches tall. Not very big at all, but still big enough that the tiny girl could make it off of her bed by herself.

So Zelda leapt off the edge of her now massive bed and grabbed onto her equally massive sheets and began climbing down them.

Link is definitely going to be hearing about this when I find him! Zelda thought to herself, but then something occurred to her. Wait. What if had doesn't even realize that he shrank me? Could he have cast the spell in his sleep?

Zelda wasn't sure if such a thing was even possible, but she did know she had to get to her boyfriend and get him to restore her as soon as possible. So she kept climbing down her bedsheets. As her tiny feet touched the floor, Zelda was thankful that she was still at least small enough to crawl under her door. But to get to Link's room she'd have to go through the halls and down the stairs, and if she did that there was a chance she'd be spotted by somebody. Zelda shivered at the thought.

"Oh, wait!" Zelda exclaimed suddenly, speaking out loud in her small voice. "I should be too small for anybody to really see me now. So it should be safe."

With herself reassured, Zelda headed for the door to the hall and...
1421121111121.title: Doll-sized again

choices: Link !
Cawlin aiming at her shelf with a slingshot !
Someone else had seen her
14211211111211.content:
Adopting a stealthy strategy to find back her boyfriend but also her shrinker, Zelda ducked and managed to leave her bedroom, passing under the door. She wiped her clothes as her white pajamas had harvested the dust of the door step. This resulted in a tiny cloud of dust, causing her to sneeze. Fortunately for her, no one was around. She might be small, but Zelda was still visible for someone careful enough, not to mention her nose was still a little irritated from the filth that had entered it. She decided to head downstairs, hoping to find Link in the kitchen, but this idea was a double edged sword: Link was indeed likely to be there, but so would other people. Will her size make her hard enough to spot? Will she be cautious to not end under someone's shoe?

As she started to climb down the stairs with her current size, that is to say by hanging down each step and drop to the next, Zelda eventually reached the end, although the process was tiring and time-consuming. Would Link still be there to help her? Suddenly, the young woman noticed the ground was shaking with loud quakes. Zelda dashed to hide in a nearby pot when a group of students unintentionally stomped the floor, coming out of the kitchen. Zelda sighed out of relief, thinking she was safe in her tiny shelter. She soon understood she was far from being out of danger when someone lifted the pot she was in!
"Who has been silly enough to leave those pots here?!" a voice said.
"Did someone try to lay a trap so that I break my back while stepping in that mess? FLEDGE! Would you explain me this?!" the same person said in a ruthless tone.

Only one person could be so strict with someone like Fledge, Zelda thought: Henya: the aging school cook. The shrunken woman then felt the pot she was in move to someone else's hand.
"B-but Miss! How was I supposed to move those pots out of the way as you asked me to take care of the dishes instead..?"

Henya crossed her arms and stared at him angrily. "Do you dare to reply to my orders? Do what I say! We haven't got all day!"

Fledge sighed and looked down. Zelda gasped, fearing him to see her, given that she was trapped in the palms of his hands! Luckily for her, he did not stare at the pot, but simply to the ground. Zelda took advantage of his lack of attention to jump out of the jar and land on a shelf nearby: she was high enough to stay out of sight. She took a better look at the kitchen now that nothing could harm her. At the bottom of the kitchen, she saw...
14211211111211.title: Crawled outside

choices: Link was still there
Link was still there, but somebody was now with him
Link had left the kitchen
142112111112111.content:
It was Link, sitting quietly at one of the table in the mess hall, eating breakfast alone. Zelda was glad she had found her boyfriend, but at the same time, she felt upset that he didn't seem to have a care in the world. She wondered if he had bothered to check on her earlier in the morning.

With her beloved found, Zelda knew she had to get over to him before he left the kitchen. But doing that was easier said than done, as the shrunken Zelda didn't want to risk shouting for and getting someone else's attention. So Zelda decided the best course of action would be to climb down the shelf she was stranded on.

The tiny girl crawled over to the edge of the high shelf and peered down, it was only several feet to the ground, but at her size it was a very long drop. Zelda gulped at the thought of falling such a height. She backed away from the edge and looked around for something to make her descent easier. As luck would have it, the shelf she was on was being supported by four poles on either corner of it, something that Zelda could use to slide down to the floor gracefully.

"Here goes..." Zelda whispered to herself, bracing for the drop. She grabbed onto the metallic pole and jumped, and with her great agility, was easily able to slide down stealthily. Once on the floor, Zelda quickly moved behind another pot to hide and think of how to get to Link.

Perfect! Now to get to Link before he leaves! Zelda thought. She wasn't too worried about Link leaving though, he usually took his time to enjoy a meal. Zelda wondered what a meal would look like to her at her miniscule height, and her mouth almost watered at the thought.

Zelda then peered out of her cover to find Link again, she looked and saw that...
142112111112111.title: Link to the kitchen

choices: Took her back to her room to help her
Continued to enjoy his meal
Decided her size needed some more adjusting
1421121111121111.content:
"Phew..." Zelda sighed. It hadn't taken her long to get off the shelf, but she still worried that Link might've left. If he did leave, then Zelda was basically stuck like this for an indefinite period of time, the thought made the tiny woman shiver.

Not wanting to waste any more time, Zelda made sure the coast was clear and ran over to Link's table. At her 6 inch size, the kitchen looked huge to her, and even thought the table was only a few feet away, Zelda built up quite a sweat in running over to it.

"Link!" Zelda shouted when she got under Link's table.

"Hmm?" Link said. He scooted his chair back and looked down for the source of the tiny squeak. His eyes widened when he saw Zelda looking back up at him, at only 6 inches tall! "Zelda!?"

"That's right, Link! It's me!" Zelda shouted.

"Wh-what happened to you..!?" Link asked. Zelda sighed, she had hoped that Link would've known that he'd made her shrink overnight, but from his genuine reaciton just now, it was clear to the shrunken girl that he had no idea what he had done to her.

"You cast the shrinking spell on me while I was sleeping!" Zelda shouted. Link seemed shocked by her accusation, but then thought about it and he seemed to understand what had happened to his tiny girlfriend.

"Oh no... I'm sorry, Zelda. Here, let me get you off the floor." Link offered.

Being gentle, Link lowered his hand for Zelda to climb on board. The shrunken blonde got on, thinking they'd go back to her room and find out why she wasn't able to regrow herself. But then, Link just pulled her close to his chest and sort of "hugged" her, as much as he could hug a 6 inch tall girl.

"I'm sorry. I can't imagine what you've been through today." Link apologized sincerely.

"No, I've been... fine." Zelda told him. She wanted answers, but also liked to enjoy melting in her gentle giant's hand.

"I'm glad you're safe." Link said. He then moved Zelda back and just looked at her for a moment. "Why didn't you use the 'Final rise of the goddess' spell?"

"Oh, Link, I tried! But it isn't working for some reason!" Zelda cried.

Link looked worried, but not in any hurry to help her. Zelda was glad that she had gotten his attention so easily, and even though she had to admit it felt good to be safe and held by her giant lover, it wasn't really what she wanted right now.

"Please, Link. I don't know how you shrank me in my sleep, or why my own growth spell isn't working so we need to get to the bottom of this!" Zelda insisted, hugging one of Link's fingers tightly.

Link looked down at his tiny girlfriend and...
1421121111121111.title: Link was still there

choices: Zelda agrees and eats
Zelda just watches Link eat instead
Zelda refuses to play along and demands Link help her now
14211211111211112.content:
Link nodded at Zelda's tiny form, but then went ahead and put her down on his table and then picked up his knife and fork and dug right back into the meal he was eating before she showed up. He didn't just eat it quickly so he could go and help Zelda, he took his time and savored the delicious food, much to Zelda's annoyance.

"Link!" Zelda shouted, stamping her foot down. "What about me?"

"Mmm!" Link moaned softly, enjoying his breakfast. He then looked down at Zelda again, and shoved a plate towards her. "Oh yeah, here you go! Eat up!"

Zelda looked at the huge pile of food next to her, puzzled by how Link expected her to eat it when it was bigger than her whole body. Not that she wanted to eat right now anyway, all she wanted was to return to normal size and get a proper breakfast.

"Link, please! Just help me get back to normal size now so I can get something for myself already!" Zelda pleaded.

"Don't worry, Zelda. I will. I just don't want to let my food go to waste!" Link told her, still digging into his rather large meal.

Zelda just stood there, surprised that Link could be so careless. She knew he liked to eat, but never thought that that would stop him from helping her. She guessed that this is what she gets for letting Link control her size, and resigned herself to for fate of waiting for Link to finish, she was in no real danger or rush now that she was with Link, and besides, despite her protests, Zelda did still like being small next to her hero. Moodily, Zelda crawled over to the edge of the table and sat down and waited.

"What am I supposed to do while I wait for you to finish?" Zelda asked.

"Relax, Zelda! Enjoy the food, it's really good today!" Link insisted, motioning to the plate he'd pushed towards her before.

Zelda eyed the giant meal curiously, she was pretty hungry but she wasn't sure she'd like to eat anything in her current size...
14211211111211112.title: Shrinking and eating

choices: Zelda finally has her fill
Zelda continues to eat everything on the plate
Link tries to stop Zelda himself
142112111112111121.content:
Zelda shrugged and crawled onto the food-topped plate. She thought she'd much rather make the best of her current situation, and with Link's current aloofness, it didn't seem like she'd be getting back to normal any time soon. But Zelda knew she couldn't blame the boy, she had agreed to let him change her size at his whim after all, she just wished he'd have asked her before shrinking her this time!

"Pancakes, huh?" Zelda eyed the comparatively giant meal before her, wondering if it was even safe for her to eat at her shrunken size. Nonetheless, Zelda mustered up the courage to take a handful of the soft breakfast and eat it.

"How is it, little ladybug?" Link asked, grinning.

Zelda took the time to savor the flavor of the pancake before responding with great joy, "It's delicious!"

Link just laughed heartily at Zelda's reaction. The 6 inch girl looked up at her boyfriend and smiled.

"Seriously! This is the best pancake I've ever had!" Zelda sounded equal parts excited and surprised. She took another bite. "Oh my goddesses, could it be because I'm so small that it tastes so good!?" Zelda quickly took yet another bite of the huge pancake. She nearly squealed in delight as she ate it. Then she got curious about the rest of the food on her plate and crawled over to inspect it.

Link was laughing the whole time as he watched his tiny girlfriend scamper about on his plate, eating up all his food like she hadn't had a meal in weeks.

"Oh, Zelda, you should see how funny you look from my point of view!" Link chuckled. Zelda simply ignored him though and kept right on going through a sort of 'taste-test' of everything she could get her tiny little hands on. Link stopped laughing, and started to worry about her. "Hey, now, Zelda. Don't you think you've had enough yet?"

"Uh-uh!" Zelda shook her head, enjoying a delicious piece of oversized bacon.

"Um, are you sure you can handle all that much at a time? I'm surprised you can eat so much considering you're so small!" Link noted.

"Maybe a little more..." Zelda said, her words mumbled through her chewing. Despite her words, Zelda kept right on eating, and Link started to actually get seriously worried that she'd eat herself into a coma when...
142112111112111121.title: The secret to a good meal

choices: ..Realised he was dealing with much more than a doll !
..Remained oblivious.
..Got bored and tossed the "Doll"
142112111112112.content:
"Uh-oh..." Zelda whispered. "That's not good..."
She had the impression to witness the scene in slow motion. The projectile fired from Cawlin's weapon progressively came at her, getting as big as a boulder to her once about to collide into Zelda's spot. The only thing the latter could do was to scream out of terror and duck, hoping to dodge the shot, or at the very least not get spotted by anyone. After the loud impact of the pellet, Zelda slowly looked around her, understanding she was safe and sound...or rather for now: the tiny woman noticed the shelf's structure was badly weakened by the attack and about to collapse! She had to find a way out, before crashing to the ground with the massive furniture! As Henya was yelling at Cawlin for such a violation of the school rules -and served him right- Zelda thought. Did he spot her, especially at this size and distance?
She did not have the time to give it further thought, when the shelf finally fell down, causing Zelda to thankfully land in a bag of flour.
"What happened? Where am I..?" Zelda said, confused.

The next thing she could see was the gigantic Henya, walking to the mess Cawlin had caused.

"Oh no, no, no, no!" Zelda cried, despaired. Unable to think straight, she could think of a single place to hide: the flour she was on. She covered herself in it, hoping to be as stealthy as a chameleon.
There goes the time I spent doing my laundry...Zelda thought. Henya thankfully fell for the trick, too busy to think of thousands of ideas of punishment for Cawlin. Zelda's nose started to itch, causing her to repeatedly sneeze. Henya unavoidably flinched when the flour quaked, as if coming to life, but moved on, blaming some cockroaches instead.
"Disgusting pests! " she unknowingly insulted Zelda. "Always there to spoil my ingredients! Cawlin! Be useful for once and get me rid of it!"

"Yes, ma'am." the troublemaker replied.

He dragged the bag to the exterior, with its minuscule intruder still in it. Zelda did not attempt to flee, as it would only get her into huge trouble. Unfortunately, the outcome did not prove that simple, especially when Cawlin decided to stuff his hand into the bag, thinking out loud :

"That old hag isn't friend with insects, huh? Then let's see how she likes those in that flour! "

Zelda could not move from an inch, and Cawlin eventually found her, pulling her out of her hide. Fortunately for her, she was covered with the white powder and could not be recognized this easily. It took her all of her willpower to stay silent and motionless.

"What's that? How did that doll got here? And what am I supposed to do with it?" he said, holding the shrunken Zelda in his clutch.
"I wonder if I'd rather sell it to that idiot of Beedle, that slingshot was really expensive..."
But suddenly, he...
142112111112112.title: Cawlin aiming at her shelf with a slingshot !

choices: Zelda escapes
Cawlin reaches in and grabs her
Zelda reveals she's not a doll in the hopes that he'll help her
1421121111121122.content:
Cawlin noticed that Beedle's shop was flying into town. Excited by the prospect of making a few extra rupees, the boy ran towards the flying shop, stuffing the "doll" into his pocket.

Inside the dark refines of Cawlin's pocket however, the Zelda "doll" was getting rather upset. Here she was, 6 inches tall and covered in flour, and now trapped inside the pocket of one of Groose's creepy friends while having to pretend to be a doll as to not be discovered. Oh how she wished to just be back at the dorm with Link, full sized or no, she'd not mind being small if it were with him. That said, she still wished for Link to take responsibility for shrinking her in her sleep.

"Ooh.." Zelda groaned as she landed on something sticky that she couldn't see in the darkness of the pocket. To make matters worse, every step that Cawlin took shook her whole world, bumping her into the same spot several times and getting her all sticky. She felt disgusted and humiliated by the whole ordeal, but knew that before she could get anything she wanted, she first needed to escape Cawlin and somehow make it back to the school.

Then, in a sudden turn of good luck, Zelda saw light shine into her prison as Cawlin's pocket flapped open suddenly. Zelda thought now was her chance, with her agility she'd surely make it out of the pocket and onto the ground safely, after that it was just a matter of returning to the school to find Link. She'd be back at square one, but at least, she thought, she'd be away from Cawlin.

Zelda got up and prepared to make the leap out of her little pocket prison...
1421121111121122.title: Sticky situation

choices: She was about to be sold to Beedle
Cawlin was going to show her to Groose
She was being shown to someone else
14211211111211222.content:
Zelda gasped as she saw a huge hand come from above. Instantly, she returned to a prone position and remained motionless, becoming a "doll" once more. As much as she hated being stuck with Cawlin, she'd hate to be found out by him even more.

"Hehehe..." Zelda heard Cawlin's cackle form above and recoiled into his pocket. The boy's giant hand came in and grabbed her, whipping her out of her prison and into the light, where Zelda's eyes had to adjust before she could see where she was.

"See? It's pretty neat, isn't it?" She heard Cawlin say to someone.

Blinked her eyes to recover, quickly, hoping to not get seen by Cawlin or whoever he was talking to. When she opened them again she could now see that...
14211211111211222.title: Staying as a doll for a little longer

choices: Fight the bug and use it as a vehicle to escape..?
Hide and wait for a new customer..?
142112111112112221.content:
The salesman carefully looked at what he thought to be merchandise. Zelda had to hold her breath to fool Beedle into not discovering the Headmaster's daughter was now in his grip. He analyzed the pyjama Zelda wore with his fingers.

"He's gonna rip my clothes off at that rythm!" Zelda panicked.

His hand even applied a slight pressure to her chest.
"Of all the parts of my body, you had to touch this one in particular?!" the shrunken woman mentally raged.

But what tested Zelda's patience beyond all other humiliation was how Beedle blew on the flour covering her body.

"And there goes the rest of my disguise..."

Unfortunately for her, the last flour particles flew into the one of her nostrils, but Zelda managed to hold the sneezing back, releasing a tear instead.

"Well," Beedle said. "I've never seen such precise details on a doll before. It even looks like the girl that disappeared a few months ago to be brought back by Link and Groose."

"Uh-oh..." Zelda feared.

"Where did you find it? It doesn't seem to be carved in wood, as it really feels like it was made out of flesh! That's creepy..." Beedle commented.

Cawlin shrugged, as if not interested by the review of who he brought in out of unawareness.
"If you say so, buddy. Now, how much is that junk worth?"

"Speak for yourself!" Zelda wanted to reply.

The shop owner checked out Zelda one more time, swinging her in every angle to be sure to not miss any detail.

"If I throw up, you've got only yourself to blame..!"

"How about 300 rupees?"

Given that Beedle had always been a rip off, Cawlin did not play the picky one.

"It's a deal."

As Zelda was passed from a hand to another, she thought :
"Hylia's reincarnation sold for a single golden rupee! Now if that's not ironic..."

The giant hand put her on a shelf where other products were displayed. Beedle's shop was lifting off, hinting Cawlin had left and the salesman was busy providing the power necessary for his trading ship to fly. Zelda then slowly walked, hoping to get away without attracting his attention. She knew they were way too high in the sky for her to escape, but given her current size, being at two or twelve feet above the ground did not really matter. She noticed how a wooden cage, fitting her size, was empty and left ajar. What could have been inside? The answer came to her by itself when a pincer-shaped mouth snapped in her direction. The Horn Colossus Beetle had just found its dinner. Zelda proved agile enough to dodge its charge, before using its own cage as a shelter. Zelda quickly slammed the cage door shut, causing the insect to give up and simply wander around. Zelda had to figure a way out. Two ideas popped out of her mind...
142112111112112221.title: She was about to be sold to Beedle

choices: Link
Groose
Someone Else
1421121111121122212.content:
Zelda sat miserably inside the wire cage for a while. The insect that had tried to eat her had long since crawled off, leaving the shrunken young woman with nothing to do but sit and wait inside the tiny cage. At her 6 inches of height, Zelda was far too big to be comfortable in the cage meant for a small bug. Even now, sitting alone in the corner of the wire cage, Zelda was feeling cramped.

Minutes passed before Zelda heard someone approach her cage. Zelda squeaked and stiffened up to look like a doll again.

"Ooh? How did you get in there!?" Beedle cried curiously. Beedle found his answer shortly, when the Horned Colossus Beetle crawled back up to the cage. "So it was you, huh? Get back in!"

Beedle pushed the insect with one hand, while his other opened the cage. Zelda gulped as she saw the giant bug enter her previously safe cage. But luckily for her, she didn't have to get comfy with her roommate for long, as Beedle swiftly picked up her shrunken form and pulled her out of the beetle's cage.

That's a relief! Zelda thought as she was lifted into the air. But now that she was in someone's hand again, Zelda knew she had to stay as perfectly still as she could and keep her breathing slow, which was not an easy thing to do with a giant shopkeeper is manhandling her 6 inch body.

Once again, Zelda's luck was on her side as the ride didn't take too long and Zelda was put down on the counter of Beedle's floating shop. Zelda landed straight on her back, which left her staring straight up at the ceiling of the small building, and she was too afraid to even move her eyes, lest she be discovered as the living, breathing Zelda instead of the doll that she'd convinced everyone that she was. Zelda tiny ears still worked just as well though, and she could hear Beedle talking with someone else.

"Okay, that'll be six hundred rupees!" Beedle told the customer all too happily.

Quite the profit, huh, Beedle? Zelda thought as the greedy merchant sold her for twice the amount he paid for her. But I'm still worth more, you know!

"It's a deal." The customer said. Zelda thought she recognized the voice, but wasn't sure. She wished she could just turn her head for a second to see who it was, but alas, she had to keep up her facade of being nothing but a small plaything.

The customer handed Beedle the rupees, while Zelda watched the two's arms make the transaction from below.

"Thaaank you!" Beedle chimed cheerfully.

"Yes, thank you." The customer said slowly, Zelda could almost feel whoever it was eyeing her.

The customer grabbed Zelda quickly and carried her out of Beedle's shop in a hurry. Zelda groaned inwardly, both from the swinging motion of being held by someone while they were walking, and from wondering just how much longer she'd have to pretend to be a toy. Zelda thought she was going to feel sick, when all of a sudden, her new "owner" held her up to their face.

Zelda nearly gasped in shock when she saw that it was...
1421121111121122212.title: New ownership

choices: Someone entered her room
She jumped down to the floor safely
1421121111122.content:
Zelda was fully prepared to give Link a scolding, but as she freed herself from her oversized bedsheets, she noticed two things. One, Link was nowhere to be seen, and two, she was tinier then she'd been the night before. Her bed now looked like a massive expanse of white, and the covers she'd just crawled out of a gigantic, soft structure the likes she'd never seen, even on the surface. The shrunken girl gasped at her insanely enlarged surroundings, she was sure she was much smaller then before, feeling like a speck on her bed, she was sure she was less than an inch tall now.

Immediately, Zelda tried casting the spell she used to restore herself the night before, out of fear of her greatly expanded world. But, to her surprise, nothing happened. She tried again, getting frustrated, and again, now getting scared, but each time the result was the same.

"Oh no... Why isn't it working?!" Zelda panicked. She could feel tears welling up in her eyes as dark thoughts crossed her mind. She wondered if she was stuck at this pitiful size, while she had agreed to stay small, she certainly to mean to stay this tiny! She wondered if Link or anyone else would even be able to see her, as small as she now was. She wondered if Link even knew what had happened to her, and if he ever did notice her at her incredibly small size, that he'd be able to restore her to normal, or even doll-size. Zelda laughed a little at the thought, she felt so desperate now that even being just inches tall was preferable to this size.

No! Zelda thought to herself, pushing those negative thoughts away, she tried to reassure herself. I made it through the surface, I can make it through this!

Zelda took another look at the drop to the floor from her bed, just the walk there taking the minute woman a considerable amount of time. At her size it was a good 50 feet down. Zelda nodded to herself, and began climbing down. She wasn't sure what she could do by herself once on the floor, being so small, but she had to at least try. If she was lucky, Link might even already be aware of what he'd done to her and maybe, she thought wishfully, that he'd shrank her so much on purpose, as a prank, and was just waiting in the other room laughing to himself, and he'd come around the corner and reveal himself before growing her back to normal.

"I might forgive him if he did that..." Zelda said aloud, eyeing the bathroom door hopefully. But as Zelda kept climbing down her bedsheets, it was becoming more apparent that Link hadn't intended to do this her and certainly wasn't just playing a 'prank' on her.

"Oh well... I guess it's up to me then..." Zelda was about most of the way down her bed when...
1421121111122.title: Waking up a speck

choices: Link
Someone else
14211211111221.content:
Zelda gasped as she heard her door slowly open. She stopped her progress down her bed and waited to see who it was.

"Hello? Zelda?" A voice called from the other side of the door.

Zelda gulped as she recognized the voice as none other than...
14211211111221.title: Someone entered her room

choices: "Are you in here?" Link is oblivious
"I'm sorry for shrinking you..." Link is aware
142112111112211.content:
"Hello..?" The voice repeated, this time it was undeniable to Zelda, she recognized it as Link's voice. It was confirmed when her once again giant-to-her boyfriend poked his head through the opening of the door. Zelda felt relieved that it was Link who had entered her room, feeling hopeful that he'd know all about how small she'd become overnight, and be able to reverse it soon!

But at the same time, Zelda was fearful of Link's massive size. Her beloved appeared more like the goddess statue that used to be part of Skyloft than any human she'd ever known, only magnified by an insane amount! Zelda felt like an ant as she watched him come in. Still though, she remained hopeful that he could help her.

Link! I hope he knows what happened to me! Zelda thought as her enormous boyfriend entered her room.

From the way he carried himself, however, it seemed to Zelda that Link had no idea that she had shrunk so small, as he entered her room cautiously, as if not wanting to wake her. He looked then scanned her room for her, looking straight at her bed that she was currently trying to climb down. Seizing the opportunit, Zelda tried to get her monolithic boyfriend's attention.

"Link! Down here!" Zelda shouted as loud as she could, she even let one arm hang free to wave at him for added measure. But it was no use, her voice was far too small to carry all the way to her boyfriend's elf-like ears, and her body much too small to be seen from his comparative mile-long height. Zelda gulped as she started to wonder whether or not Link actually did know that she was the size of a speck on her bed and just waiting for him to help her like the hero she knew he was.

This became more apparent when Link, still showing no sign of acknowledging Zelda's presence, looked around her "empty" room for her, seemingly oblivious to her nearby self clinging onto a single strand of her bedsheet while desperately trying to get his attention. He walked around the room so cautiously, Zelda thought for a moment he might still know what was going on and was just being cautious as to not step on her. She could only hope, but things were confirmed when Link spoke up again, saying...
142112111112211.title: Larger than life Link

choices: The floor
On Link
Back on her bed
1421121111122111.content:
"Zelda? Are you in here?" Link asked as he suddenly started walking more casual through Zelda's room.

Meanwhile, Zelda's heart dropped as she heard him say the words. Her worst fear had become reality, Link truly had no idea what had happened to her, he was clueless to the fact that she was shrunk down to an extremely miniscule, not to mention frightening, size and struggling to get down her own gigantic bed. But now she knew beyond doubt that she was on her own, and so decided that getting Link's help would be her first priority, though she wasn't sure how she would do that exactly, being so small and all.

Zelda climbed downwards again and cursed inwardly, regretting teaching Link the shrinking spell without knowing the full details about it herself first. She couldn't blame Link for wanting to shrink her again, but if she'd known how powerful a spell the shrinking one was, she'd have thought twice about teaching it to him, instead keeping the shrinking magic to herself and shrinking herself for him when he asked. But as it was now, Zelda knew Link was her only hope of getting back to normal, again. So she kept on climbing down her sheets in the hopes of getting his attention any way she could at bug's size.

"Hmm... Maybe she's already eating breakfast?" Link seemed to wonder aloud. His loud voice grabbing Zelda's attention, and she looked back at Link, then her eyes went wide as she saw Link start to move closer to her bed.

Zelda panicked as the colossus moved towards her. If he got on her bed now, then at her puny size she'd likely go flying from the force. But with nowhere to go, Zelda did the only thing she could do, cling tightly to the strands of bedsheet she was on and hope for the best.

Link, puzzled as to where Zelda could be, while thinking of how to shrink her down for fun when he saw her later, took a rest and sat down on Zelda's bed carelessly. 15123.content:
Taking things back a bit...
---
It had been weeks since Zelda had met Link, and told him of her visions and her plan to stop Ganondof. At first, she was sure he'd be able to help her stop that evil man, but as the days went on Zelda became increasingly worried about Ganondorf's search for the sacred realm, and she wasn't sure that the kokiri boy, Link, would be able to stop him in time. They just needed some time to put a stop to the evil warlock's plans, Zelda thought. She'd tried everything in her power to get Ganondorf thrown out of the castle, but nobody would listen to the young princess, not even her father, the king.

After being dismissed by her father again, Zelda knew that she would have to do something herself. She was searching through the the royal library for a spell book that might help her. Zelda wasn't exactly a grand mage or anything, but she had been trained by some of the best wizards and sorceresses in Hyrule, so she was confident enough in her abilities. The thought that there might not be much time left to save the kingdom hounded her mind, and so she hurriedly looked for a spell powerful enough to give her some more time or an edge in the fight against Ganondorf. After reading through several advanced spell books, Zelda still couldn't find any time-related spells, although she did come across something else, a shrinking spell.

"Shrinks any target down to any size imaginable.." Zelda read the spells description out loud. "Interesting. This could be just what I need!"

Zelda studied the spell for a while. It didn't take long for the princess to memorize the spell, and she tested it out by shrinking a book to less than an inch tall.

"Perfect!" Zelda said happily. She bent down and picked up the tiny book, she examined it between her fingers. It wasn't even as big as her fingernail! "This will be that evil Ganondorf's size soon." She thought, and left the library.

Zelda stormed into Ganondorf's chambers, and found him standing in front of his desk, he didn't even bother to turn around when she barged through the door. The young princess couldn't take his arrogance any longer, she approached the man, making sure to stomp her little legs loudly as she did.

"Ganondorf!" Zelda shouted, pointing her finger at the man.

The dark warlock turned to face her. "Ah, Princess." He said with a tinge of annoyance in his voice. "How can I help you?"

"Hmph! You can leave this castle." Zelda snided.

Ganondorf shook his head and sighed. "I know you don't care for me, Princess. But if I weren't here who would advise your father?"

"You are not here to help, and now I've had enough of your lies, Ganondorf!" Zelda shouted. "If you won't leave of your own free will, then I'm afraid that I must make you leave!"

She than recited the shrinking spell she had just learned. Magic energy began to gather in the air, causing quite a bright, multicolored spectacle.

"What are you doing?!" Ganondorf shouted, he couldn't believe that the princess was capable of using spells as powerful as he was sure this one would be. Instinctively, he began chanting his own spell, a magic barrier, one that would reflect any spell cast on him back onto the user. He finished his chant just in time, the magic struck his body then just as quickly turned around and hit the young princess Zelda instead!

The next few moments were a blur for Zelda, one second she was casting her spell, and the next she found herself looking up at quite possibly the biggest thing she had ever seen. But with her brief disorientation and the sheer size the thing in front of her, it took her moment to realize just what she was looking at, and when she finally did understand what it was, her heart sank. She was looking up at Ganondorf, from her point of view he appeared well over a thousand feet tall to her!

"N-No... NO!" Zelda cried, devastated that her spell had backfired. "How!? H-He was supposed to shrink... Not me!" Then it hit her, Ganondorf must've put some kind of reflective magic barrier at the last second, causing the shrinking spell to effect her instead of him!

Zelda didn't know what to do now that she was so small, she was now wishing she had learned a growth spell, and she couldn't even try the shrinking spell again because of Ganondorf's magic reflecting barrer. Her first thought was to run away though, and she did. Running as fast her tiny feet could carry her she tried to escape the mountain-sized man who she just tried to shrink. She was terrified of his giant form, but she took one look back as she ran and saw...

151311.content:
After Link came back from the future to warn Zelda about Ganondorf's plans, the kingdom of Hyrule entered a long period of peace. However, most history books detailing the history of the land overlook the actions of another, mostly insignificant villain's plans to cause mayhem in the kingdom. That villain was known as Garland, a powerful but largely unknown evil sorcerer, who spent most of his time refining and creating spells. He resided in a small underground cave in Hyrule Field, not too far from Lon Lon Ranch.

As coincidence would have it, he decided to take action not long after Ganondorf was arrested. Word of the Prince of Evil's arrest had spread throughout the kingdom, but it didn't bother Garland in the slightest. He finished creating a series of spells which he thought would be the first step to help him conquer Hyrule, but he needed a test subject to try them on. He eventually focused his sights on Princess Zelda: Not only would just getting to her already be a good test for some of his other spells, but he also liked to spread sorrow around: kidnapping Zelda would surely throw the kingdom into a panic.

He left his lair, having already planned every spell he would use to kidnap the young princess. When he reached the outskirts of Hyrule Castle, he used one of his newly-created spells to merge with his own shadow. This spell could also allow him to absorb people and items into his shadow, which made it perfect for the job. He slithered on the ground in shadow form, swiftly and quickly making his way to Zelda's bedroom, where he found the young princess.

She was peacefully sitting by her desk, reading a book about various legends of Hyrule. She especially liked two legends: one about a hero from the skies who travelled through the land and fought an ancient evil to protect the reincarnation of the goddess Hylia, and one about another young hero's quest against an evil Minish wizard. However, before she could continue reading, she felt a strange, cold sensation near her feet. She looked down, and saw her legs turning pitch black as her shadow was quickly growing and enveloping her. She tried to scream for help, but her shadow was moving too quickly for her to do anything. By the time she realized what was going on, her shadow has started covering her entire body, causing her to lose consciousness. It was the work of Garland, who was in the process of absorbing Zelda into his own shadow, so he could kidnap her effortlessly. The young princess's shadow started to shrink just as quickly as it had spread over her. As soon as it was done, Garland moved out of the castle and returned to his lair, quickly and undetected.

He left his shadow and caused Zelda to reappear, before tying her to a chair so she wouldn't escape. The young princess was struggling a bit, but in vain as the ropes were too tight. An overjoyed Garland proceeded to introduce himself and taunt her:

"Why, hello, your young Majesty! I am the powerful wizard Garland, and this cave we are standing in is my lair! It is a bit small at the moment, but I intend to relocate to a much bigger lair, fitting a sorcerer like me! The shadow spell I used to, shall I say, "invite" you, is a mere fragment of my large repertoire of new and powerful spells, which will allow me, in due time, to conquer this fine land of Hyrule! And with your permission, let us not waste any more time and start right away, with a de-aging spell!"

He started muttering an incantation, and raised his arms high in the air. Soon, he started glowing pure white, overflowing with energy. Zelda struggled even harder, but couldn't undo the ropes that were tied around her. After a short while, Garland threw his arms forward, pointed them at the young princess, and with a scream, released spell on her. It came out as a pure white beam of energy from the sorcerer's hands, and hit Zelda square in the chest. The young princess shook as if she was struck by lightning, and started glowing as the spell was running through her body. It was surprisingly painless, but it was nonetheless a very uncomfortable experience. After the beam wore off, Zelda started to feel dizzy, as she could feel the spell taking effect. Her hands and arms got smaller, and the rope that was tying them was beginning to loosen. Her shoes slipped off of her feet, which were getting smaller and slightly chubbier. Her head was also shrinking, and her facial features were getting even more childish than before. Her entire body was getting smaller, and even her voice was getting more high-pitched. She was getting younger so fast that within seconds, she looked like a toddler playing dress-up with her sister's clothes. She was approximatively around five years old, but did her regression stop there?

151331211.content:
"Princess Zelda of Hyrule!"
Shuffling past the Zora Announcer, Zelda smiled nervously at the young Zora standing opposite her. Her arms were crossed unhappily and a grumpy look adorned her face. All in all, she looked rather unimpressed with Zelda.

"Princess Ruto of the Zora!"
At the mention of her name, Ruto nodded. Uncrossing her arms, she finally returned Zelda's smile. However, in contrast to Zelda's natural yet nervous one, Ruto's appeared to be forced.

Ruto gestured for her guard to leave before walking towards a small table at the side of the room. Zelda did the same before nervously following her. Sitting down, the two Princesses stared awkwardly at one another for a few moments.

"So..."
Zelda cleared her throat in preparation for breaking the ice, but stopped when Ruto slammed her webbed hand down into the table.
"So, how's Link?" She demanded somewhat angrily.

"H-Huh?!" Zelda stammered. "I don't... What do you mean? He's gone to look for a friend of his. Is there a problem?"
Ruto snorted in response to the question.
"I guess there is! And its name is Zelda!"

With Ruto's hostile tone, Zelda turned to the door, intending to call for her guard. However, Ruto quickly leaned across the table, slapping her damp hand across her mouth. Zelda struggled against Ruto's grip, but couldn't escape her strangely strong grasp.

"You tried to take my future husband from me!" Ruto hissed. "I gave him my mothers sapphire, meaning he is engaged to me! I can't have you around when he returns, so I've come up with a plan to neutralize you!"

Reaching below the table, Ruto produced a small sapphire. Zelda's eyes widened as she recognized the familiar shape of it.
"That's right... Zora's Sapphire. It's used to open the Door of Time, but if used by a royal of the race, I can slowly change them into a Zora!"

Ruto grinned as she pressed the Sapphire against Zelda's flat chest, where it began to glow with a bright blue light. Zelda groaned as her body began to tingle...

15133212.content:
The seemingly endless summer had slowly drawn to an end. What seemed like endless days of fun and games were soon to be done. None so poignant than when Link told Zelda that he would soon leave the land of Hyrule. He said he was going on a journey to find a lost friend. She granted him luck with his decision to leave Hyrule. They'd had so much fun together the past summer. Zelda didn't want it to end but she would not stop him. Besides, she felt he'd come back one day. Still - she wished she could go with him, if only to be with him always; but being a Princess, she would not be allowed to travel.

On the last day before he left, Zelda offered him a gift - a good-luck present. She gave him the Ocarina of Time; the precious heirloom of the royal family, and the mysterious instrument that sent Link on a journey beyond her wildest imaginations. Surely this precious flute could do so again. And if not...well it would help remind him of her. She felt no regret giving it up to him again; she knew she could trust him with it. And it would of course eventually lead him back to her, if only to return it.

But now our story begins. Zelda roused from her sleep, feeling strange. She awoke feeling a definite hollow feeling and her skin felt hard and smooth. She could not move a muscle, but she could still feel. She felt her body was much rounder, but asymmetrical, like she was oblong or potato shaped. What was going on.

She felt a warm and comforting feeling come over her lower body, but the feeling was joined with fear when she saw what looked like giant fingers wrap around her and lift her from her place - wherever she was. She felt herself turned until she saw the face of a giant Link. What was going on? Why was Link huge? Or maybe what if she herself was smaller? If that was the case, then she was somewhat gladdened that it was Link of all people to find her.

"Zelda gave you to me," Link said to her. Why was he talking to her like that? "I'll make sure that nothing happens to you. After all we've been through, it's glad to have you back again." Zelda could sense that Link didn't recognize her. She wanted to wave her arms to get his attention but she still couldn't move. Disheartened by the fact that whatever she'd transformed into, she clearly didn't have a face.

As she tried to look down at herself - difficult as she was unable to move her head, but her eyes were still at least mobile, she saw that her body was a light blue color. It was then that she realized the shocking truth - she had become the Ocarina of Time!

She could hear the yells of soldiers training, a welcome sound considering she was trying to leave undetected.

However, as she drew level with the doorway, she came across what was effectively the final test. Two of her most experienced guards, ordered to keep an eye out for her by her personal maid, Impa, who took her security seriously. As Zelda neared them, she could feel their eyes lock onto her. Lowering her head, she paused when they crossed their spears across the doorway, barring her from leaving.

"Come now, Your Majesty," One of them rumbled, looking at Zelda. "You know the rules".
Sighing, Zelda looked up. Of course they'd recognize her escape attempt.
"I do know the rules. However, I believe the rules no longer apply as Ganon has been defeated. Very little out there poses a threat to me," She said.

A couple danced near the fountain in the centre, which had been one of the first things repaired after people had made their way back into town. On the other side of the fountain, a small band had stuck up an unfamiliar tune.

Keeping her head low, Zelda made her way past the fountain.
"Hey! Lookie here! Where you off to in such a hurry, huh?"
Feeling a rough hand grab her shoulder, Zelda was forced to stop.
"I suggest you let go," She warned the owner of the voice. "Otherwise, you may find yourself in major trouble".

"Yeah, right! I'm sure you're a regular Princess Zelda!" The voice scoffed. "Now, let me see that pretty face of yours..."
Zelda let out a gasp as she was whirled around to face the person who grabbed her. Once upon a time, he may have been considered handsome, however ugly scars now marred his face. His blue eyes were blood-shot and racing all over her body.

As Zelda watched, he stumbled slightly to the side, almost taking her with him.
"Why, hello there!" The man slurred, a sinister grin spreading across his face. "Why hide such a beautiful face from me, huh?"

Zelda quickly scanned the square, looking for the guards that were meant to be posted here.
"Looking for the guards?" The man guessed. "Well, you'll find them in there, enjoying themselves!"

He jerked a thumb at the building behind him. The door was wide open, revealing a few people wearing armour sitting around a table, bottles in front of them.
I knew opening that tavern so early was a bad idea, Zelda thought regretfully. I'll have to have a word with guards posted to Castle Town... But first, I need to get away from this creep!

"You know, you look like you could do with a drink, sweetheart!" The man offered. "How's about it? My treat, of course!"
155312212111132112.title: Something happens in Castle Town...

1553122121111321121.content:
"I-" Zelda only manages out one word before she is dragged by the drunken scarred man.

"Of course you want a free drink! Who doesn't want a free drink?!" The man exclaims drunkenly. Zelda tries to escape, but even with her older body she fails to shake away from his grasp. Before long, she is dragged into the tavern the smell of alcohol fills her nose making her scrunch up her face. Several people are dancing or lying on the floor thanks to the fast music being played, one of them being a guard. "I'll have to set firm rules on playing around while working, it seems. Once i take care of this problem."

"Sir, i really need to get going."Zelda says politely but firmly as the scarred man forces her to sit down. The man seemingly gets the message as his scarred face seems to finally realize her words as sits on a wooden stool nearby.

"Fine.....party pooper. Please though have one drink! Please!" The man waves his hand and a drink come down the table, being surprisingly skillfully caught by the drunk blue hair man.


Zelda looks down in the tall wooden mug, a dark red reflection staring back at her. If she wasn't worried about the effects of the potion on her, she would proudly say her older face has become beautiful. Her long hair adds an allure, which is why this drunk dragged her in the first place. Her wise eyes look at the drink in slight distain. She stares at the other drinks noting that others are all the same rusty brown with none being the same as hers.

"I ordered something special for such a sweet thing such as you! Once you're done your free to goooo!" The man slurs at the end, his breath making Zelda back up the slightest.

"Fine, as long it's just one." Zelda sighs, knowing that this is her only way to get out of here without making a scene. She could use some of her magic, but it would cause a panic. Grasping the wooden handle, the princess brings it to her mouth taking a small sip. Tasting something sweet yet sour, Zelda takes an another one.

15531221211113211213.content:
"C'mon, sweetheart! Hurry it up!"
Taking another small sip, Zelda glared at her forced drinking partner. As she watched, he quickly downed his own drink, slamming the tankard down and letting out a satisfied belch. Zelda leaned back, anxious to avoid the invisible stench.

"Is that all you've drunk?!" The man demanded drunkenly, leaning over to peer into her tankard, which was still near full. "You ain't a lightweight, are you?"
Zelda didn't answer, instead electing to look everywhere but at him.
"Silence says it all, sweetheart!" The man chuckled. "Another one!"

Another tankard filled to the brim was set down in front of the man. He downed it just as quickly as the first, which resulted in yet another revolting belch. Zelda leaned back while taking another sip of her own drink.

"Well, only one way to help with that!"
Zelda let out a yelp as her tankard was ripped from her hands. Despite the sickly sweet taste, the drink had been starting to grow on her. Not enough to make her crave it, but just enough for her to tolerate it.

"Excuse me!" She said, clearly irritated. "I thought you wanted me to finish that?"
"Uh-huh. But you ain't drinking quick enough! You gotta drink fast to enjoy it! And you ain't enjoying it!"

Probably because I don't want to be here, especially with somebody like you! Zelda though indignantly.
"You gotta drink it like..."
He paused and took a look around the bar. Zelda copied him, doing her best to follow his gaze. He looked at the bartender, who was at the other side of the bar. He then looked at some guards, who were too busy playing cards and drinking to be of any use. He finally focused on Zelda, who glared back at him.

"This!"
With surprising speed, the man grabbed Zelda's cheeks and squeezed. Her eyes widened, and she was fully prepared to slap him when his other hand shot out and grabbed hers. Before she could ready her other hand, the man began to pour her drink into her mouth.

Zelda initially choked as she resisted the urge to swallow. After a few seconds, she reluctantly began to drink down the red liquid. Even then, she began to choke on the taste, which was amplified immensely by the quantity flowing down her throat.

Unlike Zelda, who hated everything about this, the man seemed to be enjoying himself. He giggled every time she struggled against his grip, chuckled every time she coughed, causing the liquid to spit out of her mouth.

When the last drop flowed down Zelda's throat, he stumbled away from her, a massive smile plastered across his face. As for Zelda...

"URRRPP!"
Letting out a long belch, which caused her drinking partner to clap gleefully, Zelda giggled.
"Hylia, that was good!" She said, her voice beginning to slur. "I could do with another... Hey!"

She looked over at the man who guided her in.
"Buy a woman a drink?"

The bartender shot him a look.

The Bartender shook his head.

Burlon frowned.

Zelda reached into one of her pockets and rummaged around. She pulled out a silver rupee, which caused both the bartender and Burlon to let out gasps.
"You're loaded?! And you didn't tell me?!"

Ignoring Burlon, Zelda slapped it down on the counter.
"Well, I... Uh... Coming right up!"
Grabbing the rupee and shoving it under the counter, he quickly poured them another two drinks. Burlon grabbed his, while Zelda took her own.

"Cheers, rich lady!"
"Cheers, Burlon!"
Clinking their tankards together, the pair took long swings from their drinks. Burlon downed his entire glass, while Zelda managed to down just over half of hers.

"Good try!" Burlon congratulated, slapping Zelda on the back. "See what I mean? More enjoyment!"
Zelda nodded in response, lifting her tankard and finishing off her drink. She slammed her tankard down and signalled for another drink. Within seconds, another was set in front of her.

Beginning on her third drink, Zelda felt great. Her first drink had been mediocre at best. Now, it tasted much better. She felt as though she could drink, like, ten more of them!

Finishing her third drink, Zelda swiftly ordered a fourth. As she lifted it to her lips...

1553122121111321121311.content:
Lifting her tankard to her lips, Zelda prepared herself to down yet another drink. However, as the liquid began to run down her throat, her vision darkened. Lowering her tankard, she swayed slightly on her seat, something that she couldn't attribute to her drink.

No... Not here! Not in front of everybody!
Looking around the tavern, Zelda's rational mind quickly returned to her. She shouldn't have been slacking off in here, and now she was going to pay the price. Even if she could hide her aging process from the tavern, there was one person who would definitely notice it...

"What's up, sweetheart?"
Jumping as Burlon's hand grabbed her shoulder, Zelda looked at him with worry.
"N-Nothing at all!" She said quickly. "J-Just need some fresh air! Yes, that's all! If you'll excuse me..."

Going to move past him, Zelda felt his grip tighten.
"Fresh air, huh..."
She swallowed nervously. Eyeing the nearby guards, she wondered if they would still be able to do their jobs when drunk...

"Sounds like a great plan, sweetheart! Lead on!"
Getting up from his seat, Burlon pushed Zelda towards the door. With no other options, she reluctantly stumbled towards it. One hand clutched her head, while the other helped steady her.

Damn him! She cursed silently. He couldn't leave me alone, even for five minutes?!
As Zelda marched out of the tavern, she shivered as the cold Hylian air hit her. Even with her cloak, nights were still quite cold.

Next to her, Burlon seemed to be having no problems with the cold. Rather, he seemed more energetic. He whistled happily, leaning next to the door. Zelda couldn't help but notice that he was keeping an eye on her. He had started out friendly enough, but now...

She stumbled. Leaning up against the wall for support, Zelda turned her back to Burlon. Keeping her growth secret would be hard enough without him peering over her shoulder.

Feeling pressure build within her, Zelda looked down. She was expecting the usual changes she had come to expect. A bigger bust, a rounder ass, wider hips and maybe a few changes to her face.

Her breasts and backside did grow, however their growth was barely noticeable. What was noticeable, however, were the small rips and tears now beginning to appear on her overtaxed clothes. Between her new curves and new height, all her clothes were struggling. Her tunic no longer covered her belly button, her pants were clinging to her like a second skin, her boots were painfully tight and the hem of her cloak now only reached down to her knees.

As for the rest of her body, such as her face and height, Zelda wouldn't be able to make out any changes without a mirror to help. She didn't feel any taller, and a quick touch of her face didn't reveal any huge differences. At a guess, she had probably aged another couple of years, leaving her at twenty eight years old.

I really need to get going, Zelda thought as she inspected her longer nails. Before Burlon hauls me back into that tavern again...
"You've been awful quiet, sweetheart!"
Zelda let out a yelp as Burlon spoke right next to her.

"Please, don't do that!" She said, clutching her chest.
Burlon grinned in response.
"Anyway, Burlon, I must get going. I have... business in Hateno Village, and I must leave Castle Town as soon as possible. It was a pleasure meeting you, and I hope we meet again!"

Smiling, Zelda turned around. She began to head for the gate, but a couple of steps later, a hand grabs her shoulder. Letting out a gasp, she turns to face Burlon...

15531221211113211213112.content:
"Well sweetheart.... How about I accompany you?" Surprisingly, despite all the ugly features he possesses, Burlon still had all his teeth even if they were not brown. " I mean sure I don't look like much now but I used to be quite the warrior back in the day."

"Really?" Zelda questioned but inside she was frustrated. She highly doubts the guards will come due to their past foolishiness. Good for the princess as Burlon has yet to notice her aging. His eyes seem unfocused and he seems unbalanced as he sways the slightest. "I really need to get going, like a couple hours ago."

"I'm sorry Burlon but this is a very personal matter. My...." Zelda tries to find the right words. Though the aging process has helped her sober up, her mind is trying to find a good excuse. " My life is at stake here."

That is also very true. If she continues to age no one would recognize their princess except Link who had an eye for such things somehow. Gods, she could even become an old woman if this process doesn't stop!

"Your life eh? Hic Looks like you really do neeed me! I'll follow you!" Burlon hiccups as he walks past Zelda. "Now let's get going!"

"But Hateno Village is-" Zelda is instantly silenced by Burlon who yells aloud.

"Shut up! I said I was coming with you so I am. I owe you for those drinks and getting me out of debt!" Zelda raises her brow a bit. Debt? She never cleared Burlon's debt did she? Maybe somehow she did. She did toss out high value Rupees after all. Honestly, she thought he was following her in order to get into her pants. She still thought that but was surprised that this maybe out of debt drunk was more then he seemed. But she still can't have him following her.

Right now though it would seem she would have no choice but to deal with him or she could use some of her weakened magic. It should easily take care of Burlon in his current condition.

After Burlon takes a few steps, he mumbles a bit his large scarred body swaying left and right even more. “Al-Alright princess let’s get…..going….”

As he trails off the blue haired man sways an falls to the ground with a hearty thump! Zelda nearly jumps in fright but realizes that it was a foregone conclusion. While she did find the man annoying, she really didn’t want to leave him on the ground but she had no choice at the moment. Not just because she was in a rush mind you but because of her clothes.

“If I try to bend down quickly or move the wrong way….these clothes may just tear. And I have no replacements on hand at the moment.” Zelda thinks as she looks down at her pants. Her hips have escaped just the slightest and her skin tight clothing has various small tears here and there. There seemed to be some new ones or ones that she failed to notice before. Her pant legs have risen as well climbing up past her ankle and between said ankle and knees. She might need to find new clothes in the next village perhaps. Zelda could get some here, but she rather not waste even one more second in Castle Town if she can help it. Taking several careful steps in her extremely tight boots, Zelda notes that torches have been lit and the sun has almost completely set as few stars start to appear. Zelda wants to curse her luck but this should make it easier for her to leave Castle Town.

“Farwell Burlon.” Zelda says to the man now snoring loudly as she starts to walk. He at least gave her a taste of the commoner life. Even if most of it was something she rather not knows about.
