1553122121111321121311232.content:
Zelda walks carefully toward to the front gates fearing that perhaps she’ll be stopped again just like last time. That or be lustfully stared at if the distained looks of women and the lustful stares of men she passed on the way were anyway to tell what they thought. However, the guards were…asleep. One had his head bobbing up and down with each breath and the other was snoring loudly!

“Gods I’m thankful, but also so disappointed as well.” Zelda mentally sighs as she takes several queit steps. She couldn’t help the small noises that she made with each step. Her toes were fully curled inside her boots making it only possible for the princess to step a little loudly. It takes more time then she would have want thanks to her clothes resisting some movements but she manages to sneak past the sleeping men.

“When I get back I think I’ll have Link take over their training for a week. Seems to be a perfect punishment for these lazy men that call themselves guards of Hyrule.” Zelda angrily mutters as she gathers distance from the guards. Link, being an actual knight would have been perfect to train them but his training was rather Spartan, so she put others in his place to train them. Now she realizes that thankfully for this time only she made a terrible mistake.

“Well I can’t fix it now…I need to move.” Zelda thinks as she goes out into the plains that surround Castle Town.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------

Zelda makes it a good distance away from Hyrule several times she wants to stop and get a good look at her face over the lake that surrounds Hyrule but out of fear of not even recognizing even herself , the princess forces herself onward only stopping to fill the few bottles in her tight pockets she has on hand. Thankfully, she runs across no one as she travels possible because it is at night. She needs to make as much progress as possible in order to make up for lost time.

“Hateno Village is at least five days on foot. If I manage to get a horse that would be good and only take at least three. But that may require a detour I may not have time for.” Zelda thinks to herself. The distance is vast but she must cover it quickly, every moment counts!

Along the way Zelda slowly figures out how well her clothes that fit her younger body deal with their current situation. Her butt and breasts that once bounced the slightest now don’t as they are squeezed tightly. Her sleeves traveld up her arms barely covering past her elbows, several long tears align the sleeves as they protest against their older owner. Her stomach is cold against the cold night as well. Every bend and twist is met with a slight protest warning Zelda of her clothing predicament at each moment. Her boots are the worse however, she has loosened them fully but she still can’t pull her feet out, they were stuck in her boots!

Zelda sighs tiredly, the princess rather keeps going but for some reason she feels extremely tired. Mostly likely a combination of events led to this. “I dislike it but I have to stop here for the night. Monsters are also active even more at night so making a fire should keep most of them away." Except for the stupid ones of course but Zelda received reports that monsters have been avoiding fires of late from Link.

The moon and the stars shine brightly as Zelda goes about her business there are few trees around the plains but at least kindling and wood is easy to find. The fire will be easy to start as soon as she collects enough and the leaves, grass, and her cloak should keep her warm in the cold weather. The wind is fair and should help with a fire and some sticks are large enough to make a torch if she decides to continue at later tonight.

Zelda starts to gather careful of the way she gathers wood as she does. Her clothes refuse to let her bend down fully as they are forced to bend to her curves and bigger breasts. Sometimes her large breasts get so squished that she has hard time breathing. “I hope I find a merchant on the way to Hateno Village, or else…Gods I should have just bought some clothes at Castle Town!”

As she continues to gather wood, Zelda hears something out of the ordinary…

choices: Zelda decides to just lie down...

15531221211113211213112321.content:
Slowly crouching down, Zelda grabbed another couple of twigs and added to the slowly growing bundle cradled in her arms. Despite the best efforts of her clothes to stop her from bending over, she had gathered a decent amount of wood. While she was no Link when it came to survival in the wilderness, she probably had more than enough to last her the night.

Heading slowly back to her makeshift campsite, Zelda stopped when something caught her eye. It twinkled at her in the undergrowth, beckoning her closer. Curious, she took a couple of steps towards it.

"Oh!"
Zelda's eyes widened as she discovered the source of the twinkle. A silver rupee, seemingly polished, had been discarded in the undergrowth. She had no idea why somebody would discard such a valuable rupee, but she wasn't going to complain. It would replace the rupee she had spent in the tavern earlier.

In her excitement, Zelda temporarily forgot about her stretched clothing. Storing her collected wood under one of her arms, she bent over, her other hand reaching out to grab the rare rupee...

*RIIIIIIIIIIIIP*
She stopped. For a few seconds, she was completely still as her face began to turn red. Only when a chilling breeze blew past her, lifting her cloak and whisking past the new hole in her pants did Zelda begin to move.

"Oh, Hylia!"
Cursing in her traditional manner, she instantly straightened up. Her free hand flew to her backside and began to inspect the new rip. Unlike the others, which were negligible, this one was an actual hole directly over the top of one of her cheeks. Her ass, finally given an outlet, bulged through.

With a face redder than a red Bokoblin, Zelda crouched down and grabbed the rupee. Shoving it into her pocket, she hurried back to her camp, her exposed flesh bouncing and wobbling with each step.

Throwing some of the wood into a stone out she had prepared earlier, Zelda did her best to move her mind away from the stupid mistake she had made. Grabbing a bit of flint she had happened upon, she grinded it against a knife Link had practically ordered her to carry. Sparks flew into the air, and with another few strikes, a small fire had sprung up in front of her.

Despite this small triumph, Zelda now faced a new problem. Her clothes were tight enough to prevent her from sitting next to the fire. And while her crouching pose didn't threaten her clothes, it was incredibly uncomfortable. There was no way she could just crouch next to the fire all night.

"Damn it!" She cursed again, looking down at the warm flames. "What I'm Nayru's name am I meant to do?! I can't sit, I can't bend over... I suppose I could lie down... But, ugh... I don't really want to ruin these clothes. They're the only ones I've got, and it's bad enough travelling in these. Mud would just make it unbearable!"

Eyeing the muddy ground, which was covered in twigs, leaves and a few white stains that looked suspiciously like bird droppings, she gave a reluctant shrug. If Link could sleep through a storm, complete with lightning that actually tried to target his sword, then she could sleep atop some mud and bird droppings.

"Or I suppose I could... No!"
She tried to wave another idea from her head, but despite her best efforts, it lingered. It involved just stripping out of her clothes, leaving her in just her underwear and probably her boots, and...
"No, stop it, Zelda! You are a Princess, and cannot be seen naked in front of Hyrule!"

Crossing her arms under her bust, which caused a few rips in her sleeves to widen, Zelda looked down at the small flame...

1553122121111321121311232131.content:
As Zelda drew closer and closer to a potential refuge from the coming rain, she heard a couple of whinnies. Her first thought, understandably, was about Link, and how he had found her.

However, as the whinnies began to sound closer to her, she began to pick up on another couple of sounds. The sounds of wooden wheels creaking and spinning, the sound of mud being kicked up, and the sounds of a carriage driver grunting as he fought to kept his horses under control.

Peering through the murky darkness, Zelda saw a faint light approaching her. The occasional shadow flitted in front of it, presumably the people within the carriage.

Thank Hylia! Zelda thought happily. Maybe I can persuade the driver to stop and give me a ride!
Doing her best to ignore both the rain, which was beginning to steadily increase, and the chilly wind, which blew past her exposed stomach, wrists and face, Zelda stepped into the road.

They can't miss me if I stand here, she thought, standing slightly off to the side, just in case they somehow did miss her and then trampled over her. Clothes would be the least of her worries if that happened.

As the carriage neared her, Zelda began to wave. She frowned briefly as she heard another few rips from under her arms, but ignored them. If these people had clothes in her size, then she could finally get rid of these heavily tattered ones.

Uh... They aren't stopping?
Realization almost hit Zelda too late. Just before she was trampled by two brown stallions, she dove aside. Landing heavily in the mud, Zelda let out a groan.

I am going to take a long look at the rules of the road once I'm back to normal, she thought, looking down at her arms. So much for avoiding the mud...

A little bit down the road, the carriage came to a halt. Looking up from the mud, Zelda saw the door swing open. A shadow stepped out of the carriage, looked around for a few seconds before spotting the fallen Zelda.
They said something to the carriage driver, who nodded, before heading towards her.

As they drew closer, Zelda made out a few details about the shadowy figure. First, they were definitely female, with a chest about half the size of Zelda's. Second, they were dressed like one of the nobles that marched around Hyrule Castle like they owned the place. And third, they looked somewhat irritated that they had almost run over Zelda.

As the mysterious noble reached Zelda, she kneeled down and inspected her for a few seconds. She then looked over her shoulder and called out...

155312212111132112131123213112.content:
Zelda let out a gasp as she finally got a good luck at the woman's previously unseen face. She had assumed that she would've been dolled up in the typical fashion that Hylian nobles liked to adopt; thick white make-up with the reddest lipstick, eyeliner and blush they could possibly spend their money on.

Instead, a beautiful face adorned with a cruel sneer glared down at the fallen Princess. She had slightly tanned skin, with hair as golden as those gold rupees that used to be in circulation. Her ruby red eyes held irritation as they connected with Zelda's green eyes. And the part that really worried Zelda and helped identity the mysterious noble was the tattoo of an upside down eye that surrounded her right eye.

A Yiga Sorceress! She thought worriedly. I hope she doesn't recognize me as Princess Zelda. I hate to have to do this, but...
Throwing her head down and holding her hands up in forgiveness, she muttered through gritted teeth, "Please forgive me, Ma'am. I didn't realize you were a noble!"

The sorceress let out a cold laugh.
"What, you thought another stripper such as yourself could afford a carriage? Grow up!"
Zelda grunted as she felt the woman's boot force her head down even more.

"But what is this? Perhaps you aren't the stripping pig I originally thought you were! Look up at me!"

A few seconds passed, during which neither the anxious Zelda nor the Zora spoke. Eventually, the Zora let out a heavy sigh and flashed Zelda a faux apologetic look.

"As much as I tried, I just can't think of anything you could possibly provide for me that I don't already have," The Zora said, holding the bell between her thumb and forefinger. "If you were the actual Princess Zelda, then it would be a different manner entirely. But as it stands, you merely share her name. Perhaps you will be easier to teach if you are a tad younger?"

"N-No, wait!" Zelda stuttered, moving from sitting on her backside to kneeling before the Zora. "I... I am Princess Z-Zelda! The P-Princess of Hyrule!"

The Zora hesitated, during Zelda with a newfound curiosity, before letting out a titter and frowning.

"And perhaps Lady Camilla can train that deception out of you as well!" The Zora commented. "It's common knowledge that the Princess is both well into her teens and living comfortably in Hyrule Castle! You are merely a pre-teen, who is about to be regressed to a child, and destined to live out your days in service to the Yiga! Now, be quiet, lest I ring this twice!"

Shutting her mouth, Zelda watched with sad eyes as the Zora gently swung the bell from side to side. A gentle ringing echoed around the room before a dark mist swirled out of the base of the bell. As it did, pressure began to build within her small body. Falling back onto her backside, Zelda merely stared at the Zora before her, already resigned to her fate. Closing her eyes, she gasped and groaned as she felt her already diminished body compress and shrink down even further. And while her body shrank, more and more of her former life as the Princess was lost to her.

"Oh, dear..."

The pressure suddenly dissipated from her body, which allowed Zelda's body to stiffen as she heard a familiar voice with a dangerous edge to it.

"I see our newest... recruit... wasn't to your liking. As compensation for her failings, feel free to visit another of our fine workers. It's on the house, of course".

Cracking a nervous eye open, Zelda watched as the Zora strode past her without a second glance. As soon as she left the room, she heard a heavy sigh, followed by footsteps as somebody walked in front of her.

"My dear Princess..." Camilla tutted, kneeling down in front of Zelda. "I see you found out what the punishment is for not pleasing your clients. But before I continue, take a look at yourself. See what you've become".

Sniffling, Zelda opened both eyes and inspected her body. Her top had fallen from her shoulders and was bunched around her legs, as was her skirt. With no clothes covering her, her completely flat chest and lower body was on full view to Camilla, who didn't seem concerned by her nudity.

"I'd estimate you're around... eight years old now," Camilla continued. "Seeing as you've fallen so far in such a short time, I should explain what happens should you continue to fail me. Regress below three years old, and your mind becomes mine to command. But I am not entirely without mercy. Reach the age of twenty by pleasing clients, and I'll let you go free. But for now, I think you're done for the day. Back to your cell you go..."

Gathering up her clothes, Zelda allowed herself to be led back to her cell. As she walked, she didn't even attempt to memorize an escape route. Instead, she stared down at her childish body, her mind confused. Camilla called her 'Princess' earlier... Was she a Princess?

I am... Princess Zelda... Zelda thought. Of Hy... Hyrule? But why am I here?

Zelda continued to ponder why she was here, and not in Hyrule Castle like an actual Princess, until she reached her cell. Glancing up at Camilla, she briefly considered pleading to stay with her, however Camilla paid her no mind and shoved her into her cell. The door slid shut behind her, leaving Zelda alone in her room...

Over the top of her fence, Zelda saw a large field. In one corner of it sat a large stone structure, while in the centre was a long fence that formed a large oval. A well-worn track encircled the outside of the fence.

As for her pen, it seemed to be at near the end of a long row of roofed outdoor pens. She could hear chickens in the one to her right, while a cow occasionally mooed from somewhere to her left.

This place... It seems familiar, Zelda thought. But I can't place it...
Hearing a whinney, Zelda's brow furrowed in confusion. She hadn't heard any horses earlier.

Looking around, she saw a number of horses ride into the central pen. They galloped around for a few minutes before suddenly stopping. At the same time, their heads all turned to face something out of view of Zelda's pen.

Curious about their sudden interest in something, Zelda tried to poke her head out of her own to see what it was. Sadly, much like her shorter arms, her legs seemed a tad shorter, meaning she was unable to see whatever attracted the horses interest.

A few seconds later, she heard what was so interesting. A woman's voice singing a somewhat familiar tune reached Zelda's ears, which twitched in response. She felt attracted to the beautiful voice, and all of the tension and worry that filled her body slowly melted away, leaving serenity in their place.

It's so beautiful... Zelda thought. And so familiar... I wish I could see who was singing it...
A second later, her wish came true as a woman appeared. She walked into the centre of the horses pen, where she stood and continued to sing.

The woman had fiery red hair, and wore a pretty white top with a light purple skirt. A long apron, decorated with pictures of various animals, covered the front of her outfit.

She seems familiar as well, Zelda thought as the woman's song came to a satisfying end. Why does this place fill me with such a sense of nostalgia? And why was her song so calming to me? Only one other song has that kind of effect on me...

Her thoughts were interrupted by the woman's voice, which sounded a lot closer now.
"Here we are!" She said happily. "Some delicious feed! Eat up~"

Peeking over the top of her fence, Zelda saw the woman slowly making her way down the row of pens. She carried various buckets, all of which seemed to be filled with different kinds of animal food. She could see seeds in some, while others were filled with hay. All of them, however, smelled delicious to Zelda.

As she drew closer to Zelda's pen, her worry began to reappear. How this woman react to her? At this point, she looked more like a pig walking on two legs than a Hylian. What if she just dumped a bunch of food into her pen and walked off?

I need to talk to this woman, Zelda decided. I'll see how she reacts to me first though...

Maron trailed off as she caught sight of the nearly naked woman with piggish features standing awkwardly in the pen.

"Um, who are you?" Maron asked, looking between Camilla and Zelda. "Is she with you, Miss Camilla?"
Camilla shrugged.
"That depends, really..." She said. "If she lies, then she most definitely is mine. If not, then she isn't!"

Camilla let out a chuckle, causing Zelda to shy away. Maron continued to look at her, a pitiful look on her face.
"Uh, anyway... Sign here, and you'll be free to go!" Maron said, handing a piece of parchment to Camilla, who scanned down it briefly before scribbling something down and handing it back.

"A pleasure, Maron. And you..." Camilla smiled coldly at Zelda before walking off. Zelda and Maron watched her go.
"So, um..."
Maron cleared her throat, causing Zelda to jump.

"Who exactly are you?" Maron asked curiously. "And where did you come from?"
Zelda remained silent. She wasn't going to tell her that she was the pig that formerly occupied this pen. Maron probably would laugh her out of the ranch. But if she answered her questions, maybe she would be able to work something out.

"I am... Eliza?" Zelda answered nervously. "Yes, I am Eliza. And I was following that woman for a while, hoping to find something out. I only just managed to catch up to her..."

Maron narrowed her eyes, scanning Zelda's body. Zelda shuffled uncomfortably, mud squelching beneath her feet. Hopefully Maron bought her story...

Be grateful she didn't turn you into a pig or something!" Maron yells. Camillia doesn't add a thing but sneers at Zelda as her back is turned.

1553122121111321121311232131121322123222.content:
Slowly, Camilla turned around, revealing an amused grin on her face.
"My, aren't you the presumptuous one, Maron," she called out, making her way back towards the pair. "I don't ever recall saying I was a sorceress. And even if I was, would I really go around turning people into pigs just because some farmhand asked me to?"

Maron's formerly accusatory glare slowly vanished as she looked down at the ground.
"Well, I..." She stuttered.
"Why, if I was going to turn anybody into a pig, it ought to be you!" Camilla said, stopping in front of Maron.

Looking between the pair, Zelda met Camilla's eyes. For a moment, they seemed to hold what looked like pity, before the sorceress blinked and amusement returned to them.

"I... I'm sorry..." Maron muttered nervously, still staring at the ground.
"What was that?" Camilla asked, using a hand to force Maron's gaze upwards. "I don't think Ms. Eliza heard you. Would you say that again?"
Camilla turned Maron's face towards Zelda.

"I am very sorry, Ms. Eliza!" Maron repeated, barely loud enough for Zelda to hear. "And to you as well, Ms. Camilla. I just assumed that..."
"Perhaps you assumed correctly!" Camilla said coldly, clicking her fingers.

As she did, Maron's body froze. Her arms were pinned to her sides and her legs snapped together. Camilla took a step back, grinning at the worried expression frozen onto Maron's face.

"Now, I am a firm believer in punishing those deserving of it!" Camilla said. "While I have my reasons for despising this woman, you do not. If our roles were reversed and I were you, I would've offered aid to this woman. Instead, you accused her of attempted theft and assault!"

Maron's eyes, the only part of her that wasn't frozen, darted around nervously. They looked desperately at Zelda, who felt both a twinge of guilt and a want for revenge surge through her.

"Ms. Eliza!"
Zelda jumped as she heard Camilla call out her new name. She stepped out the muddy pen and stood next to Camilla.
"As you were wrongfully accused, I will leave her fate up to you!" Camilla declared. "Should she be punished! And if so, how?"
1553122121111321121311232131121322123222.title: False accusations

1553122121111321121311232131121322123222.content:
"Are you absolutely sure you don't bottlefeed her?" Camilla asked, flashing a cruel smile towards Zelda. "She looks very young, if you know what I mean?"

Feeling pressure press down on her, Zelda suppressed a squeal. She was not going to give Camilla the satisfaction of hearing her squeal and snort as she messed with her body. To do so would be like acknowledging that Zelda had lost, and she most certainly had not!

However, her confident thought was washed away by multiple jabs of pain, mainly focused on her arms and legs. Once again, she could nothing other than watch as her limbs became shorter and shorter.

However, unlike last time, the rest of her body was beginning to shrink. Zelda let out a groan as she felt her head compress and drop, followed swiftly by her torso which likewise shrunk. Sadly, the fat she had gained from her last shrinking session didn't seem to vanish. Although thankfully, she didn't seem to be gaining any more.

Drawing closer and closer to the muddy ground beneath her, Zelda's transformation finally stopped. She wasn't sure how pigs aged, if there were teenage pigs or whatever, but if there was, she was most certainly a child pig.

A piglet... She thought sadly, inspecting her small yet fat form. The Princess of Hyrule is now a mere piglet... How could I have fallen this far?! Hopefully, she can't do much else to me...

Looking up at Camilla, who towered over her, Zelda saw a cold smile adorning her face.
"You know, she looks awfully familiar..." She heard Camilla state to Maron, who was hidden from view by the walls of her pen. "Looks a lot like Princess Zelda, doesn't it?"

Maron peeked over the walls to peer at the Piglet Princess.
"I can see what you mean..." She agreed. As she did, Zelda let out a high-profile squeal.
"I *SNORT* am Princess *SNORT* Zelda!" She said, but it fell on deaf ears.

"So, what say you Maron?" Camilla asked. "Like I said, I'm prepared to pay right now for this cute little piglet! Just say the word!"
Maron looked down at Zelda, before looking back at Camilla...

"The beast is over here boss!" Zelda's spine straightens as she hears a sudden voice coming up the main road. If not for the young sounding voice Zelda would not have heard them from the distance.

"What is it a Bokobin?" An older man's voice questions as Zelda hears multiple footsteps coming closer.

"A bokobin?" Zelda looks down at her body and the new changes. "Could they be talking about me? Not likely. Bokobins are not pink."

"Not like Bokobin I ever seen before. It's a lot bigger then a regular bokobin for one. It has pink skin, kind of fat, and for some reason is wearing more colthes then rags. Very fancy stuff they used to be I reckon."The young voice gives a disirption and Zelda lets out a huge sigh.

"They are talking about me. I do suppose I do like a Bokobin...Hyilia help me." Zelda is suddenly grateful that she did not stop in a town. If she did who knows how the guards and the people would react? She probably wouldn't be alive after someone came into her room. "I need to escape or hide. I could try to reason but I doubt they will listen to me. Maybe. They've never met a talking Bokobin before."


"Hm perhaps it's a good thing we placed these rotted food here and there. It makes them easy to capture when their bellies are full. That Yiga woman did scare me, but her advice was pretty sound wasn't it?" The older manly voice gets closer to the large vegation covering Zelda's hiding spot. Peeking out a bit Zelda cannot make out any features to tell if they were warriors or even farmers that live in the area. Her belly bobs the slightest, reminding her of her fattened body. She hears the two men moving the vegation as she realizes they are coming toward her! She needs to do something soon!

"A Yiga woman? Now I am curious, did she come here beforehand? Or is this a different Yiga woman? Also why are they capturing Bokobin instead of killing them?" Zelda calmly looks around in the small cave she is in. She's been in plenty of this situations before. She could hide somehow maybe but she'll be easily discovered as the cave was only big enough to hide the boxs and herself but if she hides behind the boxs....she doubts she could hide by holding herself up on the walls but it is also an option.

1553122121111321121311232131121322123222.content:
There's nothing for it. I'll have to hide, Zelda thought, slowly making her way towards the boxes at the back of the cave. Chances are they'll attack me before I can even get a word out. And there's no use me trying to fight them. They've got weapons, and I'm less than useless in a fight...

Hearing the bushes just outside the cave rustle, Zelda's eyes widened. She was still too far from the boxes. Moving any faster would just tell them that there was something inside the cave. Looking around for something to buy her time, her eyes fell on a small rock.

Sorry about this...
Silently apologizing as she grabbed the rock, Zelda chucked it in the general direction of one of the men hunting her.

"Ouch!"
The bushes stopped rustling. Looking back at the boxes, Zelda resumed her stealthy walk towards them.

"What's up?" The older voice asked.
"Something hit me!" The younger one replied.
The older voice gave a gruff laugh.
"It's just a pebble, son! Suck it up. Now, let's have a look inside this cave here..."

Just as Zelda made it behind the boxes, a shadow fell across the cave. Remaining completely still, she heard footsteps slowly make their way into the cave.

"You sure it was here?" The older voice asked.
"Well, around here," The younger one answered. "Maybe it cleared off after finishing all the food?"
"Hm, maybe..."

The footsteps drew nearer to her. Zelda clamped a hand over her mouth as she heard one of the boxes rattle slightly. From her prone position, she could barely make out the shadow of one of the men inspecting the box.

"Well, the boxes are cold," The younger voice declared. "It's probably moved on by now. You know they don't hang around places that don't have any food."
The older voice grunted in response.

"Ah, well. Suppose it's somebody else's problem now," It said. "Shame, though. That Yiga Woman did say she'd pay handsomely for a pink Bokoblin..."

Hearing footsteps slowly retreat from the cave, Zelda let out a long breath.
That was way too close... She thought, wiping sweat from her forehead. I'm just glad they didn't look any closer. However, this talk of a Yiga paying for Bokoblins... Is it the same woman who cursed me? Or some other member of the clan? Either way, it would probably be best if I didn't get caught by her...

Moving out of her hiding place, Zelda cast a final look at the empty boxes before heading for the exit.
Hopefully, they aren't waiting for me outside, she thought as she neared the exit. That would really suck...
1553122121111321121311232131121322123222.title: Zelda resolves to hide and not be discovered!

The younger man is thin with blonde hair but some muscles show. Zelda's lips curl in distaste for being called a beast as she opens her mouth to explain...

1553122121111321121311232133.content:
With her cautious walk, Zelda's progress towards the cave was slow. With each step, she could practically feel her pants threatening to rip apart. She could feel her boots strangling her feet, her tunic sticking to her like a second skin that didn't properly fit...

About halfway to the cave, she stumbled. Sticking a hand out, Zelda managed to keep herself on her feet, but at the cost of getting her hand covered in thick mud. Straightening up, Zelda groaned and did her best to swipe the mud from her hand before resuming her ginger wall towards the cave.

It's odd, Zelda thought as the rain began to pick up. My clothes feel a lot less... tight.
As she continued to walk towards her refuge, it turned out that her thoughts were close to what was actually happening.

While her clothes did feel less tight, it wasn't because they were shrinking, but rather because Zelda's older body was beginning to regress. Her bountiful breasts were beginning to retreat backwards, while her wide hips and round ass were likewise beginning to shrink.

A few seconds later, Zelda began to suspect something. Her clothes, which had been feeling incredibly stretched, now felt oddly baggy. Her breasts had stopped bouncing, and she noted that she was no longer forced to sway her hips in order to walk.

Glancing downwards, her eyes widened in shock.
"I-I'm... shrinking?!"
To reinforce her point, she felt her eyeline drop. With eyes filled with fear, she hurried towards the cave, confused as to why she was now beginning to shrink...

First she had to worry about becoming older and literally growing out of her clothes now she might have to worry about crawling in them!" The cave shouldn't be much farther now..."

Thankfully it seems someone was here some time ago as she sees an abandoned blanket. There was some holes and while an emergency Zelda still rather not be seen without something covering her. The clothes though loose are now hard to take off as the rainwater makes it stick to her skin. Her boots are hard to take off due to the water and mud inside them but soon her feet scream in relief as they come off. As She tumbles her clothes around as she feels her hips and breast receded a bit more and without formality quickly grabs the large blanket and uses the outside to dry herself off. As soon as the princess is completely dried she takes a deep breath as she tries to collect herself.

Yet she doubts something like this could be perfected. However she rather gets cured first before researching, or having others research, this more. Her nails and hair are still long as before her regression. Taking careful steps Zelda approaches the mouth of the cave and eyes a deep puddle near the entrance. Looking at the pool Zelda sees her mud covered face the rest of her body is covered and she still has her curves, even if they are not as prominent as before. Her eyes are still the same but her face looks even more youthful. Perhaps if she did not trip earlier she would be at her normal age. "If I'm right...I'm no longer even my eighteen year old self. Possibly fifteen, sixteen at most? Some people might recognize me as Zelda now though a bit on the young side."

Zelda carefully wipes off her face, being careful as she knows the act of water might trigger her newfound regression. Maybe now she'll stop growing? Or just continue to grow till wet like a weird plant? "Perhaps it's a onetime thing. I don't want to test it however."

Just as Zelda cleans her face she looks around the cave there were some abandoned Cargo here and there some left quiet recently to her knowledge perhaps she might find some clothes here along with some other things she might need for the journey. "First thing first I need to do something about my hair and nails. I look like some kind of lost ragged child. Then clothes, then a fire."

155312212111132112131123213332.content:
"So, first up is my hair. I wonder if any of these boxes have scissors in them..."
Due to her lack of fitting and clean boots, Zelda carefully tip-toed deeper into the cave, doing her best to avoid the pointed rocks that littered the floor.

She eventually reached the crates, having stood on a few rocks on her trip. Sitting on an empty one, Zelda took a few seconds to dig the rocks out of her heels before beginning her search for a pair of scissors.

"Let's see here..."
Humming a quiet lullaby to herself, she pulled a crate close to her. With her long fingernails, she struggled to open the lid. After a few seconds, she decided to stop caring so much about her nails, considering that she was going to cut them soon enough, and dug them underneath it. Another few seconds passed before the lid flipped open, promoting Zelda to clap happily.

"Okay! We've got... Some blue rupees... A rusty sword? And... Eww... A pair of mouldy pants..."
Throwing the pants aside and pocketing the rupees, Zelda eyed the sword.

I could use this, but it probably wouldn't be too safe... Let's see what else we have...
Grabbing another crate, Zelda struggled again with the lid, before shrugging and using her nails again.

"And box number 2 has... A single green rupee... Urgh, an even mouldier shirt and... A pair of scissors! Finally!"
Once again throwing the shirt into the corner and pocketing the rupee, Zelda ran her eyes over the scissors. Their blades were a bit rusty, and they squeaked loudly when ever she opened them, but they should suffice.

Running a hand through her blonde locks, which tickled the back of her knees, Zelda slowly cut her way through her hair until it reached mid-way down her back. Kicking the discarded hair into the corner where the mouldy clothes sat, she turned her attention to her nails.

Okay, easy does it...
With hands that shook slightly from the cold, Zelda did her best to clip her nails. Due to the rusty and dulled blades, it was a somewhat painful process that took way longer than Zelda had originally planned.

Throwing the scissors into the corner, Zelda turned her attention to the next item on her list; clean clothes. While she had technically found clothes, they weren't exactly clean. Even Link, who had no qualms wearing woman's clothing and even wandered about in his underwear on occasion, would probably shy away from the mouldy clothing.

Grabbing a third crate, Zelda now had a new problem. She no longer had her nails, which had been her only way to open the crates. After a few choice Goddess names, she came across an idea. Grabbing the rusty sword from the first crate, she used it to pry open the lid. The blade creaked dangerously and threatened to snap, but it held as the lid flipped open.

Pulling out a couple more rupees, Zelda frowned. While she did appreciate the small amounts of money, she wasn't really looking for any. Pocketing the rupees anyway, she threw that box aside and grabbed another one. Using the sword again, she managed to crack it open at the cost of her sword. The blade snapped in half, which caused Zelda to let out a yelp.

Keeping hold of the broken hilt, she flipped open the lid. Her eyes lit up as she spotted some light blue fabric and some black fabric.
It may not be new clothes, but I can definitely repair my old ones! She thought happily. Now, let's see here...

After searching through another crate and finding some thread, Zelda set about repairing her clothes. In order to repair her clothing, she reluctantly had to remove both her top and her pants, leaving her naked until she had repaired every last hole. Only when she had pulled them back in did she breath in relief.

And now, fire! There is definitely no shortage of wood, but as for some flint... Maybe the last crate has something in it...
Prying open the last crate with her demolished hilt, Zelda let out a cheer as she spotted a small bit of flint. Pocketing the rupees that she had come to expect in every box, she threw the flint onto the floor. It was followed by one of the boxes which she broke up with her sword.

A few seconds later, a fire roared to life in front of her. Sitting next to it, Zelda warmed her hands for a few seconds. Outside, the rain was still coming down, accompanied by the occasional rumble of thunder and flash of lightning.

"I guess it won't give up for the night..." She sighed, looking down at her regressed body. "I should get some sleep, and hopefully, the rain will have stopped in the morning!"

Curling up next to the fire, Zelda drifted off to sleep, the crackling of the fire and the rain helping to relax her...

15531221211113211213112321333222.content:
Between the potentially regressing downpour outside the cave and the mysterious crevice, Zelda knew which one she'd rather explore. Peering into the darkness of the crevice, she prepared to shimmy through...

Her ears twitched.
Somebody's out there! She thought, twirling around. She dove for the destroyed sword hilt she had used to pry open the boxes. While it only had an inch of rusty metal acting as a blade, it was probably still deadly enough to do some damage.

Narrowing her eyes as she struggled to peer through the curtain of water covering the cave entrance, Zelda lifted her hilt in both hands. Her regressed arms shook slightly, but she held it bravely in front of her, just as she had seen her knight do many a time.

Worst comes to worst, I may need to brave that rain if something hostile comes in here, she thought, hearing faint footsteps slowly approaching the cave. Get ready...

As she lifted her hilt in preparation to attack, a man burst through the rain. Water dropped from his ragged brown hair, while his blue eyes darted around madly. Familiar scars adorned his face, causing Zelda to let out a gasp...

"Burlon!" She cried out.
"Quiet, lass!" Burlon answered. "I'm looking for this older girl. Same hair colour as you, same eye colour and same clothing sense! Seen her?"

For a moment, Zelda was rendered speechless. He couldn't recognize her, even with a few years knocked off her age? Well, it was more than a few, but still...

"Burlon, it's... me," Zelda said, dropping her hilt. "I'm the girl from the bar!"
Burlon squinted at her. His eyes were no longer bloodshot, which probably meant that he was no longer drunk. However, he wore an irritated expression, which probably meant that he was suffering from a bad hangover.

"Well, you do look awfully familiar..." Burlon muttered. "But just to make sure... What was the drink I bought for you?"
"I don't know. You never told me what it was called," Zelda answered.

Burlon was silent, which worried Zelda. While he had been an incredible pain while drunk, maybe sober Burlon was a little more helpful.
"Lass! It is you!"

Zelda let out a yelp as Burlon crossed the cave in two steps and scooped her up into a big hug. Her feet left the floor, which told Zelda that she had lost a fair bit of height. The two had almost been equal the last time she had seen him.

"But what happened? You're so..."
"Young?" Zelda filled in.
Burlon nodded.
"Well..."

1553122121111321121311232133322221.content:
"Well, the way I see it, you just gotta avoid the rain!" Burlon stated.
"That... probably would work, but how am I meant to avoid the rain in a downpour like that? Do you have an umbrella?" Zelda asked, peering over Burlon's shoulder at the curtain of rain still covering the cave entrance.

Burlon poked at the fire with the tip of his sword, an odd look on his face. After a few seconds, the look faded and he nodded. Reaching into his pack, he pulled out another bag.

"Na, not an umbrella... Something a little more effective. I always thought some of the things Ma taught me would be useless," he said, looking over at Zelda. "Thought she was mad when she told me to always carry this, that and some more of this. Looks like at least two of those skills aren't useless!"

As Burlon unzipped his bag, Zelda curiously peered over. Her eyes lit up as she saw what the bag contained.
"Is that... A clothing repair kit?!" She asked.
"Uh-huh, plus a few extras. Never actually been used, now that I think about it. I'll need your clothes, so..."

Zelda shot him an irritated look.
"What am I supposed to wear while you repair these?" She asked.
Reaching back into his bag, Burlon pulled out what looked to be some of his clothing. He threw them at Zelda before turning his back to her.

His meaning clear, Zelda pulled her own baggy clothing off and replaced it with Burlon's even baggier clothing. His top stunk of alcohol and acted as more of a dress on her teenage frame, while she had been forced to tie a length of rope around her waist in order to keep his pants on, but other than that, his clothes were quite comfortable.

"Please be careful with those!" She asked, handing her clothes to him. "They... don't make them anymore..."
Burlon nodded gently.
"Not to worry, Lida. I'll take good care of them. Now, let's see here..."

Zelda watched in silence as Burlon reached into his bag, pulling out a couple of needles and a length of string. He slowly measured out various lengths before beginning to patch up the holes.
"You mind not looking?" Burlon grunted suddenly. "Makes me a bit nervous".

"O-Oh! Of course! Just tell me when you're done!"
Turning around, Zelda found herself quickly becoming bored as she listened to the fire crackling, the rain falling and the soft noises of Burlon fixing her clothing.

Time passed slowly. Unfortunately, the rain didn't ease off, instead sounding even heavier. Thunder and lightning began to join the torrential downpour, which worried Zelda. Lightning had a habit of striking people out of the blue...

After an indeterminate amount of time had passed, Zelda heard Burlon drop his tools and let out a long sigh.
"There. That should be that".
Zelda turned around. In his arms were her clothes, which looked almost brand new. A few specks of mud were the only evidence that they had been damaged at any point.

"Oh, and I made you this as well. Should keep the rain from your skin!"
He handed her a black long-sleeved hood.
"Thank you, Burlon. And I'm sorry for leaving you back there," Zelda apologised.

Burlon grunted in response.
"Nah, I was... Doesn't matter. Get changed, and we'll try that hood out!"
He turned around, giving Zelda her privacy.

A few seconds later, Zelda was back in her own clothing, which had been both repaired and resized for her younger body. Pulling the hood on, she tapped Burlon on the shoulder.

"How do I look?" She asked brightly, twirling around.
"Looking good, Lida," Burlon grunted. "Now, let's try it out".
Heading towards the cave entrance, Zelda cast all doubt from her mind. She trusted Burlon's handiwork, despite not even knowing him that well.

Pushing through the curtain of rain, Zelda stood in the rain for a few seconds...

155312212111132112131123213332222122.content:
Skipping somewhat childishly along the muddy path, Zelda hummed a familiar tune to herself.
"You a musician?" Burlon asked from over her shoulder.

Slowing her pace, Zelda fell in beside him.
"Me? Oh, no... Well, some of my ancestors were. The very first Zel... Uh, Lida... played a harp. Then there was the Ocarina, and I think there was a set of pan pipes at some point..."

"Okay..." Burlon scratched his head. "What about that song though?"
"The lullaby? It... was passed down through my family, from mother to daughter. Apparently it has magical powers, but it's never shown any!"

Zelda looked away, feigning interest in a nearby tree as a smile spread across her face. Her lullaby did indeed have magical abilities, but only when played on one of the aforementioned instruments. However, seeing as all three instruments had been missing for millennia, the only power it had now was the power to make her drowsy.

"Magical power, huh... Sounds like your ancestors were quite powerful!" Burlon said.
"I... guess you could say that!" Zelda said nervously, unwilling to say anymore. "Anyway, how much longer until the village?"

"Not long. Look, you can see the hill over those trees".
Burlon pointed over some trees ahead. Zelda craned her neck in an attempt to see the mill, but was unable to see over the trees. Noticing this, Burlon reached over and, with relative ease, lifted Zelda up.

"W-Woah!"
Zelda's hood wobbled dangerously. With an unsteady hand , she yanked it forwards.
"Burlon!" She said angrily, looking down at her partner. "Tell me before you do that! I almost lost my hood!"

Burlon gave a gruff laugh in response.
"Sorry... You're a lot lighter than I thought!"
"Excuse me?!" Zelda said, pouting. "Put me down! I'm done with being carried like a sack of grain!"

Without a word, Burlon dropped her. She landed unsteadily, almost losing her footing. Her hood fell down, and for a few seconds, Zelda's hair was subjected to the intense downpour.

"No!" She wailed, yanking her hood back up. "Don't look!"
Burlon, visibly confused, averted his eyes.
Please don't shrink, please don't shrink, please don't shrink...

Feeling her body tingle slightly, Zelda felt herself drop about an inch. Her tunic and pants loosened a little, but remained tight enough to stay on her body.

Zelda ran her hands over her body. Her breasts had lost a little mass, as had her ass. Her face was slightly rounder, while her lengthy locks had retreated up her back a little.
At least it wasn't too much... She sighed in relief. Maybe a year at most! So I'm probably fifteen again...

"Hey, so..."
Zelda looked over at her partner, who had his back to her.
"Can I look now? Or..."

"Yes, you can!" Zelda said indignantly, crossing her arms. "Don't lift me again, okay?!"
Burlon nodded.
"Good. Now, lead on!"

They walked in silence until they reached the village. True to Burlon's word, the sign outside the village was blank, aside from a scuff of white paint. It was small as well, having only a few buildings arranged around a central stone.

Walking into the centre, Zelda...

15531221211113211213112321333222212212.content:
Deciding to stick close to Burlon in case something went wrong, such as an unexpected fainting, Zelda pushed her way through the crowd. Sporting him at the bar chatting to some woman, she made to move towards him, but was stopped when a hand tapped her on the shoulder.

"Oi, lass!"
Are they talking to me? Zelda thought. I guess it wouldn't hurt to find out...
Turning around, two empty glasses were shoved into her hands.
"Two of the same, lass!" A young guy, not much older than her, peered at her for a second. "And make it quick!"

He thinks I'm a waitress?! Zelda thought angrily. I should shove these glasses back at him, and tell him-
"Hey, waitress! I wanna talk to you!"
In the corner of her eye, Zelda spotted Burlon waving and calling her over.

Begrudgingly, Zelda headed towards him, two empty glasses clutched in her hands.
"What do you want?" Zelda asked roughly.
"Wow, service sure is rough around here!" Burlon chuckled before lowering his voice. "Listen, Lida. People think you work here, and that works in our favour. They'll ignore you, giving you ample opportunity to pick up information. So, play along. Refill some glasses. Deal with the drunks. You know, the typical kinda stuff".

Zelda shuffled nervously. She had been way out of her depth before this. Now, she couldn't even see the sun.
"I... I suppose I could do it..." She muttered. "But only if you promise you won't drink too much! Deal?"
Burlon grinned.
"Deal. Now, get me a top-up!"

Surprisingly, despite her royal upbringing, Zelda found her new temporary job relatively simple. She weaved her way through the crowd with ease, even while holding two full tankards. She even got into the mindset of a waitress, giggling at drunks telling her bad jokes and even trying her hand at flirting. However, after somebody tried to kiss her, she quickly stopped.

After refilling her another couple of tankards, Zelda found herself summoned by a still sober Burlon.
"So, I see you're fitting right in!" He said as Zelda made her way to the other side of the counter. "Hear anything interesting?"

"More worrying than interesting," Zelda said, pretending to wipe down some glasses. "Yiga have been spotted in the area".
"Those customed weirdos? Thought they disbanded. Another, please".
Refilling Burlon's glass, Zelda let out a sigh.

"What's wrong?" Burlon asked, a faint smile on his scarred face. "Job getting to you?"
"What? Yes, I guess so..."
Zelda trailed off. Her real worry was being recognized and subsequently kidnapped by the Yiga. Link had always scared off potential kidnappers. Burlon, while imposing, probably wouldn't have the same effect on them.

"Anyway, how much longer are we going to stay here?" Zelda asked. "I think that guy over there is waiting for me to leave or something..."
"Hmm... I suppose we could get a couple of rooms. You got any money?"
Zelda dug around in her pockets. Over the course of the night, she had made a decent amount in tips, so she could easily afford two rooms.

"Easy. Problem is, I think everybody assumes I work here now. Even the owner thinks so! How am I meant to get two rooms?"
Burlon tapped his chin in thought.
"Give me the money. I'll buy the rooms, tell which one is yours, and then you can sneak in at some point. Deal?"

Zelda nodded. She handed Burlon the rupees before moving away to deal with a couple more refills.
"Got them. Here's your key. Upper floor, first in the left. See you in the morning".
With a wink, Burlon disappeared upstairs.

After dealing with a few more empty drinks and telling a few more bad jokes, Zelda finally got a moment to herself. She headed towards the stairs...

Gods, that was horrible... She groaned internally. I wish I could move... I want to know how bad the damage is...

Rooting around in the drawer, Zelda found nothing to fit her older body. Letting out a sigh, she cast a look down at her discarded teenage clothing.

"Perhaps I should invest in some sort of stretchy material?" She wondered, reaching down to grab her tunic. "Once I get to Purah, I'll suggest it to her. But as for now..."

A knock at the door caused her to fall silent. She held her breath for a few seconds, silently willing whoever knocked it to move on.
Please, do not be Burlon... Anyone but him...

Hearing her new companions voice through the door, Zelda made a face. She couldn't really answer him, considering that her voice had matured along with her body. Although, she had explained to him that she had regressed from this age... Perhaps she could come up with another explanation about why she was suddenly this age again?

Before she could come up with some sort of explanation for him, the door flew open. Burlon stood in the doorway, a smile on his face.
"Morning, Lida!" He announced. "Time to wake up!"

Silence followed his announcement. He locked eyes with the nearly naked Zelda, which caused the silence to take on an uncomfortable air.

If it was any other situation, she would immediately call for guards and have him incarcerated for life. But if Burlon had to stare at her for a few seconds in order to determine her identity, then so be it.

"Well, colour me surprised, Lass!" Burlon finally said. "It is you! I'd know those eyes anywhere!"
Letting out a relieved breath, Zelda smiled.

Burlon shook his head.
"Nah, after you drink with someone, you tend to remember them. And you are most definitely the girl I shared drinks with! But, uh..."
He fell silent. It took Zelda a few seconds to work out why. She looked down, remembering that she was almost naked. She was tempted to yell at him, but stopped herself. He was her best chance of finding clothing...

Burlon shook his head.

I was afraid he'd say that, Zelda thought. "Well, can you get something?"
Burlon nodded. He disappeared, but quickly returned, clothes draped over his arms.
"Here, I... found these," he said, handing the clothes to Zelda, who was reluctant to accept them.

Where did he get these? She wondered, eyeing them suspiciously. Well, I suppose it doesn't matter. As long as they fit...

Downstairs, she saw Burlon talking to the bartender. He gave her a brief wave as she came down the stairs.
I wonder if it's still raining? She wondered. Surely it must have stopped during the night?

1553122121111321121311232133322221221222.content:
Zelda had only taken a few steps out into the torrent of rain, and that was all she needed to know her upcoming regression would be a bad one. Her old clothes had been somewhat waterproof and helped keep some of the water from her body.

These new ones, however, were not. Even with her ill-fitting cloak, they were almost instantly drenched. Her fringe, which was not covered by her hood, was quickly plastered to her face, forcing Zelda to lift her arms to swipe her hair from her vision, which caused the sleeves of her hood to fall back and caused her arms to become even more soaked.

Feeling a set of rough her gentle hands grip her shoulder and give her a light push, Zelda began to pick up her pace. Burlon's meaning was clear.
Don't stop. Just keep moving.

And keep moving she did. Picking her pace up to a near sprint, Zelda and Burlon raced out of the small village. Where possible, Zelda weaved under trees, which provided a brief respite from the torrential downpour, but she always had to leave to catch up to Burlon.

"Up ahead, Lida!"
Hearing Burlon's voice over the rain, Zelda risked a quick look up. Up ahead, the rain just stopped, giving way to sunshine and clear skies.
"Not much further now!" Burlon yelled as he fell in beside Zelda.

That would be great, but...
Zelda looked down at her tingling body. Thankfully, her regression wasn't a painful ordeal, otherwise she would've stopped back in the village. But even so, it was an uncomfortable feeling, having her bones shrink and losing mass.

In response, he received silence from the still thinking Zelda and a grunt of acknowledgment from Burlon, who still wore a look of annoyance from his encounter with the salesman. However, this didn't seem to bother the guard, who continued on despite the lack of answers.

"And where would you and you daughter be heading to on this fine day, sir?"
Finally forced to speak, Burlon let out a sigh.
"Heading to Hateno Village. Hoped to get a place to sleep here overnight. Maybe some extra supplies".

The guard nodded.
"Hateno Village, huh? That's a brave walk. But as for supplies and a bed, we've got both. General store isn't that big, but it'll have the essentials. As for a bed, we've got one of them new inns the Princess set up in every town".

Upon hearing her title, Zelda looked up slightly.
"The princess?" She asked curiously. "Have you met her? What's she like?"
The guard chuckled.
"Well, I haven't seen her... Had some dealings with that knight of hers, but that's about it. As for what I think of her... She's done a damn fine job, considering the state of Hyrule. But hey, that's adult talk. Not stuff I'm willing to discuss with a child. Now, you two run along. And stay out of trouble!"

And with that, the guard saluted them again before heading off to deal with another couple of travellers.
"Well, he's a cheery one," Burlon grumbled, looking towards the sun. "Come on. We'll get a room, you can get some rest and let that ankle heal, and I'll gather some information".

"And I suppose the best place to gather information is at the tavern with a couple of drinks?" Zelda joked, a slight smile appearing on her face.
"After the day I've had fighting off Yiga and annoying salesmen, I think I deserve a drink or two," Burlon replied.

Hobbling towards the inn, Burlon bought two rooms. After helping Zelda get to her room and get comfortable in bed, he disappeared back downstairs, presumably to start drinking.

I just hope he doesn't drink too much, Zelda thought as she relaxed in her bed. I need him somewhat sober if Yiga decide to attack us again...
After a few minutes had passed...

She cannot help but think about her current condition, her body forced to lay on her side due to the weight on her chest and her hips making her back hurt. Only by laying on her side gave her some relief. Still despite the need to rest and recover Zelda refuses to sleep. Even if she knows she needs to.

"I hope Burlon comes back soon. After that attack by the Yiga she cannot feel safe. "I am in a tavern. Burlon is below alongside possibly other tough thugs that would hate to have their drinking disturbed by an unruly bunch. Plus the guards as well. Though they seem a bit too....friendly. I will be fine. I can sleep peacefully here." Zelda shakes her head as she moves her body in a more comfortable position.

It takes several minutes before the princess can finally fall asleep with her wandering mind.

When she wakes up Zelda....

A rumble of thunder interrupts Burlon...

1553122121111321121311232133322221221222.content:
The next morning, Zelda woke with a cute yawn. After a quick stretch, she sat up in her bed and cast a groggy look around her room. She hadn't taken the time last night to have a look around, her main priority being getting into bed and letting her ankle heal naturally.

It was nothing special, however as Zelda stretched again, and her body began to wake up, she became aware that her body had changed again while she slept. Looking down, she began to let out a cheer, before stopping herself.

Her child-sized body had vanished, replaced by her fairly regular looking teenage body. As she threw her covers back, she realised that, while she was more or less back to her regular height, her magic was still interacting with the potion and had messed with various parts of her body.

Her adult-sized breasts had shrunk into nothingness, however it seemed their mass had travelled to her backside, hips and thighs, leaving Zelda with a very pear-shaped form.

Well, it's more normal looking that the curvy child I was yesterday, she thought, getting out of bed. Honestly, anything is better than that. The only problem now is clothes... Thank Hylia I decided to take my old ones off before heading to bed!

Spying a pack sitting on a chair in the corner, Zelda headed over to her. She made a face as she realised that her hips swayed in quite an erotic fashion in order for her to walk. As well as that, her round backside, which looked like a couple of globes, rippled and bounced with each step.

Opening the pack, she pulled out a long brown dress that hung down to her calves. Pulling it over her head, it did a good job of hiding her hefty lower body, but showed off her completely flat chest in exchange.

I'd rather my chest be shown off than my lower body, Zelda thought, pulling her boots onto her feet. Now, let's see if Burlon managed to find any information, or if he's slumped over the bar...

Heading to the door, Zelda pulled it open to reveal Burlon, who held his hand in a knocking manner.
"Burlon!" Zelda gasped, stumbling back.
"Morning, Lida," Burlon responded somewhat brightly. "I see you got the stuff I left for you. Hope it fits".

"Yeah, it does. Quite well in fact, thank you..." Zelda flashed him a gracious smile. "I don't suppose you found anything useful out?"
A look of darkness passed over Burlon's face.

"Yeah, I did. Although, you might not like it..."
1553122121111321121311232133322221221222.title: A new day, a new body and new news

Before Burlon can continue there is a loud banging by the door followed by the cracking of wood.

“Dyn’s arse they picked up my trail.”Burlon cruses as Zelda jumps from the noise.

“Burlon, did you get drunk and cause a commotion?” Zelda asks, a stink eye is sent toward the scarred man. Zelda curses her luck, one good thing happens then another complication happens. This never happened this often a hundred years ago or currently. Perhaps this is the result of Burlon or her being a wanted woman?

“No, I swear I just asked some questions. Honestly they have been chasing me all night Lida!” Burlon exclaims as one man, dressed in plain clothes rushes forward knife in hand. Burlon quickly grabs the man wrist and throws him into wal before delivering a quick kick to the face, knocking him out. Before Zelda could ask again she feels Burlon place her bag on her shoulder of her pear like body. “There’s no time to ask questions Lass. Get out of town or go to the guards I’ll meet you at one or the other!

“Wait Burl-“ Before Zelda knows it she is tossed out a window that Burlon somehow opened while she was distracted. Being on the second floor Zelda expected a hard landing but finds herself landing in a pile of hay.

Working her way out, Zelda spits out several pieces of hay while also being thankful of the stable being nearby. Getting a horse would be hard so the princess will still have to run to her destination. “When this is over I swear I will teach that man how to treat a lady, even link doesn’t treat me this roughly!”

Zelda then-

1553122121111321121311232133322221221222.content:
Pulling herself out of the hay, Zelda brushed some stray strands off her dress. Looking back up at the window, she heard a few grunts from Burlon before it was abruptly slammed shut.

"Please be safe, Burlon..." She said quietly before grabbing her bag. Rummaging around inside, she produced her cloak , which she quickly donned. Shouldering her pack, she headed off, keeping her head low.

I feel bad for leaving him behind, but it's probably best I not be there. It would be hard to fight while trying to keep me safe, Zelda thought as she wandered into the main square. Now, let's see.... Going to the guards would probably be best, as they could help Burlon fight. But there's the chance they might help the other people... And leaving town is out of the question. There's no telling what's waiting out there...

Looking around the square, Zelda tried to spot either a guard or a building that resembled a barracks. Strangely, she saw no guards, nor a barracks.
Odd, guards should be patrolling everywhere, she thought. And the barracks should be easy to spot... Something doesn't seem right about this place...

Despite her reservations, Zelda decided to continue searching. With her current body, she looked like she was Princess Zelda, minus her bust. If she ordered them, they would have to help her.

Leaving the square, Zelda headed down a side street. Compared to the main square, which had vendors opening their stalls for the day and the beginnings of shoppers, this street was near empty. However, down near the end of the street was a building with a large banner over the door.

The barracks! Zelda let out a sigh of relief. Finally... But why is it shoved down a side street, and not in the main square?
Pulling her hood tight around her head, Zelda knocked on the door. A few seconds passed before the door swung open, revealing...

"Oh....the princess!?" As the door opens a familiar guard appears, gleaming armor and three golden stripes. The cheery guard they met at the front gate! He bows as he gives the same old formality every person gives her.

"Thank Hylia it's a familiar face! Plus they know who I am despite....lacking a few things." Zelda thinks with relief, this guard, unlike the ones in Castle town, seems to do a good job. Instantly without worry, Zelda grabs the guard's armored hand."There is a brawl at the local inn! A man is being attacked by armed men! You need to help him!"

"Hold on Princess....what do you mean?" The guard's smile turns into a confused frown as Zelda explains, holding back several happenings such as her potion issue and her actually knowing Burlon and saying she sneaked in here with a couple guards, who were currently trying to help the man. She hurried here in order to get help. " I see....that explains it. Please princess, come into the barracks and take a seat. Forgive me, I need to see to your safety first before the man's."


Knowing the look on the striped guard's face, Zelda knows that she has no choice but to get inside and seated before they go help Burlon. The guard holds open the door and Zelda enters silently handing her pack to the man, noting that the barracks seem quite empty.

"Excuse me guardsmen but is it usually this quite?" Zelda slowly sits in a seat of wood noting that it seems to be quite comfortable with hardly any splinters. The guard makes a disarming smile once more.

"No but when they are taking out the threat to the princess and perhaps the princess herself....it can be quite empty here princess." Zelda is barely able to acknowledge the hate in the last princess before thick steel comes over her wrist. Her feet, barely meeting the floor feel like they are stuck.

"What's going on here?!" Zelda is able to get out before the guard stand before her as a thick shadow. She freezes as the armored man in front of her begins to talk.

"Did you know Zelda....before you came along we were poor and broken we had to fight everyday to get rid of numerous beast while you played around in your little castle and your little knight." Zelda notes the guard's distain with each syllable, noting that a strange tube had come out of the ground holding something familiar. The man's distain however suprises Zelda making her unable to think. “No one ever came to this remote place…. except for the Yiga. They helped us more than you ever did. Now pay for your crimes you witch!"

"Wai-" Is the only thing Zelda is able to get out before-
1553122121111321121311232133322221221222.title: The cheery guard from earlier...

choices: Zelda's body begins to change...

1553122121111321121311232133322221221222.content:
As the tube neared Zelda's mouth, which hung open slightly surprise, her mind began to work again. Her eyes darted around, trying to look for anybody other than the formerly cheery guard. Spotting nothing, they focused in on the tube in front of her.

Sadly, she decided to pay attention to it too late. It had been moving rather slowly and she thought she had the time to look around the room, maybe find someone or something to help her.

The tube rammed itself into her mouth, causing Zelda to choke and splutter as it continued moving, dropping only when it entered her throat. She continued to cough and gasp for breath for a few seconds, inciting a few deep chuckles from the guard.

"What's wrong?" He asked mockingly, leaning down so he was due level with Zelda. "Having trouble breathing?"
Unable to speak due to the tube stuffed down her throat, Zelda responded with a dark glare, which didn't faze the guard in the slightest.

"You know, I almost didn't believe the Yiga when they said you were heading for our little village," the guard said, straightening up. "They told me their rain barrier would be more than enough to stop you in your tracks. I don't want to speak bad of them, considering all they did for us, but having no Plan B was a bad move on their part. I don't know how you escaped that barrier, but you won't escape me!"

As the guard droned on and on, Zelda realised something.
He doesn't know how I escaped... So maybe he doesn't know about Burlon!
Had a tube not been rammed down her throat, she would've smiled.
It's a long shot, but maybe he'll bust in and save me before he decides to turn this tube on...

As she thought that, the guard decided to end his monologue.
"But I've spoken long enough. Let's see what this stuff does to you, your Highness!"
Powerless to do anything other than watch, Zelda did just that. She watched as he strode over to a lever on the floor, his armour clanking.

As he pulled it, the tube juddered slightly, causing Zelda to cough again. A familiar looking liquid flowed up the tube and into her mouth, falling directly into her stomach. It caused her to shift uncomfortably as she began to feel odd.

What's this stuff going to do to me?! She wondered desperately, looking towards the door. And where's Burlon?!

"HMPH, UMPH!" Zelda tries to yell back as she tastes the familiar liquid. It's that drink she had when met Burlon in castle town! "Is this man planning to get me drunk? Make me do something stupid? Well the joke might be on him."

Zelda managed to drink at least several large mugs full of this stuff back then so she should be able to at least resist it long enough in order for Burlon to reach her. Though her body was older then and perhaps more resistant to alcohol compared to her current body."All I can do is try at this point."

Several minutes pass as Zelda is forced to drink the alcohol, her mind still staying sharp despite the small amount of liquid making Zelda's stomach poke out a bit. Her body feels relaxed as her muscles become heavy and slow her struggling limbs ceasing. The guard is silent and the only sound is Zelda's gasps through her nose as she moves her tongue but even it too is starting to feel numb. Plus the sounds of activity outside but the pear shaped princess can't tell if it's due to the people going along with their daily activities or their hunt for Burlon. Still Zelda is able to stay conscious as her eyes remain sharp and her mind struggles to remain just as sharp.

"I gotta stay awake." Zelda thinks. "I gotta...enjoy more of this stuff. It's a gots a bad flavor but the aftertaste is-No wait what am I thinking?! I gotta stay awake till Burlon comes!"

" You finally noticed." Noting Zelda's wide eyes the guard chuckles darkly. "You see the Yiga gave me something extra bit of something to this stuff from Castle Town'...the more you drink the more addicted you become to whatever is being drink.' Or so they told me...I figured why not alcohol, you royals do like to be slothful after all."

"UMPG MMMMMM!" Zelda waves her head slowly back and forth and side to side in an effort to get rid of the pain. The tube makes the movement slightly painful but the alcohol has made her sense of pain a bit dull. The movement of her throat makes the alcohol squeeze out a bit faster and the princess needs to fight in order to not do so.

"Don't worry princess Zelda I will stay here the whole time....got to make sure you don't run out of your favorite drink now! Hehe that or pass out!" The guard chuckles at Zelda's fruitless struggles.

"At this rate I don't know what is worse...becoming drunk or...enjoying this drink...but it's so good...I need more! NO I DON"T!" Zelda begins to fight the growing desire to drink more and willingly suck down more from the tube. Her eyes become half-lidded as more pours itself into her stomach. Her belly edges out a bit more.

Just then...

1553122121111321121311232133322221221222.content:
Doing her best to keep her eyes open, Zelda glanced over at the guard. He leaned back in his chair, arms crossed over his chest. His eyes were firmly locked onto Zelda, an amused smile on his face.

Seeing that Zelda was watching him, he looked up slightly.
"So, did I get the right stuff?" He asked, grinning at her. Zelda nodded in response, before stopping herself.
No, don't answer... that... She thought slowly. I can't let him know that... it's working on me...

"That's good... I was worried that you might be fussy about your choice of drinks. We don't exactly have our choice of drinks out here in the middle of nowhere. Not like that glorious Castle Town of yours!"
The guard chuckled as he grabbed another chair, pulling it in front of him and sticking his feet up on it.

"I've heard tales of Castle Town," he continued. "The massive tavern, filled with prostitutes and drunk guards. I'm surprised they can still protect that town, considering the amount they drink. Then again, if they lose the town, they lose their alcohol!"

Well... He isn't... wrong... Zelda thought, her mind moving slower and slower. But... we still have... some decent people...
She thought of Burlon, who, despite his love of drinking, had turned out to be a good guy. He had helped her get this far, despite not even knowing her.

Casting a look at the door, Zelda's eyes fell shut for a few seconds. She felt her breathing begin to slow...
No... If Burlon can... fight... then so can I!
Forcing her eyes open, Zelda glared at the guard.

"Still fighting it, are we?" He tutted. "I should probably fix that..."
Letting out a sigh as he got to his feet, he wandered over to Zelda. As he drew level with her, he leaned down and pinched her belly.

"Looks like you're taking after your father!" He grinned. "If the history books tell the truth, then he was a hefty fellow! Then again, all you royals usually end up quite heavy!"

Disappearing from her view, Zelda heard a clunk from behind her. A second later, she felt more and more alcohol rush into her body, causing her blinks to last longer and longer.

"Nighty night, Princess!"
The guards voice echoed around her head as Zelda finally reached her limit. Her eyes shut, her breathing slowed and she drifted off to sleep...

Her sleep was relatively calm, aside from an odd sensation within her stomach. Zelda had no idea how long she had slept for, but as she was woken awake, she found herself staring into the face of...

1553122121111321121311232133322221221222.content:
The first thing Zelda feels upon awaking is a harsh headache, it almost felt like someone grabbed a Goron and ran it into her head. Her mouth as still wide open, save for the pipe that someone forgotten to remove. Her eyes are blurry but she can still hear. In the blur she can make out a face but not many other details.

"Lida hang on! Dyn's arse, I didn't think this place would be a Yiga den!" Zelda makes out Burlon's scarred features as she feels her throat loosen and her jaw numb as the tube is yanked out. Thankfully for the princess the alcohol in her system has numbed her senses. Her mind feels like a fog...she has no idea how long has she been out. "Honestly.....should....have had....more...no not right...i need... to escape..."

"Burlon is....that...you...?" Zelda manages to mumble out. She feels the metal bands holding her ankles and legs being ripped off. She tries to stand but finds her body to be unbalanced. Her stomach gives a protest when she tries again.

"Slow down...they put a lot of alcohol in your body. I'm surprised you are even waked up. " Burlon moves her, her stomach nearly letting her lunch loose as she is hauled off her seat. “Dang a whole barrel full…any other situation I would give a round of applause for you missy.”

“….I drink….that….much?” Zelda’s muddled mind thinks. Part of her can’t believe it, while another part is disappointed that was all she could drink.

"Is that.....guard still....here?" Zelda tries to look around but her neck refuses to move.

"There was someone else here? No one was here when I snuck in here." Burlon looks around moving softly as he gently puts Zelda over his shoulder being careful of her stomach. "I need to get us out of here....so be as quiet as possible Lida."

Zelda can only give a quiet groan in agreement as Burlon starts to move.
1553122121111321121311232133322221221222.title: Burlon the Hero Zelda did not think she needed!

1553122121111321121311232133322221221222.content:
As the pair slowly started to move, Zelda did her best to keep an eye out for the guard, who had seemingly disappeared into thin air. The only evidence that he had been here were the two chairs he had been resting on.

Nearing the door, Burlon was forced to stop as Zelda let out a worrying belch.
"You okay, lass?" He asked.
"Urgh... I feel... URRP..."

Another burp escaped her mouth. Burlon gently grabbed a seat, placing her down and crouching down in front of her.
"Look, I've been where you are," he said. "The best thing to do is rest. Considering where we are, however, that ain't the best thing right now. So the second best thing in my opinion? Get it out. Your body only has a finite amount of stuff to chuck out. Once it's out, it's out. So if you need to throw up, don't try and stop it".

Zelda looked up, a gracious smile on her face.
"G-great..." She said before leaning forward and vomiting. Burlon managed to leap back, avoiding the spray. Zelda continued to throw up for a few minutes, until her body felt empty.

"Well?" Burlon asked. "Feel better?"
Zelda nodded, wiping some vomit from the corner of her mouth.
"Good. Let me find something to clean you up, then we'll move out".
Burlon disappeared into a side room, leaving Zelda alone.

As she leaned back in her seat, she spied a barrel in the corner. She thought nothing of it, until something Burlon said echoed around her head.
A whole barrel full...

Zelda got to her feet. She stumbled over the barrel, collapsing against it for support.
I shouldn't... be doing this... She thought as her hands fiddled with the lid. I shouldn't be... doing this...

Flipping the lid open, Zelda stared down at the muddy red liquid that she hated to love. Leaning down, her blonde hair fell into the liquid as she took a long gulp from the barrel.

So... good... She thought as she drank deeply from the barrel. I want... more... No, I don't! Yes, I do...
As she drank, her mind, which had been slowly clearing, began to fog over once again. Her eyes drooped as her body relaxed...

"Hey, lass! Got something for you!"
Burlon wandered back into the room, a rag clutched in his hand. Seeing that the chair he had left Zelda in was empty, his hand went to his sword.
"Lida?" He called out.

A moan answered him. Following the source, he found Zelda with her head stuffed into a barrel.
"Lass!"
Grabbing her by the scruff of the neck, he yanked her out of the barrel. Peering in, he saw that she had managed to finish...
