1553122121111321121311232133322221221222.content:
Forcing her eyes shut, Zelda tried to think about anything other than her new craving for whatever that drink was. She focused on Burlon's heavy footsteps and the gentle swaying of her body as he slowly made his way forwards.

"Y... You too gwod to meh..." Zelda mumbled quietly.
"I'm just doing what is right, lass," Burlon grunted back. "No more talking. Get some sleep now. I'll try my best to keep you still".

Relaxing her body, Zelda refocused on trying to make herself fall asleep. She tried listening to the wind blowing through some nearby trees, causing their leaves to rustle. She tried to clear her mind, however thoughts of murky red liquid and the smug face of a guard kept appearing.

"Bur...on?" Zelda asked, cracking an eye open. "Canz you... hum?"
Burlon was silent for a moment, probably trying to decipher her meaning.
"Hum? Uh, I guess so... Do you want me to try?" He asked.
Zelda nodded her head slightly, causing Burlon to clear his throat.

"Okay... What am I humming?"
An eye still open, Zelda coughed as she cleared her own throat. Normally, she was an expert at humming, singing and playing this particular song, but considering her current state, she's probably be out of tune.

Nevertheless, she gave it her best shot, humming a quiet song that consisted of six notes. She hummed it twice before falling silent.
"Think I've got it. Now, just relax, lass..."

Burlon picked up where she left off. His deep voice sounded out of place, and made her lullaby sound off, but it did the trick. Zelda felt her mind clear and her eyes shut. Eventually, she fell into a peaceful sleep.

Zelda's eyes flickered open. For a moment, she lay still, trying to remember where she was and what had happened.
That's right... Burlon carried me out of those barracks after that guard forced me to drink that repulsive stuff... So where am I now?

Sitting up, Zelda looked around at her surroundings...

choices: The changes to her age and body.

Her stomach lets loose a large gurgle making Zelda lay back down on the bed!
1553122121111321121311232133322221221222.content:
Zelda blinks her eyes several times as they adjust from the haze from slumber. The sun seems to be not out as she stares at the wooden wall and smell the faint smell of animals in the area. The walls have some holes in them allowing fresh yet slightly chilly air and bright moonlight go through the walls. The rustic details and the fact it has a faint smell of animals makes the formerly sleeping princess realize where she is. "A...barn of some kind?"

Standing up, Zelda swayed dangerously. She grabbed the arms of the chair beneath her for support, but she refused to fall back into it, just in case she was trapped in it again.

Is he really just letting me go? Zelda thought, her arms shaking slightly. Considering all he did to me, I thought he would've tried a little harder to keep me captive. I suppose I shouldn't hang around, the guard probably won't leave me alone for too long...

Letting go of the chair, Zelda took a wobbly step forwards. She almost fell to her knees, but caught herself at the last moment.
This... might be harder than I initially thought, Zelda admitted, taking another shaky step. But I can do it! Then I'll find Burlon, we'll get to Hateno Village, Purah will fix me and then I'll have Link clean this place out!

Nodding at her plan, Zelda took another step. As she did, a familiar scent reached her nose. Without meaning to, her body rotated to the right, meaning she was now facing the wall of barrels the guard had drawn her attention to earlier.

He was joking, wasn't he? Zelda wondered nervously. Although, would it be so bad if he wasn't? All that delicious alcohol... No! I don't need it! Though I suppose taking a look wouldn't hurt...

As she reached the wall of barrels, Zelda tripped over her feet and fell up against a barrel, causing it to wobble and shake. Within it, she heard a faint sloshing, which piqued her interest.

Let's see here...
Flipping the lid open, Zelda eyes widened as she found herself looking down at a sea of murky red liquid.
Yes! Zelda thought, leaning down in preparation to drink. At the last second, however, her hands shot out, grabbing the rim of the barrel and halting her descent.

No! I drink from this, I'm probably going to end up addicted to this stuff for the rest of my life! It's hard enough rebuilding Hyrule without an addiction to feed!

Zelda glared at her reflection in the barrel, which seemed to invite her closer. Her arms began to shake as her resolve weakened. As her belly let out a gurgle, she finally gave in.

Plunging her head into the barrel, which sent some of the liquid flying out of the barrel, Zelda drunk deeply. She felt the liquid flow into her belly, where it sat heavily, causing her feeling of nausea to return. She ignored this, however, intent on drinking as much as she possibly could...

Beginning on her fourth drink, Zelda finishes it in record time.
"Well, well, sweetheart!" Burlon said, clapping slowly. "Looks like you're getting the hang of it now! Maybe someday you'll give even me a run for my rupees!"

Letting out a long burp, Zelda slams her tankard down. The bartender hurried over and quickly refilled it. Picking her refilled tankard back up, she raised it to her lips, intending to pour it down her throat as well...

She stopped, the tankard half way to her mouth. Raising a hand to her head, Zelda blinked a few times. Her head felt really light all of a sudden...
"Whoops!"
She cried out as she fell forwards, almost smacking her head on the counter.

"You all right there, sweetheart?" Burlon asked, a hint of concern in his voice.
Zelda responded with a bubbly giggle. Her head felt, like, really light and she felt... She didn't know.

"Maybe you drank too fast?" Burlon suggested, shuffling his stool closer to her. "You should probably take a break for a bit..."
Zelda snatched her tankard up. Locking eyes with Burlon, she took a small sip. She purposely allowed a small bit to escape her mouth, which gave her to excuse to seductively lick her lips.

"Or maybe..." Zelda purred, putting her tankard down. "I'm not drinking fast enough?"
Her eyes still locked with Burlon's, Zelda practically chucked her drink down her throat. Slamming her tankard down, Zelda licked her lips again.

"Wow, it's really warm in here, isn't it?" Zelda asked, getting to her feet. "Well, I know how to fix that!"
With one swift motion, she discarded her cloak, revealing her curvy body to the entire bar.

The entire room fell silent. Zelda could feel eyes glued to her round ass and her fertile hips. She could see Burlon and the bartender both staring at her bountiful busom.
"Whew! Much better!"

Sitting back down, the vast majority of the bar returned to normal. Zelda could still sense people staring at her ass, which hung over the edges of her stool slightly.
"So, Burlon... Fancy another one?"

Stricken speechless by the appearance of the well-endowed woman sitting in front of him, Burlon merely nodded. A tankard was set next to him, which he picked up and took a small sip from.
"Oh, you dribbled a bit!" Zelda noticed, spotting a small speck of liquid on his lips. "Let me get that for you..."

15531221212.content:
"Are you sure this will work, Purah?" Zelda asked worriedly.
"Of course, Princess!" Purah answered in her childish voice. "How often do things go wrong with me?"
Zelda didn't answer, but she could think of one occasion when things did go wrong. One hundred years ago, Purah was middle-aged. Now, she had the appearance of a six-year old. Not only that, but she had the mind of one too. Sure, she was still super smart, but she acted like a child sometimes.

"Okay!" Purah clapped her hands together, looking at Zelda. "Stand right there, and prepare yourself!"
Zelda moved to the spot Purah had marked out for her, standing completely still. She still felt uneasy about this, but both Impa and Purah had assured her that noting would happen to her. Two of the smartest people in Hyrule couldn't possibly be wrong, could they?

Purah fiddled with her homemade Sheikah Slate, humming to herself as her fingers danced across the screen. A blue light rain over Zelda, scanning her body. She shifted uncomfortably as a robotic voice began to speak.

"CURRENT SUBJECT: PRINCESS ZELDA. AGE OF SUBJECT: 17 YEARS OLD. ADDITIONAL NOTES: SUBJECT'S HEART RATE IS HIGHER THAN AVERAGE. CONCLUSION: SUBJECT IS CONCERNED".

"Oh, you'll be fine!" Purah said cheerfully. "Now, let's go!"
Hitting a button on her Slate, Zelda felt a blue light wash over her. She groaned with discomfort as she began to feel funny...
"Purah..?" She asked, not noticing how her voice sounded higher-pitched. "What's happening..."
Purah didn't answer. She seemed to be busy looking at something on her Slate.

Looking around, Zelda noticed that everything seemed to be getting bigger. Her clothes began to feel baggy as she shrunk. Her breasts slowly lost mass, as did her lower body. Her arms and legs grew smaller and smaller, her face becoming more and more childish-looking by the minute.

As Zelda looked around worriedly...

1553122122111.content:
"I must say, Mipha, Zora culture is much more diverse than I originally thought".
Princess Zelda and Lady Mipha were walking through the centre of Zora's Domain, Link trailing behind them. Wherever Zelda went, her chosen knight wouldn't be too far away.

"Forgive me if I offend, Princess, but Hylians have never really understood us," Mipha said in her quiet voice. "They believe us to be less evolved versions of the Rito, which may be true. However, the Zora are a proud race, with a history dating back to the Hero of Time himself. So, that theory, while it may convince some people, it isn't the truth".

"So, what is the truth then?" Zelda asked, curious. Like many people, she had believed that the Rito had evolved from the Zora when a massive flood had covered Hyrule. However, no evidence had ever proved if the Rito and Zora were connected in any way, and the two races never really spoke about it.

"The truth?" Mipha giggled. "My apologies, Princess. But even we don't know!"
"You don't?" Zelda asked, her heart dropping. She had been looking forward to hearing the truth.
"Unfortunately not. And neither do the Rito, so Revali won't be able to help you either. If it helps, early records state that we evolved from washed up fish that the Goddess Nayru took pity on. However, the reliability of our early records is... not so good. Another record from that time states that the Master Sword was wielded by a Zora".

"A Zora? Wielding the Master Sword? I don't mean to offend, but the Master Sword can only-"
"Be wielded by the Hylian who possesses the spirit of the Hero". Mipha smiled as she finished Zelda's explanation. "I know, Princess. Like I said, the reliability of early documents wasn't the best".

"If I may ask another question, Mipha..." Zelda asked, stopping to peer over a railing at some Zoras swimming down below. She smiled as a couple waved up at her.
"The Zoras eat fish, correct? Yet, as you just explained, Zora may or may not be descended from fish".

Mipha let out a quiet laugh.
"Yes, I did say that. The reason we eat fish dates back to the Era of the Hero of Time, when the Zora race still had its guardian deity," Mipha explained, joining Zelda at the railing.
"You mean Lord Jabu-Jabu?"

Nodding, Mipha continued.
"Yes. Lord Jabu-Jabu's favourite meal was actually fish, despite being a large one himself. After he disappeared from his lake, we grieved for his loss by eating a feast in his memory. That feast consisted mainly of fish, in remembrance of his favourite food".

"I see. And it is a tradition that continues to this day, I presume?" Zelda asked, her eye drawn to a glint of light reflecting off the Master Sword's blade. Both Mipha and Zelda watched as Link showed a group of young Zoras the Blade of Evil's Bane. Mipha smiled at the "Ooo's" and "Ahh's" Link received.

"It was always believed that the Zora Princess was the only one who could prepare a meal that he would enjoy," Mipha said after a moment of silence. "As the one who fed Lord Jabu-Jabu was Princess Ruto, the secret to his meals was passed down through Zora Royalty".

"So you could prepare something like it?" Zelda asked.
"I suppose I could. I've never really tried. After all, I was raised a Princess. Meals were mostly cooked for me, not by me".
Thinking, Zelda finally spoke up.
"Well then, let's try it!"
Mipha looked at her, confusion on her face. She had never seen Zelda this excited, especially these days.

"A-Are you sure? Like I said, I've never really cooked anything..." She trailed off.
"I'm sure that between the three of us, we can work something out!" Zelda said excitedly.
"Well, okay... I guess I could try. But first, we need to deliver that report to my father," Mipha reminded Zelda, who nodded.
"Of course. We should head there now".
As the pair headed off, Link didn't notice them, too busy being mobbed by children wanting to look at the Master Sword. It wasn't until Zelda came back and grabbed him by the arm that he escaped.

After delivering their report on the Divine Beast, Zelda, Mipha and Link headed up to the reservoir, where they had been camping.
"Right. Here's how it's going to go," Zelda said firmly, quickly taking charge. "Link, you can start on a fire. Mipha, you and I will look for fish".
Link nodded, pulling a bundle of wood out of his magic pouch. Zelda had asked on multiple occasions how he managed to fit extra clothes, spare weapons, food, materials and camping gear in there, but he could never give a proper answer.

"How about these ones?" Zelda asked, pointing to a group of blue fish.
"Armoured Carp... No, I think Hyrule Bass would do just fine. Unless you're planning on heading into battle?" Mipha asked, smiling.
"No, of course not!" Zelda replied, shaking her head. "Okay, so... Hyrule Bass look like this?"
She showed Mipha a picture of a green fish on her Sheikah Slate. She nodded.
"Pictures are all well and good, but nothing beats the real thing!"

Without breaking eye contact with Zelda, Mipha stabbed her spear into the water and pulled it out, a green fish skewered on the end. She smiled, plucking the wriggling fish off her spear and handing it to Zelda, who held it gingerly, a look of disgust on her face.

Mipha payed her no attention, instead focusing it on her technique. Her spear was a flash of silver, darting in and out of the water with exceptional speed. The fish held in Zelda's hand began to pile up, until she was groaning under the amount Mipha had just caught.

"I think that should do!" Mipha said, pleased with her catch. "Normally, they are much harder to catch!"
She turned to Zelda, who was struggling to hold them all.
"Oh, I'm so sorry! I caught too many, didn't I?" Mipha realised, grabbing some of the still wriggling ones and throwing them back into the reservoir.
"T-Thank you!" Zelda gasped, now holding a reasonable amount of fish. "Now, shall we return to camp?"

As they reached their camp, Zelda sighed. She had just seen Link...
"Oh, have you already eaten?" Mipha asked, disappointment in her voice. She had been looking forward to cooking for Link, one of the reasons she had agreed to in the first place.
Link shrugged, an apologetic look on his face.
"Argh!" Zelda stamped her foot angrily. "Mipha was all ready to prepare this nice meal, and you couldn't wait!"
Link looked away. He never really spoke, not unless you really prompted him.

"It's fine, Princess. I can cook for the two of us," Mipha said, laying a hand on Zelda's shoulder. She instantly perked up.
"Thank you, Mipha," she said, bowing her head in thanks. "I simply cannot wait!"

Zelda watched Mipha go through the steps of preparing their dinner. She looked on with interest as she took the bones out of the fish, before cutting it into pieces and sprinkling on a little salt.
"We give thanks to Lord Jabu-Jabu for this meal," she said quietly, before closing her eyes and concentrating.
"A silent prayer," she said to Zelda before handing her a silver plate, a number of pieces of fish piled high on it.

"I must say, that was delicious!"
Zelda leaned back against the rock she had chosen to act as a chair. Mipha sat opposite her, a pleased expression on her face.
"Thank you, Princess. It's kind of you to say," Mipha thanked her. Behind her, Link was practicing with the Master Sword, which drew both of their attentions.

"Do you think he's ready?" Mipha asked, hearing the blade cut through the air.
"Are any of us truly ready?" Zelda asked, worry in her voice.
"You needn't worry. With all of us working together, we'll do brilliant!" Mipha reassured her.

Nodding, Zelda fell silent. Everybody was ready... Everybody except her. She couldn't awaken her power, which was critical to the plan. Sure, Link was good with the Master Sword, but unless she could seal Ganon away, he would be battling for a very long time. And even he had his limits.

"I must return to the Domain," Mipha said, bringing Zelda out of her thoughts. "Remember that Lynel up there". She pointed towards the mountain behind them.
"Yes, of course. Be safe, Mipha".
As she watched Mipha go, Zelda placed her hands on her belly. She briefly thought that it felt somewhat softer, but dismissed the notion. She had just had a large dinner, after all.

"Don't stay up too late, please," she told Link, who nodded. He normally went to bed after her and woke before her. She used to believe that he never actually slept until she was woken during a storm, which Link had slept right through.
As she lay down on her sleeping bag, Zelda shifted. Her backside felt a little odd, as did her breasts...
"It's nothing," she said, drifting off to sleep.
1553122122111.title: The Fish of the Zora Princess

choices: Decide to try Link's cooking.
Stick with Mipha's cooking.
15531221221112.content:
As Zelda slept, Link was wide awake. Despite her earlier order, he was busy keeping watch. He had one eye trained on the sky, and the other on a nearby ramp. The Lynel that Mipha had warned them about lived up that ramp, and while it didn't normally come down the ramp, Link didn't want to be held responsible for Zelda's death.

Thunder rumbled above them, causing Link to sigh. While the approaching storm wouldn't bother him, it would definitely bother...
"What-What?!" Zelda yelped, instantly sitting upright and looking around.
"What's going on?! Are we being attacked?!"

Clapping eyes on Link, Zelda breathed out. He looked relaxed enough, so they weren't under attack. That was good.
"I swore I heard thunder... Or was it a dream?" Zelda wondered, looking around. Her surroundings were dark, their only source of light being the campfire from earlier.

Thunder rumbled again, causing Zelda to let out a yelp and pull her sleeping bag tightly around her. She looked at Link, who was busy looking at something in the distance.
Following his gaze, she saw rain clouds coming towards them, along with the occasional flash of lightning. She flinched as a bolt struck the ground.

"We can't stay here," she said, looking at Link, who nodded. "The Master Sword is made of metal, which will attract that lightning. We should head back to the Domain, and stay there for the night".
Link nodded again, getting to his feet and pulling his hood up. He ushered Zelda out of her sleeping bag before beginning to pack everything into his pouch.

After packing up their camp, Zelda pulled her own hood up. While Link wasn't looking, she adjusted her blue top, which felt quite tight around her breasts, and her pants, which also felt a little tighter.
"Ready to go?" She asked, looking at Link. He nodded and set off ahead of her.

A few steps down the path, the pair ran into a Lizalfos, making Zelda thankful that he had gone first. Occasionally, she would rush ahead of him, which irritated Link immensely, especially when she ran into an enemy and he'd have to cone rescue her.

Link drew the Master Sword, moon light reflecting off its blade. The Lizalfos slashed at Link with its own crude weapon. Link easily parried it and hit back with his own slash. Unable to dodge, the Lizalfos fell back before bursting into smoke.

"T-Thank you," she said to Link. Even since he had saved her from the Yiga Clan, he kept a very close eye on her at all times. Even when she needed to go to the bathroom, she could tell that he was near. Not looking at her or anything weird, but definitely near.

Link nodded. He gripped the Master Sword tighter when a roar echoed from the mountain next to them.
"The Lynel... We should hurry!" Zelda said worriedly. Link pointed down the path, where a couple of Zora were waiting. Zelda ran to them, Link following when he was sure that she had reached them.

Zelda ran into the centre of Zora's Domain, water dripping off her hood. They weren't able to outrun the storm, something Zelda had voiced her displeasure about.
"I hate the rain!" She complained, shaking her head and covering Link with water. He pulled his own hood down and hung it over a chair while Zelda looked around. They had ended up in the inn, which was more a coincidence than anything.

"I would like two beds please. One normal, and one water," Zelda asked the owner.
He bowed.
"Of course, your Highness. They are on the house, of course. Lady Mipha had a feeling that a storm might hit tonight, and reserved two beds. You will, however, have to pay extra for the water bed".

"Certainly!" She looked at Link expectantly. Link sighed and reached into his pouch, lifting two shining red rupees and handing them to the owner.
"Thank you," Zelda said to both the owner and Link. She jumped when lightning hit the ground outside.
"I hate lightning!"

The next morning, Zelda awoke to see Mipha standing at the foot of her bed. As she sat up, the bed sloshed underneath her.
"Lady Mipha. I wasn't expecting to see you so soon. I must thank you for reserving these beds for us," Zelda said, gesturing to her bed.

"Not an issue, Princess. I took the liberty of preparing breakfast for you. After last night, I find cooking... relaxing," Mipha said, pointing to a plate on the table behind her. One plate was empty, indicating that Link was up.
"Oh, thank you!" Zelda smiled at Mipha, before getting out of bed.

Zelda took a seat at the table. It wasn't the kind of breakfast she was used to, having been raised on eggs and meat, but she still devoured it.
"Ahhh... You really are an outstanding cook!" Zelda complimented, rubbing her belly.
Mipha blushed.

"You're too kind, Princess. Anyway, I hate to tell you this, but the storm caused a landslide on the path to the Domain. I'm afraid you'll be stuck here for a while," Mipha explained.

Zelda nodded.
"I'll need to inform Daruk. We were meant to inspect Vah Rudania later today," Zelda mused, tapping her chin. She didn't notice how it felt softer, her jawline less defined.

"I'll send a Zora up one of the waterfalls. They won't be able to head up to Goron City, but they should be able to get the message to a Goron".
Zelda nodded. She blushed when her stomach let out a quiet gurgle.

"Still hungry?" Mipha giggled.
"I-I... Guess so," Zelda stuttered, embarrassed by her stomach.
"There's still some food left up near the throne room. You're welcome to have it," Mipha offered. "Then again, I have heard that your knight is no slouch when it comes to cooking".

"Really?"
Zelda was surprised to hear that. She had no idea that Link could cook...
"Well, you'll be here for a while. Feel free to tour the city," Mipha said, leaving Zelda alone.

After adjusting her top, which had grown tighter around her bust, Zelda headed out into the Domain. She was still feeling hungry, and the news that Link was an accomplished chef had intrigued her. She always liked trying new things. Or, she could just stick with Mipha's cooking. She knew for a fact that it was good, but then again...
15531221221112.title: Travel Plans on hold

choices: An open door, with food behind it...
An odd shadow on the mountain...
155312212211121.content:
Zelda argued internally before finally, she decided upon trying Link's cooking. She travelled with him all the time, and while he wasn't the chattiest person to travel with, his presence around the campfire at night comforted her. If he could actually cook a proper meal, then she could add that to the list of things he was good at.

Leaving the inn, Zelda looked around for Link. Usually, he didn't go too far, but on this occasion, he was nowhere to be seen. It wasn't until she heard a number of cries from the courtyard did she find him.

"Oh, Link! There you are!" Zelda said, relief in her voice. He was surrounded by the same group of young Zoras from yesterday, all of which were asking him to show off the Master Sword again.

Hearing them all talk, Zelda pouted. Apparently, her voice had been drowned out by the mass of smaller Zora. Either that, or Link had ignored her. And if he had, then he was in HUGE trouble...

As she drew nearer to the mob, Link looked up and made eye contact with Zelda. For the first time, Zelda saw worry in his eyes. She gave him a reassuring smile before pointing at the Master Sword and miming a couple of swings. Link nodded, the worry in his eyes melting away. Swinging a sword about? He could definitely do that.

Unsheathing the blade, Link gestured for the group to step back before giving it a couple of practice swings. Even swinging it caused the Zora's to clap and chatter excitedly. He smiled before placing the blade on his shoulder. He closed his eyes, and let out a long breath.

Zelda watched him with interest. She had never seen him this focused before. She was used to him swinging it about, or cleaning the blade or whatever. Placing it on his shoulder and concentrating was something she had never seen him do.

As Link's eyes opened, he swung the sword horizontally. A bright beam of light shot out of the blade, startling the crowd of Zoras and causing Zelda to clap her hands together. The beam flew past them, colliding with a wall in a bright flash of light.

"He's never done that before!" She said, a hint of excitement in her voice. "Maybe the spirit is beginning to trust him?"
Smiling as he was mobbed again, Zelda left the group. She took a seat at a nearby bench, smiling at Link again when he looked at her with worry.

Eventually, the crowd dispersed to go swimming. A couple of them voiced their disappointment that Link couldn't join them, but made no protest when Zelda approached them.

"So, Link. A rather interesting rumour has reached my ears. It seems that you are an experienced chef?" Zelda asked, raising an eyebrow.
Link hesitated before nodding. He did have experience cooking, but it was his own unique style. It was meant to fill you up during a battle and, as such, was filled with all sorts of nutrients.
And as he was more active than anybody else in Hyrule, he could make it with any ingredients he wanted, including the juiciest, most fattening stuff he could get his hands on.

"I would like you to prepare a meal for me," Zelda said to him. He considered denying her request, but stopped himself. The last time he had stopped Zelda from doing something, she had almost gotten him arrested. Man, he hated Gerudo Town.

Following Link to a cooking pot just inside the entrance to the inn, Zelda sat next to the fire and warmed her hands. She watched as Link pulled out a juicy slab of meat from his pouch, her mouth almost watering...

She caught herself, just in time to see Link produced a green herb and some sort of radish. Before he threw them into the pot, she stopped him, producing the Sheikah Slate.
"Just in case you need to find more," She told him, taking a picture of each ingredient. "A Hyrule Herb... and a Hearty Radish! Thank you!"
After Zelda had holstered the Slate, he threw them into the pot and sat back, watching the ingredients simmer and bounce in the pot.

Sniffing, Zelda was amazed at how good it smelt. It was the perfect blend of smells, all combining together to create a beautiful aroma that made her stomach rumble. She leaned in, taking a large sniff.

However, she quickly jumped back as the ingredients disappeared in a cloud of smoke.
"You burnt it!" She complained, looking at Link, who ignored her. He plunged his hands into the smoke and pulled out something that caused Zelda's eyes to widen.

The Gourmet Meat smelt divine. The Herb had been sprinkled atop it, while the Radish had been cut apart and lay around the meat.
"How did you do that?" She asked, amazed at the presentation. She hadn't even seen him cut it...

Link shrugged. He just kind of threw ingredients into a pot, gave it a few seconds and a meal came out. He had never really thought about how it worked, and probably never would.

Handing a plate to Zelda, he quickly left the Inn. He didn't really want to be around when she found out why he had never cooked for her before.
It was likely that Zelda would slice him apart with his own sword if she found out.

Zelda didn't know where he was going, nor did she particularly care after she took a bite of the meat. She moaned as it practically fell apart in her mouth.
"So good... Mipha wasn't lying!"

Zelda dug into her meal with gusto, not noticing her body slowly growing. Her soft belly bulged outwards, pushing against her blue tunic. Her breasts, reasonably sized for her age, grew tighter within her bra. Her backside, which had been commented on by people thinking she wasn't listening when she actually was, became thicker, causing her pants to tighten.

"Ahhh... Delicious!"
Zelda leaned back and let out a quiet burp. She rubbed her belly, not noticing how soft it was now. Standing up, she wobbled slightly.
"Hmmm... Odd. Must just be light-headed".
As she headed outside, she didn't notice her thighs brushing against each other, nor her jiggling backside. Spying Link looking over a railing, she headed up to him.

"That was an excellent meal, Link. Thank you very much!" She said, bowing her head to convey her thanks. Link merely nodded. He had noticed Zelda's thicker body, her bigger breasts, her wider hips...
"Is something the matter?"
He stopped staring at her and shook his head.

"Very well then. Seeing as we are stuck here until that landslide is cleared, I suppose I could have a look around. After all, we don't stay in these places for very long. I would like you to remain here. No harm should come to me in a major city!" Zelda said, walking off.

After exploring most of the Domain, Zelda took a seat outside the Throne Room. She was breathing heavily, for reasons she couldn't understand.
"Must be... something in the air," she said, taking a deep breath. Relaxing on her bench, Zelda looked around. Down in the centre of the city, she saw Mipha and Link talking, much to her annoyance. Off to the right, she saw an elderly Zora teaching a bunch of younger ones. And off to the left, she saw...
155312212211121.title: The Hero's Cooking

choices: Zelda starts on Link's tray.
Link and Mipha stumble through the door...
1553122122111212.content:
Looking to her left, Zelda saw Ploymus Mountain towering in the distance. She had heard tales of a Lynel, a creature with the body of a horse, the torso of a human and the head of a lion, that lived there. They were ferocious creatures, the only ones in Hyrule that Link wouldn't willingly fight.

She remembered the time Link and her had encountered one when they had gotten lost in the Hebra Mountains. Link had drawn the Master Sword, determined to defend her at any cost. However, one shock arrow had caused him to drop it, prompting Zelda to order a retreat. They had only taken a couple of steps before the Lynel had charged them, knocking Zelda down a hill. Link had tried to follow her, but the Lynel stopped him.

After her fall, a couple of travellers had found her and took her to a nearby stable, but as for Link, he didn't return for a number of days. She remembered her grief at his loss, and her relief when he had staggered over a hill, sunlight reflecting off the blade of the Master Sword.

"Princess, look out!"
A shout from a Zora Guard drew her back to reality. She looked around, seeing the guard that had shouted at her pointing to the sky above her. She followed his finger. Initially, she saw nothing. Then she heard a crackling noise, the same made by shock arrows...

She was pushed from the bench, landing heavily on the ground and causing her to let out a yelp. Her breasts bounced, and her new belly jiggled. She looked up at the guard that had pushed her to the ground. She opened her mouth to warn him about the approaching arrow...

She wasn't fast enough. The arrow embedded itself in the guards back, causing him to yell with pain and collapse next to her. She scrambled to her knees and tried to pull the arrow out, remembering that the Zoras really didn't like electricity of any sort. She let out her own yell as the arrow shocked her.

Feeling a hand grab her shoulder and guide her away from the guard, Zelda struggled against the grip. She only stopped when she was spun around, revealing Link with a serious expression on his face.
"Link!" She gasped. "What's happening?!"
"Princess, we must get you out of here," a quiet voice answered from behind Link.

Mipha walked out of what looked like an armoury, a silver spear in her hands. "The Lynel that lives on Ploymus Mountain is attacking the Domain".
"But why?" Zelda asked. She had done a little research into Lynels, and knew that they normally kept their distance from populated areas.
"He knows he has an advantage over us with his shock arrows. Even touching one would render a Zora unable to attack," Mipha explained. "Link, take her to my room. Then meet me by the eastern gate".

Link nodded, grabbing Zelda's hand. She yanked it free from his grasp.
"I can find my own way there, thank you very much!" She said, irritated. She calmed herself before continuing. "You deal with the Lynel".
Link nodded again. He looked at Mipha before the pair ran off, leaving Zelda alone.

She briefly considered running after them, but reconsidered. She had no weapons, nor any training with weapons. Sure, she had the Sheikah Slate with bombs and stasis, but Link had scolded her when she had tried to help him with bombs. Thankfully, his burn wasn't too severe and healed quickly.

Deciding to do what Link and Mipha had told her, she ran towards the throne room. She stopped halfway up a set of stairs when she heard a roar in the distance. Looking to the east, she let out a gasp.

She saw the Lynel swing his massive sword. A blue figure backflipped away before jumping forward and bringing its sword down hard, causing the Lynel to stagger backwards. A red figure then jumped over him, stabbing with their spear and forcing the Lynel backwards even further.

"Princess Zelda!"
Looking around Zelda saw the elderly Zora that was teaching earlier staring at her.
"Princess, it is much too dangerous out here for you!" He told her urgently. A shock arrow hit the ground behind her, causing them both to jump.
"I realise that, but..."
Zelda trailed off. She wanted to help, but had no means to do so.
"Very well. Mipha has allowed me to remain in her room. Where about is it?"
"Follow me," the Zora said, walking off.

Sitting on Mipha's bed, which sloshed and rippled beneath her, Zelda looked around. Mipha had a nice room, with a view over the Domain. On her dresser sat a tattered blue cloth, similar to the one she had made for Mipha and the rest of the Champions.

Beside it was a picture of Mipha and Link when they were younger. Link wore a goofy grin on his face, and had a large cut down his arm. Mipha, on the other hand, had a subdued smile and worry in her eyes. She hated when Link hurt himself, but was always happy to heal any injuries he had.

Zelda sighed. Every so often, she heard a distant roar, indicating that Link and Mipha were still battling the Lynel. She felt so useless, just sitting here and doing nothing.
"Princess?"
A knock at the door, followed by some voices, caused her to jump to her feet.
"Yes? Who is it?" She asked, opening the door.

A couple of small Zoras carrying trays looked at her.
"We thought you might get hungry, so we brought you some food!" One of them said brightly, handing Zelda a tray.
"This one's for Link, for helping Princess Mipha fight the scary Lynel," A second one said, handing a second tray to her.
"Thank you. I'll make sure he gets it," Zelda said, bowing to show her thanks. She took the trays and set them on the bed, sitting next to them.

As she sat, her stomach let out a grumble.
"Well, I guess it is about lunchtime," Zelda said, taking the lid off her assigned tray, revealing a pile of Roasted Bass. She gently poked one, smiling as she felt how hot they were.
"Freshly cooked Bass... I must say, the Zora style of cooking is rather nice, if simple".

Picking one up, Zelda dug in, quickly devouring it. She smiled again, licking her lips. Zelda then worked her way through the rest of her meal, eating the next fish faster than the last, until she stuffed the last one in her mouth, chewing madly.

"URRP... Oh, excuse me!" Zelda said, embarrassed. She lay back on the bed, listening to the water slosh beneath her. Putting her hands on her belly, Zelda still didn't notice that it was much softer, her tunic tight around it. It formed a noticeable bump against it. Her bra was just as tight, her breast flesh starting to overflow the cups. Her pants were tight as well, the fabric slipping in between Zelda's much rounder ass cheeks. Her face was softer, a second chin starting to form.

Raising a chubby arm to her face, she brushed a strand of hair out of her vision. Her fingers were plumper, her hands no longer dainty. Her thighs rubbed against each other as she sat up, her belly splitting into two small rolls.

"I haven't heard anything in awhile... Is it over?" Zelda wondered. The silence in the room was broken by another rumble from her stomach, which caused her to sigh.
"I just ate!" She said to herself. "I can't seriously be hungry again!"

15531221222112.content:
"Link, behind you!"
Zelda pointed at a small red creature trying to sneak up on Link. Hearing her warning, Link hit the Bokoblin in front of him with his shield and spun around, slashing the sneaking one with the Master Sword. It crumpled into a heap, disappearing in a puff of purple smoke.

When he turned back around, he was met with a lot more than the single Bokoblin he had smacked with his shield. Even Zelda was surprised, and disappointed in herself. She was supposed to be keeping an eye out, and she had missed this small horde of enemies.

"Sorry, Link!" She called out.
Link didn't answer, instead extending his sword out behind him. It glowed twice before he spun it in a circle. Lightning crashed around him, striking the army of Bokoblins and causing them all to fall to the ground, stunned. He slowly walked through the broken army, slashing at the various fallen enemies.

From a distance, Zelda relaxed. She dusted off her blue tunic and fixed her golden hair, even though she had been involved in the fighting.
Her job, for the moment anyway, was done. After the fall of Calamity Ganon, most monsters had retreated from the world, hunted by the few Guardians that the Sheikah had managed to repair and also by Link and herself. While she wasn't a fighter, she was very good at-

She didn't get to finish her thoughts. Another small horde appeared from behind a hill, rushing towards Link. Before she could call out to him, she felt something hard collide with the back of her head. She fell forwards onto her hands and knees, before collapsing into darkness.

"W-Where..."
Zelda let put a groan as she looked around her room. It was dimly lit, and completely empty, except for her and the chair she was sitting on. She was tied down, and no matter how much she struggled, her bonds wouldn't break.
"Come... On!" She grunted, trying to wiggle her arms out of her restraints.

She quickly stopped when the metal door on front of her opened, revealing a golden Bokoblin. It grinned at her, revealing its dirty, misshapen teeth. She looked away in disgust, which irritated the creature. It chartered angrily, banging its wooden club on the floor until Zelda glared at it.

"Stop that!" She ordered. "And let me go!"
The Bokoblin cocked its head. It clearly didn't understand her, and she definitely didn't understand it.
Before she could continue, the Bokoblin wandered towards her. What she hadn't seen in its other hand was a cracked bottle full of a dirty looking liquid. As the golden creature unstoppered the bottle, she quickly caught onto its intentions.

"N-No!" She protested, turning her head. "You keep that stuff away from me!"
The Bokoblin ignored her protests, grabbing her head roughly and forcing her mouth open. It poured the liquid into her mouth. Zelda gagged as she was forced to swallow the disgusting drink, almost throwing up.

Unknown to her, the drink was beginning to change her...

155312212221122.content:
While she continued to spit furiously in disgust, trying to get rid of the taste that was still lingering inside her mouth; the Bokoblin watched silently with anticipation knowing what was going to happen to her next.

First Zelda’s body slowly started to shrink, losing about a foot in height of what she originally was. Her slim belly pushed outwards, pushing her tunic up.

“Uggh! Absolutely revolting!” Zelda groaned out loud, unaware what was happening to her.

Soon followed were her breasts, filling out to a bigger bust size on her smaller body, tightening the top half of her top. And then lastly her ass and hips filled out, tightening her trousers and causing small ripped holes to appear. Her once elegant body had become monstrous and she was also beginning to develop the same stench that came from the very same Bokoblin that was with her.

But her changes weren’t done just yet, her pale skin began to darken. Quickly becoming a deep rough red colour.

“When Link finds me -SNORT- you’ll be sorry-!” she snapped back angrily until she noticed by the unexpected grunt from that statement. “W-Where did that come from?”

The Bokoblin laughed at the princess’ actions, as the creature was very pleased to see what had happened to her. The drink had transformed the princess of Hyrule into a female Bokoblin. The only few remainders of Zelda’s previous appearance were her ruined clothes, long blonde hair, and blue eyes.

Staring at the reflective water (most likely the only clean substance around here), she watched with a mix of shock and intrigue. What stared back at her was almost making her tremble.

The princess’ heart rate grew faster and faster, trying her best not to panic. She then tried to distract herself by thinking some positive outlooks from this. What was used to change into this? Would she able to understand Bokoblin culture and behavior?

But as she was thinking all of these things, another unexpecting thing happened…

“Soon, you be queen of Bokoblins!” grunted her kidnapper.

1553122122221121.content:
"Not to worry! My knight will be more than able to take care of your Chu problem!"

choices: With her new motherly mindset, Zelda wants to protect the rest of the Chu's...
With her new body, Zelda looks for a way out of the cave...
Zelda hears somebody calling her name...
155312212222112111212121212.content:
A peaceful smile slowly spread across Zelda's face as the last drip of the Chu slid into her mouth. With one final swallow, her bulging cheeks deflated and the Chu vanished down her throat, where it was promptly absorbed by her own gelatinous body.

Even as her body gurgled and began to change again, Zelda continued to smile. One of her hands slowly moved to her stomach, where she began to gently caress her slim stomach.

The last remnants of her pale Hylian skin began to fade away, consumed by her gelatinous skin. It began to spread to her hair, which began to meld together until a blob of yellow hair with drooping tendrils of jelly sat atop her head. Her green eyes took on a blue hue, while her pink lips also turned blue.

Her clothing, which had remained untouched by all her changes, began to melt into her body. Her tunic vanished into her torso, where it quickly began to dissolve. As soon as the last thread had dissolved, her breasts swelled slightly. The same happened to her pants and boots, their mass adding to that of her ass and thighs.

Now completely naked, Zelda giggled as she felt her slim belly begin to push outwards.
"That feels... Oh, Hylia..."
Her giggles quickly turned to moans as her belly continued to fill with the absorbed Chu.

Reaching a hand that dripped with jelly down past her belly, Zelda groped around for her vagina. After a few seconds, she stopped when it became clear that her new body didn't actually have one.

"My... Oh, no! How am I meant to... Oh, please..."
Another moan escaped her lips as her belly finished growing, making her appear in the latter stages of pregnancy. Placing a hand on it, a peaceful smile returned to Zelda's face as she felt something within her belly quiver at her touch.

"Calm down, little one..." Zelda whispered soothingly. "Your Princess is here for you..."
Looking around the cave, Zelda got to her feet, a hand still glued to her belly. Jelly ran down her legs and arms, dripped from her hair.

"Your Princess is here for all of you!"
155312212222112111212121212.title: Princess of the Chu's

choices: Zelda looks for a way out of the cave...
Zelda hears somebody calling her name...
1553122122221121112121212121.content:
With a hand still rubbing her gravid belly, Zelda inspected her new subjects, a pleased smile on her face.
"Oh, my new children..." She cooed, kneeling down and gesturing for the Chus to come closer. "Please, allow me to see you..."

It took a few moments, but the squad of Chus eventually made their way towards Zelda. They sat around in her in a circle, awaiting orders from their new Princess.

"So beautiful..." Zelda murmured dreamily, inspecting each member of her new family. "All of you are so, so beautiful... It would break my heart of anything happened to any of you..."

A small blue tear ran down her gelatinous face as thoughts of her precious family getting crushed beneath boots and slashed with rusty blades flashed through her head. Wiping it away, Zelda forced a smile to her face.

"But I have a plan!" She announced grandly. "The duty of a princess is to protect her citizens. And I plan to do that in the best way I know how!"
Rubbing her belly, Zelda hummed happily as she gestured for the Chus to come even closer.

Again, it took them a moment, but they drew closer and closer to Zelda. As they came within arms reach, she began to scoop them up and lift them to her open mouth. She groaned and moaned as she accepted more Chus into her body, which began to gurgle and swell with more jelly.

Lifting the last Chu in her hands, Zelda gave it a gentle kiss before opening her mouth and allowing the Chu to slither in. Her cheeks bulged for a few seconds, before the Chu began to slide down her throat and added its mass to her.

Letting out a polite burp, Zelda giggled and rubbed her belly, which had grown considerably. It had almost tripled in size, and was wobbling constantly. Above it sat two heavy orbs of dripping jelly that acted as breasts. Her hips had widened considerably to accommodate her much rounder ass.

And yet, Zelda didn't care. She only cared about how her new family was now completely safe within her...
1553122122221121112121212121.title: Mother of the Chu's

choices: Zelda finds herself in an underground cavern, filled with various monsters...
Zelda finds herself in a rocky canyon, the sky above her...
15531221222211211121212121211.content:
"Now that my new family is safe within me, I should really think about getting out of this hole..." Zelda said, a hand gently caressing her belly. "I can hardly start my new kingdom from within here..."

Looking at the sky above her, which had faint streaks of pink running through it, she let out a disappointed sigh.
I highly doubt my new body would allow me to climb this wall, she thought, waddling towards the rocky wall. But let's see anyway, shall we?

Removing her hand from her belly, Zelda planted it on the wall. The handhold she had tried to grab simply dug into her body, affirming her theory. As she pulled her hand away, the rock came with her. It floated within her hand, before slowly melting away.

"I don't recall Chu Jelly being corrosive..." Zelda murmured, watching the now pebble dissolve. "Perhaps it has something to do with my own power... Well, I suppose it doesn't matter much. If climbing is out, then I suppose the only other solution would be that crevice..."

Moving away from the wall, she made her way towards the crack in the wall. She was doubtful that she would be able to fit with her family-filled body, but it was her only hope. If she didn't fit, then both her and her family would be confined to this pit until Ganon wiped out Hyrule.

"Let's see here..."
Pushing her hand into the gap, Zelda let out a gasp of surprise as she saw her arm flatten to fit.
"I see... Well, I suppose having a body made of jelly would allow you to do that. I just hope that it'll work with the rest of me!"

Taking a deep breath, Zelda slowly edged her body into the gap. She let out a groan of discomfort as she felt her body compress and flatten. It felt incredibly weird, but at the same time, felt somewhat natural. She pushed her body through the gap, looking for a way out.

What if this ends in a dead end? She realised. What if I can't get back out?!
Thankfully, her worry was short-lived as the gap began to widen. Zelda felt her body began to widen out again, little by little. She felt a breeze race over her body, causing her eyes to brighten.

Fresh air! I'm almost out!
Pushing a little further, Zelda felt her body return to its original dimensions with a loud squelch. Brushing some dust from the crevice into her body, she looked around at her new surroundings...
15531221222211211121212121211.title: Zelda looks for a way out of the cave...

choices: Zelda tries to find lodging in the tavern...
Zelda has a look down the market street...
Zelda decides to inspect the Castle...
155312212222112111212121212111.content:
Looking around at her new surroundings, Zelda was initially disappointed.
Another cave? She thought. I was hoping to see the sky again... Aw, well. At least it's more spacious than the last cave! Let's see what we have...

Heading deeper into the cave, Zelda became aware of a faint noise. It was familiar, almost nostalgic.
Sounds like Castle Town, she thought, her hand resting atop her gooey belly. But that can't be right, I'm deep underground...

Pushing onwards toward the noise, Zelda found herself faced with a rather large hill of dirt. Taking a few steps up it, her gelatinous feet quickly lost grip on the dirt, causing both her and a rather large pile of dirt to go sliding back down.

Hmm... This problem with my grip is getting quite bad. I can't climb walls, and now I can't even walk up slight hills?
Looking up the hill, Zelda decided to try something unorthodox. Getting down on her hands and knees, she slowly began to crawl up the dirt hill.

Even though her method was weird, it worked. She slowly moved her gooey bulk up the hill, her belly rubbing against the ground. Occasionally, her grip would fail her and she would slip down the hill, but she always recovered.

Reaching the top of the hill, Zelda pushed the loose dirt on her palms into her body, where it quickly dissolved.
"That really is quite useful!" She said, looking at her hands with interest. "Now, let's see what that... noise... is..."
She slowly trailed off as she got a good look at the source of the bustle.

The cavern opened up massively, revealing a city similar in size to Castle Town. Much like the Hylian capital, a large castle overlooked the town. From her vantage point, she could make out what looked like a number of fields, a central plaza with a fountain and an area that she assumed was mainly residential.

"I didn't even know this town existed!" Zelda said, her voice filled with awe. "The Slate didn't tell me, and I know that the Castle's Library never mentioned it! I wonder what I can find down here..."

After making her way down the hill and across a rocky plain, Zelda found herself standing at the gates. As she prepared to make her way in...
"Stop!"
Heading a gruff voice, Zelda paused. A second later, she heard footsteps approaching her.

"Well, well... It's not often we get a Chu who's taken on a human form. In fact, I think you're the first!"
Zelda's eyes widened as she saw a Moblin approach her, a wooden spear clutched in its red hand.

A monster that I can talk?! What's going on here?! Is my family in danger?!
Covering her belly with protective hands, Zelda eyed the monster suspiciously.
"Where am I?" She asked.

"You don't know?" The Moblin scratched its snout. "This is the only safe haven for us monsters. We... don't really have a name for the town yet. But, it's populated by monsters, and only monsters. Hylians are... unwelcome here".

Slowly removing her hands, Zelda peered through the gates.
"Monsters, huh..."
The Moblin nodded.
"Uh-huh. You're welcome to go in. Just don't cause any trouble, and we'll get on fine!"

The Moblin smiled at her. At least, Zelda assumed it was a smile. It was more of a threatening leer, but she decided to just ignore that and enter the town.
A town populated by nothing but monsters? Zelda thought. Father would love nothing more than to burn this place and massacre the inhabitants... I, however, will not do that. At this point, I'm more monster than Hylian. Not to mention my family...

Walking into the central plaza, Zelda took a proper look around. It was almost a carbon copy of Castle Town, aside from the missing Triforce symbols. A large tavern filled with rowdy Moblins and Bokoblins sat to her left, while a street filled with what looked like Poe's manning market stalls was on her right. And directly in front of her was the unnamed castle.

So much to look at! Zelda thought, looking around. Where do I even start?!
155312212222112111212121212111.title: Underground Castle Town

choices: Information. Zelda checks out the library.
Food. Zelda attempts to secure a meal for her and her family.
Money. Zelda searches for some rupees.
1553122122221121112121212121112.content:
I should familiarise myself with the town, Zelda thought, looking around. Something tells me I'm going to be here for a long time...

While her surroundings looked familiar, she could make out a number of differences. The tavern was where the armoury would be in Castle Town, and Market Street seemed to have a lot more side alleys than Castle Town.

Heading towards Market Street, Zelda noted that the vast majority of other monsters seemed to avoid her. A few bokoblins backed away when she approached, and a lizalfos hissed at her when she drew near.

Maybe they know who I truly am? Zelda wondered as she turned into Market Street. Hopefully not... I just got here. I really don't want to be run out of town just yet...

Thankfully, as she joined the bustling crowd, monsters began to ignore her. Occasionally, a monster would shoot her dirty looks as she passed by, but nobody confronted her.

Let's see... What do monsters eat?
Stopping at a stall manned by a Blizzrobe, Zelda inspected his goods. He seemed to be selling meat, however she couldn't be sure if it was animal, monster or human.

"Excuse me, uh... sir?" Zelda said. "What kind of meat is this?"
The Blizzrobe eyed her with distrust.
"Cow. Any other questions, Chu?" He asked roughly.
Surprised and slightly frightened at the Blizzrobes tone, Zelda shook her head and hurried off.

Nobody seems to trust me very much... She thought as she made her way through the crowd. Thankfully, she didn't have to push her way through as people still avoided her, giving her a small area around her in which she could move freely.

"I wouldn't take it personally. They just aren't used to your kind around here. You're a very rare breed, you know? And a Broodmother at that? You're probably rarer than some of those golden monsters!"
Zelda let out a yelp as something tapped her on the shoulder. Spinning around, she found a Blazerobe staring at her.

"I-I'm sorry... What did you say?"
The Blazerobe chuckled.
"Monsters tend to distrust that which they are not familiar with. To my knowledge, you are the first ever Chu to ever achieve both sentience and a human form. Plus, you're a Broodmother! Combine all those, and that makes you incredibly dangerous".

"Dangerous? How? And why aren't you afraid of me?"
The Blazerobe chuckled again.
"I don't fear you because I've spent time among much more dangerous beasts. Hylians are a vicious sort. And as for how dangerous you are, you are a Chu. You absorb fire. You absorb ice. And you absorb electricity. You are highly resistant to weapons. You have corrosive insides. You can take other Chu's into your body and add their power to yours. And you have intelligence. That is the most dangerous part of you".

"You seem to know an awful lot about me. Is there a library in town?" Zelda asked.
"Only the Castle library. Lucky for you, the Castle is always open. We've got no ruler, so it's mainly for show. I doubt anybody down here could band all of the different races together. Anyway, it's been nice, but I gotta run. Things to buy, monsters to see!"

The Blazerobe hustled off, leaving Zelda alone.
I'm a dangerous sort? She repeated in her head. Well, I'm not but... It doesn't matter. I could check out the library, try to find out a little more about this place. On the other hand, I haven't eaten since before I fell in that hole. Wait... Do I still even need to eat? And even if I do, I probably need money. Do they use rupees down here? I'll assume so, seeing as monsters constantly drop them. Where would I even get rupees down here? Urgh, so many questions...

Shaking her head, Zelda decided to take it one question at a time, starting with...
1553122122221121112121212121112.title: Inspecting the Market

15531221222211211121212121211122.content:
As much as Zelda, who still had her inquisitive mindset, would love to gather information on herself and this mysterious town, her brood had other plans. Her gelatinous belly visibly churned, some jelly dripping onto the ground beneath her.

Alright then... Zelda thought, caressing her belly until it was still. I suppose we should find something to eat. Although, that comes with its own set of questions... What does a Chu Broodmother even eat? And how do I pay for whatever it is?

Deciding to find these answers out as she went along, Zelda joined the crowd once again. As soon as she did, monsters edged away from her, a few shooting her looks of disgust. She ignored these for the most part, until a particular fat-looking Bokoblin got in her way.

"Stupid Chu!" It screeched, jumping up and down on its thick, stumpy legs. "You no belong here!"
"E-Excuse me?" Zelda asked in disbelief. Could this stupid creature possibly know her secret?
"Chu's dumber than Bokoblin!" It squealed, pointing at her and then itself. "You dumb!"

By this point, a small crowd had gathered around the pair. Some were nodding at the Bokoblin's statements, while others seemed to be eyeing Zelda with something like pity on their faces.
This thing is calling me stupid? She thought. That's irony if I've ever seen it... I suppose I could demonstrate that I'm different...

"You are calling me stupid?!" Zelda demanded, stomping her foot with such force that the Bokoblin took a step back. "You, whose race can't even organize themselves properly on the surface?!"
"That no true!" The Bokoblin tried to protest, but Zelda wasn't having it.

"I have been to the surface!" She declared. "I have seen the cruelty of the Hylians! I have seen the ramshackle bands of monsters on the surface, fighting over scraps! Being declared stupid by someone who hasn't left this town? Hah!"

By now, the crowd around her had grown exponentially. Almost all of the crowd seemed to be staring at Zelda, with the exception of a few Bokoblins, who continued to eye her with disgust.

Taking a deep breath, Zelda fell silent. She watched her opponent, waiting for their next move. Most of what she said was true, however she kind of made up that Hylians were a cruel race. Not all of them were cruel. Only the ones who abused her poor Chu's were cruel.

"You... You dead!"
Hearing the Bokoblin let out a screech, Zelda's eyes widened as it charged towards her. As it did...
15531221222211211121212121211122.title: Showdown in the street

choices: The crowd murmurs amongst themselves before dispersing...
The crowd bursts into applause, surprising Zelda...
The crowd parts, revealing a number of Lynel Guards...
155312212222112111212121212111221.content:
Time seemed to slow for Zelda as the Bokoblin clumsily raced towards her. She could see its fat belly bouncing, some sort of liquid flying off it. She could see its tongue, hanging out of its mouth, waggling. And she could see her own body moving, even though she had intended to.

What's going on?!
She felt her mouth open to an impossible size, easily large enough to envelop her attacker. As it reached its full size, her jaw brushing against the dusty floor, time sped back up.

The crowd let out a collective gasp of surprise as the Bokoblin sprinted into her mouth, disappearing from view. As soon as she felt its disgusting feet touch the inside of her cavernous mouth, Zelda shut her mouth.

For a few moments, she felt the Bokoblin struggle within its prison. It beat against the sides of her mouth, which was slowly shrinking around her prey. As soon as her mouth stopped shrinking, the Bokoblin's futile attempts at escape slowly became weaker and weaker, before stopping completely.

With her prey still, Zelda felt her belly shrinking.
No, not shrinking... They're moving...
Her brood navigated towards her mouth, leaving her belly slim and flat. However, various parts of her body ballooned as they passed through her. Her breasts tripled in size for a few seconds before returning to normal. Her neck bulged uncomfortably before she felt them flood into her mouth.

A few squelch's that meant nothing to the stunned crowd, but informed Zelda that her family was pleased with their meal, came from her mouth. A few seconds later, her mouth began to return to its original size, the mass of the Bokoblin slowly vanishing.

As her mouth returned to its normal size, her family travelled back to her belly. Her belly swelled back out to its gravid state. With her body back to normal, Zelda let out a quiet burp.

I feel so full... She groaned internally, rubbing her belly. Is that how I eat now? It's... kind of disgusting... But necessary, I suppose. And it does add to my mass a little...
Moving a hand away from her belly, Zelda rubbed her breasts, which were a little rounder now. She giggled, before remembering where she was.

Looking around at the silent crowd, she began to worry. She had basically committed murder, a crime punishable by death in Castle Town. Would she be sentenced to the same here?

Wrapping her hands defensively around her belly, Zelda took a step back...
155312212222112111212121212111221.title: Making a meal out of it

choices: Zelda asks the Blazerobe for information...
Zelda heads for the library...

1553122122221121112121212121112212.content:
Taking another step back, Zelda glanced around for a possible escape. While she wouldn't be welcome... anywhere, really... on the surface, she could probably survive up there. If her diet consisted mainly of Bokoblins, then she'd be fine! Plenty of rogue bands wandered the surface, despite having no leader to follow.

However, her escape plan was soon rendered unnecessary as the crowd around her burst in applause. She stared at them in disbelief. She had just eaten somebody, and they were applauding her? Was murder common in these streets?

"She's the one!"
"Never thought I'd see the day..."
"We won't have to live in fear anymore!"

Picking out a few shouts, Zelda's brow furrowed in confusion.
I'm the one? She wondered. The one to do what?
Her question, sadly, was not answered. Instead, the crowd, still clapping, shouting and screaming, surged towards her. She inched backwards, scared in case she accidentally absorbed them or something.

Feeling her bulk hoisted into the air, Zelda let out a scream. She could feel all sorts of hands pressing into her gelatinous body. A few even penetrated her body, floating inside her until the owner realised what they had done.

Atop the crowd, Zelda was carried down the street and into the central plaza, where they were met by curious faces.
"She's the one!"
With that one line, the entire plaza erupted into applause. The crowd holding her grew as she was carried towards a massive gate that looked very familiar.

This is where Hyrule Castle's Gate would be! She realised. So that means they're carrying me towards their version of the Castle?
As she neared the gates, two Lynel Guards appeared. They glared at the crowd, before nodding at one another and parting, allowing the crowd to push through the massive gates.

Passing through, Zelda got her first proper look at the Castle. It was similar to Hyrule Castle, yet at the same time, was different. The walls were built with black bricks instead of white. No flags flew from the poles adorning the walls. And the gates that led to Hyrule Castle's lower levels didn't exist.

Zelda was carried from the bottom of the hill all the way to the top. As they neared the Throne Room, the crowd stopped and fell silent. Looking up, Zelda spotted a lone Blazerobe standing before them. Fire encircled his feet, smoke rising around him.

I know him... Zelda thought.
"Present her!" He cried, raising his arms.
The ones holding Zelda, a blue Moblin and a black Moblin, gently set Zelda down. The crowd patted before her, giving her a passage to the Blazerobe.

Cautiously walking towards him, Zelda watched the crowd as she moved. What appeared to be a family of Lizalfos smiled at her, their tongues flicking out. A massive Lynel nodded at her, giving her a gruff growl. A few Stal-Bokoblins chattered between themselves, watching her closely with empty eyes.

Reaching the Blazerobe, Zelda stared at him. One of his eyes twinkled as though he were winking at her.
"I see, I see..." He mumbled, loud enough for Zelda to hear. "They sense something within you... Magic, perhaps? No, something more ancient, more... divine..."

Looking away from her, the Blazerobe raised his arms again.
"She has been blessed by the Goddesses!" He declared, causing a cheer to erupt from the crowd. "She is the one!"
The crowd repeated this, cheering as they did.

I am the one... To do what? She wondered again. Before she could ask, the Blazerobe floated towards her.
"Come, my dear Princess..." He said. "Quarters have been prepared for you. And of course, the Castle is at your disposal..."

Upon hearing her title, Zelda swallowed nervously. Surely he didn't know who she was?
"P-Princess?" She repeated.
The Blazerobe nodded.
"But of course! You are the one spoken of in the prophecy, a descendant of the Royal Family! Unfortunately, without a coronation ceremony, we cannot call you Queen just yet. I hope Princess will suffice?"

Zelda nodded hesitantly.
Prophecy? Royal Family? This is moving really fast... All I wanted was some food, and now I'm a member of the Underground Royal Family?! I need some answers...

Allowing herself to be led away from the cheering crowd by the Blazerobe Zelda was taken to a large bedroom. Inside was very similar to her room in Hyrule Castle, although she didn't have her tower here. She
I did see it when I was being carried up here. I wonder if I can still access it?

"I hope these lodgings are to your liking?" The Blazerobe asked.
"Uh... Yes! Thank you very much!" Zelda responded.
The Blazerobe bowed, before making for the door.

Should I ask him about all this? Zelda wondered. He did mention a library earlier... Perhaps independent research would be more informative? Then again, it's been a long day... Sleep would definitely benefit me...
1553122122221121112121212121112212.title: The Chosen Chu

Caressing her gravid belly, Zelda groaned with reluctant pleasure. Its inhabitant refused to remain still, writhing and churning within her. Initially, it had felt rather repulsive but now, she was actually growing to like it somewhat...

Giggling as the chu pressed against her finger, Zelda ignored the numb sensation slowly spreading throughout her body. It had originated in her belly, more specifically from her inhabitant, yet her belly still had feeling in it. If anything, it was a little more sensitive, which explained why Zelda was so fixated on caressing it.

Gradually, both her legs and her ample backside fell to the numbness. And yet, Zelda still remained oblivious to it. Another giggle escaped her lips as her fingers danced nimbly across its surface, causing the Chu within to squirm happily.

With the numbness, which was still avoiding her belly, now inching down her arms, Zelda finally became aware of the missing sensation. And even then, it was only due to her agile fingers suddenly feeling clumsy and unresponsive that she finally paid any attention to it.

"Why do I feel so weird?" She wondered, struggling to lift her arm up. "Is the Chu doing something to me?!"
Staring wide-eyed at her belly, Zelda's realisation came too later. As feeling vanished from her fingers, she felt the numbness begin to advance up her neck. And that was the least of her worries.

I've lost control of my body?! She thought anxiously. Then who's in control right now?

T-The Chu is in charge?! How?! What about me?!
No longer in control of her own body, Zelda watched with horror as her body...

Her body now completely under the control of the Chu, Zelda could do nothing but watch as it stumbled towards the crevice the Chu had originally crawled out of. Falling to her knees in front of it, her body leaned into the crack and let out a few squelching sounds which echoed down the tunnel.

No, not more of them! I need control of my body back!

No, no more! I don't think my body can handle that many!
Her body didn't listen to her. Instead, it reached out and began to apply guide the Chu's to her mouth, pushing them in when they drew near.

For the next few minutes, Zelda's body fed Chu after Chu into her mouth. With each one that was swallowed, her belly swelled larger and larger. Her tunic was quickly forced upwards and bunched beneath her breasts, which remained untouched by her sudden stuffing.

Soon, her body ran out of Chu's and fell backwards, landing heavily on her backside. A pained squelch escaped her mouth, followed by a pleased one as her hands began massaging her belly, which reached out to her knees.

I need to regain control! Zelda thought. I don't want any more monsters in me!
As Zelda struggled to regain control, her body gurgled as...
1553122122221121121.title: Filling up the Puppet
