15531221222211211211.content:
An almighty gurgle escaped Zelda's rotund gut, causing a noise of happiness to escape her mouth. Her hands still gently caressing its taut surface, Zelda watched with horror as her skin began to bubble.

M-My skin! What's happening to me?!
The bubbling began to spread outwards, slowly covering her pale skin. However, with no control over her body and therefore no feeling, Zelda couldn't tell if it was painful, pleasurable or what. And the current controller didn't give much away, making only the occasional wet squelch.

Soon, Zelda's entire body was engulfed by the bubbling, whose effects soon became apparent to her. A happy noise came from her mouth as her hands, still firmly glued to her belly, began to slowly sinking into it. At the same time her hands began to sink into her belly, her skin began to change colours, taking on a deep blue hue.

Am I melting?! No... Not melting... It's changing consistency...
As Zelda watched, her skin became softer and less solid. Her gravid belly was the first to finish, leaving Zelda's body with a hefty jelly belly. The changes then began to spread throughout the rest of her body, slowly but surely changing the Puppet Princess's body into that of a mere Chu.

Powerless to stop it, Zelda's body soon fell away, leaving her with a gelatinous blue body. Even her hair and eyes had succumbed to the changes, leaving her hair as a blonde mass of dripping tentacles and eyes as glowing green balls.

My body... What's going to happen to me? Zelda wondered, feeling both horrified and slightly curious about what was happening to her. She wouldn't have to wait long, however, as...
15531221222211211211.title: Zelda's loss of body

choices: Zelda starts towards the distant Zora's Domain...
Zelda begins with the nearby Rito Village...
Zelda hears somebody calling her name...
155312212222112112111.content:
Zelda's head glanced around the cave, letting out a few wet burbles as it did, before looking down at her gelatinous form. Her hands gently massaged her dripping breasts, causing her body to shiver slightly. Pleasure raced through her mind, causing Zelda's mind to dog over slightly.

Hylia, that felt so good... No, wait... I want more... Touch me... Less! More...
Her head was a whirlwind of opposing thoughts. Part of her wanted more, to have her dripping form fondled and pleased, while another part wanted to resist, to have her body returned to her control.

As Zelda's mind warred with itself, her body took the side of more pleasure by providing just that. One hand continued to fondle her breasts, digging her fingers into them, while the other was currently stuffed into her gravid jelly belly, her fingers wiggling and providing more and more pleasure for both body and mind.

As her body fell to its knees with a wet slap, Zelda's mind was slowly drawing closer to a winner.
More... Harder... Bigger... Faster... L-Less... Longer! N-No... Yes!
With a long squelch that conveyed something approaching pleasure, her belly groping hand moved downwards in her body. Now stuffed firmly in the centre of her crotch, her green eyes flashed rapidly.

Yes... Yes... Yes...
"YEEESSSS!"
The scream of pure ecstasy escaped from Zelda's lips, echoing around her pit. It continued for a few more seconds as she climaxed, a thin blue liquid leaking from her crotch.

Breathing heavily, Zelda pulled her hands away from her body, lifting them up and inspecting them. Licking the liquid from her hand, she grinned happily. She was back in control of her body, but she didn't care that she now consisted of jelly. In fact, she loved it. And she wanted to spread it, create more like her...

And she knew exactly where to start.

Making her way towards the edge of her pit, she began to effortlessly climb out of the hole, her body sticking to the wall. After a few minutes of climbing, she stood at the edge of the pit, her body dropping jelly. Looking back down into her pit, she grinned again.

"I fell in as a Princess of Hyrule, and came out a Queen of Chu's... Not a bad trade. But a Queen needs a kingdom, and I know where to start..."
155312212222112112111.title: The new Queen

choices: Zelda spies a familiar red figure nearby and starts towards her...
Zelda waits until night to launch a frontal assault on the Domain...
Zelda decides to hide in the water and sneak into the Domain...
1553122122221121121111.content:
"What better way to grow my own kingdom than taking control of somebody else's?" Zelda said to herself, starting to walk. "Now, I obviously can't take control of Hyrule, not yet. But Hyrule does have a second Princess, albeit a much less powerful and influential one..."

Pausing for a moment, she glanced towards the sky. She had only been in that pit for a few hours at most, meaning the sun was now high above her. Staring at it for a few moments, she ran a quick calculation in her head before looking east, or what she hoped was easy.

"The Domain, and my new kingdom, is that way!" She declared, a hand stroking her belly. "Don't worry, my children. I'll have some delectable bodies for you to assume control off soon! And once you have, we can begin spreading across Hyrule at a much quicker pace!"

Laughing gleefully to herself, Zelda started towards the Domain, looking forwards to meeting her new subjects...

<-- A couple of days later -->


Zelda let out a long breath as she struggled up the last few feet of the steep hill she found herself on. All in all, her journey had been quite exhausting. The sun had warmed her body considerably during the day, making her legs feel weak and wobbly. Travelling during the cool nights had worked much better for her, even with the amount of enemies that also enjoyed the nights. They had all ignored her, save for the Chu's.

Zelda gave her belly a loving caress as she reached the peak of the hill. During her trip across Hyrule, Chu after Chu had flocked to her, seeking refuge within her body. As their new Queen, Zelda was more than happy to accommodate them, no matter their typing or number. As a result, her once slim yet pregnant looking blue body was long gone, replaced by something new.

While she was still mainly blue, tinges of red, white and yellow from various different types of Chu's had spread throughout her form, making her resemble some sort of rainbow. Her belly, which housed the majority of her babies, had swelled massively, protruding a good five feet from the rest of her body. Within it was a vortex of colour, once again stemming from her different children.

However, the rest of her body had not been ignored, with a fair number of Chu's deciding to house themselves elsewhere. Her breasts had doubled in size during her trip and rested atop her gravid belly, while her ass, hips and thighs were considerably thicker. Aside from those three areas, a few weirder Chu's had settled in her arms, making them noticeably thicker, while one really irritating one had made its home in her neck.

Even so, Zelda loved them all. As she stared down at Zora's Domain, which glittered beautifully in the early morning sun, she rubbed her body, moaning quietly as she did. While it would be sad to say goodbye to her children, they would soon be living better lives in the bodies of others. And as their Queen, she would need to support them.

"Now, how should we go about this, my children?" She asked, eyeing the Domain curiously...
1553122122221121121111.title: Setting sights on Zora's Domain

choices: Zelda takes control of Mipha's mind...
Zelda turns Mipha into one of her minions...
Mipha manages to escape...
15531221222211211211111.content:
For the next few minutes, Zelda gazed over Zora's Domain, trying to come up with a plan that gave her the most amount of control over the Zora's with the least amount of losses. Eventually, she let out a sad sigh and stepped back. However she approached the Domain, be it from either of the bridges or from one of the many waterfalls surrounding it, she would incur massive losses and gain very little from it.

"Perhaps we should start with some place else, my children..." She whispered dejectedly to her belly, which vibrated slightly in response. "I know, I know... I am not happy about it either, but I am unwilling to sacrifice any of you! Perhaps if we..."

Zelda trailed off as she heard a splash nearby. Returning to the edge of the cliff, she looked straight down. Covering the cliff face was a beautiful waterfall, one of many dotted around Zora's Domain. However, as she looked closer, she spotted a red fin aimed towards her racing up it...

"Oh dear... It appears we've been seen..."
Zelda stepped back as a Zora launched themselves into the air. As they did, they managed to unsheathe a silver trident.
"You dare enter Zora's Domain, foul beast?!" They cried, landing gracefully and levelling their spear at Zelda.

For a moment, the duo inspected the other. Standing before Zelda was a red and white female Zora. Her slim body was clad in various types of silver jewellery, all of which shone slightly in the light of the sun. However, a smile spread across Zelda's gelatinous face as she spotted a light blue sash with a drawing of a large creature with a trunk wrapped around her torso.

"Princess Mipha..." She murmured, stroking her belly. "Perhaps we can start with Zora's Domain after all..."
At the mention of her name, Mipha stepped forwards and thrust her spear out. The tip of it now rested about two inches from Zelda's face, not that she was particularly worried about it.
"How do you know my name?" She demanded. "Answer honestly, or be struck down where you stand!"

Zelda giggled in response.
"Oh, never mind that, Princess!" She responded brightly. "All I'll say for now is that I too was once a Princess! But now, I'm a Queen without a kingdom, and we can't have that, can we? So hold still, and accept my gift so that I grow both my kingdom and people..."

Mipha's eyes widened as the creature before her moved at a blinding speed. With one arm, they batted away her spear, knocking it from her grip. The other shot out, losing its shape and morphing into some sort of tentacle, aimed directly at her face...
15531221222211211211111.title: The Princess and the Queen

choices: Mipha has completely accepted the changes...
Mipha seems to be resisting the changes...
A few Zoras appear, looking for Mipha...
155312212222112112111112.content:
Gripped firmly in her assailants sticky hand, Mipha could do nothing but struggle and watch as the tentacle flew towards her face. As it drew closer, she clamped her mouth shut, hoping it would be enough to keep the dripping appendage out.

Unfortunately, the self-proclaimed Chu Queen had somehow predicted she would try this and tightly squeezed her other hand, causing the air to rush from Mipha's lungs. As she opened her mouth to gasp for air, the tentacle made its move and shot directly into her mouth.

As her cheeks bulged with jelly, Mipha tried to spit it out. When that didn't work, she tried biting, hoping her sharper Zora teeth would cause the creature some pain. Her hopes were quickly dashed as her teeth refused to cut through the rubbery tendril and merely slid across it slightly.

"Oh, my dear Mipha..." The Chu Queen giggled. "Only a few items in Hyrule have the power necessary to cut through my body! And unfortunately for you, your teeth are not counted amongst them! Now, just relax... Allow my gift to fill and change your life..."

Feeling the tendril in her mouth pulsate disgustingly, Mipha began to panic as she spotted a bulge on the Chu Queen's neck pulsate in response before sliding down her neck and into the tendril stuffed into her mouth. With eyes filled with fear, Mipha watched the bulge slide down the tendril and into her mouth. Her cheeks bulged even more as she felt the bulge sit atop her tongue for a few moments before dropping atop it, chilling and numbing her mouth greatly.

"Now, my child..." The Queen cooed. "She's all yours..."

Feeling the tendril retreat from her mouth, Mipha was about to spit out whatever it had placed there when it, with surprising speed, slid down her throat and into her belly. Mipha groaned as her belly bulged outwards slightly to accommodate it. Thankfully, her distended belly didn't last too long as it gurgled loudly and shrank back into her body.

Unfortunately, it doing so caused a numbing chill to fill Mipha's body. As the chill reached her head, her vision began to dull. The last thing Mipha saw before her vision disappeared was the serene smile on the Chu Queen's familiar face...

=====


Seeing Mipha's eyes gradually shut, Zelda reached a hand out and gently caressed her cheek. Beneath her hand, she could feel Mipha's skin beginning to bubble, signalling her changes were beginning.

"Soon, I'll have a Princess and a Kingdom..." Zelda whispered happily. "Come, my sweet first child... Join me!"

Reaching in response to her command, Mipha's skin began to visibly bubble and melt away, soon leaving her with a gelatinous replacement of her former body. Unlike Zelda, who was a rainbow of colours and filled with her children, Mipha was a brilliant white, signalling that she had been changed by an Ice Chu.

As the last bit of Mipha's Zora body melted away and her jewellery felt to the ground with a gentle clink, the new Chu Princess's eyes gradually fluttered open, revealing that they were a glowing yellow, similar to Zelda's.

"Well?" Zelda asked. "How does my new Princess and Daughter feel?"

choices: Zelda wakes up a Zora...
Zelda wakes up as herself, although her skin feels a little dry...
Zelda wakes up as herself, thought she really wants some fish...
15531221222222112.content:
"Zora culture really is exciting! Wouldn't you agree, Link?"

Turning to her travelling companion, an look of displeasure appeared on Zelda's fair face as she saw Link sitting down, his eyes shut. His chest rose and fell slowly, telling the irritated Zelda that he had fallen asleep at some point during her wondering about the Zora Race.

Matching over to her slumbering knight, Zelda have him a light tap with the toe of her boot. Link let a snort, causing Zelda to giggle briefly. Giving him another tap, her giggles vanished as he stubbornly refused to wake up. Taking a deep breath, Zelda prepared herself...

"LINK! WAKE UP!"
Zelda shouted at the top of her voice, while also stomping her foot. Her demand echoed around the room for a few seconds, before silence returned. Link's hand twitched slightly before he lifted his head. He lazily looked around the room before focusing in on Zelda and giving her an apologetic look.

"Honestly! You'd think the warrior capable of defeating Calamity Ganon would be a little more alert! What if we were attacked? What would've happened to me?" Zelda demanded, hands on her hips. "In case you forgot, monsters still roam Hyrule, and I'm pretty sure they'll all relish the chance to get at me!"

In response, Link merely shrugged and stood up. He stretched for a few moments before looking at Zelda, awaiting her orders.
She contemplated punishing him somehow, maybe force him to make her an extra large dinner or something, but that probably wouldn't stick. Maybe she could...

"A-Ah!"
She cried out as Link grabbed his bow. He nocked an arrow and aimed behind her. Ducking down, she flinched as she heard the arrow fly across the room, embedding itself into something with a dull thunk.

"What was that?"
Hesitantly straightening up, Zelda looked towards his target. His arrow was stuck in a wall, something small glittering below it. Link walked over to it, a hand on the grip of the Master Sword. He stooped down and grabbed the shiny object, inspecting it closely.

After a few seconds, Zelda curiously wandered over to him.
"What is it?" She asked, peering over his shoulder.
Her eyes lit up as she spotted a beautiful sapphire in the centre of his hand. Gold encircled it, giving it a familiar look that Zelda just couldn't place...

"Beautiful..." She whispered, reaching down and taking it from Link's hand. She held it up to the fading evening light, giving it her own inspection.
"It looks familiar, yet I can't place it..." She murmured. "I think I'll keep hold of it... Research purposes, of course!"

Pocketing the sapphire, she looked at Link.
"Good find!" She said gratefully, before remembering what they were talking about. "But not good enough for my forgiveness! I want an extra large dinner if you want that!"

Link let out a sigh, nodding in response to her demand. From experience, it was best that he just went along with her demands, lest he want even more trouble from her.

After a delicious dinner consisting of grilled meat, vegetables and a jug of cold milk, the pair turned in for the night. The sapphire remained in Zelda's pocket, emitting a faint light that washed over Zelda's slumbering form...
15531221222222112.title: Finding the Beautiful Sapphire...

choices: Coming across a pool of water, Zelda is overcome with the urge to swim...
Stepping out into the rain, Zelda's skin feels refreshed...
Stepping outside, Zelda flinches when lightning strikes nearby...
155312212222221123.content:
The next morning, Zelda awoke to the gentle sounds of rain falling on leaves. Sitting up, she rubbed the sleep out of her eyes and peered outside. They had elected to use the ruins she had found as cover, the Sheikah Slate having told them that rain would arrive at some point during the night.

Link sat opposite her, staring at the campfire he had restarted. Zelda joined him, sitting opposite him. She stared at the Master Sword for a few seconds before speaking.

"Morning!" She said brightly, Link's dinner having done its job in cheering her up. "Ready for another day of research?"
Link gave her a half-hearted shrug, inciting a laugh from Zelda.
"Come on... Cheer up! Research isn't that bad!"

Link hesitated, unsure of how to answer.
"I know you don't like it, but research helps us understand the world around us! It's an amazing feeling, stumbling across some long-lost relic or some ancient text..."
Zelda let out a dreamy sigh, imagining the possibilities. If she had found that beautiful sapphire yesterday, who knew what she might find today?

However, before she could disappear off into the ruins, her belly let out a long gurgle. She blushed, rubbing her slim stomach.
"Well, can't research on an empty stomach, can you? I'm really in the mood for some... fish! Yeah, the bigger it is, the better!"

Envisioning herself gorging on a huge Hylian Bass, her mouth began to water. When Link produced one from his infinite satchel, her eyes lit up.
"Quickly! Hand it over!"
Link hesitated. The last time he had let her cook, she had almost burnt down their surroundings. Although this time, she seemed to be so much more confident....

Against his better judgement, Link handed her the slightly slimy fish. He watched as she lifted it to her face, apparently inhaling its scent. When she opened her mouth to take a bite, that was when he looked away.

Taking a large chunk out of the still raw fish, Zelda chewed slowly, savouring the taste. It was slimy, tough and still had scales attached to it, but none of that bothered her. Taking another bite, she let out a moan. It tasted so good...

Eventually, the fish was reduced to a small pile of white bones that sat next to Zelda. She rubbed her belly happily, pleased with her slightly weird meal.
"Delicious!" She said, getting to her feet. "Now, shall we get started?"

Link looked at the pile of bones and then at her. He shook his head, slight confused by her odd behaviour before following her into the ruins...
155312212222221123.title: A hankering for some fish

choices: Zelda's hunger for fish returns...
Zelda comes across another pool, however this one seems somewhat cleaner...
Stepping on a pressure plate, Zelda feels the floor beneath her vanish...
1553122122222211231.content:
Zelda marched through the ruins, stepping over fallen pillars and peeking into collapsed rooms. Behind her, Link followed at a distance. He was close enough to be at her aid at a seconds notice, but far enough to avoid the smell of fish that seemed to be following her.

"Lets see what's in here..."
Poking her head around an archway, she expected to find yet another room that had collapsed in upon itself. What she did not expect to find was a large pool sitting in the centre of the relatively undamaged room. The pool was filled with water that could only be described as 'Rank', as algae, dirt and moss floated atop its green surface.

While this repulsed Link, who was no stranger to disgusting conditions, Zelda, on the other hand, clapped happily.
"I fancy a swim!" She declared, heading into the room. Link followed her in, checking for other entrances. Finding none, he left the room, unwilling to see Zelda strip and then swim in filth.

Leaning next to the pools surface, Zelda dipped a finger in. Even the way the water felt was wrong, yet this did nothing to dissuade her from her actions. Straightening back up, she pulled her tunic off over her head. Dropping it onto a relatively clean looking tile, she pulled off her boots and pants, leaving her clad in her underwear.

Stepping into the water, Zelda shivered. It was partially due to the coldness of the liquid, and partially due to the sensation of water gently lapping against her skin. It felt so good, so... refreshing!

"Here we go!"
Diving forwards, Zelda disappeared under the surface of the filth-covered liquid. She closed her eyes, allowing the water to refresh her entire body, before pushing upwards. Her head broke the surface, her blonde hair plastered to her face.

Swiping hair from her eyes, she let out a long sigh.
"Hylia, this feels so good!" She said enthusiastically, rubbing algae over her skin. "Why didn't I take up swimming sooner? If only I'd known about how it makes you feel..."

For a while, Zelda swam back and forth in the pool. It was deep enough to allow her to swim freely, yet shallow enough to allow her to stand up when she needed a break. During one such break, she became aware of an odd sensation in her hands and feet. However, the refreshing water soon washed it away, and she thought no more of it. Had she looked down, she would've noticed webbing now extending between her fingers and toes.

After a while, Zelda stopped. Stretching her arms above her head, she swam for the edge, deftly pulling herself out of the dank water. Shaking water from her body, she didn't notice that the majority of the water was quickly absorbed by her skin, which had a faint shine to it now.

After dressing herself, Zelda left the room, stopping only to give Link a quick tap. As the pair headed further down the corridor...
1553122122222211231.title: A refreshing dip in a not-so-refreshing pool

choices: Zelda is curious about how long she can hold her breath...
Zelda feels something nibble at her legs...
Zelda feels restricted by her underwear and strips completely...
15531221222222112312.content:
Zelda slowly made her way down the corridor, following behind Link who cleared a path for her. Her walk was slow, not because of tiredness or anything like that, but because her feet didn't feel right inside her boots. They felt dry, while her toes felt oddly constricted.

Before she could see why was wrong with her feet, an explosion of blue light, followed by a long period of crumbling rocks, echoed throughout the corridor. Looking up, she saw Link peering through a hole he had just made with a bomb.

Marching to his side, Zelda have him a gentle punch on the shoulder, not hard enough to hurt the hardened knight, but enough to show her displeasure at his path-clearing methods.
"Please try not to destroy the ruins!" She chided him. "It's difficult to research when your artefacts have been blown up!"

Link gave her an apologetic look before climbing through the hole. Zelda made to follow him, but stopped when she heard the familiar chattering of Bokoblins. She held back, listening as Link rushed in, yelling his signature battlecry. The Bokoblins screeched angrily for a few seconds, before silence fell.

Guessing that it was safe, Zelda climbed through the hole. Crawling out the other side, she landed in a corridor that was much cleaner then the one she had just left. Dirt was still present, although it no longer caked every surface. And as far as she could see, no fallen pillars or rubble piles blocked the corridor.

"Wow... You can almost see what was etched on this wall..." Zelda commented, inspecting the wall next to her. "It looks like writing... I can barely recognize the language... Zora, maybe? And this... This is definitely an arrow, pointing into here..."

Peering into the door next to her, Zelda's eyes lit up as she spotted another pool of water. This one was double the length of the other and the water in it was much clearer, although algae still floated across the surface.

Without hesitation, she marched in. Link followed her in, making sure it was safe, before leaving again. He had no idea where her new desire for swimming and fish had come from, and he wasn't too concerned about it. He sat up against the wall, leaning his head back and closing his eyes. Hopefully Zelda didn't need him for a while...

"Oh, so cold! I love it!"
Zelda let out a happy squeal as she tested the water with her hand. The refreshing feeling returned, filling her with energy. Grabbing her top and pants, she threw them behind her and dove into the pool. She closed her eyes, allowing the water to fill her with more and more energy.

Returning to the surface, she took a deep breath. She giggled as she played with a patch of algae, unconcerned that it clung to her hands...
15531221222222112312.title: Zelda comes across a cleaner pool...

choices: Zelda inspects the other walls, prompting further changes...
Zelda realises that she's breathing underwater...
An enemy appears out of nowhere, surprising Zelda...
155312212222221123121.content:
Humming happily to herself, Zelda splashed around in the clear water for a bit. She had never been the most active person in Hyrule, but while she was in the water, her energy knew no bounds.

"So refreshing!" Zelda repeated for the umpteenth time, swimming another length of the pool. Her webbed feet helped propel her quickly through the water, the princess reaching speeds only a Zora could. And yet, she didn't realise this.

Eventually, she stopped. Treading water in the middle of the pond, Zelda sighed happily.
"I wonder..." She mused, looking down past her webbed feet to the bottom of the pool. "How long can I hold my breath?"

Curiosity piqued, Zelda stopped treading water, allowing her body to sink deeper into the water. Before her head disappeared under the water, she took a deep breath, filling her lungs to capacity, and closed her eyes.

Zelda sank for a few seconds before her feet met the bottom of the pool. She remained there for a good minute before her chest began to ache, demanding air. Somewhat reluctantly, she kicked upwards, her head quickly breaking the surface of the water.

"Apparently..." She gasped. "Not that long..."
Taking a few deep breaths, Zelda floated there for another few seconds.
"But the only way I'll ever improve is through practice!" She told herself. "And what better place and time than now?"

Taking another deep breath, Zelda sank to the bottom once again. This time, however, was slightly different. Her green eyes remained open and, as she sank, she felt her vision adjust slightly. Rather than the water making everything appear blurry, everything was crystal clear. She could see all four walls of the pool, all of which seemed to have some of inscription.

Curious...
Kicking back to the surface, Zelda took a few breaths before diving again. Swimming over to the nearest wall, she ran her hand over it, her eyes narrowing as she mentally translated the writing.

The writing is awfully faded... Test... Zora... Breath... Test of the Zora? But what about breath?
Stepping away from the wall, Zelda took a deep breath, completely missing the fact that she was still under water.

"I wonder what the other walls say..." She said, her voice muffled by the water. "Suppose I should find out..."
As she swam towards another wall, she didn't realise that six narrow slits had appeared on her neck, three on either side, that were acting as gills for her...

15531221222222222.title: Size Changing?

choices: The green one, Zelda grows.
The red one, Zelda shrinks. (Reserved)
155312212222222221.content:
Since the downfall of the Calamity Ganon, peace has been returned to Hyrule and its citizens have wasted little time in rebuilding the kingdom. It has been a stressful time for everyone, especially for Hyrule's princess, who has been at the forefront of the kingdom's reconstruction. Zelda felt she was long due for a break, afterall she would love to return to her studies on the ancient Sheikah technology, especially after learning of the new discoveries Link had made on his travels. Link's Sheikah Slate seemed to have so much application, Zelda wondered if Link had really discovered all it could be used for. So, in her first vacation in over 100 years, Zelda decided to spend some time in her room, tinkering around the mechanics of the device to find any hidden potential.

"Hmm, just what I suspected," Zelda murmured to herself, tools deep into the inners of Link's Sheikah Slate, "There seem to be a sorta lock chip. It's keeping the device from achieving it full capabilities. If I were to just ... deactivate." Suddenly, the device flash with energy and spontaneously lit up, she had successfully deactivated the chip and seemingly unleashed the full power of the device. "This is great! This will definitely prove useful in solving the mysteries of the Sheikahs, I wonder what sort of applications are now available."

Booting up the device, Zelda was met with a new message, it stated, "New rune installed: Volume"

"Volume? What could that possibly mean? Did I just mess around with dangerous Sheikah technology just to add some sort of sound control feature to the slate?" Booting it up, Zelda remained puzzled. In front of her laid a slider of some sort ranging from 200 percent to 1 percent and two buttons, one green and one red. Both buttons featured text that was unreadable to Zelda, as it was displayed in the langauge of the Sheikah. "Wha-what is this? What does it mean by volume?" Zelda began to play with the rune, setting the slider to 50 percent, "Volume in what form? Sound? Light? Siz-" With a press of the red button, a huge beam of light shot out from the slate and hit a lamp laying on Zelda's desk. What followed next, left Zelda in a state of shock, the lamp on her desk seemed to shrink before her eyes, until it reached half the size it once was.

"Did that really just happen?" Zelda couldn't help but doubt her own eyesight, did such technology really exist and does she really possess it? Picking up the miniature lamp, she could tell it was not only smaller but lighter too, like all the mass it once possessed had just vanished. "This goes against all known laws of nature! Just how advance were these Sheikahs? Hey I wonder, if the red button shrinks things, does the green button...?" With another toggle of the percent slider, and a press of the green button, the lamp begin to change once again, now growing back to its original size. "Yes, it can grow stuff too! What a discovery! I'll have to test this feature out even more. If it works perfectly with inorganic matter, will it work the same with organics?" She had to find out, so she gave the word to the guards stationed outside of her room to find and bring Link to her.

In only a few minutes, Zelda's appointed Knight entered her room, kneeling in respect. However, this was no time for formality, now was the time for science. Zelda pulled Link quickly to his feet before handing him the slate. "OK Link, short story, I discovered this new rune on the Sheikah Slate and I want you to test it on me, just mess with the slider and press either the green or red button. Surprise me, OK?" Link was a bit surprised, but did what Zelda commanded him to do. He set the slider to just 25 percent off 100 and pressed one of the buttons. A huge beam of light came out of the slate and engulfed the princess. Link stood stunned as he watched Zelda change before his very eyes.

Except, what button did Link press?
155312212222222221.title: Yes let's do that! (Reserved)

choices: Link finds her in the castle's library. (Reserved)
Link finds her in the Hyrule Castle Town market.
1553122122222222212.content:
Zelda couldn't believe her eyes, the whole world around her was changing. Everything was growing, her bed, desk, books, and even Link. Just a minute ago she was a similar height to him, around 5'6" compared to his 5'7", only slightly shorter, but now she would be lucky if she even reached the five-foot mark. Except, she was still dwindling, and everything around her just kept growing more distant. The whole experience was extremely exciting, everything around her felt familiar, yet so foreign. She still couldn't believe all this was real, she thought that in any second now she would wake up from a dream and continue her day as normal with her normal height. Maybe at lunch she would tell Link about her dream and he would say, ". . . . ." Oh yeah, nothing, nothing as usual. Yet, the tingling feeling around her body continues as she further shrank in size, even confirming the reality of her situation with a short, but painful pinch on her arm.

By the time she was done shrinking she was staring Link directly into his lower chest. She had to crane her head far up to look him in the eyes. From the look on his face, she could tell that he was just as shocked and mesmerized by her shrinking as she was, perhaps even more, knowing that he had no idea what the rune did in the first place. Slowly, Zelda walked around her room trying to take in and understand her new size. Everything seemed bigger, not unnaturally big, but definitely made for someone bigger than herself. When she tried to pick up a nearby book off the floor, it was heavier than she expected and it easily fell out of her hands. Looking into her closet, she could tell that none of the clothes hanging up would fit her small self, and her knee-high boots would most likely come up to her mid-thigh now. It definitely made her thankful that the clothes she was currently wearing shrank with her as well, she didn't want to embarrass herself in front of Link.

Speaking of Link, Zelda couldn't help but notice how different he has become too. Of course, he was bigger than Zelda was used to, but were those muscles of his always that big? And his face, it looked so... soft and smooth, in a way, somewhat feminine. And his big cute eyes along with his wavy hair seemed to glisten from the light coming in through the windows. Zelda was memorized, although Link was there time and time again for her and saved her from the evil that was Calamity Ganon, she had never felt as attracted to him as she did now. All the minor details in his body and complexity that she previously glossed over, seemed to be more prevalent to her than ever.

She had to get a closer look, so she slowly approached her tall knight, and as she did she could feel herself trembling in excitement. It was like she was in a trance, no longer able to control herself as she stood mere feet away from Link and looked up and down his body at all the features he had to offer. Link stared down at her with wide eyes, the whole situation was turning really awkward for him, and his cheeks couldn't help but blush a bright red as Zelda continued to invade his personal space. Suddenly, with lustful eyes, Zelda reached her hand out and began to feel Link's abs through his tunic, they were so toned and strong. "So ... hot." Zelda couldn't help but murmur to herself, she had never been so turned on before like she was now, next to Link, feeling the warmth emanating off his body and feeling the finer curves and details of his muscles. Link's whole face was red now, he had never seen his princess so lustful before, especially towards him, it was all overwhelming.

Eventually, Zelda looked up and noticed the surprise on Link's face, which made her heart skip a beat. She didn't even realize what she was doing, it didn't even occur to her that she was intruding in Link's space or that she was making him uncomfortable. "I'm so sorry!" Zelda couldn't be more embarrassed; her face turned a deep red as she raised her hands to cover it. All this was too much for her, she had to escape, so she ran out of the room in a hurry, not even caring that she was still a runt compared to her old self. Link tried to stop her but was fruitless. He felt bad for her, in truth, he has had a crush on the princess for a while now, but just didn't know the right way to tell her.

"If only she was a little less shy," Link thought to himself, "She would be a bit more open in sharing her feelings with me." Collecting his thoughts, Link decided it was best to find her before she made it too far, after all she a fraction off her original height, she could put herself in serious danger like that. So, Sheikah slate in tow, Link set out to find Zelda.

But, where did she go?
1553122122222222212.title: Shrinking Zelda and the growing crush.

choices: Zelda and Link set out on their journey for the desert. (Reserved)
Something unexpected happens before they can leave.
15531221222222222121.content:
Zelda ran and ran, she wasn't sure where she was running to, but she knew she couldn't stand to be in Link's presence for a while. "How could I be so stupid? Link's never going to forgive me. Oh... why do I have to be like this?" Out of breath, Zelda stopped to gasp for air. Looking up, she could see that she had arrived at the castle's library. This was one of her favorite places to be, especially when she needed some alone time, and by Hylia now was one of those times. After she collected her thoughts and took in her surroundings though, Zelda was initially confused to find that the grand library seemed to be even more grand than before. It took her a minute to realize that she was still shrunk, and Link had the Sheikah slate now. "I can't believe I forgot, and worse of it, Link has the only device capable of turning me back to normal. But, I can't possibly look him in the face right after that. I suppose I'm stuck like this for now."

Walking down the stairs, Zelda entered the main area of the library and began to look for something to read. Reading was always something that would calm her down, she could just get lost in a good book. She was quite limited in her selection, after all, there were a lot of books on higher shelves that she could no longer reach. Eventually however, Zelda found something that intrigued her interest, the book was titled, "The History of the Gerudo Race and People: Volume 1" The book was huge, over 600 pages long, and consequentially heavy, especially to the smaller Zelda. It was a struggle to lug the big book over to the one of the nearby tables, but the tiny princess managed. Sitting down in one of the seats though, Zelda was disheartened to find that her feet did not touch the floor and that she had a hard time looking over the table. This frustrated her but it was something she just had to deal with, she thought that once she started reading she would quickly forget about these minor inconveniences.

In mere minutes Zelda was lost in the words of the book, in the hours she had been reading, she had learned a lot about the Gerudo, including their culture, architecture, trade, relationships, wars, and even the demographics of their people. Although she already knew the Gerudo were tall, with some members growing up to 8 to 9 feet tall, their stature seemed even more impressive compared to Zelda's current height. She imagined that she would be absolutely dwarfed by any Gerudo women her age. This began to make Zelda curious, she didn't even know her own height right now, as she didn't have time to measure herself before being distracted by Link's wonderful physique. Grabbing a bit of measuring tape and walking over to a nearby wall, Zelda made a little indention where the top of her head was parallel with the wall. Measuring the height of the mark, Zelda's petite stature became ever so known to the ponderous princess. "Oh gosh, I'm not even 4'2"!"

Zelda was surprised yet began to grow curious once again. "With other runes on the Sheikah slate they have some sort of timer before their effects dissipate," Zelda thought, "Yet, the rune that shrank me hasn't worn off yet. Would it ever? Or does it require another use of the rune to return me to my proper size? Perhaps this rune just has a longer lasting effect that the others." With that thought, Zelda had decided. She was going to wait a day or two before returning to her normal size, after all, she had to, it was for science and research! Plus, she wouldn't have to approach Link right away, she was still embarrassed for what she did earlier, even after calming herself down.

However, Zelda's wish wouldn't last for long as once she turned around she saw Link starring down at her from the 2nd story. Her heart sank, and she began to get nervous once again as her knight slowly approached her. She expected him to be mad at her still or at least disappointed or apathetic, but looking into his eyes, Zelda saw none of that. He just looked happy to see her, which made Zelda feel more relieved, perhaps Link had forgiven her from earlier. "Look, Link, I'm sorry about earlier, I was just... I-I didn't know..." Zelda couldn't find the right words, but Link just shook his head as if to indicate that he understood what she was trying to say and that it was in the past. Instead, Link handed her a sheet a paper. It was an invitation for Zelda from the Chief of the Gerudo, asking for an audience with the princess in order to strengthen the ties between Hyrule and the Gerudo people now that the war with evil was over.

To put it simply, Zelda was excited, she hasn't visited Gerudo Town in over 100 years, and now she had the opportunity to see the true height of the Gerudo people in person. If she and Link left tomorrow for the desert, it would be around a five-day trip. She had to get her things ready, there was little time to lose. Zelda was about to hurry out of the library and back to her room, when she felt Link stop her by her shoulder. Turning around, she saw him trying to hand the Sheikah slate to her as if to imply if she wanted to grow back to normal. "Oh well, you see, I was sort of thinking about staying this size for now. You know, I just want to see if the effects wear off through time or not." Link gave her a concerned look. "Don't worry about me, I can take care of myself. I'm just doing this for knowledge. You hang on to the slate for now, OK?"

To be truthful, although Zelda was tempted to see if the shrinking effects did wear off eventually, she was more inclined to rough it out small if it meant she could look up at her knight more and more greatly appreciate his amazing features. After all, she could help but shake in excitement every time she entered his presence. His immense stature was just so overwhelming to the poor tiny princess.

Anyway, Zelda successfully returned to her room and began to pack. Although a lot of her clothes wouldn't fit her stature now, she was sure that she could just shrink them down to fit her if needed. By the time her bags were packed, it was already late at night and Zelda was exhausted. She laid in her over-sized bed and stared towards the ceiling in peace. While the white night gown she put on didn't seem to fit her well at all and draped below her feet, Zelda didn't seem to care. She was beginning to feel as if shrinking wasn't such of a hindrance and was also excited to see what adventures would hold for her tomorrow. "A five-day journey with just Link and I... that'll be fun... just me and Link... ah... Link." In no time at all, Zelda was fast asleep, tossing and turning about in her roomy nightgown and huge bed.

What will tomorrow hold in store for Zelda?
15531221222222222121.title: Zelda in the castle's library.

choices: Zelda wakes up in the middle of the night, unable to fall back asleep. (Reserved
They continue their journey in the morning.
155312212222222221211.content:
It was the next morning and Link was waiting for Zelda by the castle's stables. He had already prepared a horse for their journey, he figured that he could just share a horse with Zelda, due to her still being child sized. However, Link was growing impatient, it was already 25 minutes past their agreed upon meeting time and Zelda was nowhere to be found. Link was just about to give up waiting and go look for her before he noticed someone approaching from the distance. It was the tardy Zelda, struggling to walk as she lugged a bag nearly half her size. Panting, Zelda began, "Sorry I'm late, I got caught up on the stairs and this bag seems really heavy for some reason."

Link was a little annoyed, but looking down at the tiny princess, he knew he couldn't stay mad at her. She was so cute at that size after all and seeing her struggle to carry her bag just made him feel bad for her, like a helpless kitten struggling to stand up and walk. It made Link think for a moment, it would probably be infinitely easier if he were to just shrink the princess down even more and just carry her around in his pocket. Seeing her current display of strength, there probably wouldn't be anything she could do to stop him if he were to try. Besides, if she was cute at four foot, she would probably be absolutely adorable at the size of his palm. The whole idea was tempting, but Link knew better than to do things out of Zelda's will, he wouldn't here the end of it if he were to upset her. She would probably squeak at him in rage for the whole five-day journey.

Attaching Zelda's luggage to the side of the horse, the two of them were officially ready to head out. Overall, it was good that they were packing light, it would probably be best for both of them as to not draw any outside attention to themselves by announcing their voyage to the whole kingdom. Even though Ganon is gone, monsters still roam in the far reaches of the kingdom, some which would like nothing more than to get their hands on the precious princess of Hyrule. To put it simply, the less they make known of their travels the better.

While Link had no problem hopping onto the horse, Zelda was another story. No matter how many times she tried to jump aboard, she couldn't get a grip on the large horse. When Link offered a helping hand, Zelda seemed embarrassed to accept, knowing that she rode horses all her life and never had this issue before. Reluctantly though, she accepted his gesture and climbed upon. "You know, if you just gave me another minute, I'm sure I could have got on myself." Link somehow doubted this statement as he patted Zelda on the head in pity. In response, Zelda hugged onto Link's waist with greater force than before, and dug her face into Link's back as if to hide the fact that her whole face has turned red.

With a flick of the reins and a hearty gallop, the two of them began their journey to one of the most desolate and isolated parts of the kingdom. The first day of their trip was nothing special, just hours and hours on end of fields and hills as they made their way across the great plains of Hyrule Field. Occasionally, they would pass by other travelers heading the opposite way down the same road, however none seemed to recognize the princess, perhaps this was because of her smaller size, or that they just weren't really looking. While Link found no problem in finding comfort while they rode, Zelda was always worried that she would just fly off at every bump in the road and thus held on to Link for dear life. She wasn't exactly use to the fact she was much lighter than she used to be, anything or anyone could probably push her around with no effort on their part. On the other hand, Zelda was enjoying the fact that she got to be so close to Link, throughout the whole ride she could feel the warmth emanating off his body and smell his unique but pleasant scent. It definitely helped her relax over the long ride.

Eventually, the sun was beginning to set and the two of them agreed to call it a day. They found a good, secluded place to camp between the trees of lower Hyrule Field. While a stable would have been the ideal place to stop for the night, the next one wouldn't come for another few miles, and at that point it would already be dark. They decided to split up the work, while Link would set up a tent, Zelda would go around a collect firewood. It seemed like a simple task, but her size had come to her disadvantage yet again. She could only pick up a few good-sized branches before she would have to return to the campsite. At her whole height, it wouldn't have taken her more than 15 minutes to prepare all the firewood, but with her smaller hands it was looking to take around double that time.

During her last trip out, Zelda had to travel a bit farther into the woods to find anymore sticks, outside of Link's vision. It was then, as she was picking up her final stick, that she seemed to see something move about in the shadows. Zelda began to grow scared, whatever it was, it was fast and definitely bigger than she was. And worse of all, it seemed to be getting closer! It weaved from tree to tree, back and forth as it eventually made its way to the tiny princess. Zelda was not having any of it, she dropped her cargo and ran as fast as her little legs could take her. Turning her head to look, she couldn't really make out whatever was chasing her, it was too dark, but she saw that whatever it was it was picking up its pace. Thoughts flew in and out of Zelda's head as she ran, "Could it be a Bokoblin? Or worse, a Moblin? A Lizalfos even? What would happen to me if it caught me? I-I... this is too much!" It was when she could begin to see Link and the campsite in the distance that she began to hear the crunching of leaves behind her, as if the beast chasing her was just mere feet away. Zelda didn't have time to look, she just ran, too scared and out of breath to even let out a scream for help.

Luckily, Zelda made it back to the campsite and instantly clung onto Link. Exasperated, Zelda made out a few words, "Help... something... chasing... me." Link's face grew serious as he readied a battling stance and drew his Master Sword. Coming from the direction Zelda came from, Link could see the bushes rattle and the trees shake as a shadowy figure grew ever closer. Suddenly it leaped from the bushes and onto the campsite where its true identity was revealed. It was no monster; it was just a deer. Zelda seemed to have of wandered into its territory and the deer, thinking she was a threat, just wanted to scare her off. After getting a quick look at Link though as he slowly approached, the deer grew frightened itself and ran back into the woods.

Zelda fell to the ground, exhausted, both physically and mentally. It took nearly all of her energy to run from the deer and it left her limbs weak and her body tired. She was still gasping for air, despite not running for that long of a distance in reality, it seemed much further to her shrunken self. Link crouched down to try and comfort her and lift her to her feet. Since Link had already finished setting up the tent, the two of them went together to get the rest of the firewood and light the fire. The creamy meat soup Link cooked up for both of them was absolutely delectable. It turns out Link is actually a great cook, which Zelda never realized, perhaps he gained this skill during his adventures to save her from Calamity Ganon.

At the end of it though, both Link and Zelda were exhausted from their long day and ready for sleep with their full stomachs. While Zelda slept in the tent, Link opted to sleep out under the stars to watch guard, in case something tried to attack them during the night. In mere minutes however, they were fast asleep.

What happens next for Link and Zelda?
155312212222222221211.title: Journey to the Gerudo Desert: Day 1

choices: Trouble emerges as they leave Hyrule Field. (Reserved)
Something else unexpected happens. / They make it to the desert with no trouble.
1553122122222222212111.content:
The time was approximately 3:43 A.M. Zelda tossed and turned around the floor of the tent, attempting to get comfortable. Over an hour earlier she was awakened by the cry of an owl and she hadn't been able to fall asleep since. The tent wasn't exactly the most comfortable and she had a lot of things on her mind. At this point, she was beginning to give up on the idea of falling back to sleep, it just didn't look like her body wanted her to. Zelda thought to herself, "Perhaps I should just go sit outside and enjoy the nightly air." So, Zelda got up from her position, put her small boots on, and walked outside of the tent. Looking around, she could see Link in a deep sleep a few feet away from the tent as well as the last little sparks of flames emanating from the ash of the campfire. Outside of the opening where they set up camp, which was illuminated by the moonlight, she couldn't see anything else beyond the trees besides the occasional flicker of a sunset firefly.

Sitting down, Zelda felt the cool air flow over her skin which she found very relaxing. Still, she didn't think of sleep as a option anymore, she might just as well wait till Link wakes up in a few hours so they may continue on their voyage. Yet, Zelda thought, there must be something she could do while she waited. Usually, when Zelda was up this late at night, she was busy tinkering with some sort of piece of technology or ancient artifact. "Too bad there was nothing like that around her," Zelda thought, "Oh! But there is, the Sheikah slate!" Zelda looked over by Link to find a pile of his stuff at his side, including his Master Sword, shield, bow, and even Sheikah slate. "This great, I can further test the capabilities of the device and its new rune." Scooting over to where Link was sleeping, Zelda carefully and quietly reached her hand out to grab the slate. Luckily for her, she was a master of stealth, and only made several loud clanging sounds as she accidentally bumped the Sheikah slate on Link's sword and shield. Even more luckily for her, Link was an incredibly heavy sleeper. Probably not the best person to keep guard at night, to be perfectly honest.

Quickly scurrying to the opposite side of the campfire as Link, Zelda booted up the slate only to be greeted by a loud boot up sound. She couldn't help but cringe, she never realized how much noise the device made, but thankfully Link was still asleep. "If only there was a way to control this darn thing's volume." In that moment, Zelda noticed a button in the corner of the new volume rune that she hadn't seen before. It was symbolized by a music note icon and with a click it brought up a separate slider from the size related one. It was volume controls! "I can't believe it; I was right all along!" Zelda felt proud for predicting the rune's function but was still happy that it wasn't the only thing it had to offer. She quickly turned the volume to zero percent.

Now, without the risk to make a bunch of noise, Zelda was free to play around with the device. The first thing she was tempted to do was to play around more with the shrink feature, after all, she hadn't fully tested its capabilities on organic life. Was there a limit to how much it could shrink living, breathing cells? Of course, not wanting to test the feature on the peacefully sleeping Link, Zelda decided she would be her own guinea pig. According to her calculations, Link only shrank her to 75 percent of her original height, from 5'6" to 4'1.5". The next logical step would to go down to 50 percent now, so Zelda set the slider accordingly, turned the device toward her, and pressed the red button without much hesitation.

Suddenly, she could feel the same tingling feeling she felt before the first time she shrank, and everything began to grow around her as well. She could see the trees grow taller, the tent grows bigger, and the campfire and Link grow farther and farther away as Zelda shrank into the spot she was sitting on. Even the slate that was laying in her lap seemed to slowly grow bigger and heavier every passing moment. Zelda couldn't be more excited, the world looked so foreign at three fourths her original height, what would it look like now that she was only half height? Time seemed to slow down as she was memorized by the shrinking process. Slowly she could feel herself drop below four feet, then three and a half, and even three feet flat. By the time Zelda was done shrinking, she estimated to only be a puny 2'9". "Wow," Zelda thought to herself, "I haven't been this height since I was a toddler, it feels so weird." The Sheikah slate which laid on her lap was now doubled the size it once was to her. Where it used to be 10 inches long to her, it was now 20 and it spread over both sides of her lap as if she was wedged under some sort of table or kotatsu. Carefully, she picked it up and placed it safely on the grass before rising to her feet.

Walking around she couldn't help but notice everything felt weird and comically large. Zelda had now entered the world of giants, anyone, even children, could probably tower over her. This made Zelda feel a little nervous, she didn't think she could live being so small, everything and everyone would probably intimidate her. Maybe everyone except Link. Walking over to where he laid and looking down at him, she could really feel how big he was compared to her now. Still, it didn't really frighten her at all, Link was someone she trusted her life with, and she knew that he wouldn't do anything to hurt her, not even she was bug sized. In that moment, it really made her appreciate all he had done for her up to that point. He had done countless selfless acts and gotten himself in so many dangerous situations in the past just to make sure she was okay, and more often than not, she took it for granted. Overall, she just began to feel even more attracted to her loyal knight like she had never felt in the past.

Yet, not only was Zelda admiring Link's character but his body as well. Now that she was even smaller, the finer details of Link's build became ever clearer to her. She could see every little curve in his muscles, the fine hairs on his smooth and nearly flawless skin, and even the cute complexities of his face. The way his chest moved rhythmically up and down with every breath made Zelda imagining curling up and falling asleep like a kitten in its owner's lap. While the idea was extremely tempting to her, Zelda didn't want to reveal to Link that she shrunk herself even more or disrupt him from his sleep, after all, he looked so much at peace. Zelda could just get lost for hours looking up and down the sleeping giant that was her knight, escort, friend, and, dare to say, crush. She imagined that if he were to stand up in front on her, she would only come up to his waist at this height.

Eventually, however, Zelda managed to leave her trance as she noticed the first daylight emerge from the sky. It seems that she did indeed ogle at Link all night, so, not wanting to be this size once he waked up, Zelda walked over to where she left the Sheikah slate and began to play around with the settings of the volume rune. With a press of the green button this time, Zelda returned to her, not exactly old, old height of 4'1.5". Seeing the world shrink for a while was a new feeling for her, and it made her seem taller than she actual was, especially considering how she was just adjusting to be half her original height. Maybe she would have less trouble managing with this size now that she was more used to being even smaller, but she would have to see to find the truth in that statement for later. Right now, she returned the Sheikah slate to where she had found it and reentered her tent to wait for Link's awakening.

About half am hour later, Link finally began to get up which prompted Zelda to leave the tent and greet him. He seemed really happy to see her that morning, based on the relaxed look on his face. "Perhaps he had a good dream about me last night, that must have been nice," Zelda imagined. Awake and alive, the two of them began to pack their belongings and set out for the day ahead of them. Zelda made sure to use the Sheikah slate one last time to shrink herself a fresh pair of clothes from her luggage. Meanwhile, Link double checked he grabbed all of his gear while humming a pleasant, but adventurous tune to himself. Once both of them were ready, they mounted their horse and set off.

What will happen on the second day of their journey?
1553122122222222212111.title: Zelda experiments in the night.

choices: Link arrives at the monster hideout to save Zelda. (Reserved)
Zelda manages to save herself, somehow.
15531221222222222121111.content:
The sun was almost about to set as Link and Zelda crossed over Digdogg suspension bridge and entered the Gerudo canyon pass. The second day of their journey was revealed to be uneventful and the two of them were nearly ready to set up camp and call it a night. Zelda was already falling asleep against Link's back as her lack of sleep the previous night came to bite her in the butt. Link was just about ready to pull over to the side and set up camp when he began to get a weird feeling. It was like they were being watched. Link started to put up his guard as he looked above at the tops of the canyon. Nothing at first glance, and while there was always a chance he was wrong, he had never doubted his intuition in the past. So, Link ordered his horse to a stop and dismounted. This caused Zelda to wake up, "Huh? Is something the matter *yawn* Link?" With a quick serious glance, Zelda understood what was up and joined Link at his side.

Everything was quiet, too quiet. Link was on edge; the darkening sky hindered his vision of the more secluded areas of the canyon. Still, he didn't see any sort of threat. Perhaps his intuition was wrong? Maybe it was just something he ate earlier that was messing with his gut? No, Link felt fine, something was definitely amidst. Suddenly, Link felt the ground rumble and explode under him. An arm emerged and grabbed him violently by the leg. Link was not expecting it and tumbled to the ground. Zelda tried to run back to the horse but was met with two more figures emerging from the ground in front of her. It was two Bokoblins, a red and blue one, not only have they surrounded her, but they towered over her short stature. It didn't take much for one of them, the blue one, to overpower and grab her, throwing her over its shoulder. She tried to struggle, slamming her fists onto the Bokoblins's back, but it didn't do much damage, and the monster kept its grip on her. She yelled for Link's help, but he was in the middle of his own predicament.

The Bokoblin that grabbed him by the leg wouldn't let go, it remained his grip as it slowly emerged from the ground. Meanwhile, while Link was not looking, another couple of Bokoblins came from behind one of the walls of the canyon and grabbed Link by both his arms. Link was pinned to the ground, he struggled to release his limbs, but the monsters wouldn't let go. She could witness Zelda being grabbed by another couple of Bokoblins, but Link was powerless to do anything. As his anger grew, Link managed to release his right arm from the hands on the Bokoblin. Link was beginning to gain some hope they could recover from this situation, when he looked to his other side and saw a huge Moblin approaching him.

With no time to think, the huge beast raised its giant club and slammed it with with immense force into Link's chest. Blood spewed out of Link's mouth as he withdrew in pain. Zelda, who managed to witness the event, cried in agony, "Link! No! Please hang in there!" His strength beginning to fail him, the arm he just managed to release from the Bokoblin was grabbed once again. The three lesser monsters began to stretch Link's body like a large quilt, causing greater pain to his limbs and chest. Before he could even scream in pain however, the Moblin slammed the club upon his chest yet again. By this point, Link's consciousness began to fade, but the great beast did not stop, he kept on hitting Link over and over again into the dirt with his huge weapon. "No! Stop it! Please!" Zelda was in tears at this point. After the seventh hit, Link was officially unconscious. "Linkkk!" Zelda did all she could to try to escape the Bokoblins's grasp and run to Link side, but her efforts were fruitless as the other, red Bokoblin came to tie her up and silence her.

In mere minutes, the group of monsters, who had hidden themselves by burying themselves in small holes under the ground, had successfully defeated the great Hero of the Wild and captured the tiny princess. As the sun finally began to set beneath the canyon walls, Link laid there, motionless, in a puddle of his own blood. Great wounds were present on his chest where the Moblin struck him with its club. While he was still breathing, his breaths were slow and weak. Slowly, a figure cloaked in red and black approached the fallen Link. It was a member of the Yiga Clan, although, unlike other foot soldiers Link encountered on his journey, this was shorter in stature and appeared weaker in physical strength. He was like a twig. Crouching down to where Link laid, he laughed in triumph, "I can't believe that you feel so easily champion. My colleagues back at the hideout always acted as if you were so high and mighty, the most powerful being in the kingdom. But look at you now, defeated by the clan's newbie, the great and amazing, Volgu! My monsters made so short work of you, it's a shame really, it doesn't make for much of a story. Kind of an anticlimactic ending to the great hero. Well, whatever, once I'm done with that princess of yours, I'll return to my hideout and be exalted as the true leader of the Yiga. No one will make fun of Volgu anymore, if they want to keep their head that is!" Without much hesitation, Volgu violently slammed his foot on Link's chest before beginning to walk to where his monsters brought Zelda.

With that final blow, Link had lost his last heart, and without any fairies, it didn't look good for the Hero of the Wild. However, in what could only be called a miracle, light broke the night's darkness and beamed down on the fallen body of Link. The spirit of Mipha, the Zora guardian of 100 years ago, emerged from the sky and hovered over Link. With her power of healing, she began to fix the wounds on Link's body until Link began to gain consciousness again. Once Link was fully recovered, Mipha gave Link a few words of encouragement before disappearing back into the Heavens. "Now is not the time to rest, you must save the princess. Go Link, hurry!" Link spent no time dilly dallying; he grabbed his gear and began to search for clues as to where the monsters took Zelda. What he found were footprints, footprints not of a monster but of someone human. They couldn't have been Zelda's either, they were too big for her shrunken self. Link knew that whoever left them, however, was probably where Zelda was. No time to lose, Link followed the footprints in a sprint, he had to save Zelda before something terrible happened to her.

What happens next?

1553312112.content:
Zelda saw how small everything had become to her, and how huge she herself had become, and was afraid to think of the destruction she might cause from even a small movement of hers. So the princess decided to play it safe and stay put where she stood, towering above her father and subjects and what was left of her castle.

Zelda watched carefully at the scene that unfolded below her. It was hard to make out the ant-sized people from her viewpoint, but it seemed that her father the King was ordering some people around. Zelda couldn't hear what they were saying, but from the way everyone scattered about frantically, she knew they must have some kind of plan in mind.

Curious as to what was being said, Zelda bent over quickly to try and see if she could hear them if she were closer. But the force from her sudden, giant movement kicked up some powerful gusts of wind that nearly blew over her loyal subjects.

"Oh, sorry!" Zelda apologized absentmindedly. The tiny people below dropped to their knees and covered their ears. Zelda gasped softly, now understanding that her voice alone was enough to hurt people if she didn't keep her volume in check. She tried to apologize again, but thought better of it.

Despite her accidentally caused pain, Zelda was now able to hear the ant-sized people more clearly. She thought she heard a tiny voice, it was still almost too soft for her to hear, but this person seemed to be shouting louder than the rest. Zelda had to focus to make out the words.

"Zelda!" She heard the voice call her, and recognized it as her father. Zelda looked at the king, who she could see was glad to be heard by her. He continued, "Zelda, my daughter! I've summoned the court mage to help you! His powerful magic should be enough to shrink you down a little bit. I'm sorry we can't return you to normal yet, as we still need your help to destroy Ganon and his minions, but once you're down to a more reasonable size we can talk further! Nod if you understand!"

Zelda understood, she just wished she could be normal again now, but she knew that defeating Ganon should come first as they never knew when she'd be this big and powerful again.
Zelda nodded her understanding to her father. But as she did, her giant locks of hair brushed down and ran over the ground, giving everyone more than a face-full of her giant hair. Zelda quickly shot back up when she realized what she just did, and stood embarrassed before everyone.

Now that she was standing tall, very tall, over the remains of her castle, Zelda couldn't hear her father or anyone else anymore. She could do nothing but wait and see it the castle's resident magician's magic worked. She watched as one of the tiny people below her seemed to start to chanting a spell, the court mage she assumed.
Moments later, a ball of magic energy that was rather large started to form, it then flew forward into princess Zelda's body and burst into magic sparks. Zelda felt a feeling similar to the weird one's she had felt before and...

155331212221.content:
Princess Zelda was now roaming the countryside, 50 ft. tall and looking for food to satisfy her seemingly never-ending hunger. It made sense to her now though, she was so huge, so of course she had to eat a lot. But after going through several apple tress and farmers fields, Zelda didn't feel her hunger subside at all!

"I hope you don't mind! But I'm a growing girl!" Zelda told some tiny farmers as the 50 foot tall princess devoured all the crops in their fields as they were helpless to do anything but watch.

Zelda burped loudly, and felt a little more satisfied at last. The loud gutteral sound she made created a wind storm that knocked down a nearby windmill.

"Oops!" Zelda whispered, her face turning a shade of red.

Feeling embarrassed, Zelda got up and moved on. She felt a little better now, but still wanted more. For now though, she could rest. So Zelda sat down on an open field in Hyrule, making sure there wasn't any little people or animals below her before doing so, and took a break from her ravenous doings.

"I feel so powerful! But so hungry too!" Zelda said, rubbing her large stomach. "I can barely think straight... why does it have to be this way?"

As Zelda continued to sit, she thought about how she got into this mess in the first place. All she wanted was to destory that monster Ganon, but the Triforce had twisted her wish and turned her into this! Zelda was hesitant to call herself a monster but she couldn't deny the changes to her body, she was monster-sized and apparently eternally hungry. Zelda didn't want to live her whole life like this, she couldn't!

"What am I going to do?" Zelda asked herself.

I don't want any of you getting hurt!" She cried down to the crowd as they got the message and scattered as the two giants wrestled the Gleeok for a while seemed to be gaining the upper hand as it had the princess entangled but then she remembered the spare magical bow in her pocket that fired magical bolts of energy quickly pulling it out luckily it grew with her she fired a few bolts at the monster's midsection and in a flash the Gleeok vanished in a puff of smoke once the townspeople saw what happened they began cheering for their giantess princess who took a bow "Thank you all my loyal subjects and I greatly apologize for all the damage I have done to your town now if you excuse me I have a evil wizard and his army to crush..." As she began walking slowly towards Ganon's underworld the evil boar was throwing himself and his minions a lavish party "Ahhh success my minions with all of Hyrule under my control,the giant princess now a outcast from her own people and Link still nowhere around to stop me the Triforce of Wisdom is within my grasp at long last!" He screamed as she held him in her palm with a smirk "So you think I fled into hiding did you pig boy? I'm taking back the Triforce of Power Ganon so basically your reign of terror is at a end..." But she started to squeeze him tightly he squealed like the boar he was trying to break her grip "Like what? What could you possibly offer me in return?" "By shrinking you back to normal...." As she opened her mouth wide dangling the squirming wizard before her massive choppers he screamed fearfully "Okay,okay I can tell you're serious about this! I'll lay off future attacks until the start of next year..." "No you will lay off until the fall or winter of next year!" Zelda insisted as she prepared to drop him straight down her throat into her waiting stomach "Fine whatever you want! I'll do it just let me go!" He was truly terrified now that his power had no effect on her she set him down and he raised his hands and muttered a spell at once Zelda felt herself shrinking back to regular size "Oh good I'm back to normal!" She cried happily once he recovered from his shock Ganon was prepared to go back on his word "Yes you're back to normal princess but now that I got you in my grasp..." But folding her arms she muttered "Don't even think about it Ganon you forget we still got the Triforce of Wisdom and I could always use it to grow big again! Could you imagine if I was over 100 feet tall what damage I could do to your underworld?" "You'd just as likely destroy your kingdom than attack me in my domain but though it pains me to do so I'll keep my word princess I won't attack your kingdom for a entire year villain's code of honor..." As they shook on it and she later exited the underworld once back in the destroyed town of Hyrule already she saw the reconstruction going underway "Well despite the horrible day I just had at least one good thing out of it occurred...." She muttered to herself as she walked back to the palace also slowly being rebuilt brick by brick "Link wasn't around to witness my moment of gigantism *giggle*"
